translated: and he teaches the Discipline with joy and with no bias. Therefore in this commentary on the Discipline🔽he is praised with a praise appropriate to him. After saying “of the well-ordered” he said

original: sāruppāya thutiyā thomento āha ‘susaṇṭhitassā”’ti vatvā “gaṇṭhipadesu vuttattho adhippetādhikārānurūpo
analyzed: sāruppāya thutiyā thomentaḥ āha su saṇṭhitassa iti vatvā gaṇṭhi padesu vutta tthaḥ adhippeta adhikāra anurūpaḥ
translated: “the meaning stated in the key terms is not appropriate to the matter intended.” But our opinion here is this: the meaning should be taken as follows:

original: na hotī”ti vuttaṃ. Ayaṃ panettha amhākaṃ khanti – yathāvuttakāmasukhallikādiantadvaye🔽aṭṭhitattāyeva majjhimāya paṭipadāya sammā ṭhitattā susaṇṭhitassāti evamattho gahetabboti.
analyzed: na hoti iti vuttam ayam pana ittha amhākam khanti yathā vutta kāma sukhallika ādi anta dvaye  a ṭṭhita ttāya iva majjhimāya paṭipadāya sammā ṭhita ttā su saṇṭhitassa ati evam atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ ti
translated: because he does not stand in the two extremes consisting of indulgence in sensual pleasures and indulgence in self-torment as described,🔽he stands rightly in the middle, thus he is “of the well-ordered” .🔽For in that case the praise is made appropriate to the undertaking, since the teaching of the Discipline is made known for the most part by the middle way,

original: Evañhi sati ārambhānurūpathomanā katā hoti yathāvuttaantadvayaṃ vivajjetvā majjhimāya🔽paṭipadāya vinayapaññattiyāyeva yebhuyyena pakāsanato.🔽Tanti pubbe “yasmi”nti aniyametvā vuttassa niyamavacanaṃ, tassa “vinaya”nti iminā
analyzed: evam hi sati ārambha anurūpa thomanā katā hoti yathāvutta anta dvayam vivajjetvā majjhimāya  paṭipadāya vinaya paññattiyāya iva yebhuyyena pakāsanato  tat ti pubbe yasmin ti aniyametvā vuttassa niyama vacanam tassa vinayanti iminā
translated: after avoiding the two extremes as described.🔽The word “his” is a demonstrative pronoun referring back to the word “whose” used without specifying anything in particular. It is connected with the word “Discipline” .

original: sambandho. Asammissanti bhāvanapuṃsakaniddeso, nikāyantaraladdhīhi asammissaṃ katvā
analyzed: sambandhaḥ a sammissanti bhāva napuṃsaka niddesaḥ nikāya antara laddhīhi a sammissam katvā
translated: The word “unadulterated” is a neuter noun. It should be taken as meaning “unmixed with those of other sects.”

original: anākulaṃ katvā vaṇṇayissanti vuttaṃ hoti. Sikkhāpadapaññattiyā anurūpassa kālamattassapi
analyzed: an ākulam katvā vaṇṇayissanti vuttam hoti sikkhāpada paññattiyā anurūpassa kāla mattassa api
translated: and will expound it without confusion. The time is suitable for the expounding of the training precepts.

original: dhammasenāpatisāriputtattherasadisenapi duviññeyyabhāvato kevalaṃ buddhavisayaṃ vinayapiṭakaṃ
analyzed: dhamma senāpati sāriputta tthera sadisena api du viññeyya bhāvato kevalam buddha visayam vinaya piṭakam
translated: The Vinaya Piṭaka, which is the province of the Buddhas alone and is hard to understand even for the Elder Sāriputta, the general of the Dhamma,

original: attano balena vaṇṇayissāmīti vacanamattampi aññehi vattumasakkuṇeyyattā “nissāya🔽pubbācariyānubhāva”nti āha. Pubbācariyānubhāvo nāma atthato pubbācariyehi saṃvaṇṇitā
analyzed: attanaḥ balena vaṇṇayissāmi iti vacanam attam pi aññehi vattum a sakkuṇeyya ttā nissāya  pubba ācariya anubhāvanti āha pubba ācariya anubhāvaḥ nāma atthataḥ pubba ācariyehi saṃvaṇṇitā
translated: I will expound by the power of my own understanding, relying on the authority of the ancients.🔽The authority of the ancients is the commentaries composed by the ancients.🔽And in all the passages of the text where the words “the authority of the ancients” occur,

original: aṭṭhakathā, tatoyeva ca “pubbācariyānubhāvo aṭṭhakathā”ti sabbattha gaṇṭhipadesu🔽vuttaṃ. Tasmā pubbācariyehi saṃvaṇṇitaṃ aṭṭhakathaṃ nissāya vaṇṇayissaṃ, na attanoyeva
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā tatas yā iva ca pubba ācariya anubhāvaḥ aṭṭhakathā ati sabbattha gaṇṭhi padesu  vuttam tasmā pubba ācariyehi saṃvaṇṇitam aṭṭhakatham nissāya vaṇṇayissam na attano yā iva
translated: it is the commentaries that are meant.

original: balaṃ nissāyāti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: balam nissāya iti vuttam hoti
translated: Therefore the meaning is: I will expound the Vinaya relying on the commentaries composed by the ancients, not by the power of my own understanding alone.

original: Atha “porāṇaṭṭhakathāsu vijjamānāsu puna vinayasaṃvaṇṇanāya kiṃ payojana”nti yo vadeyya,
analyzed: atha porāṇa aṭṭha kathāsu vijjamānāsu puna vinaya saṃvaṇṇanāya kim payojanam ti yaḥ vadeyya
translated: If anyone should say: “Since the ancient commentaries exist, what is the point of expounding the Vinaya again?”

original: tassa porāṇaṭṭhakathāya anūnabhāvaṃ attano ca saṃvaṇṇanāya payojanaṃ dassento “kāmañcā”tiādimāha.🔽Kāmanti ekantena, yathicchakaṃ vā, sabbasoti vuttaṃ hoti, tassa “saṃvaṇṇito”ti iminā
analyzed: tassa porāṇa aṭṭhakathāya anūna bhāvam attano ca saṃvaṇṇanāya payojanam dassentaḥ kāmañca ati ādim āha  kāmam ti ekantena yathicchakam vā sabbaso ti vuttam hoti tassa saṃvaṇṇito ti iminā
translated: He said “Kāmañca” in order to show that the old commentary is not deficient and to show the purpose of his own commentary.

original: sambandho. Kāmaṃ saṃvaṇṇitoyeva, no na saṃvaṇṇitoti attho. Kehi pana so vinayo saṃvaṇṇitoti🔽āha “pubbācariyāsabhehī”ti. Mahākassapattherādayo pubbācariyā eva akampiyaṭṭhena
analyzed: sambandho kāmam saṃvaṇṇito yā iva no na saṃvaṇṇito ti attho kehi pana saḥ vinayo saṃvaṇṇito ti  āha mahākassapa thera ādayo pubba ācariyāḥ eva akampiya ṭṭhena
translated: Kāmañca means “if one wishes” or “as one wishes,” all, is what is meant. It is connected with “saṃvaṇṇito” in the verse. The meaning is: “If one wishes, it is praised, not that it is not praised.” But by whom was this Discipline praised?

original: uttamaṭṭhena ca āsabhā, tehi pubbācariyāsabhehīti vuttaṃ hoti. Kīdisā panete pubbācariyāti
analyzed: uttama ṭṭhena ca āsabhā tehi pubba ācariya āsabhehi iti vuttam hoti kīdisā pana ete pubba ācariyā ti
translated: He said “pubbācariyāsabhehī.” The Elder Mahākassapa and the rest are the “ancients” (pubbācariya). They are “bulls” (āsabha) in the sense of being unshakable and in the sense of being supreme. It is said: “by those ancient bulls.” But what kind are they?

original: āha “ñāṇambū”tiādi. Aggamaggañāṇasaṅkhātena ambunā salilena niddhotāni nissesato🔽āyatiṃ anuppattidhammatāpādanena dhotāni vikkhālitāni visodhitāni rāgādīni tīṇi malāni
analyzed: āha ñāṇa ambu uti ādi aggamagga ñāṇa saṅkhātena ambunā salilena niddhotāni nissesataḥ  āyatim anuppatti dhamma tā āpādanena dhotāni vikkhālitāni visodhitāni rāga ādīni tīṇi malāni
translated: He said “ñāṇambū” and so on. They are “washed” (niddhāta) by the water (ambu) called the knowledge of the path of the foremost (aggamaggañāṇa).

original: kāmāsavādayo ca cattāro āsavā yehi te ñāṇambuniddhātamalāsavā, tehīti attho. Iminā
analyzed: kāma āsava ādayo ca cattāro āsavāḥ yehi te tehi iti atthaḥ iminā
translated: The three stains (mala) of lust and so on, and the four corruptions (āsava) beginning with the corruption of sense desire, are “washed” (dhotāni), that is, cleansed, by the attainment of the state of not arising again in the future.🔽They are “washed by the water of knowledge,” is the meaning. By this he shows that the ancient bulls are purified by the water of knowledge. But what is the water of knowledge?

original: ca na kevalaṃ etesu ācariyabhāvoyeva, atha kho rāgādimalarahitā khīṇāsavā visuddhasattā eteti dasseti.
analyzed: ca na kevalam etesu atha kho rāga ādi mala rahitā khīṇa āsavā visuddha sattā ete iti dasseti
translated: and not only in the sense of being teachers, but also in the sense of being beings who are pure, that is, devoid of the defilements of lust, etc., and who have destroyed the cankers.

original: Khīṇāsavabhāvepi na ete sukkhavipassakā, atha kho evarūpehipi ānubhāvehi samannāgatāti
analyzed: khīṇāsava bhāve pi na ete sukkha vipassakāḥ atha kho evarūpehi pi ānubhāvehi samannāgatā ati
translated: And not only in the sense of having destroyed the cankers, but also in the sense of being endowed with such other kinds of distinction as these.

original: dassento āha “visuddhavijjāpaṭisambhidehī”ti. Visuddhā accantaparisuddhā vijjā catasso🔽ca paṭisambhidā yesaṃ te visuddhavijjāpaṭisambhidā, tehi. Ekadesena paṭisambhidaṃ
analyzed: dassentaḥ āha visuddha vijjā paṭisambhidehi iti visuddhā accanta parisuddhā vijjā catasso  ca paṭisambhidā yesam te visuddha vijjā paṭisambhidā tehi eka desena paṭisambhidam
translated: To show this he says “endowed with the clear vision of the analytical knowledges.” The analytical knowledges are the four analytical knowledges.🔽Those who possess them are “endowed with the clear vision of the analytical knowledges.”

original: appattānaṃ ariyānameva abhāvato etehi adhigatapaṭisambhidā paṭutaraladdhappabhedāti🔽dassetuṃ visuddhaggahaṇaṃ kataṃ. Vijjāti tisso vijjā, aṭṭha vijjā vā. Tattha dibbacakkhuñāṇaṃ
analyzed: appattānam ariyānam eva abhāvataḥ etehi adhigata paṭisambhidā paṭutara laddha ppabhedā ti  dassetum visuddha ggahaṇam katam vijjā ti tissaḥ vijjāḥ aṭṭha vijjāḥ vā tattha dibba cakkhu ñāṇam
translated: The phrase “clear vision” is used to show that they have attained the analytical knowledges in their most excellent form, since those who have not yet attained the noble paths possess only a partial form of the analytical knowledges.🔽“Clear vision” means utterly pure knowledge. The “analytical knowledges” are the three or the eight kinds of knowledge.🔽Herein, the three kinds of knowledge are the knowledge of the divine eye, the knowledge of the recollection of past lives, and the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.

original: pubbenivāsañāṇaṃ āsavakkhayañāṇañcāti imā tisso vijjā. Aṭṭha vijjā pana –
analyzed: pubbenivāsa ñāṇam āsava kkhaya ñāṇañca ati imā tissaḥ vijjāḥ aṭṭha vijjāḥ pana
translated: The eight kinds of knowledge are:

original: “Vipassanāñāṇamanomayiddhi,
analyzed: vipassanā ñāṇa manaḥ maya iddhi
translated: Insight knowledge, knowledge of the mind-made body,

original: Iddhippabhedopi ca dibbasotaṃ;
analyzed: iddhippabhedaḥ api ca
translated: The various kinds of supernormal power, the divine ear,

original: Parassa cetopariyāyañāṇaṃ,
analyzed: parassa cetas upariyāya ñāṇam
translated: Knowledge of the mental processes of others,

original: Pubbenivāsānugatañca ñāṇaṃ;
analyzed: pubbenivāsa anugatam ca ñāṇam
translated: And knowledge of past lives,

original: Dibbañca cakkhāsavasaṅkhayo ca,
analyzed: dibbam ca cakkhu āsava saṅkhayo ca
translated: And the divine eye, and the ending of cankers:

original: Etāni ñāṇāni idhaṭṭha vijjā”ti. –
analyzed: etāni ñāṇāni idhaṭṭha vijjāti
translated: These are the eight kinds of knowledge here.”

original: Evaṃ vipassanāñāṇamanomayiddhīhi saddhiṃ pariggahitā cha abhiññāyeva. Atthapaṭisambhidā
analyzed: evam vipassanā ñāṇa manaḥ maya iddhīhi saddhim pariggahitā cha abhiññāya iva attha paṭisambhidā
translated: So the six kinds of direct knowledge are included in insight knowledge, together with the supernormal power of the mind-made body.🔽The four discriminations are:

original: dhammapaṭisambhidā niruttipaṭisambhidā paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāti catasso paṭisambhidā.
analyzed: dhamma paṭisambhidā nirutti paṭisambhidā paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā ti catasso paṭisambhidā
translated: discrimination of meaning, discrimination of truth, discrimination of language, and discrimination of perspicuity.

original: Tattha saṅkhepato hetuphale ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā, hetumhi ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā,
analyzed: tattha saṅkhepataḥ hetu phale ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā hetumhi ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā
translated: Herein, knowledge of cause and fruit is discrimination of meaning; knowledge of cause is discrimination of truth;

original: hetuhetuphalānurūpaṃ vohāresu ñāṇaṃ niruttipaṭisambhidā, idaṃ ñāṇaṃ imamatthaṃ jotayatīti
analyzed: hetu hetu phala anurūpam vohāresu ñāṇam nirutti paṭisambhidā idam ñāṇam imam attham jotayati iti
translated: knowledge of the use of expressions in conformity with the cause and the fruit is discrimination of language;

original: iminā ākārena heṭṭhā vuttesu tīsu ñāṇesu pavattañāṇaṃ paṭibhānapaṭisambhidā. Etāsaṃ
analyzed: iminā ākārena heṭṭhā vuttesu tīsu ñāṇesu pavatta ñāṇam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā etāsam
translated: knowledge occurring in the three kinds of knowledge stated above in the way beginning, “This knowledge illumines this meaning” is discrimination of perspicuity.

original: pana vitthārakathā atipapañcabhāvato idha na vuccati. Paṭisambhidāppattānaṃ saddhammesu
analyzed: pana vitthāra kathā ati papañca bhāvataḥ idha na vuccati paṭisambhidā appattānam saddhammesu
translated: But the detailed explanation of these is not given here because it would lead to too great prolixity.

original: chekabhāvato āha “saddhammasaṃvaṇṇanakovidehī”ti. “Paṭisambhidāppattānampi dhammesu
analyzed: cheka bhāvataḥ āha saddhamma saṃvaṇṇana kovidehi iti paṭisambhidā appattānam pi dhammesu
translated: “Who are skilled in expounding the True Idea”: they are skilled in expounding the True Idea because they have reached the discriminations.🔽“Even though they have reached the discriminations” means that they have reached the discriminations in the True Idea.

original: abhiyogavasena viseso hotīti laddhapaṭisambhidāsu sātisayataṃ dassetuṃ āhā”tipi vadanti.🔽Saddhammasaṃvaṇṇanakovidehīti piṭakattayasaṅkhātassa saddhammassa saṃvaṇṇane sabbaso
analyzed: abhiyoga vasena visesaḥ hoti iti laddha paṭisambhidāsu sa atisaya tam dassetum āha atipi vadanti  saddhamma saṃvaṇṇana kovidehi iti piṭaka ttaya saṅkhātassa saddhammassa saṃvaṇṇane sabbaso
translated: and the difference is due to the degree of intensity. ”🔽“Skilled in expounding the true Dhamma”: skilled, that is, thoroughly🔽versed, in expounding the true Dhamma consisting of the three Piṭakas,

original: atthappakāsane kovidehi chekehi, kusalehīti attho.🔽Kilesajālaṃ parikkhārabāhullaṃ vā saṃlikhati tanuṃ karotīti sallekho. Idha pana khīṇāsavādhikārattā🔽parikkhārabāhullassa sallikhanavaseneva attho gahetabbo, tatoyeva ca gaṇṭhipade “sallekhiye
analyzed: attha ppakāsane kovidehi chekehi kusalehi iti atthaḥ  kilesa jālam parikkhāra bāhullam vā saṃlikhati tanum karoti iti sallekhaḥ idha pana khīṇāsava adhikāra ttā  parikkhāra bāhullassa sallikhana vasena iva atthaḥ gahetabbo ca gaṇṭhi pade sallekhiye
translated: in revealing its meaning in its entirety.🔽“Self-effacement” : it “sweeps away” the net of defilements or the abundance of requisites, making them thin. Here, however, the meaning should be taken as “sweeping away the abundance of requisites” in the sense of “making it thin,”

original: parimitaparikkhāravuttiyā”ti attho vutto. Sallekhassa bhāvo sallekhiyaṃ, tasmiṃ sallekhiye,🔽sallekhapaṭipattiyanti vuttaṃ hoti. Nosulabhūpamehīti asulabhūpamehi sallekhapaṭipattiyā
analyzed: parimita parikkhāra vuttiyā ti atthaḥ vuttaḥ sallekhassa bhāvaḥ sallekhiyam tasmim sallekhiye  sallekha paṭipattiyanti vuttam hoti nosula bhūpamehi iti asula bhūpamehi sallekha paṭipattiyā
translated: for this is the meaning given in the Paṭisambhidā in the section on the word “effacement” : “Effacement is the practice of self-effacement,🔽the practice of having few wants, the practice of being contented, the practice of seclusion, the practice of disassociation, the practice of being unencumbered.”🔽“Not having a simile that is easily found”: the practice of self-effacement is not easily found a simile for,

original: asukasadisāti tesaṃ upamāya anucchavikapuggalānaṃ dullabhattā natthi sulabhā upamā
analyzed: asuka sadisā ti tesam upamāya anucchavika puggalānam dullabha ttā natthi sulabhā upamā
translated: because there are no persons suitable for such a simile who are comparable to it.

original: etesanti nosulabhūpamā. Mahāvihārassāti cittalapabbataabhayagirisesanikāyadvayaṃ
analyzed: etesanti mahāvihārassa ati cittala pabbata abhaya giri sesa nikāya dvayam
translated: ‘These’ are the two great monasteries, namely, the Cittalapabbata and the Abhayagiri.

original: paṭikkhipati. Dhajūpamehīti rathassa sañjānanahetukaṃ rathe baddhadhajaṃ viya ajānantānaṃ
analyzed: paṭikkhipati dhajūpamehi iti rathassa sañjānana hetukam rathe baddha dhajam viya a jānantānam
translated: ‘Like a banner’ means like a banner attached to a chariot, which is the cause of recognizing the chariot,

original: “asukehi ca asukehi ca therehi nivāsito mahāvihāro nāmā”ti evaṃ mahāvihārassa sañjānanahetuttā
analyzed: asukehi ca asukehi ca therehi nivāsitaḥ mahāvihāraḥ nāma ati evam mahāvihārassa sañjānana hetuttā
translated: so too, the great monastery is the cause of recognizing the great monastery in this way: ‘The great monastery is inhabited by so-and-so and so-and-so elders.’

original: mahāvihārassa dhajūpamehi. Saṃvaṇṇitoti sammā anūnaṃ katvā vaṇṇito. Saṃvaṇṇito ayaṃ
analyzed: mahāvihārassa dhajū pamehi saṃvaṇṇitaḥ ti sammā anūnam katvā vaṇṇitaḥ saṃvaṇṇitaḥ ayam
translated: ‘Like a banner’ means like a banner of the great monastery. ‘Praised’ means praised correctly without omission. ‘This Vinaya’

original: vinayoti padacchedo kātabbo. Cittehi nayehīti anekappabhedanayattā vicittehi nayehi.
analyzed: vinayaḥ ti padacchedaḥ kātabbaḥ cittehi nayehi iti aneka ppabheda naya ttā vicittehi nayehi
translated: should be analyzed as follows: ‘Vinaya.’ ‘With various methods’ means with various methods of many kinds.

original: Sambuddhavaranvayehīti sabbaññubuddhavaraṃ anugatehi, bhagavato adhippāyānugatehi
analyzed: sambuddha vara anvayehi iti sabbaññu buddha varam anugatehi bhagavataḥ adhippāya anugatehi
translated: ‘With the succession of the best of the Buddhas’ means with the succession of the best of the Buddhas, following the intention of the Blessed One,

original: nayehīti vuttaṃ hoti. Atha vā buddhavaraṃ anugatehi pubbācariyāsabhehīti sambandho kātabbo.
analyzed: nayehi iti vuttam hoti atha vā buddha varam anugatehi pubba ācariya āsabhehi iti sambandhaḥ kātabbaḥ
translated: ‘with methods’ is what is meant. Or else, the connection should be made with the elders, the best of the teachers, following the best of the Buddhas.

original: Evaṃ porāṇaṭṭhakathāya anūnabhāvaṃ dassetvā idāni attano saṃvaṇṇanāya payojanavisesaṃ
analyzed: evam porāṇa aṭṭhakathāya anūna bhāvam dassetvā idāni attano saṃvaṇṇanāya payojana visesam
translated: Having thus shown the non-omission of the ancient commentary, now, the special purpose of his own praise,

original: dassetuṃ “saṃvaṇṇanā”tiādimāha. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – kiñcāpi pubbācariyāsabhehi yathāvuttaguṇavisiṭṭhehi
analyzed: dassetum saṃvaṇṇanā ti ādim āha idam vuttam hoti kiñcā api pubba ācariya āsabhehi yathā vutta guṇa visiṭṭhehi
translated: He says “commentary” in order to show that. This is what is meant: although this Discipline has been entirely praised by the Elder Brethren who are distinguished by the aforesaid special qualities,

original: ayaṃ vinayo sabbaso vaṇṇito, tathāpi tesaṃ esā saṃvaṇṇanā sīhaḷadīpavāsīnaṃ bhāsāya
analyzed: ayam vinayo sabbasas vaṇṇito tathā api tesam esā saṃvaṇṇanā sīhaḷadīpa vāsīnam bhāsāya
translated: nevertheless this commentary of theirs, because it is composed in the language of the people of the island of Sri Lanka,

original: saṅkhatattā racitattā dīpantare bhikkhujanassa sīhaḷadīpato aññadīpavāsino bhikkhugaṇassa
analyzed: saṅkhata ttā racita ttā dīpa antare bhikkhu janassa sīhaḷa dīpataḥ añña dīpa vāsino bhikkhu gaṇassa
translated: because it is made up, because it is not understood by the multitude of monks who live in other islands, other than the island of Sri Lanka,

original: kiñci atthaṃ payojanaṃ yasmā nābhisambhuṇāti na sampādeti na sādheti, tasmā imaṃ
analyzed: kiñci attham payojanam yasmai na abhisambhuṇāti na sampādeti na sādheti tasmai imam
translated: because it does not accomplish, does not bring about, does not achieve, some meaning, some purpose, therefore

original: saṃvaṇṇanaṃ pāḷinayānurūpaṃ katvā buddhasirittherena ajjhiṭṭho idāni samārabhissanti.
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇanam pāḷi naya anurūpam katvā buddha siri therena idāni samārabhissanti
translated: this commentary, having been composed in accordance with the method of the text, has been undertaken by the Elder Buddhappiya, and now they will begin.

original: Tattha saṃvaṇṇiyati attho etāyāti saṃvaṇṇanā, aṭṭhakathā. Sā pana dhammasaṅgāhakattherehi
analyzed: tattha atthaḥ etāya ati saṃvaṇṇanā aṭṭhakathā sā pana dhammasaṅgāhaka therehi
translated: Herein, it is a commentary because meaning is commented on by it. It is an exegesis. But that was first compiled by the Elder Dhamma-saddhamma-jotipāla-tthera,

original: paṭhamaṃ tīṇi piṭakāni saṅgāyitvā tassa atthavaṇṇanānurūpeneva vācanāmaggaṃ āropitattā
analyzed: paṭhamam tīṇi piṭakāni saṅgāyitvā tassa attha vaṇṇanā anurūpena iva vācanā maggam āropita ttā
translated: and then, because it was placed on the path of recitation in accordance with the commentary on its meaning,

original: tisso saṅgītiyo āruḷhoyeva buddhavacanassa atthasaṃvaṇṇanābhūto kathāmaggo. Soyeva
analyzed: tissaḥ saṅgītiyaḥ āruḷhaḥ yeva buddha vacanassa attha saṃvaṇṇanā bhūto kathā maggo saḥ yeva
translated: The path of the commentary on the meaning of the Buddha’s word is the three councils.

original: ca mahāmahindattherena tambapaṇṇidīpaṃ ābhato, pacchā tambapaṇṇiyehi mahātherehi
analyzed: ca mahā mahinda ttherena tambapaṇṇi dīpam pacchā tambapaṇṇiyehi mahā therehi
translated: And this was brought to the island of Tambapaṇṇi by the Elder Mahinda, and later it was set down in the Sinhalese language by the great elders of Tambapaṇṇi

original: nikāyantaraladdhīhi saṅkarapariharaṇatthaṃ sīhaḷabhāsāya ṭhapito. Tenāha “sīhaḷadīpakenā”tiādi.
analyzed: nikāya antara laddhīhi saṅkara pariharaṇa attham sīhaḷa bhāsāya tena āha sīhaḷa dīpakena ati ādi
translated: in order to avoid confusion with other schools. Therefore he says “by the Sinhalese” and so on.

original: Sīhassa lānato gahaṇato sīhaḷo, sīhakumāro. Taṃvaṃsajātatāya tambapaṇṇidīpe khattiyānaṃ
analyzed: sīhassa lānataḥ gahaṇataḥ sīhaḷaḥ sīha kumāro taṃ vaṃsa jāta tāya tambapaṇṇidīpe khattiyānaṃ
translated: The Sinhalese is the lion cub because it was taken from the lion’s jaw. Because they were born in that family, the khattiyas in the island of Tambapaṇṇi

original: tesaṃ nivāsatāya tambapaṇṇidīpassapi sīhaḷabhāvo veditabbo, tasmiṃ sīhaḷadīpe bhūtattā
analyzed: tesam nivāsa tāya tambapaṇṇi dīpassa api sīhaḷa bhāvaḥ veditabbo tasmin sīhaḷa dīpe bhūta ttā
translated: are called Sinhalese because they lived there. The island of Tambapaṇṇi should be understood as having the nature of the Sinhalese because it exists in that island of Sinhala.

original: sīhaḷadīpakena vākyena vacanena, sīhaḷabhāsāyāti vuttaṃ hoti.🔽Pāḷinayānurūpanti pāḷinayassa anurūpaṃ katvā, māgadhabhāsāya parivattitvāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: sīhaḷadīpakena vākyena vacanena sīhaḷa bhāsāya ati vuttam hoti  pāḷinaya anurūpam ti pāḷinayassa anurūpam katvā māgadha bhāsāya parivattitvā iti vuttam
translated: Therefore it is said: “by the Sinhalese” means by the sentence, by the statement, by the Sinhalese language.🔽In accordance with the method of the texts means having made it in accordance with the method of the texts, having turned it into the Magadha language.

original: hoti. Ajjhesananti garuṭṭhāniyaṃ payirupāsitvā garutaraṃ payojanaṃ uddissa abhipatthanā
analyzed: hoti ajjhesanam ti garuṭṭhāniyam payirupāsitvā garutaram payojanam uddissa abhipatthanā
translated: The request means having attended on the venerable ones, the aspiration for the most important purpose.

original: ajjhesanā, taṃ ajjhesanaṃ, āyācananti attho. Tassa “samanussaranto”ti iminā sambandho.
analyzed: ajjhesanā tam ajjhesanam āyācananti attho tassa samanussarantaḥ ti iminā sambandhaḥ
translated: The meaning is: the request, that request. The meaning is: remembering that, he placed it in his heart.🔽Whose request? He said: “The Elder Buddhasirivaddha’s.” The name of the Elder was Buddhasirivaddha.

original: Kassa ajjhesananti āha “buddhasirivhayassa therassā”ti. Buddhasirīti avhayo nāmaṃ🔽yassa soyaṃ buddhasirivhayo, tassa, itthannāmassa therassa ajjhesanaṃ sammā ādarena🔽samanussaranto hadaye ṭhapentoti attho.
analyzed: kassa ajjhesananti āha buddhasirivhayassa therassa ati buddhasirī iti avhayaḥ nāmaṃ  yassa saḥ ayam buddha sirivhayaḥ tassa itthannāmassa therassa ajjhesanam sammā ādarena  samanussarantaḥ hadaye ṭhapento ti attho
translated: The meaning is: remembering the request of that Elder of such a name, he placed it in his heart, he established it in his heart.

original: Idāni attano saṃvaṇṇanāya karaṇappakāraṃ dassento “saṃvaṇṇanaṃ tañcā”tiādimāha. Tattha🔽tañca idāni vuccamānaṃ saṃvaṇṇanaṃ samārabhanto sakalāyapi mahāaṭṭhakathāya idha
analyzed: idāni attanaḥ saṃvaṇṇanāya karaṇa ppakāram dassentaḥ saṃvaṇṇanam tat ca ati ādim āha tattha  tat ca idāni vuccamānam saṃvaṇṇanam mahā aṭṭhakathāya
translated: Now, showing the way in which he made his own commendation, he said: “And that commendation of it.” Herein🔽and that commendation of it which is now being spoken, beginning it, he said: “The Great Commentary,” etc.🔽The meaning is: because the whole of the Great Commentary is to be taken here, he made the body of the Great Commentary the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken.🔽The meaning is: because the Great Commentary is the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken, he made the body of the Great Commentary the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken.

original: gahetabbato mahāaṭṭhakathaṃ tassā idāni vuccamānāya saṃvaṇṇanāya sarīraṃ katvā mahāpaccariyaṃ🔽yo vinicchayo vutto, tatheva kurundīnāmādīsu vissutāsu aṭṭhakathāsu yo vinicchayo
analyzed: gahetabbataḥ mahā aṭṭhakatham tassāḥ idāni vuccamānāya saṃvaṇṇanāya sarīram katvā mahā paccariyam 🔽yaḥ vinicchayaḥ vutto tathā iva kurundī nāma ādīsu vissutāsu aṭṭhakathāsu yaḥ vinicchayo
translated: The meaning is: because the Great Commentary is the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken, he made the body of the Great Commentary the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken.🔽The meaning is: because the Great Commentary is the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken, he made the body of the Great Commentary the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken.🔽The meaning is: because the Great Commentary is the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken, he made the body of the Great Commentary the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken.🔽The meaning is: because the Great Commentary is the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken, he made the body of the Great Commentary the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken.🔽The meaning is: because the Great Commentary is the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken, he made the body of the Great Commentary the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken.🔽The meaning is: because the Great Commentary is the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken, he made the body of the Great Commentary the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken.🔽The meaning is: because the Great Commentary is the body of the commendation of it which is now being spoken, he made the body of the Great

original: vutto, tatopi vinicchayato yuttamatthaṃ apariccajanto antogadhattheravādaṃ katvā
analyzed: vuttaḥ tatas api vinicchayataḥ yuttam attham a pariccajantaḥ katvā
translated: and not abandoning the meaning that is proper to the text, they will begin the commentary, taking the Elder’s opinion as the basis.

original: saṃvaṇṇanaṃ samārabhissanti padatthasambandho veditabbo. Ettha ca attho kathiyati
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇanam samārabhissanti padattha sambandhaḥ veditabbaḥ ettha ca attho kathiyati
translated: The meaning is spoken of here

original: etāyāti atthakathā, sāyeva aṭṭhakathā tthakārassa ṭṭhakāraṃ katvā “dukkhassa pīḷanaṭṭho”tiādīsu
analyzed: etāya ati atthakathā sāya iva aṭṭhakathā tthakārassa ṭṭhakāram katvā dukkhassa pīḷana ṭṭho ti ādīsu
translated: by this, thus it is an Atthakathā . That same is an Aṭṭhakathā , the -tth- of -atthakathā being treated as a -ṭṭha- , as in the words “dukkhassa pīḷanaṭṭho” , etc.

original: viya. Mahāpaccariyanti ettha paccarīti uḷumpaṃ vuccati, tasmiṃ nisīditvā katattā
analyzed: viya mahāpaccariyanti ettha paccarī iti uḷumpam vuccati tasmim nisīditvā katattā
translated: The Mahāpaccariya is so called because it was composed while sitting in a certain place called Paccari .

original: tameva nāmaṃ jātaṃ. Kurundivallivihāro nāma atthi, tattha katattā kurundīti nāmaṃ
analyzed: tam eva nāmam jātam kurundivallivihāraḥ nāma atthi tattha katattā kurundī iti nāmaṃ
translated: They say that the Kurundi is so called because it was composed in a monastery called Kurundivalli .

original: jātanti vadanti. Ādisaddena andhakaṭṭhakathaṃ saṅkhepaṭṭhakathañca saṅgaṇhāti. Vissutāsūti
analyzed: jāta nti vadanti ādi saddena andhaka ṭṭhakatham saṅkhepa ṭṭhakatham ca saṅgaṇhāti vissutāsu iti
translated: The word ādi includes the Andhakaṭṭhaka and the Saṅkhepaṭṭhaka .

original: sabbattha patthaṭāsu, pākaṭāsūti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: sabbattha patthaṭāsu pākaṭāsu iti vuttam hoti
translated: The word vissuta means well known everywhere, well established everywhere, is what is meant.

original: Yuttamatthanti ettha tāva majjhimagaṇṭhipade cūḷagaṇṭhipade ca idaṃ vuttaṃ “yuttamatthanti
analyzed: ettha tāva majjhima gaṇṭhi pade cūḷagaṇṭhi pade ca idam vuttam yuttam attham ti
translated: The meaning that is proper to the text: here, in the Majjhima and Cūḷa Gaṇṭhi, this is said: “The meaning that is proper to the text is the meaning that is proper to the text of the Vinaya and the Sutta.

original: saṃvaṇṇetabbaṭṭhānassa yuttamatthaṃ, na pana tattha ayuttampi atthīti vuttaṃ hotī”ti.🔽Mahāgaṇṭhipade panettha na kiñci vuttaṃ. Kenaci pana “mahāaṭṭhakathānayena vinayayuttiyā
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇetabba ṭṭhānassa yuttam attham na pana tattha ayuttam pi atthi iti vuttam hoti iti  mahāgaṇṭhipade pana ittha na kiñci vuttam kenaci pana mahā aṭṭhakathā nayena vinaya yuttiyā
translated: but it does not mean that there is no other meaning there that is not suitable” .🔽But nothing is said in the Great Commentary here. But someone has said: “The meaning that is suitable by the method of the Great Commentary or by the Vinaya exegesis” .

original: vā yuttamattha”nti vuttaṃ, taṃ yuttaṃ viya dissati mahāpaccariādīsupi katthaci ayuttassāpi🔽atthassa upari vibhāvanato. “Aṭṭhakathaṃyeva gahetvā saṃvaṇṇanaṃ karissāmī”ti vutte
analyzed: vā yuttam attham ti vuttam tam yuttam viya dissati mahāpaccariā ādīsu pi katthaci ayuttassa api  atthassa upari vibhāvanataḥ aṭṭhakathaṃyā iva gahetvā saṃvaṇṇanam karissāmi iti vutte
translated: That appears to be suitable, since in the Great Book of the Discipline and so on, although the meaning is not suitable in some places,🔽it is commented on above. When it is said: “I shall comment only by means of the commentaries” ,

original: aṭṭhakathāsu vuttattheravādānaṃ bāhirabhāvo siyāti tepi antokattukāmo “antogadhatheravāda”nti🔽āha, theravādepi antokatvāti vuttaṃ hoti. Saṃvaṇṇananti aparakālakiriyāya kammaniddeso.
analyzed: aṭṭhakathāsu vutta tthera vādānam bāhira bhāvaḥ siyāti te pi antokattu kāmo  āha thera vāde pi anto katvā iti vuttam hoti saṃvaṇṇanam ti apara kāla kiriyāya kamma niddeso
translated: it would follow that the Elder’s opinions stated in the commentaries are outside . So wishing to include them he said “the Elder’s opinions included within” .🔽What is meant is: “even those stated in the Elder’s opinions within the commentaries.” “Comment” is a verbal noun formed from the verb samvaṇṇanā .

original: Pubbe vuttaṃ tu “saṃvaṇṇana”nti vacanaṃ tattheva “samārabhanto”ti pubbakālakiriyāya
analyzed: pubbe vuttam tu saṃvaṇṇanan ti vacanam tattha eva samārabhantaḥ ti pubba kāla kiriyāya
translated: But the word “comment” stated above is a verbal noun formed from the verb samārabhanto .

original: kammabhāvena yojetabbaṃ. Sammāti vattabbe gāthābandhavasena rassabhāvo katoti veditabbo.
analyzed: kamma bhāvena yojetabbam sammā iti vattabbe gāthābandha vasena rassa bhāvaḥ kataḥ iti veditabbaḥ
translated: The word “right” should be understood to have been made short in the text for metrical reasons.

original: Evaṃ karaṇappakāraṃ dassetvā idāni sotūhi paṭipajjitabbavidhiṃ dassento “taṃ me”tiādimāha.🔽Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – idāni vuccamānaṃ taṃ mama saṃvaṇṇanaṃ dhammapadīpassa tathāgatassa
analyzed: evam karaṇa ppakāram dassetvā idāni sotūhi paṭipajjitabba vidhim dassentaḥ tam mā iti ādim āha  idam vuttam hoti idāni vuccamānam tam mama saṃvaṇṇanam dhammapadīpassa tathāgatassa
translated: Having thus shown the manner of doing, he now said “Taṃ me” in order to show the method of practice for the listeners.

original: dhammaṃ sāsanadhammaṃ pāḷidhammaṃ vā sakkaccaṃ paṭimānayantā pūjentā thirehi sīlakkhandhādīhi
analyzed: dhammam sāsana dhammam pāḷi dhammam vā sakkaccam paṭimānayantā pūjentā thirehi sīla kkhandha ādīhi
translated: This is what is meant: “You monks, who are elders because you are endowed with the aggregate of virtue, etc., which are firm,

original: samannāgatattā therā, acirapabbajitattā navā, tesaṃ majjhe bhavattā majjhimā ca bhikkhū
analyzed: samannāgata ttā therāḥ acira pabbajita ttā navā tesam majjhe bhavattā majjhimā ca bhikkhū
translated: and who are novices because you have recently gone forth, and who are of middle standing because you are in between the two,🔽should listen with confidence, with minds possessed of joy and gladness, without being envious,🔽having accepted this praise of mine, which is now being spoken, as the Dhamma of the Tathāgata,

original: pasannacittā yathāvuttanayena sappayojanattā upari vakkhamānavidhinā pamāṇattā ca🔽saddahitvā pītisomanassayuttacittā issāpakatā ahutvā nisāmentu suṇantūti. Tattha
analyzed: pasanna cittā yathā vutta nayena sa payojana ttā upari vakkhamāna vidhinā pamāṇa ttā ca  saddahitvā pīti somanassa yutta cittāḥ issāpaka tāḥ a hutvā nisāmentu suṇantu iti tattha
translated: the Dhamma of the Dispensation, or the Dhamma of the texts, and having honoured it with respect.

original: dhammappadīpassāti dhammoyeva sattasantānesu mohandhakāravidhamanato padīpasadisattā
analyzed: dhamma ppadīpassa ati satta santānesu moha ndhakāra vidhamanato padīpa sadisa ttā
translated: Herein, “Dhammappadīpa” : the Dhamma itself is like a lamp because it dispels the darkness of delusion in the continua of beings.

original: padīpo assāti dhammapadīpo, bhagavā. Tassa dhammapadīpassa.
analyzed: padīpaḥ assa ati dhamma padīpaḥ bhagavā tassa dhamma padīpassa
translated: The light is the Dhamma-light, the Blessed One. Of that Dhamma-light.

original: Idāni attano saṃvaṇṇanāya āgamavisuddhiṃ dassetvā pamāṇabhāvaṃ dassento “buddhenā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: idāni attano saṃvaṇṇanāya āgama visuddhim dassetvā pamāṇa bhāvam dassentaḥ buddhena ati ādim āha
translated: Now, after showing the purity of the tradition by his own commendation, he said “buddhenā” , showing the authoritative nature .

original: Yatheva buddhena yo dhammo ca vinayo ca vutto, so tassa buddhassa yehi puttehi dhammasenāpatiādīhi🔽tatheva ñāto, tesaṃ buddhaputtānaṃ matimaccajantā sīhaḷaṭṭhakathācariyā yasmā pure
analyzed: yathā iva buddhena yaḥ dhammo ca vinayo ca vutto so tassa buddhassa yehi puttehi dhamma senāpati ādīhi  tathā iva tesam buddha puttānam matimat cajantā sīhaḷaṭṭhakathā cariyāḥ yasmai pure
translated: Just as the Dhamma and the Discipline were spoken by the Buddha, so they were known by the Buddha’s sons, the chief of whom was the General of the Dhamma,🔽and just as the commentaries were made by the wise men of the lion race, the teachers of the Sinhalese commentaries, in the past,

original: aṭṭhakathā akaṃsūti ayamettha sambandho. Tattha dhammoti suttābhidhamme saṅgaṇhāti,
analyzed: aṭṭhakathāḥ akaṃsu iti ayam ettha sambandhaḥ tattha dhammo ti sutta abhidhamme saṅgaṇhāti
translated: so they are known by the wise men of the lion race, the teachers of the Sinhalese commentaries, in the present. This is the connection here. Herein, the Dhamma is included in the Suttas and the Abhidhamma.

original: vinayoti sakalaṃ vinayapiṭakaṃ. Ettāvatā ca sabbampi buddhavacanaṃ niddiṭṭhaṃ hoti.
analyzed: vinayo ti sakalam vinaya piṭakam ettāvatā ca sabbam pi buddha vacanam niddiṭṭham hoti
translated: The Discipline is the entire Vinaya Piṭaka. And so far all the word of the Buddha has been indicated.

original: Sakalañhi buddhavacanaṃ dhammavinayavasena duvidhaṃ hoti. Vuttoti pāḷito ca atthato
analyzed: sakalam hi buddha vacanam dhamma vinaya vasena duvidham hoti vuttaḥ iti pāḷitaḥ ca atthato
translated: For the entire word of the Buddha is twofold as Dhamma and Discipline. Spoken is recited by the Blessed One in the texts and in the meaning.

original: ca buddhena bhagavatā vutto. Na hi bhagavatā abyākataṃ nāma tantipadaṃ atthi, sabbesaṃyeva
analyzed: ca buddhena bhagavatā vuttaḥ na hi bhagavatā abyākatam nāma tanti padam atthi sabbesam yeva
translated: For there is no line of text whatsoever that is not spoken by the Blessed One, for all

original: attho kathito, tasmā sammāsambuddheneva tiṇṇaṃ piṭakānaṃ atthavaṇṇanākkamopi bhāsitoti
analyzed: attho kathito tasmā sammāsambuddhena iva tiṇṇam piṭakānam attha vaṇṇanā kkamaḥ api bhāsito ti
translated: The meaning has been stated, therefore the method of commenting on the meaning of the three Piṭakas should be regarded as spoken by the Perfectly Enlightened One himself.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tattha tattha bhagavatā pavattitā pakiṇṇakadesanāyeva hi aṭṭhakathā.🔽Tatheva ñātoti yatheva buddhena vutto, tatheva ekapadampi ekakkharampi avināsetvā
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam tattha tattha bhagavatā pavattitā pakiṇṇaka desanāya iva hi aṭṭhakathā  tathā iva ñātaḥ iti yathā iva buddhena vuttaḥ tathā iva eka padam pi eka kkharam pi a vināsetvā
translated: For the commentaries are just the miscellaneous teachings given by the Blessed One here and there.🔽“Just as he knew it”: the meaning is that it was known, understood, just as it was spoken by the Buddha, without a single word or syllable being omitted,

original: adhippāyañca avikopetvā ñāto viditoti attho. Tesaṃ matimaccajantāti tesaṃ buddhaputtānaṃ
analyzed: adhippāyam ca a vikopetvā ñātaḥ viditaḥ iti attho tesam matimat cajantā ti tesam buddha puttānam
translated: and without distorting the intention. “Without transgressing their opinion”: without transgressing the opinion of those sons of the Buddha.

original: adhippāyaṃ apariccajantā. Aṭṭhakathā akaṃsūti aṭṭhakathāyo akaṃsu. Katthaci “aṭṭhakathāmakaṃsū”ti
analyzed: adhippāyam a pariccajantāḥ aṭṭhakathāḥ akaṃsu iti aṭṭhakathāyaḥ akaṃsu katthaci aṭṭhakathām akaṃsu iti
translated: “They made the commentaries”: they composed the commentaries. In some places the reading is “aṭṭhakathāmakaṃsū,”

original: pāṭho dissati, tatthāpi soyevattho, ma-kāro pana padasandhivasena āgatoti daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: pāṭhaḥ dissati tattha api makāraḥ pana pada sandhi vasena āgataḥ ti daṭṭhabbo
translated: but there too the same meaning should be understood, and the syllable ma should be regarded as having come in by way of a metrical split.

original: “Aṭṭhakathā”ti bahuvacananiddesena mahāpaccariyādikaṃ saṅgaṇhāti.
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā iti bahuvacana niddesena mahāpaccariyā ādikam saṅgaṇhāti
translated: “Aṭṭhakathā” is a collective designation for the Mahāpaccariya, etc.

original: Tasmāti yasmā tesaṃ buddhaputtānaṃ adhippāyaṃ avikopetvā pure aṭṭhakathā akaṃsu,
analyzed: tasmā iti yasmā tesam buddha puttānam adhippāyam a vikopetvā pure aṭṭhakathāḥ akaṃsu
translated: “Therefore”: because they made the commentaries in the past without distorting the opinion of those sons of the Buddha,

original: tasmāti attho. Hīti nipātamattaṃ hetuatthassa “tasmā”ti imināyeva pakāsitattā. Yadi
analyzed: tasmā iti atthaḥ hi iti nipāta mattam hetu atthassa tasmā iti yadi
translated: Therefore is the meaning. But is merely a particle. Because the meaning of cause is shown by the word therefore.

original: aṭṭhakathāsu vuttaṃ sabbampi pamāṇaṃ, evaṃ sati tattha pamādalekhāpi pamāṇaṃ siyāti🔽āha “vajjayitvāna pamādalekha”nti. Tattha pamādalekhanti aparabhāge potthakāruḷhakāle
analyzed: aṭṭhakathāsu vuttam sabbam pi pamāṇam evam sati tattha pamāda lekhā api pamāṇam siyā ti  āha vajjayitvāna tattha aparabhāge potthaka āruḷha kāle
translated: If what is stated in the commentaries is all authoritative, then the scribal errors in them should be authoritative too.

original: pamajjitvā likhanavasena pavattaṃ pamādapāṭhaṃ. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – pamādena satiṃ🔽apaccupaṭṭhapetvā adinnādānassa pubbapayoge “saccepi alikepi dukkaṭa”nti vuttavacanasadisaṃ
analyzed: pamajjitvā likhana vasena pavattam pamāda pāṭham idam vuttam hoti pamādena satim  a paccupaṭṭhapetvā adinnādānassa pubba payoge sacce pi alike pi dukkaṭam ti vutta vacana sadisam
translated: So he says, “after rejecting the scribal errors.” Herein, the scribal errors are the careless readings that occur through the carelessness of writing down later on the palm-leaf after having forgotten. This is what is said:🔽after rejecting, after removing, all that is written carelessly, that is to say, after not having attended well to the memory, like the words stated thus, “Whether it is true or not, there is an offence of wrong-doing,”

original: yaṃ likhitaṃ, taṃ vajjayitvā apanetvā sabbaṃ pamāṇanti. Vakkhati hi tattha –
analyzed: yam likhitam tam vajjayitvā apanetvā sabbam pamāṇam ti vakkhati hi tattha
translated: in the preliminary work to the taking of what is not given. For it is said there:

original: “Mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana saccepi alikepi dukkaṭameva vuttaṃ, taṃ pamādalikhitanti veditabbaṃ. Na hi adinnādānassa pubbapayoge pācittiyaṭṭhāne dukkaṭaṃ nāma atthī”ti.
analyzed: mahā aṭṭhakathā ayam pana sacce pi alike pi dukkaṭam eva vuttam tam pamāda likhitam ti veditabbam na hi adinnādānassa pubba payoge pācittiya ṭṭhāne dukkaṭam nāma atthi iti
translated: “But in the Great Commentary it is said that whether it is true or not, there is only an offence of wrong-doing. That should be understood as carelessly written. For there is no offence of wrong-doing in the place of an offence entailing expiation in the preliminary work to the taking of what is not given.”

original: Kesaṃ pamāṇanti āha “sikkhāsu sagāravānaṃ idha paṇḍitāna”nti. Idhāti imasmiṃ sāsane.
analyzed: kesam pamāṇam ti āha sikkhāsu sagāravānam idha paṇḍitānam ti idha ati imasmim sāsane
translated: As to whose measure: he says “Herein, of the wise who have respect for the training” . Herein : in this Dispensation.

original: Puna “yasmā”ti vacanassa ko sambandhoti ce? Ettha tāva mahāgaṇṭhipade gaṇṭhipade
analyzed: puna yasmā iti vacanassa kaḥ sambandho ti ce ettha tāva mahā gaṇṭhi pade gaṇṭhi pade
translated: And if it be asked, “What is the connexion of the word ‘since’?” ,🔽then in the first place nothing is said in the Great Thread and in the Thread .

original: ca na kiñci vuttaṃ, majjhimagaṇṭhipade pana cūḷagaṇṭhipade ca idaṃ vuttaṃ “yasmā
analyzed: ca na kiñci vuttam majjhima gaṇṭhi pade pana cūḷagaṇṭhi pade ca idam vuttam yasmā
translated: But in the Middle Thread and in the Minor Thread this is said:

original: pamāṇaṃ, tasmā nisāmentu pasannacittā”ti. Evamassa sambandho daṭṭhabbo. Yasmā aṭṭhakathāsu🔽vuttaṃ pamāṇaṃ, tasmā idha vuttampi pamāṇamevāti pāṭhasesaṃ katvā vajirabuddhitthero
analyzed: pamāṇam tasmai nisāmentu pasanna cittā iti evam assa sambandhaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ yasmai aṭṭhakathāsu  vuttam pamāṇam tasmai idha vuttam pi pamāṇam evā ti pāṭha sesam katvā vajirabuddhi theraḥ
translated: “Since there is a measure, therefore let them sit down with confident hearts” .🔽So the connexion should be seen in this way. Since the measure stated in the Commentaries is the same as that stated here, the Elder Vajirabuddhi says that the remainder of the text should be taken as follows:

original: vadati. Tattha idhāti imissā samantapāsādikāyāti attho gahetabbo.🔽Tattha “yasmā”ti vacanassa paṭhamaṃ vuttasambandhavasena aṭṭhakathāsu vuttaṃ sabbampi
analyzed: vadati tattha idha ati imissā samantapāsādikāya ati atthaḥ gahetabbo  tattha yasmā iti vacanassa paṭhamam vutta sambandha vasena aṭṭhakathāsu vuttam sabbam pi
translated: “Since the measure is stated in the Commentaries, therefore the commendation stated here is only a mere statement since it is already established.”🔽Herein, here means in this all-round pleasing .

original: pamāṇanti sādhitattā idāni vuccamānāpi saṃvaṇṇanā kevalaṃ vacanamatteneva bhinnā,
analyzed: idāni vuccamānā api saṃvaṇṇanā kevalam vacana mattena iva bhinnā
translated: Herein, since the word “since” has already been given a connexion in the Commentaries, all the measure stated there is established, and so the commendation now being stated is only a mere statement since it is already established.

original: atthato pana aṭṭhakathāyevāti dassetuṃ “tato ca bhāsantaramevā”tiādimāha. Pacchā
analyzed: atthataḥ pana aṭṭhakathāya iva ati dassetum tatas ca bhāsa antaram eva iti ādim āha pacchā
translated: But in fact it is the commentary itself. In order to show this he says, “And it is the commentary itself that states the reason.”

original: vuttasambandhavasena pana idha vuttampi kasmā pamāṇanti ce? Yasmā vacanamattaṃ ṭhapetvā
analyzed: vutta sambandha vasena pana idha vuttam api kasmā ce yasmā vacana mattam ṭhapetvā
translated: But why is what is stated here a source of knowledge, since it is stated in terms of the connection with what is stated later?

original: esāpi aṭṭhakathāyeva, tasmā pamāṇanti dassetuṃ “tato ca bhāsantaramevā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: esā api aṭṭhakathāyā iva tasmā pamāṇa nti dassetum tatas ca bhāsa antaram eva ati ādim āha
translated: Because, apart from the mere statement, this is the commentary itself. In order to show that it is a source of knowledge he says, “And it is the commentary itself that states the reason.”

original: Evamākulaṃ dubbiññeyyasabhāvañca katvā gaṇṭhipadesu sambandho dassito, anākulavacano🔽ca bhadantabuddhaghosācariyo. Na hi so evamākulaṃ katvā vattumarahati, tasmā yathādhippetamatthamanākulaṃ🔽suviññeyyañca katvā yathāṭhitassa sambandhavaseneva dassayissāma. Kathaṃ? Yasmā aṭṭhakathāsu
analyzed: evam ākulam dubbiññeyya sabhāvam ca katvā gaṇṭhi padesu sambandhaḥ dassitaḥ an ākula vacanaḥ  ca bhadanta buddhaghosā cariyaḥ na hi saḥ evam ākulam katvā vattum arahati tasmai yathā adhippetam attham an ākulam  su viññeyyam ca katvā yathā ṭhitassa sambandha vasena iva dassayissāma katham yasmai aṭṭhakathāsu
translated: The connection is shown in the key terms by making it clear and easy to understand.

original: vuttaṃ pamāṇaṃ, tasmā sakkaccaṃ anusikkhitabbāti evamettha sambandho daṭṭhabbo. Yadi
analyzed: vuttam pamāṇam tasmā sakkaccam anusikkhitabbā ti evam ettha sambandhaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ yadi
translated: The venerable Buddhaghosa is a teacher who uses clear expressions. For he is not one to use such a confused expression. Therefore we shall show the connection in accordance with the actual words, making the meaning clear and easy to understand. How? Because the commentary is a source of knowledge, therefore it should be carefully studied. This is how the connection should be understood here.🔽If

original: nāma aṭṭhakathāsu vuttaṃ pamāṇaṃ, ayaṃ pana idāni vuccamānā kasmā sakkaccaṃ anusikkhitabbāti🔽āha “tato ca bhāsantarameva hitvā”tiādi. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yasmā aṭṭhakathāsu vuttaṃ
analyzed: nāma aṭṭhakathāsu vuttam pamāṇam ayam pana idāni vuccamānā kasmā sakkaccam anusikkhitabbā ti  āha tatas ca bhāsa antaram eva hitvā atiādi idam vuttam hoti yasmai aṭṭhakathāsu vuttam
translated: The measure stated in the commentaries is the measure. But why should this one now being stated be carefully studied?

original: pamāṇaṃ, yasmā ca ayaṃ saṃvaṇṇanāpi bhāsantarapariccāgādimattavisiṭṭhā, atthato pana
analyzed: pamāṇam ca ayam saṃvaṇṇanā api bhāsa antara pariccāga ādimatta visiṭṭhā atthataḥ pana
translated: He says “And leaving aside what is said elsewhere” and so on. This is what he means. Since the measure is stated in the commentaries, and since this commentary too is distinguished by the mere fact of its leaving aside what is said elsewhere, and so on, and since it is not different in meaning,

original: abhinnāva, tatoyeva ca pamāṇabhūtā hessati, tasmā sakkaccaṃ ādaraṃ katvā anusikkhitabbāti.🔽Tathā hi porāṇaṭṭhakathānaṃ pamāṇabhāvo, imissā ca saṃvaṇṇanāya bhāsantarapariccāgādimattavisiṭṭhāya
analyzed: a bhinnā ava tatoyā iva ca pamāṇa bhūtā hessati tasmā sakkaccam ādaram katvā anusikkhitabbā ati  tathā hi porāṇa aṭṭhakathānam pamāṇa bhāvaḥ imissā ca saṃvaṇṇanāya bhāsa antara pariccāga ādi matta visiṭṭhāya
translated: it will be a measure too, therefore it should be carefully studied with respect and attention.

original: atthato tato abhinnabhāvoti ubhayampetaṃ sakkaccaṃ anusikkhitabbabhāvahetūti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: atthataḥ tatas abhinna bhāvaḥ ti ubhayam petam sakkaccam anusikkhitabba bhāva hetū ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: For it should be regarded as the reason for the need to study carefully both the fact that the ancient commentaries are a measure and the fact that this commentary, which is distinguished by the mere fact of its leaving aside what is said elsewhere, and so on,🔽is not different in meaning from them.

original: Na hi kevalaṃ porāṇaṭṭhakathānaṃ satipi pamāṇabhāve ayaṃ saṃvaṇṇanā tato bhinnā atthato
analyzed: na hi kevalam porāṇa aṭṭhakathānam sati pi pamāṇa bhāve ayam saṃvaṇṇanā tatas bhinnā atthato
translated: For this commentary is not different from them in meaning, even though the ancient commentaries are a measure, and

original: aññāyeva ca sakkaccaṃ anusikkhitabbāti vattumarahati, nāpi imissā saṃvaṇṇanāya tatoabhinnabhāvepi
analyzed: aññāya iva ca sakkaccam anusikkhitabbā ti vattum arahati nā api imissā saṃvaṇṇanāya tatas abhinna bhāve pi
translated: and it is proper to say that it should be trained in just as it is, and not that it should be trained in as different from that, even though it is not the same as that.

original: porāṇaṭṭhakathānaṃ asati pamāṇabhāve ayaṃ saṃvaṇṇanā sakkaccaṃ anusikkhitabbāti vattuṃ
analyzed: porāṇa aṭṭhakathānam asati pamāṇa bhāve ayam saṃvaṇṇanā sakkaccam anusikkhitabbā iti vattum
translated: and it is proper to say that it should be studied carefully. And it is not proper to say that this commentary should be studied carefully because it is not a source for the ancient commentaries, even though it is not different from them.

original: yuttarūpā hoti, tasmā yathāvuttanayena ubhayampetaṃ sakkaccaṃ anusikkhitabbabhāvahetūti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: yutta rūpā hoti tasmai yathā vutta nayena ubhayam petam sakkaccam anusikkhitabba bhāva hetu iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: Therefore it should be regarded as the reason why both should be studied carefully in the way already stated.

original: Tatoti aṭṭhakathāto. Bhāsantarameva hitvāti kañcukasadisaṃ sīhaḷabhāsaṃ apanetvā.
analyzed: tatas ti aṭṭhakathātaḥ bhāsa antaram eva hitvā ati kañcuka sadisam sīhaḷa bhāsam apanetvā
translated: ‘From that’: from the commentary. ‘Having omitted the foreign language’: having omitted the Sinhalese language, which is like a cloak.

original: Vitthāramaggañca samāsayitvāti porāṇaṭṭhakathāsu upari vuccamānampi ānetvā tattha
analyzed: vitthāra maggam ca samāsayitvā ti porāṇa aṭṭhakathāsu upari vuccamānam pi ānetvā tattha
translated: ‘And having condensed the detailed method’: having brought down what is said above in the ancient commentaries, and having expanded it here and there,

original: tattha papañcitaṃ “ñatticatutthena kammena akuppena ṭhānārahena upasampannoti bhikkhū”ti🔽ettha apalokanādīnaṃ catunnampi kammānaṃ vitthārakathā viya tādisaṃ vitthāramaggaṃ
analyzed: tattha papañcitam ñatti catutthena kammena akuppena ṭhāna arahena upasampannaḥ ti bhikkhu iti  ettha apalokana ādīnam catunnam pi kammānam vitthāra kathā viya tādisam vitthāra maggam
translated: ‘One who has been ordained by a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand,’ and so on.🔽The meaning is that he will explain having condensed the detailed method in this way,🔽like the detailed explanation of the four legal procedures beginning with the act of information.

original: saṅkhipitvā vaṇṇayissāmāti adhippāyo. Tathā hi vakkhati –
analyzed: saṅkhipitvā vaṇṇayissāma ati adhippāyaḥ tathā hi vakkhati
translated: For he says:

original: “Ettha ca ñatticatutthakammaṃ ekameva āgataṃ, imasmiṃ pana ṭhāne ṭhatvā cattāri saṅghakammāni
analyzed: ettha ca ñatti catuttha kammam ekam eva āgatam imasmim pana ṭhāne ṭhatvā cattāri saṅgha kammāni
translated: And here the transaction consisting of a motion and one proclamation is the only one mentioned. But in the Commentaries it is said that the four kinds of transactions

original: nīharitvā vitthārato kathetabbānīti sabbaaṭṭhakathāsu vuttaṃ, tāni ca ‘apalokanakammaṃ
analyzed: nīharitvā vitthārato kathetabbāni iti sabba aṭṭhakathāsu vuttam tāni ca apalokana kammam
translated: should be extracted from this place and explained in detail. And those four are:🔽the transaction consisting of a motion,🔽the transaction consisting of a motion and one proclamation,

original: ñattikammaṃ ñattidutiyakammaṃ ñatticatutthakamma’nti paṭipāṭiyā ṭhapetvā vitthārena
analyzed: ñatti kammam ñatti dutiya kammam ñatti catuttha kammanti paṭipāṭiyā ṭhapetvā vitthārena
translated: the transaction consisting of a motion and three proclamations.

original: khandhakato parivārāvasāne kammavibhaṅgato ca pāḷiṃ āharitvā kathitāni. Tāni mayaṃ🔽parivārāvasāne kammavibhaṅgeyeva vaṇṇayissāma. Evañhi sati paṭhamapārājikavaṇṇanā
analyzed: khandhakataḥ parivāra avasāne kamma vibhaṅgataḥ ca pāḷim āharitvā kathitāni tāni mayam  parivāra avasāne vaṇṇayissāmaḥ evam hi sati paṭhama pārājika vaṇṇanā
translated: They are given in detail in the Khandhaka and in the Kamma Vibhaṅga at the end of the Parivāra.🔽We shall comment on them at the end of the Kamma Vibhaṅga in the Parivāra.

original: ca na bhāriyā bhavissati, yathāṭhitāya ca pāḷiyā vaṇṇanā suviññeyyā bhavissati, tāni
analyzed: ca na bhāriyā bhavissati yathā ṭhitāya ca pāḷiyā vaṇṇanā su viññeyyā bhavissati tāni
translated: For if that is done, the commentary on the first Pārājika will not be too long, and the commentary on the text as it stands will be easy to understand, and those places will not be left blank.

original: ca ṭhānāni asuññāni bhavissanti, tasmā anupadavaṇṇanameva karomā”ti.
analyzed: ca ṭhānāni asuññāni bhavissanti tasmai anupada vaṇṇanam eva karoma ati
translated: So we shall comment only on the commentary on the Nissaggiyas.”

original: Vinicchayaṃ sabbamasesayitvāti taṃtaṃaṭṭhakathāsu vuttaṃ sabbampi vinicchayaṃ asesayitvā
analyzed: vinicchayam sabbam a sesayitvā ti taṃ taṃ aṭṭhakathāsu vuttam sabbam pi vinicchayam a sesayitvā
translated: Having investigated all the decisions without reserve

original: sesaṃ akatvā, kiñcimattampi apariccajitvāti vuttaṃ hoti. Vaṇṇituṃ yuttarūpaṃ hutvā
analyzed: sesam a katvā a pariccajitvā iti vuttam hoti vaṇṇitum yutta rūpam hutvā
translated: without omitting any, without leaving out even a little, is what is meant.🔽Without omitting any of the text as it comes down in the right order,

original: anukkamena āgataṃ pāḷiṃ apariccajitvā saṃvaṇṇanato sīhaḷaṭṭhakathāsu ayuttaṭṭhāne
analyzed: anukkamena āgatam pāḷim a pariccajitvā saṃvaṇṇanataḥ sīhaḷa ṭṭhakathāsu ayutta ṭṭhāne
translated: and without misrepresenting what is wrongly placed in the Sinhalese commentaries,🔽it is said: “without overlooking anything in the text.”

original: vaṇṇitaṃ yathāṭhāneyeva saṃvaṇṇanato ca vuttaṃ “tantikkamaṃ kiñci avokkamitvā”ti,🔽kiñci pāḷikkamaṃ anatikkamitvā anukkameneva vaṇṇayissāmāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: vaṇṇitam yathāṭhāneya iva saṃvaṇṇanato ca vuttam tantikkamam kiñci avokkamitvā ati  kiñci pāḷikkamam an atikkamitvā anukkamena iva vaṇṇayissāma ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he intends to comment in the right order without overlooking anything in the text.

original: Suttantikānaṃ vacanānamatthanti suttantapāḷiyaṃ āgatānampi vacanānamatthaṃ. Sīhaḷaṭṭhakathāsu
analyzed: suttantikānam vacanānam atthanti suttantapāḷiyam āgatānam pi vacanānam attham sīhaḷaṭṭhakathāsu
translated: The meaning of the words of the Suttantas: the meaning of the words occurring in the Sutta-Piṭaka.🔽In the Sinhalese commentaries🔽it is said: “the burden of the Suttantikas.” The meaning of the words of the Suttantas that is not mentioned in the Verañja chapter, etc.,

original: “suttantikānaṃ bhāro”ti vatvā avuttānampi verañjakaṇḍādīsu jhānakathāānāpānassatisamaādhiādīnaṃ🔽suttantavacanānamatthaṃ taṃtaṃsuttānurūpaṃ sabbaso paridīpayissāmīti adhippāyo. Hessatīti
analyzed: suttantikānam bhāraḥ ti vatvā avuttānam pi verañja kaṇḍa ādīsu jhāna kathā ānāpāna ssati samaādhi ādīnam  suttanta vacanānam attham tad tad sutta anurūpam sabbaso paridīpayissāmi iti adhippāyaḥ hessati iti
translated: such as the discussion of jhāna, the concentration of mindfulness of breathing, etc.,

original: bhavissati, kariyissatīti vā attho. Ettha ca paṭhamasmiṃ atthavikappe bhāsantarapariccāgādikaṃ
analyzed: bhavissati kariyissati iti vā atthaḥ ettha ca paṭhamasmin attha vikappe bhāsa antara pariccāga ādikam
translated: he will fully reveal in accordance with the relevant sutta. The meaning is that he intends to do this. Will exist: will come to be, will be done, is the meaning. And here, in the first sense, the meaning of the words of the Suttantas is the meaning of the words of the Suttantas that is not mentioned in the Verañja chapter, etc., such as the discussion of jhāna, the concentration of mindfulness of breathing, etc.,

original: catubbidhaṃ kiccaṃ nipphādetvā suttantikānaṃ vacanānamatthaṃ paridīpayantī ayaṃ vaṇṇanā
analyzed: catubbidham kiccam nipphādetvā suttantikānam vacanānam attham paridīpayantī ayam vaṇṇanā
translated: This commentary, which illuminates the meaning of the Suttantika’s words, has fourfold function.

original: bhavissatīti vaṇṇanāya vasena samānakattukatā veditabbā. Pacchimasmiṃ atthavikappe
analyzed: bhavissati iti vaṇṇanāya vasena samāna kattuka tā veditabbā pacchimasmin attha vikappe
translated: It is to be understood that the commentary is the same in meaning as the sutta passages in that it reveals the meaning of the sutta passages after producing the fourfold duty.

original: pana heṭṭhāvuttabhāsantarapariccāgādiṃ katvā suttantikānaṃ vacanānamatthaṃ paridīpayantī
analyzed: pana heṭṭhā vutta bhāsa antara pariccāga ādim katvā suttantikānam vacanānam attham paridīpayantī
translated: But in the last method of interpretation, after abandoning the language and the expression of the former,

original: ayaṃ vaṇṇanā amhehi kariyissatīti evaṃ ācariyavasena samānakattukatā veditabbā. Vaṇṇanāpīti🔽ettha apisaddaṃ gahetvā “tasmāpi sakkaccaṃ anusikkhitabbāti yojetabba”nti cūḷagaṇṭhipade
analyzed: ayam vaṇṇanā amhehi kariyissati iti evam ācariya vasena samāna kattuka tā veditabbā vaṇṇanā api iti  ettha api saddam gahetvā tasmā api sakkaccam anusikkhitabbā iti yojetabbanti cūḷagaṇṭhi pade
translated: it is to be understood that the commentary is the same in meaning as the teacher in that it reveals the meaning of the sutta passages in the way, “This commentary will be done by us.”🔽In the word “commentary” in the text, the word “also” is to be taken as follows: “Therefore it is to be trained in well.”

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha pubbe vuttappayojanavisesaṃ pamāṇabhāvañca sampiṇḍetīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: vuttam tattha pubbe vutta payojana visesam pamāṇa bhāvañca sampiṇḍeti iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: This is said in the Minor Commentary in the section on the “knot” . There the intention is that it combines the special purpose stated above and the measure.

original: Majjhimagaṇṭhipade pana “tasmā sakkaccaṃ anusikkhitabbāpī”ti sambandho vutto. Ettha
analyzed: majjhima gaṇṭhi pade pana tasmā sakkaccam anusikkhitabbā api iti sambandhaḥ vuttaḥ ettha
translated: But in the Middle Commentary the connection is stated thus: “Therefore it is to be trained in well also.”

original: pana na kevalaṃ ayaṃ vaṇṇanā hessati, atha kho anusikkhitabbāpīti imamatthaṃ sampiṇḍetīti
analyzed: pana na kevalam ayam vaṇṇanā hessati atha kho anusikkhitabbā api iti imam attham sampiṇḍeti iti
translated: Herein, the meaning is combined thus: “This commentary is not only to be, but also to be trained in.”

original: adhippāyo. Etthāpi yathāṭhitavaseneva apisaddassa attho gahetabboti amhākaṃ khanti.🔽Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yasmā aṭṭhakathāsu vuttaṃ pamāṇaṃ, yasmā ca ayaṃ vaṇṇanāpi tato
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ ettha api yathā aṭhita vasena iva api saddassa atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ ti amhākam khanti  idam vuttam hoti yasmā aṭṭhakathāsu vuttam pamāṇam yasmā ca ayam vaṇṇanā api tatas
translated: This is the purport. Here too we think that the word “also” should be taken in the sense of “just as it is” .

original: abhinnattā pamāṇabhūtāyeva hessati, tasmā sakkaccaṃ anusikkhitabbāti.
analyzed: a bhinna ttā pamāṇa bhūtāya iva hessati tasmā sakkaccam anusikkhitabbā ati
translated: This is what is meant: since the measure is stated in the commentaries, and since this commentary will be a measure too because it is not different from them, therefore it should be carefully studied.

original: Ganthārambhakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: gantha ārambha kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the introduction to the text is finished.

original: Bāhiranidānakathā
analyzed: bāhira nidāna kathā
translated: The external introduction

original: Idāni “taṃ vaṇṇayissaṃ vinaya”nti paṭiññātattā yathāpaṭiññātavinayasaṃvaṇṇanaṃ kattukāmo
analyzed: idāni tam vaṇṇayissam vinayanti paṭiññāta ttā yathā paṭiññāta vinaya saṃvaṇṇanam kattu kāmo
translated: Now, since he has undertaken to “explain the Discipline,” wishing to comment on the Discipline as he has undertaken to do,

original: saṃvaravinayapahānavinayādivasena vinayassa bahuvidhattā idha saṃvaṇṇetabbabhāvena🔽adhippeto tāva vinayo vavatthapetabboti dassento āha “tatthā”tiādi. Tattha tatthāti
analyzed: saṃvara vinaya pahāna vinaya ādi vasena vinayassa bahuvidha ttā idha saṃvaṇṇetabba bhāvena  adhippetaḥ tāva vinayaḥ vavatthapetabbaḥ ti dassentaḥ āha tattha atiādi tattha tattha ati
translated: since the Discipline is of many kinds as restraint, as abandoning, etc.,

original: tāsu gāthāsu. Tāva-saddo paṭhamanti imasmiṃ atthe daṭṭhabbo. Tena paṭhamaṃ vinayaṃ
analyzed: tāsu gāthāsu tāva saddo paṭhamanti imasmin atthe daṭṭhabbo tena paṭhamam vinayam
translated: he shows that the Discipline which is intended to be commented on here should be defined, saying “Therein,” etc. Therein = in those verses. The word tāva should be taken in the sense of “firstly.” Therefore, first of all, the Discipline should be defined.

original: vavatthapetvā pacchā tassa vaṇṇanaṃ karissāmīti dīpeti. Vavatthapetabboti niyametabbo.🔽Tenetaṃ vuccatīti yasmā vavatthapetabbo, tena hetunā etaṃ “vinayo nāmā”tiādikaṃ niyāmakavacanaṃ
analyzed: vavatthapetvā pacchā tassa vaṇṇanam karissāmi iti dīpeti vavatthapetabbaḥ iti niyametabbaḥ  tena itam vuccati iti yasmai tena hetunā etam vinayaḥ nāma ati ādikam niyāmaka vacanam
translated: and then he will explain it. “It should be defined”: it should be delimited.🔽“Therefore it is said”: because it should be defined, therefore for this reason this delimiting statement “The name of the Vinaya is this . . . ” is said.

original: vuccatīti attho. Assāti vinayassa. Mātikāti uddeso. So hi niddesapadānaṃ jananīṭhāne
analyzed: vuccati iti atthaḥ assa ati vinayassa mātikā ati uddesaḥ saḥ hi niddesa padānam jananī ṭhāne
translated: The meaning is: “it is said.” “The Schedule”: the uddesa. For that is called the “schedule” because it stands at the beginning as the mother of the words of the niddesa,

original: ṭhitattā mātā viyāti mātikāti vuccati.
analyzed: ṭhita ttā mātā viyāti mātikā ati vuccati
translated: as a mother does.

original: Idāni vaṇṇetabbamatthaṃ mātikaṃ ṭhapetvā dassento āha “vuttaṃ yenā”tiādi. Idaṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: idāni vaṇṇetabbam attham mātikam ṭhapetvā dassentaḥ āha vuttam yena atiādi idam vuttam
translated: Now, in order to show the meaning to be explained by setting it out in the schedule, he said “It is said by him” . This is what is said:

original: hoti – etaṃ “tena samayena buddho bhagavā verañjāyaṃ viharatī”tiādinidānavacanapaṭimaṇḍitaṃ🔽vinayapiṭakaṃ yena puggalena vuttaṃ, yasmiṃ kāle vuttaṃ, yasmā kāraṇā vuttaṃ, yena
analyzed: hoti etam tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā verañjāyam viharati iti ādi nidāna vacana paṭimaṇḍitam  vinaya piṭakam yena puggalena vuttam yasmin kāle vuttam yasmā kāraṇā vuttam yena
translated: this Vinaya Piṭaka, adorned with the nidāna statement beginning “At that time the Enlightened One, the Blessed One, was staying at Verañjā” ,🔽was said by a certain person, was said at a certain time, was said for a certain reason, was borne in mind by a certain person, was brought down to earth by a certain person, was established among a certain group of people.

original: dhāritaṃ, yena ca ābhataṃ, yesu patiṭṭhitaṃ, etaṃ yathāvuttavidhānaṃ vatvā tato “tena
analyzed: dhāritam yena ca ābhatam yesu patiṭṭhitam etam yathā vutta vidhānam vatvā tena
translated: After stating this method as it was said, he said “Therefore it is said” .

original: samayenā”tiādipāṭhassa atthaṃ anekappakārato dassayanto vinayassa atthavaṇṇanaṃ karissāmīti.🔽Ettha ca “vuttaṃ yena yadā yasmā”ti idaṃ vacanaṃ “tena samayena buddho bhagavā”tiādinidānavacanamattaṃ
analyzed: samayena ati ādi pāṭhassa attham aneka ppakārataḥ dassayantaḥ vinayassa attha vaṇṇanam karissāmi iti  ettha ca vuttam yena yadā yasmā iti idam vacanam tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavān ati ādi nidāna vacana mattam
translated: I shall comment on the meaning of the Vinaya by showing in various ways the meaning of the passage beginning, “At one time.”🔽Herein, although he wants to say, “What was said, by whom, when, and why,”

original: apekkhitvā vattukāmopi visuṃ avatvā “nidānena ādikalyāṇaṃ, ‘idamavocā’ti nigamanena
analyzed: apekkhitvā vattu kāmaḥ api visum a vatvā nidānena ādi kalyāṇam idam avoca ati nigamanena
translated: without mentioning it separately, he includes it in the words, “At that time, the Enlightened One, the Blessed One,” which are merely the words of the introduction.🔽And because the introduction and the conclusion are in conformity with the Master’s teaching,

original: pariyosānakalyāṇa”nti ca vacanato nidānanigamanānipi satthudesanāya anuvidhānattā
analyzed: ca vacanataḥ nidāna nigamanāni pi satthu desanāya
translated: they are included in it too.🔽So the introduction is included in the Vinaya Piṭaka itself.

original: tadantogadhānevāti nidānassapi vinayapāḷiyaṃyeva antogadhattā “vuttaṃ yena yadā yasmā”ti
analyzed: tad antogadhānā iva ati vinaya pāḷiyaṃya iva vuttam yena yadā yasmā iti
translated: Therefore he set up the mātikā thus, “What was said, by whom, when, and why,”

original: idampi vinayapiṭakasambandhaṃyeva katvā mātikaṃ ṭhapesi. Mātikāya hi “eta”nti vuttaṃ
analyzed: idam pi vinaya piṭaka sambandham yeva katvā mātikam ṭhapesi mātikāya hi etat ti vuttam
translated: making it refer only to the Vinaya Piṭaka. For the Vinaya Piṭaka, which is called “this” in the mātikā,

original: vinayapiṭakaṃyeva sāmaññato sabbattha sambandhamupagacchati.
analyzed: vinaya piṭakam yā iva sāmaññataḥ sabbattha sambandham upagacchati
translated: is in common parlance accepted as referring to all the Vinaya Piṭaka everywhere.

original: Idāni pana taṃ visuṃ nīharitvā dassento “tattha vuttaṃ yenā”tiādimāha. Tattha tatthāti
analyzed: idāni pana tam visum nīharitvā dassento tattha vuttam yena ati ādim āha tattha tattha ati
translated: But now, in order to show it separately, he says, “Herein, what was said by whom,” and so on. Herein, here is a term for each of the four Piṭakas.

original: tesu mātikāpadesu. Atha kasmā idameva vacanaṃ sandhāya vuttanti āha “idañhī”tiādi.
analyzed: tesu mātikā padesu atha kasmai idam eva vacanam sandhāya vuttan ti āha idam hi itiādi
translated: In the case of the passages in the Schedule. Now, why is it said with reference to this very statement? He said “for this reason” and so on.

original: Idanti “tena samayena buddho bhagavā”tiādivacanaṃ. Hi-saddo yasmāti atthe daṭṭhabbo,
analyzed: idam ti tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā ati ādi vacanam hi saddaḥ yasmā ati atthe daṭṭhabbo
translated: This is the statement beginning “At that time the Buddha, the Blessed One” . The word “for” should be regarded as having the meaning of “because” ,

original: yasmā buddhassa bhagavato attapaccakkhavacanaṃ na hoti, tasmāti vuttaṃ hoti. Attapaccakkhavacanaṃ🔽na hotīti attano paccakkhaṃ katvā vuttavacanaṃ na hoti, bhagavatā vuttavacanaṃ na
analyzed: yasmā buddhassa bhagavataḥ atta paccakkha vacanam na hoti tasmā ati vuttam hoti atta paccakkha vacanam  na hoti iti attanaḥ paccakkham katvā vutta vacanam na hoti bhagavatā vutta vacanam na
translated: because the Blessed One’s statement is not one of personal knowledge. That is what is meant.🔽It is not a statement of personal knowledge: it is not a statement made by him after making it known to himself. The meaning is that it is not a statement made by the Blessed One.

original: hotīti adhippāyo. “Attapaccakkhavacanaṃ na hotīti āhacca bhāsitaṃ na hotīti adhippāyo”ti
analyzed: hoti iti adhippāyaḥ atta paccakkha vacanam na hoti iti āhacca bhāsitam na hoti iti adhippāyaḥ ti
translated: “It is not a statement of personal knowledge” means that it is not a statement made by him after making it known to himself.

original: kenaci vuttaṃ. Gaṇṭhipade pana “attapaccakkhavacanaṃ na hotīti attano dharamānakāle🔽vuttavacanaṃ na hotī”ti likhitaṃ. Tadubhayampi atthato samānameva. Idāni pañhakaraṇaṃ
analyzed: kenacid vuttam gaṇṭhi pade pana atta paccakkha vacanam na hoti iti attanaḥ dharamāna kāle  vutta vacanam na hoti iti likhitam tat ubhayam pi atthataḥ samānam eva idāni pañha karaṇam
translated: This is what is meant. But in the Commentary on the Knot it is written: “It is not a statement of personal knowledge: it is not a statement made by him at the time when he was himself experiencing it.”

original: vatvā anukkamena yathāvuttapañhavissajjanaṃ karonto “āyasmatā”tiādimāha. Iminā puggalaṃ
analyzed: vatvā anukkamena yathā vutta pañha vissajjanam karontaḥ āyasmatā ati ādim āha iminā puggalam
translated: Both of these are the same in meaning. Now, after asking the question, he gives the answer to the question as asked in due sequence, saying “The venerable Ānanda” . By this he shows that the Blessed One’s statement is not one of personal knowledge because it is not a statement made by him at the time when he was himself experiencing it.

original: niyameti, “tañcā”tiādinā kālaṃ niyameti. Tañca upālittherena vuttavacanaṃ kālato
analyzed: niyama iti tat ca ati ādinā kālam niyama iti tat ca upālittherena vutta vacanam kālatas
translated: He defines the time by “And that” and so on. The words spoken by the Elder Upāli were spoken at the time of the First Great Rehearsal.

original: paṭhamamahāsaṅgītikāle vuttanti attho.
translated: This is the meaning.

original: Paṭhamamahāsaṅgītikathāvaṇṇanā🔽Idāni taṃ paṭhamamahāsaṅgītiṃ dassetukāmo tassā tantiāruḷhāya idha vacane kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: idāni tam paṭhama mahā saṅgītim dassetu kāmo tassā tanti āruḷhāya vacane kāraṇam
translated: The explanation of the First Great Rehearsal

original: dassento “paṭhamamahāsaṅgīti nāma cesā…pe… veditabbā”ti āha. Paṭhamamahāsaṅgīti nāma🔽cesāti ca-saddo īdisesu ṭhānesu vattabbasampiṇḍanattho, tañca paṭhamamahāsaṅgītikāle
analyzed: dassento paṭhama mahāsaṅgī iti nāma cesāpe veditabbā ti āha paṭhama mahāsaṅgī iti nāma  ca isā ti ca saddaḥ īdisesu ṭhānesu vattabba sampiṇḍana tthaḥ tat ca paṭhama mahā saṅgīti kāle
translated: Now, wanting to show that First Great Rehearsal, he shows the reason for the words here that are based on that rehearsal, saying, “This is called the First Great Rehearsal … should be understood” .🔽The word “called” is a word for including what should be said in such places. And that was spoken at the time of the First Great Rehearsal. And this First Great Rehearsal should be understood thus.

original: vuttaṃ, esā ca paṭhamamahāsaṅgīti evaṃ veditabbāti vuttaṃ hoti. Upaññāsattho vā ca-saddo.🔽Upaññāsoti ca vākyārambho vuccati. Esā hi ganthakārānaṃ pakati, yadidaṃ kiñci vatvā
analyzed: vuttam esā ca paṭhama mahāsaṅgī iti evam veditabbā ti vuttam hoti upaññāsa atthaḥ vā ca saddo  upaññāsaḥ ti ca vākya ārambhaḥ vuccati esā hi ganthakārānam yat idam kiñci vatvā
translated: Or the word “called” has the meaning of “approximately” .

original: puna paraṃ vattumārabhantānaṃ casaddappayogo. Yaṃ pana kenaci vuttaṃ “paṭhamamahāsaṅgīti
analyzed: puna param vattum ārabhantānam ca sadda ppayogaḥ yam pana kenacid vuttam paṭhama mahāsaṅgī iti
translated: And “approximately” is said to be the beginning of a sentence. This is the nature of the authors of texts, namely, that when they have said something and then want to say something more, they use the word “ca” . But what was said by someone else, namely, “The First Great Rehearsal

original: nāma cāti ettha ca-saddo atirekattho, tena aññāpi atthīti dīpetī”ti. Tadeva tassa
analyzed: nāma ca ati ettha casaddo atireka attho tena aññā api atthi iti dīpeti iti tat eva tassa
translated: And the word “and” here has the meaning of “moreover”; thus it shows that there is also another meaning.” But he shows his own lack of skill in the method of composition by this,

original: ganthakkame akovidataṃ dasseti. Na hettha casaddena atirekattho viññāyati. Yadi cettha🔽etadatthoyeva ca-kāro adhippeto siyā, evaṃ sati na kattabboyeva paṭhamasaddeneva
analyzed: gantha kkame akovida tam dasseti na ha ittha ca saddena atireka atthaḥ viññāyati yadi ca ittha  etad atthaḥ yeva cakāraḥ adhippetaḥ siyā evam sati na kattabbaḥ yeva paṭhama saddena iva
translated: for the meaning of “moreover” is not conveyed by the word “and” here. If the word “and” were intended to have this meaning,🔽then it should not have been used, because the existence of the other collections is already shown by the word “first” itself.

original: aññāsaṃ dutiyādisaṅgītīnampi atthibhāvassa dīpitattā. Dutiyādiṃ upādāya hi paṭhamasaddappayogo🔽dīghādiṃ upādāya rassādisaddappayogo viya. Yathāpaccayaṃ tattha tattha desitattā
analyzed: aññāsam dutiya ādi saṅgītīnam pi atthi bhāvassa dīpita ttā dutiya ādim upādāya hi paṭhama sadda ppayogaḥ  dīgha ādim upādāya rassa ādi sadda ppayogaḥ viya yathāpaccayam tattha tattha desita ttā
translated: For the use of the word “first” in relation to the second, etc., is like the use of the word “short” in relation to the “long,” etc.

original: paññattattā ca vippakiṇṇānaṃ dhammavinayānaṃ saṅgahetvā gāyanaṃ kathanaṃ saṅgīti.
analyzed: paññatta ttā ca vippakiṇṇānam dhamma vinayānam saṅgahetvā gāyanam kathanam saṅgīti
translated: The “chanting” is the collecting together, the singing, the teaching, of the scattered rules of the Dhamma and the Discipline, which have been taught here and there in accordance with the need and the occasion.

original: Etena taṃtaṃsikkhāpadānaṃ suttānañca ādipariyosānesu antarantarā ca sambandhavasena
analyzed: etena taṃ taṃ sikkhā padānam suttānam ca ādi pariyosānesu antar antarā ca sambandha vasena
translated: By this, the words of the compilers, which are placed at the beginning, the end, and in the middle of the various rules and suttas in order to show their connection, are included.

original: ṭhapitaṃ saṅgītikāravacanaṃ saṅgahitaṃ hoti. Mahāvisayattā pūjanīyattā ca mahatī
analyzed: saṅgīti kāra vacanam saṅgahitam hoti mahā visaya ttā pūjanīya ttā ca mahatī
translated: The “great collection” is so called because it is great in scope and worthy of veneration.

original: saṅgīti mahāsaṅgīti, paṭhamā mahāsaṅgīti paṭhamamahāsaṅgīti. Nidānakosallatthanti
analyzed: saṅgīti mahāsaṅgīti paṭhamā mahāsaṅgīti paṭhama mahā saṅgīti
translated: The Great Recital, the First Great Recital, the First Great Recital. The meaning of skill in the Nidana.

original: nidadāti desanaṃ desakālādivasena aviditaṃ viditaṃ katvā nidassetīti nidānaṃ, tattha
analyzed: nidadāti desanam desa kāla ādi vasena aviditam viditam katvā nidasseti iti nidānam tattha
translated: He gives a discourse by making it known after making what was unknown known by means of country, occasion, etc., thus it is a nidana. Herein,

original: kosallaṃ nidānakosallaṃ, tadatthanti attho.
analyzed: kosallam nidānakosallam tad atthanti attho
translated: skill in the Nidana is nidana-kosalla. The meaning of that is attha.

original: Sattānaṃ dassanānuttariyasaraṇādipaṭilābhahetubhūtāsu vijjamānāsupi aññāsu bhagavato🔽kiriyāsu “buddho bodheyya”nti paṭiññāya anulomanato veneyyānaṃ maggaphaluppattihetubhūtā
analyzed: sattānam dassana anuttariya saraṇa ādi paṭilābha hetu bhūtāsu vijjamānāsu pi aññāsu bhagavato  kiriyāsu buddhaḥ bodheyyanti paṭiññāya anulomanataḥ veneyyānam magga phala uppatti hetu bhūtā
translated: Although other acts of the Blessed One exist that are a cause for the acquisition of the unsurpassed seeing of beings, of the refuge of the supreme enlightenment, etc.,🔽the act that is a cause for the production of the path and fruition in disciples is the act of a Buddha in the true sense, since it conforms to the vow ‘ Buddha will enlighten ‘.

original: kiriyā nippariyāyena buddhakiccanti āha “dhammacakkappavattanañhi ādiṃ katvā”ti.🔽Tattha saddhindriyādidhammoyeva pavattanaṭṭhena cakkanti dhammacakkaṃ. Atha vā cakkanti🔽āṇā, dhammato anapetattā dhammañca taṃ cakkañcāti dhammacakkaṃ, dhammena ñāyena cakkantipi
analyzed: kiriyā nippariyāyena buddha kiccanti āha dhamma cakka ppavattanam hi ādim katvā iti  tattha pavattana ṭṭhena cakkanti dhammacakkam atha vā cakkanti  āṇā dhammataḥ an apeta ttā dhammam ca tam cakkam ca ati dhammacakkam dhammena ñāyena cakkanti pi
translated: Therefore it is said: ‘ Beginning with the setting in motion of the wheel of the True Idea ‘.

original: dhammacakkaṃ. Yathāha –
analyzed: dhammacakkam yathā āha
translated: Herein, the True Idea itself consisting in the faculties of faith, etc., is a wheel in the sense of moving , thus it is the wheel of the True Idea . Or alternatively, a wheel is a command ; and that is the True Idea’s wheel since it does not swerve from the True Idea, thus it is the wheel of the True Idea . Or the wheel is the True Idea’s way since it is the way to the True Idea, thus it is the wheel of the True Idea , according as it is said:

original: “Dhammañca pavatteti cakkañcāti dhammacakkaṃ, cakkañca pavatteti dhammañcāti dhammacakkaṃ, dhammena pavattetīti dhammacakkaṃ, dhammacariyāya pavattetīti dhammacakka”ntiādi.🔽Katabuddhakicceti kataṃ pariniṭṭhāpitaṃ buddhakiccaṃ yena, tasmiṃ katabuddhakicce🔽bhagavati lokanātheti sambandho. Etena buddhakattabbassa kassacipi asesitabhāvaṃ
analyzed: dhammañca pavatteti cakkañca ati dhammacakkam cakkañca pavatteti dhammañca ati dhammacakkam dhammena pavatteti iti dhammacakkam dhamma cariyāya pavatteti iti dhammacakka ntiādi  kata buddha kicca iti katam pariniṭṭhāpitam buddha kiccam yena tasmim kata buddha kicce  bhagavati lokanāthe iti sambandhaḥ etena buddha kattabbassa kassaci pi a sesita bhāvam
translated: “He sets rolling the wheel of the Dhamma and he sets rolling the wheel of the round of rebirths, thus he is the one who sets rolling the wheel of the Dhamma and the wheel of the round of rebirths. He sets rolling the wheel of the Dhamma and he sets rolling the wheel of the round of rebirths, thus he is the one who sets rolling the wheel of the Dhamma and the wheel of the round of rebirths. He sets rolling the wheel of the Dhamma by means of the Dhamma, thus he is the one who sets rolling the wheel of the Dhamma.
