He sets rolling the wheel of the Dhamma by means of the practice of the Dhamma, thus he is the one who sets rolling the wheel of the Dhamma” , and so on.🔽“Having done what a Buddha has to do”: having done, having accomplished, what a Buddha has to do.🔽The Blessed One, the Lord of the World: the construction is “in the Blessed One, the Lord of the World, who had done what a Buddha has to do.” By this he shows that there is nothing at all left for the Blessed One to do as a Buddha.

original: dasseti. Tatoyeva hi so bhagavā parinibbutoti. Nanu ca sāvakehi vinītāpi vineyyā
analyzed: dasseti tatas yā iva hi so bhagavā parinibbutaḥ ti nanu ca sāvakehi vinītā api vineyyā
translated: For it is only when he has done all that he has to do that he is called “the Blessed One, the Lord of the World, who has done what a Buddha has to do” and only then does he attain to complete extinction, which is why he is called “the Blessed One, the Lord of the World, who has done what a Buddha has to do and who has attained to complete extinction.”🔽But have not disciples to be trained been trained by disciples too?

original: bhagavatāyeva vinītā honti, tathā hi sāvakabhāsitaṃ suttaṃ buddhavacananti vuccati,
analyzed: bhagavatāya iva vinītāḥ honti tathā hi sāvaka bhāsitam suttam buddha vacanan ti vuccati
translated: And is not a sutta spoken by a disciple called the word of the Buddha?🔽And are not those to be trained by disciples already trained?

original: sāvakavineyyā ca na tāva vinītāti? Nāyaṃ doso tesaṃ vinayanūpāyassa sāvakesu ṭhapitattā. Tenevāha –
analyzed: sāvaka vineyyā ca na tāva vinītā ati na ayam doso tesam vinayana upāyassa sāvakesu ṭhapita ttā tena iva āha
translated: There is no fault here. For the Blessed One has placed the means of training in the disciples. That is why he said:

original: “Na tāvāhaṃ pāpima parinibbāyissāmi, yāva na bhikkhū viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā
analyzed: na tāva aham pāpima parinibbāyissāmi yāva na bhikkhū viyattāḥ vinītāḥ visāradāḥ bahu ssutā
translated: “I shall not attain final extinction, Pāpima, until I have monk disciples who are teachers of men and gods, who are accomplished and disciplined, who are skilled and who teach the Dhamma,

original: āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā uppannaṃ parappavādaṃ sahadhammena
analyzed: āgata āgamāḥ dhamma dharāḥ vinaya dharāḥ mātikā dharāḥ uppannam para pavādam sahadhammena
translated: who have learned much, who are bearers of the Teaching, bearers of the Monastic Law, bearers of the outline, who, when a dispute has arisen, can settle it according to the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction;

original: suniggahitaṃ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṃ dhammaṃ desessantī”tiādi.
analyzed: su niggahitam niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyam dhammam desessanti itiādi
translated: and they will be able to refute any opposing doctrines that may arise by means of the Dhamma, by means of the Discipline, by means of the Teacher’s instruction.”

original: “Kusinārāya”ntiādinā bhagavato parinibbutadesakālavisesadassanaṃ, “aparinibbuto bhagavā”ti🔽gāhassa micchābhāvadassanatthaṃ loke jātasaṃvaḍḍhabhāvadassanatthañca. Tathā hi manussabhāvassa
analyzed: kusinārāyanti ādinā bhagavato parinibbuta desa kāla visesa dassanam aparinibbutaḥ bhagavā ti  gāhassa micchā bhāva dassana ttham loke jāta saṃvaḍḍha bhāva dassana ttham ca tathā hi manussa bhāvassa
translated: “At Kusinārā” shows the place and time of the Blessed One’s final Nibbāna. “The Blessed One has not yet finally attained Nibbāna”

original: supākaṭakaraṇatthaṃ mahābodhisattā carimabhave dārapariggahādīnipi karontīti. Kusinārāyanti🔽evaṃnāmake nagare. Samīpatthe cetaṃ bhummavacanaṃ. Upavattane mallānaṃ sālavaneti🔽tassa nagarassa upavattanabhūtaṃ mallarājūnaṃ sālavanuyyānaṃ dasseti. Tattha nagaraṃ
analyzed: su pākaṭa karaṇa ttham mahā bodhisattā carima bhave dāra pariggaha ādīni pi karonti iti kusinārāyanti  evaṃnāmake nagare samīpa atthe ca itam bhumma vacanam upavattane mallānam sāla vana iti  tassa nagarassa upavattana bhūtam malla rājūnam sālavanuyyānam dasseti tattha nagaram
translated: shows that the notion that he has finally attained Nibbāna is wrong, and it shows that he was born and grew up in the world. For great Bodhisattvas, in their last existence, take a wife and so on in order to make their human state very clear.🔽“At Kusinārā” means in a city of that name. This is a locative of place. “In the Mallas’ Sal Wood at Upavattana”🔽shows the park of the Mallā kings, which was near the city and was called Upavattana. For those who wanted to enter the city would leave the park and go by this way,

original: pavisitukāmā uyyānato upecca vattanti gacchanti etenāti upavattananti sālavanaṃ vuccati.
analyzed: pavisitu kāmāḥ uyyānataḥ upecca vattanti gacchanti etena ati upavattanam ti sālavanam vuccati
translated: and so it was called Upavattana, which means “the way out.”

original: Yathā hi anurādhapurassa thūpārāmo dakkhiṇapacchimadisāyaṃ, evaṃ taṃ uyyānaṃ kusinārāya
analyzed: yathā hi anurādhapurassa thūpa ārāmaḥ dakkhiṇa pacchima disā ayam evam tam uyyānam kusinārāya
translated: Just as the Thūpārāma is to the south-west of Anurādhapura,🔽so the pleasaunce was to the south-west of Kusinārā.

original: dakkhiṇapacchimadisāya hoti. Yathā ca thūpārāmato dakkhiṇadvārena nagaraṃ pavisanamaggo
analyzed: dakkhiṇa pacchima disāya hoti yathā ca thūpa ārāmataḥ dakkhiṇa dvārena nagaram pavisana maggo
translated: And just as the road from the Thūpārāma by the southern gate into the city🔽goes east and then turns north,

original: pācīnamukho gantvā uttarena nivattati, evaṃ uyyānato sālapanti pācīnamukhā gantvā
analyzed: pācīna mukhaḥ gantvā uttarena nivattati evam uyyānataḥ sā ālapanti pācīna mukhāḥ gantvā
translated: so the road from the pleasaunce to the Sālas went east and then turned north,🔽and that is why it was called the “Upavattana.”

original: uttarena nivattā, tasmā taṃ “upavattana”nti vuccati. Yamakasālānamantareti yamakasālānaṃ
analyzed: uttarena nivattā tasmā tam upavattanam ti vuccati yamaka sālānam antareti yamaka sālānam
translated: Between the twin Sāla trees:

original: vemajjhe. Tattha kira bhagavato paññattassa parinibbānamañcassa ekā sālapanti sīsabhāge
analyzed: vemajjhe tattha kira bhagavato paññattassa parinibbāna mañcassa ekā sā ālapanti sīsa bhāge
translated: in the middle of the twin Sāla trees. It seems that one Sāla tree was at the head of the couch prepared for the Blessed One’s final Nibbāna,

original: hoti, ekā pādabhāge, tatrāpi eko taruṇasālo sīsabhāgassa āsanno hoti, eko pādabhāgassa,🔽tasmā “yamakasālānamantare”ti vuttaṃ. Api ca “yamakasālā nāma mūlakkhandhaviṭapapattehi
analyzed: hoti ekā pāda bhāge tatra api ekaḥ taruṇa sālaḥ sīsa bhāgassa āsannaḥ hoti ekaḥ pāda bhāgassa  tasmā yamaka sālānam antarā iti vuttam api ca yamaka sālāḥ nāma mūlakkhandha viṭapa pattehi
translated: and the other was at the foot. A young Sāla tree was near the head,

original: aññamaññaṃ saṃsibbetvā ṭhitasālā”tipi mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: aññam aññam saṃsibbetvā ṭhita sāla atipi mahā aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam
translated: and that is why it is said “between the twin Sāla trees.” But it is also said in the Mahā-Aṭṭhakathā that “twin Sāla trees are those that stand together, their roots, trunks, branches, and leaves interlaced” .

original: Anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyāti upādīyate kammakilesehīti upādi, vipākakkhandhā kaṭattā
analyzed: anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā ati upādīyate kamma kilesehi iti vipāka khandhā kaṭattā
translated: In the Nibbāna-element without residue left : it is clung to by defilements as the object of the assumption of self, thus it is a residue ;

original: ca rūpaṃ. So pana upādi kilesābhisaṅkhāramāranimmathanena nibbānappattiyaṃ anossaṭṭho,
analyzed: ca rūpam saḥ pana upādi kilesa abhisaṅkhāra māra nimmathanena nibbāna ppattiyam anossaṭṭhaḥ
translated: and also the materiality of the kamma-resultant aggregates is a residue because of its being the outcome of kamma. But that residue is not mentioned here because of its being eliminated by the elimination of the defilements and by the elimination of the death that is due to kamma-formation.

original: idha khandhamaccumāranimmathanena ossaṭṭho nisesitoti ayaṃ anupādisesā nibbānadhātu
analyzed: idha khandha maccu māra nimmathanena ossaṭṭhaḥ nisesito ti ayaṃ anupādisesā nibbāna dhātu
translated: What is mentioned here is the residue that is eliminated by the elimination of the death that is due to kamma-result.🔽This is the Nibbāna-element without residue left because there is no residue in it.

original: natthi etissā upādisesoti katvā. Nibbānadhātūti cettha nibbutimattaṃ adhippetaṃ,
analyzed: natthi etissā upādisesaḥ ti katvā nibbāna dhātū ti ca ittha nibbutimattam adhippetam
translated: And here the mere cessation is intended by the words “Nibbāna-element.”

original: itthambhūtalakkhaṇe cāyaṃ karaṇaniddeso. Parinibbāneti parinibbānaṭṭhāne, nimittatthe
analyzed: ittham bhūta lakkhaṇe ca ayam karaṇa niddeso parinibbāne iti parinibbāna ṭhāne nimitta atthe
translated: And this is a locative construction in the sense of a place, as in the expression “in the ocean” .🔽In the place of parinibbāna : or the locative ending is used in the sense of a cause,

original: vā bhummavacanaṃ, parinibbānahetu sannipatitānanti attho. Saṅghassa thero saṅghatthero.
analyzed: vā bhumma vacanam parinibbāna hetu sannipatitānam ti attho saṅghassa theraḥ saṅghatthero
translated: the meaning being “in the assembly that had come together for the purpose of parinibbāna.”🔽The elder of the Community : the elder in the Community.🔽But what is the extent of that Community?

original: So pana saṅgho kiṃparimāṇoti āha “sattannaṃ bhikkhusatasahassāna”nti. Niccasāpekkhattā
analyzed: saḥ pana saṅghaḥ kiṃparimāṇaḥ ti āha sattannam bhikkhu sata sahassānam ti nicca sa apekkha ttā
translated: The Community of seven hundred thousand bhikkhus,🔽for such a compound is made because of the expectation of the constant presence of the two terms,

original: hi īdisesu samāso hotiyeva yathā “devadattassa garukula”nti. Sattannaṃ bhikkhusatasahassānanti
analyzed: hi īdisesu samāsaḥ yathā devadattassa garu kulanti bhikkhu sata sahassānanti
translated: as in the expression “Devadatta’s heavy family” .

original: ca saṅghattherānaṃyeva sattannaṃ bhikkhusatasahassānaṃ. Tadā hi “sannipatitā bhikkhū🔽ettakā”ti pamāṇarahitā. Tathā hi veḷuvagāme vedanāvikkhambhanato paṭṭhāya “na cirena
analyzed: ca saṅgha ttherānam yeva sattannam bhikkhu sata sahassānam tadā hi sannipatitāḥ bhikkhū  ettakā ati pamāṇa rahitā tathā hi veḷuva gāme vedanā vikkhambhanato paṭṭhāya na cirena
translated: and seven hundred thousand bhikkhus, all of them senior elders. For at that time the number of bhikkhus who had assembled🔽was beyond reckoning. For when the bhikkhus heard that the Blessed One would attain final Nibbāna before long

original: bhagavā parinibbāyissatī”ti sutvā tato tato āgatesu bhikkhūsu ekabhikkhupi pakkanto
analyzed: bhagavā parinibbāyissati iti sutvā tatas tatas āgatesu bhikkhūsu eka bhikkhu pi pakkantaḥ
translated: after the suppression of pain in the village of Beluva, they came from all directions, and not a single bhikkhu departed.

original: nāma natthi, tasmā gaṇanaṃ vītivatto saṅgho ahosi. Āyasmā mahākassapo dhammavinayasaṅgāyanatthaṃ
analyzed: nāma na atthi tasmā gaṇanam vītivattaḥ saṅghaḥ ahosi āyasmā mahākassapaḥ dhamma vinaya saṅgāyana attham
translated: Therefore the Sangha was beyond counting. The venerable Maha Kassapa aroused the bhikkhus

original: bhikkhūnaṃ ussāhaṃ janesīti sambandho.🔽Tattha mahākassapoti mahantehi sīlakkhandhādīhi samannāgatattā mahanto kassapoti
analyzed: bhikkhūnam ussāham janesi iti sambandhaḥ  tattha mahā kassapo ti mahantehi sīlakkhandha ādīhi samannāgata ttā mahantaḥ kassapo ti
translated: to recite the True Idea and Discipline.

original: mahākassapo, apica kumārakassapattheraṃ upādāya ayaṃ mahāthero “mahākassapo”ti vuccati.
analyzed: mahākassapaḥ apica kumārakassapa theram upādāya ayam mahā theraḥ mahākassapaḥ iti vuccati
translated: Herein, Maha Kassapa: he was great because he possessed the great aggregates of moral discipline, etc., and he was Kassapa, thus he was Maha Kassapa. Moreover, this great elder is called Maha Kassapa in contrast with the bhikkhu Kassapa the Youth.

original: Atha kimatthaṃ āyasmā mahākassapo dhammavinayasaṅgāyanatthaṃ ussāhaṃ janesīti āha
analyzed: atha kimattham āyasmā mahākassapaḥ dhamma vinaya saṅgāyana attham ussāham janesi iti āha
translated: Then why did the venerable Maha Kassapa arouse the bhikkhus to recite the True Idea and Discipline?

original: “sattāhaparinibbute”tiādi. Satta ahāni samāhaṭāni sattāhaṃ, sattāhaṃ parinibbutassa
analyzed: satta aha parinibbuta itiādi satta ahāni samāhaṭāni satta aham satta aham parinibbutassa
translated: “Seven days after the total Nibbāna”: seven days collected together are seven days. The Blessed One was totally Nibbānaed seven days after the total Nibbāna.

original: unnadantī kampittha.

original: mahatā. Bhikkhūnaṃ saṅghena bhikkhusaṅghena, samaṇagaṇena saddhiṃ ekatoti attho.
analyzed: mahatā bhikkhūnam saṅghena bhikkhu saṅghena samaṇa gaṇena saddhim ekatas ti attho
translated: “With a community of bhikkhus” means “with a community of monks, with a group of ascetics.”

original: “Pañcamattehī”tiādinā saṅkhyāmahattaṃ vibhāveti. Matta-saddo cettha pamāṇavacano🔽“bhojane mattaññutā”tiādīsu viya. Sabbaṃ subhaddakaṇḍaṃ vitthārato veditabbanti sabbaṃ
analyzed: pañca mattehi iti ādinā saṅkhyā mahattam matta saddo ca ittha pamāṇa vacano  bhojane mattaññu tā ti ādīsu viya sabbam subhadda kaṇḍam vitthārataḥ veditabbanti sabbam
translated: “With five hundred bhikkhus” and so on analyses the greatness in number. The word “great” here is a synonym for “measure”🔽as in such passages as “moderation in food” .

original: subhaddakaṇḍaṃ idha ānetvā vitthārato dassetabbanti adhippāyo.
analyzed: subhadda kaṇḍam idha ānetvā vitthārataḥ dassetabban ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: “The whole of the Subhaddā Sutta should be understood in detail”: the intention is that the whole of the Subhaddā Sutta should be brought in here and shown in detail.

original: “Tato paranti tato bhikkhūnaṃ ussāhajananato para”nti ācariyadhammapālattherena vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tatas paranti tatas bhikkhūnam ussāha jananato paranti ācariya dhammapāla ttherena vuttam
translated: “Thereafter”: after the bhikkhus’ inspiration, according to the teacher Dhammapāla.

original: Mahāgaṇṭhipade pana “tato paranti subhaddakaṇḍato para”nti vuttaṃ. Idamevettha sārato
analyzed: mahāgaṇṭhi pade pana tatas paranti subhadda kaṇḍato paranti vuttam idam eva ittha sārataḥ
translated: But in the Mahāgaṇṭhi Commentary it is said: “Thereafter: after the Subhaddā Sutta.” Herein, the commentator’s intention is this:

original: paccetabbanti no takko. Ayameva hi ussāhajananappakāro, yadidaṃ “handa mayaṃ, āvuso,
analyzed: paccetabbanti no takkaḥ ayam eva hi ussāha janana ppakāraḥ yat idam handa mayam āvuso
translated: “It is to be accepted” is not a question. For this is the way of arousing energy: “Come, friends,

original: dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyeyyāma, pure adhammo dippatī”tiādi, tasmā ussāhajananato
analyzed: dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyeyyāma pure adhammaḥ dippati itiādi tasmai ussāha jananato
translated: “It should be accepted” is not a question. For this is the way of arousing zeal, namely, “Come, friends, let us recite the True Idea and Discipline, lest the True Idea be lost.”🔽Therefore, because of arousing zeal,

original: paranti na vattabbaṃ heṭṭhā ussāhajananappakārassa pāḷiyaṃ avuttattā. Ayañhettha pāḷikkamo –
analyzed: param ti na vattabbam heṭṭhā ussāha janana ppakārassa pāḷiyam a vutta ttā ayan ha ittha pāḷikkamaḥ
translated: it is not to be said that it is after the last . Because the way of arousing zeal below is not stated in the text. This is the text’s order:

original: “Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo bhikkhū āmantesi, ekamidāhaṃ, āvuso, samayaṃ pāvāya
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā mahākassapaḥ bhikkhū āmantesi ekam idā aham āvuso samayam pāvāya
translated: “Then the venerable Maha Kassapa addressed the bhikkhus, ‘On one occasion, friends,

original: kusināraṃ addhānamaggappaṭipanno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.
analyzed: kusināram addhāna magga ppaṭipannaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi
translated: I was travelling along the high road from Pava to Kusinara with a large number of bhikkhus, with about five hundred bhikkhus.

original: Atha khvāhaṃ, āvuso, maggā okkamma aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdiṃ.
analyzed: atha khvā aham āvuso maggā okkamma aññatarasmim rukkha mūle nisīdiṃ
translated: Then, friends, leaving the road I sat down at the root of a certain tree.

original: “Tena kho pana samayena aññataro ājīvako kusinārāya mandāravapupphaṃ gahetvā pāvaṃ
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ ājīvakaḥ kusinārāya mandārava puppham gahetvā pāvam
translated: “Now on that occasion a certain Ajivaka had picked a coral-tree flower in Kusinara and was travelling to Pava

original: addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti. Addasaṃ kho ahaṃ, āvuso, taṃ ājīvakaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ,
analyzed: addhāna magga ppaṭipannaḥ hoti addasam kho aham āvuso tam ājīvakam dūratas vai āgacchantam
translated: along the high road. I saw that Ajivaka coming in the distance,

original: disvāna taṃ ājīvakaṃ etadavocaṃ ‘apāvuso, amhākaṃ satthāraṃ jānāsī’ti? ‘Āma, āvuso,
analyzed: disvāna tam ājīvakam etat avocam apāvuso amhākam satthāram jānāsi iti āma āvuso
translated: and asked him, ‘Friend, do you know our Teacher?’

original: jānāmi. Ajja sattāhaparinibbuto samaṇo gotamo, tato me idaṃ mandāravapupphaṃ gahitanti.
analyzed: jānāmi ajja satta aha parinibbutaḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tatas me idam mandārava puppham gahitan ti
translated: ‘Yes, friend, I know. The ascetic Gotama attained final Nibbana a week ago. That’s how I came to pick this coral tree flower.’

original: Tatrāvuso, ye te bhikkhū avītarāgā, appekacce bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṃ🔽papatanti āvaṭṭanti vivaṭṭanti, ‘atikhippaṃ bhagavā parinibbuto, atikhippaṃ sugato
analyzed: tatra āvuso ye te bhikkhū a vīta rāgāḥ appekacce bāhā paggayha kandanti chinna pātam  papatanti āvaṭṭanti vivaṭṭanti atikhippam bhagavā parinibbutaḥ atikhippam sugato
translated: “Then, friends, those bhikkhus who were not free from passion wept and tore their hair…

original: parinibbuto, atikhippaṃ cakkhuṃ loke antarahita’nti. Ye pana te bhikkhū vītarāgā,
analyzed: parinibbutaḥ ati khippam cakkhum loke antarahitanti ye pana te bhikkhū vīta rāgā
translated: ‘Too soon has the Blessed One come to his Parinibbana! Too soon has the Happy One come to his Parinibbana! Too soon has the Eye of the World vanished from sight!’

original: te satā sampajānā adhivāsenti ‘aniccā saṅkhārā, taṃ kutettha labbhā”’ti.
analyzed: te satā sampajānāḥ adhivāsenti aniccā saṅkhārā tam kuta ittha
translated: But those bhikkhus who were free from passion bore it patiently, mindful and fully aware, saying: ‘All compounded things are impermanent - what is the use of this?’

original: “Atha khvāhaṃ, āvuso, te bhikkhū etadavocaṃ – ‘alaṃ, āvuso, mā socittha mā paridevittha,
analyzed: atha khvā aham āvuso te bhikkhū etat avocam alam āvuso mā socittha mā paridevittha
translated: “Then, friends, I said to those bhikkhus: ‘Enough, friends! Do not grieve, do not lament!

original: nanvetaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā paṭikacceva akkhātaṃ ‘sabbeheva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo
analyzed: nanu etam āvuso bhagavatā paṭikaccā iva akkhātam sabbehi iva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvaḥ
translated: Has it not been declared by the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened…

original: vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo. Taṃ kutettha, āvuso, labbhā, yaṃ taṃ jātaṃ bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ
analyzed: vinābhāvaḥ aññathābhāvo tam kuta ittha āvuso labbhā yam tam jātam bhūtam saṅkhatam
translated: the state of having disappeared, the state of having changed. But how could it be possible that what is born, what comes into being, what is created, and what is conditioned

original: palokadhammaṃ, taṃ vata mā palujjī’ti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: paloka dhammam tam vata mā palujji iti na itam ṭhānam vijjati iti
translated: could not end in destruction? That is impossible.’

original: “Tena kho pana samayena, āvuso, subhaddo nāma vuḍḍhapabbajito tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āvuso subhaddaḥ nāma vuḍḍha pabbajitaḥ tassam parisāyam nisinnaḥ
translated: “At that time, friends, there was a newly ordained monk in that assembly called Subhadda.

original: hoti. Atha kho āvuso subhaddo vuḍḍhapabbajito te bhikkhū etadavoca ‘alaṃ, āvuso,
analyzed: hoti atha kho āvuso subhaddaḥ vuḍḍha pabbajitaḥ te bhikkhū etat avoca alam āvuso
translated: Then the newly ordained monk Subhadda said to those monks,

original: mā socittha mā paridevittha, sumuttā mayaṃ tena mahāsamaṇena, upaddutā ca mayaṃ homa’
analyzed: mā socittha mā paridevittha su muttā mayam tena mahā samaṇena upaddutā ca mayam homa
translated: ‘Enough, friends, don’t grieve, don’t lament. We are well rid of the great contemplative. We were annoyed

original: ‘idaṃ vo kappati, idaṃ vo na kappatī’ti, ‘idāni pana mayaṃ yaṃ icchissāma, taṃ karissāma,
analyzed: idam vaḥ kappati idam vaḥ na kappati iti idāni pana mayam yam icchissāma tam karissāma
translated: that he said, “This is allowable for you, this is not allowable for you.” But now we can do what we like,

original: yaṃ na icchissāma, na taṃ karissāmā’ti. Handa mayaṃ āvuso dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyeyyāma,
analyzed: yam naḥ icchissāma na tam karissāma ati handa mayam āvuso dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyeyyāma
translated: and we won’t do what we don’t like.’ ‘Come, friends, let’s recite the Teaching and the Monastic Law together.

original: pure adhammo dippati, dhammo paṭibāhīyati, avinayo pure dippati, vinayo paṭibāhīyati,
analyzed: pure adhammaḥ dippati dhammo paṭibāhīyati avinayo pure dippati vinayo paṭibāhīyati
translated: Otherwise, bad qualities may spread among us, and the Teaching and the Monastic Law may be corrupted.

original: pure adhammavādino balavanto honti, dhammavādino dubbalā honti, pure avinayavādino
analyzed: pure adhamma vādinaḥ balavantaḥ honti dhamma vādinaḥ dubbalāḥ honti pure a vinaya vādinaḥ
translated: If those who speak contrary to the Teaching are powerful and those who speak in accordance with the Teaching are weak,

original: balavanto honti, vinayavādino dubbalā hontī”ti.
analyzed: balavantaḥ honti vinaya vādinaḥ dubbalāḥ honti iti
translated: “Previously the proponents of what is contrary to the Dhamma were powerful, while the proponents of the Dhamma were weak. Previously the proponents of what is contrary to the Disicipline were powerful, while the proponents of the Discipline were weak.”

original: “‘Tena hi, bhante, thero bhikkhū uccinatū’ti. Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo ekenūnapañcaarahantasatāni
analyzed: tena hi bhante theraḥ bhikkhū uccinatu iti atha kho āyasmā mahākassapaḥ eka enūnapañca arahanta satāni
translated: “‘Well then, venerable sir, let the elder select the bhikkhus.’ Then the venerable Maha Kassapa selected four hundred and ninety-nine arahats

original: uccini. Bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ mahākassapaṃ etadavocuṃ ‘ayaṃ, bhante, āyasmā ānando kiñcāpi🔽sekkho, abhabbo chandā dosā mohā bhayā agatiṃ gantuṃ, bahu cānena bhagavato santike
analyzed: uccini bhikkhū āyasmantam mahākassapam etat avocuṃ ayam bhante āyasman ānando kiñca api  sekkhaḥ abhabbaḥ chandā dosā mohā bhayā agatim gantum bahu ca anena bhagavato santike
translated: The bhikkhus said to the venerable Maha Kassapa, ‘Venerable sir, although this venerable Ananda is still a trainee, he is incapable of going to an unhappy destination in hell or as an animal; he has learned much from the Blessed One,🔽he has learned much that is good, wholesome, and praiseworthy; he has inquired and asked questions, he has done the teacher’s bidding, a fertile field has he made for the world with its gods, men, and asuras.

original: dhammo ca vinayo ca pariyatto. Tena hi, bhante, thero āyasmantampi ānandaṃ uccinatū”’tiādi.
analyzed: dhammo ca vinayo ca pariyatto tena hi bhante theraḥ āyasmantam pi ānandam uccinatu utiādi
translated: Therefore, venerable sir, let the elder select the venerable Ananda too.’

original: Tasmā tato paranti ettha subhaddakaṇḍato paranti evamattho daṭṭhabbo. “Sabbaṃ subhaddakaṇḍaṃ
analyzed: tasmā tatas paranti ettha subhadda kaṇḍato paranti evamatthaḥ daṭṭhabbo sabbam subhadda kaṇḍam
translated: Therefore, after that, the meaning should be seen here as follows: ‘After the Subhadda Khandhaka’ . For by the words ‘The whole of the Subhadda Khandhaka should be known in detail’

original: vitthārato veditabba”nti hi iminā “yaṃ na icchissāma, na taṃ karissāmā”ti etaṃ pariyantaṃ
analyzed: vitthārataḥ veditabbanti hi iminā yam naḥ icchissāma na tam karissāma ati etam pariyantam
translated: the meaning of the words ‘We will not do what we do not like’ is limited to this.

original: subhaddakaṇḍapāḷiṃ dassetvā idāni avasesaṃ ussāhajananappakārappavattaṃ pāḷimeva
analyzed: subhadda kaṇḍa pāḷim dassetvā idāni avasesam ussāha janana pakāra ppavattam pāḷim eva
translated: and having shown the Subhaddā story, now the rest of the text is given in order to generate enthusiasm.

original: dassento “handa mayaṃ āvuso”tiādimāha.
analyzed: handa mayam āvuso ti ādim āha
translated: and now, in order to show the rest of the text, which is the text itself in the form of an exhortation, he said “Now, friends, let us suppose that wrong conduct … ” .

original: Tattha pure adhammo dippatīti ettha adhammo nāma dasakusalakammapathadhammapaṭipakkhabhūto🔽adhammo. Pure dippatīti api nāma dippati. Atha vā yāva adhammo dhammaṃ paṭibāhituṃ🔽samattho hoti, tato puretaramevāti attho. Āsanne hi anāgate ayaṃ puresaddo. Dippatīti
analyzed: tattha pure adhammo dippati iti ettha adhammo nāma dasa kusala kammapatha dhamma paṭipakkha bhūto  adhammaḥ pure dippati iti api nāma dippati atha vā yāva adhammaḥ dhammam paṭibāhitum  samatthaḥ hoti tatas puretaram eva ati atthaḥ āsanne hi anāgate ayam puresaddaḥ dippati iti
translated: Herein, wrong conduct was manifest means that wrong conduct, which is the opposite of the right conduct of the ten profitable courses of action,

original: dippissati. Pure-saddayogena hi anāgatatthe ayaṃ vattamānapayogo yathā “purā vassati🔽devo”ti. Keci panettha evaṃ vaṇṇayanti “pureti pacchā anāgate yathā addhānaṃ gacchantassa
analyzed: pure sadda yogena hi anāgata tthe ayam vattamāna payogaḥ yathā purā vassati  deva iti keci pana ittha evam vaṇṇayanti purā iti pacchā anāgate yathā addhānam gacchantassa
translated: was manifest. Was manifest : it was as if it were manifest. Or else the meaning is that it was manifest before it was able to prevent the right conduct from being manifest. For the word pure is used in the future sense of “before” when the future is near. Was manifest means it will be manifest. For this present-tense usage is in the future sense by the addition of the word pure, just as in the expression “Before the rain falls, let the storehouse be built” .

original: gantabbamaggo ‘pure’ti vuccati, tathā idha daṭṭhabba”nti. Avinayoti pahānavinayasaṃvaravinayānaṃ
analyzed: gantabba maggo purā iti vuccati tathā idha daṭṭhabbanti avinayaḥ ti pahāna vinaya saṃvara vinayānam
translated: But some explain it as follows: “Pure is after, in the future. Just as the road to be gone over is called ‘before’ when a man is going, so here too” . Not in accordance with the discipline means that it was not in accordance with the discipline of abandoning and the discipline of restraint.

original: paṭipakkhabhūto avinayo. “Vinayavādino dubbalā hontī”ti evaṃ iti-saddopi ettha daṭṭhabbo,
analyzed: paṭipakkha bhūtaḥ avinayaḥ vinaya vādinaḥ dubbalāḥ honti iti evam iti saddaḥ api ettha daṭṭhabbo
translated: and the opposite of that is non-discipline. The word “but” should be understood here in the sense of “the proponents of the discipline are weak” .

original: “tato paraṃ āhā”ti iminā sambandho. Potthakesu pana katthaci iti-saddo na dissati,
analyzed: tatas param āha ati iminā sambandho potthakesu pana katthaci iti saddo na dissati
translated: The word “afterwards” is connected with this. But in the books the word “but” is not found in some places.

original: pāḷiyaṃ pana dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathāyañca attheva iti-saddo.
analyzed: pāḷiyam pana dīgha nikāya ṭṭhakathāyam ca atthā iva iti saddo
translated: But in the text and in the Commentary on the Dīgha Nikāya the word “but” is there.

original: Tena hīti uyyojanatthe nipāto. Uccinane uyyojentā hi taṃ mahākassapattheraṃ evamāhaṃsu.
analyzed: tena hi iti uyyojana atthe nipātaḥ uccinane uyyojentā hi tam mahākassapa theram evam āhaṃsu
translated: So the particle “then” is in the sense of “afterwards”. For those who were selecting the bhikkhus said this to the Elder Maha Kassapa.

original: Bhikkhū uccinatūti saṅgītiyā anurūpe bhikkhū uccinitvā gaṇhātūti attho. “Sakalanavaṅga…pe…🔽pariggahesī”ti etena sukkhavipassakakhīṇāsavapariyantānaṃ yathāvuttapuggalānaṃ satipi🔽āgamādhigamasabbhāve saha paṭisambhidāhi tevijjādiguṇayuttānaṃ āgamādhigamasampattiyā
analyzed: bhikkhū uccinatu iti saṅgītiyāḥ anurūpe bhikkhū uccinitvā gaṇhātu iti attho sakala navaṅgape  pariggahesi iti etena sukkha vipassaka khīṇāsava pariyantānam yathāvutta puggalānam sati pi  āgama adhigama sabbhāve saha paṭisambhidāhi tevijja ādi guṇa yuttānam āgama adhigama sampattiyā
translated: The meaning is: “Let the bhikkhus select, let them take after selecting those bhikkhus who are suitable for the Recital.”🔽By the words “Then the Elder Maha Kassapa … took up the nine-part Collection of Long Discourses” he shows that although those persons mentioned above, namely, the dry-insight-knowledge arahats and the stream-enterers, etc., who possess the three knowledges, etc., have the possession of the scriptures and the realizations,

original: ukkaṃsagatattā saṅgītiyā bahūpakārataṃ dasseti. Tattha sakalanavaṅgasatthusāsanapariyattidhareti
analyzed: ukkaṃsa gata ttā saṅgītiyāḥ bahu upakāra tam dasseti tattha sakala navaṅga satthu sāsana pariyatti dharā iti
translated: nevertheless they are of great service to the Recital because they are outstanding on account of their possession of the scriptures and the realizations.🔽Herein, “who had mastered the nine-part Collection of the True Idea taught by the Master” means

original: sakalaṃ suttageyyādi navaṅgaṃ ettha, etassa vā atthīti sakalanavaṅgaṃ, satthusāsanaṃ.
analyzed: sakalam sutta geyya ādi navaṅgam ettha etassa vā atthi iti sakala navaṅgam satthu sāsanam
translated: The entire ninefold Scripture consisting of the Suttas in prose and verse, etc., is the “entire ninefold scriptures,” the Master’s Dispensation.

original: Atthakāmena pariyāpuṇitabbato diṭṭhadhammikādipurisattapariyattabhāvato ca pariyattīti
analyzed: attha kāmena pariyāpuṇitabbataḥ diṭṭhadhammika ādi purisatta pariyatta bhāvataḥ ca pariyattī iti
translated: It is called “the entire ninefold scriptures” because the entire ninefold scriptures are contained in it, or because it contains the meaning of the entire ninefold scriptures.

original: tīṇi piṭakāni vuccanti, taṃ sakalanavaṅgasatthusāsanasaṅkhātaṃ pariyattiṃ dhārentīti
analyzed: tīṇi piṭakāni vuccanti tam sakala navaṅga satthu sāsana saṅkhātam pariyattim dhārenti iti
translated: The three Piṭakas are called “the entire ninefold scriptures” because they contain the entire ninefold scriptures consisting of the Master’s Dispensation.🔽They are “bearers of the entire ninefold scriptures consisting of the Master’s Dispensation” because they bear the entire ninefold scriptures consisting of the Master’s Dispensation.🔽The meaning is: in those who are such.

original: sakalanavaṅgasatthusāsanapariyattidharā, tādiseti attho. Bahūnaṃ nānappakārānaṃ kilesānaṃ
analyzed: sakala navaṅga satthu sāsana pariyatti dharā tādisā iti atthaḥ bahūnam nānappakārānam kilesānam
translated: Because they are not destroyed by the many kinds of defilements🔽and by personality view, they generate them or are generated by them, thus they are “ordinary people” .

original: sakkāyadiṭṭhiyā ca avihatattā tā janenti, tāhi vā janitāti puthujjanā. Duvidhā puthujjanā
analyzed: ca avihata ttā tāḥ janenti tāhi vā janitā ati puthujjanāḥ duvidhā puthujjanāḥ
translated: Ordinary people are of two kinds:

original: andhaputhujjanā kalyāṇaputhujjanāti. Tattha yesaṃ khandhadhātuāyatanādīsu uggahaparipucchāsavanadhāraṇapaccavekkhaṇāni
analyzed: andha puthujjanā kalyāṇa puthujjanā ti tattha yesam khandha dhātu āyatana ādīsu uggaha paripucchā savana dhāraṇa paccavekkhaṇāni
translated: blind ordinary people and good ordinary people. Herein, those who have no learning, questioning, hearing, remembering, and reviewing of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc.,

original: natthi, te andhaputhujjanā. Yesaṃ tāni atthi, te kalyāṇaputhujjanā. Te idha “puthujjanā”ti
analyzed: natthi te andha puthujjanā yesam tāni atthi te kalyāṇa puthujjanā te idha puthujjanā ati
translated: are blind ordinary people. Those who have these are good ordinary people. Herein, “ordinary people” refers to

original: adhippetā. Samathabhāvanāsinehābhāvena sukkhā lūkhā asiniddhā vipassanā etesanti sukkhavipassakā.
analyzed: adhippetā samatha bhāvanā sineha abhāvena sukkhā lūkhā asi niddhā vipassanā etesanti sukkha vipassakā
translated: They are called “dry” because they are devoid of the oiliness of the jhānas and because they are rough and hard.

translated: The meaning is: “This statement beginning with the words ‘Then the venerable Ananda’ was said in the Khandhaka of the Collection.”🔽“But why?” Why is it that the trainee is called a “learner” and the one beyond training is called an “accomplished one”?

original: Kissa panāti kasmā pana. Sikkhatīti sekkho, atha vā sikkhanaṃ sikkhā, sāyeva tassa

analyzed: na vā ayam kumārakaḥ mattam aññāsi iti tathā hi parinibbute satthari mahākassapa thero  satthu parinibbāne sannipatitassa bhikkhu saṅghassa majjhe nisīditvā dhamma vinaya saṅgāyana ttham

analyzed: aṭṭha vare yācitvā upaṭṭhahati icchiticchita ṭṭhānam satthāram gahetvā gantum sakkoti  amhākam dārake etassa santike pabbājessāma saḥ satthāram gahetvā āgamissati tasmin

translated: “Venerable Kassapa, although I have these white hairs,

analyzed: saddhim cārikam carasi sassa ghātam maññe carasi kula upaghātam maññe carasi olujjati

analyzed: kassa vā ati ādīsu saṃsaye ayam vā imesam samaṇa brāhmaṇānam sabba bālaḥ sabba mūḷhaḥ iti ādīsu
translated: in such passages as “Ke vā ime kassa vā” it is seen in the sense of doubt. In such passages as “Ayaṃ vā imesaṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ sabbabālo sabbamūḷho” it is seen

original: vavassagge. “Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā”tiādīsu vikappeti. Idha🔽pana padapūraṇe daṭṭhabbo. Teneva ca ācariyadhammapālattherena vuttaṃ “vāsaddassa
analyzed: vavassagge ye hi keci bhikkhave samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā ati ādīsu vikappeti idha  pana pada pūraṇe daṭṭhabbo tena iva ca ācariya dhammapāla ttherena vuttam vā saddassa
translated: in the sense of postposition. In such passages as “Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā” it is seen in the sense of alternative. Here🔽it should be seen in the sense of filling out. Therefore the teacher Dhammapāla said: “When the meaning of vā is being extracted, in such passages as ‘Na vāyaṃ kumārako mattamaññāsī’ it is filling out.”

original: atthuddhāraṃ karontena ‘na vāyaṃ kumārako mattamaññāsī’tiādīsu padapūraṇe”ti. Aṭṭhakathāyampi
analyzed: attha uddhāram karontena na vā ayam kumārakaḥ mattam aññāsi itiādīsu pada pūraṇā iti aṭṭhakathā ayam pi
translated: In the commentary too it is said:

original: ettakameva vuttaṃ “na vāyaṃ kumārako mattamaññāsīti ayaṃ kumārako attano pamāṇaṃ
analyzed: ettakam eva vuttam na vā ayam kumārakaḥ mattam aññāsi iti ayam kumārakaḥ attanaḥ pamāṇam
translated: It is said only this much: “This boy does not know the measure of his own strength.”🔽“He does not know, indeed,” said the Elder, rebuking him.

original: na vata jānātīti theraṃ tajjento āhā”ti. Etthāpi vatāti vacanasiliṭṭhatāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: na vata jānāti iti theram tajjentaḥ āha ati ettha api vata iti vacana siliṭṭhatāya vuttam
translated: Here, too, the word “vat” is used in the sense of a mode of expression.

original: Yaṃ panettha kenaci vuttaṃ “na vāyanti ettha vāti vibhāsā, aññāsipi na aññāsipīti
analyzed: yam pana ittha kenacid vuttam na vāyanti ettha vā iti vibhāsāḥ na aññāsipi iti
translated: But what is said here by someone: “The word ‘na vāyanti’ is a vibhāsā. The meaning is: ‘He knows, but he does not know.’“

original: attho”ti. Taṃ tassa matimattanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Na hettha ayamattho sambhavati, tasmā
analyzed: attho ti tam tassa matimattanti daṭṭhabbam na ha ittha ayam attho sambhavati tasmā
translated: That should be seen as his own opinion. For this meaning is not possible here. Therefore

original: attano pamāṇaṃ nāññāsīti evamattho veditabbo. Tatrāti evaṃ sati. Chandāgamanaṃ viyāti🔽ettha chandā āgamanaṃ viyāti padacchedo kātabbo, chandena āgamanaṃ pavattanaṃ viyāti
analyzed: attanaḥ pamāṇam na aññāsi iti evamattho veditabbo tatra ati evam sati chanda āgamanam viya ati  ettha chandāḥ āgamanam viya iti padacchedaḥ kātabbo chandena āgamanam pavattanam viya ati
translated: the meaning should be understood thus: “He does not know the measure of his own strength.” There, when it is so,🔽the word “viya” should be analyzed as “chandāgamanaṃ viya.” The meaning is: “like the occurrence of coming by desire.”

original: attho, chandena akattabbakaraṇaṃ viyāti vuttaṃ hoti. Chandaṃ vā āgacchati sampayogavasenāti
analyzed: atthaḥ chandena a kattabba karaṇam viya iti vuttam hoti chandam vā āgacchati sampayoga vasena ati
translated: It is said: “like doing what should not be done by desire.” Or it comes by desire by the means of association.

original: chandāgamanaṃ, tathā pavatto apāyagamanīyo akusalacittuppādo. Atha vā ananurūpaṃ
analyzed: chanda āgamanam tathā pavattaḥ apāya gamanīyaḥ akusala cittuppādaḥ atha vā ananurūpam
translated: Thus it is “chandāgamana.” The arising of unwholesome consciousness that occurs thus is liable to lead to the lower worlds. Or, it is not suitable.

original: gamanaṃ agamanaṃ, chandena agamanaṃ chandāgamanaṃ, chandena sinehena ananurūpaṃ gamanaṃ🔽pavattanaṃ akattabbakaraṇaṃ viyāti vuttaṃ hoti. Asekkhapaṭisambhidāppatteti asekkhabhūtā
analyzed: gamanam a gamanam chandena a gamanam chanda āgamanam chandena sinehena ananurūpam gamanam  pavattanam a kattabba karaṇam viya iti vuttam hoti asekkha paṭisambhidā appattā iti asekkha bhūtā
translated: Going by desire is going by lust, by hate, by delusion, by fear, by favour, by affection, by attachment, by bondage, by bondage of mind, by bondage of thought.

original: paṭisambhidā asekkhapaṭisambhidā, taṃ patte, paṭiladdhaasekkhapaṭisambhideti attho.
analyzed: paṭisambhidā asekkha paṭisambhidā tam patte paṭiladdha asekkha paṭisambhidā iti attho
translated: Having attained the discriminations of one beyond training: the discriminations of one who is a disciple beyond training are the discriminations of one beyond training. Having attained that, having obtained the discriminations of one beyond training, is the meaning.

original: Anumatiyāti anuññāya, yācanāyāti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: anumatiyā āti anuññāya yācanāya āti vuttam hoti
translated: With his approval: with his permission, with his request, is what is meant.

original: “Kiñcāpi sekkho”ti idaṃ na sekkhānaṃ agatigamanasabbhāvena vuttaṃ, asekkhānaṃyeva
analyzed: kiñcā api sekkha iti idam na sekkhānam agati gamana sabbhāvena vuttam asekkhānam yeva
translated: “Although he is a disciple in higher training”: this is not said because of the disciple’s going to a bad destination. But it should be regarded as said because of the elder’s going to a bad destination.

original: pana uccinitattāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Paṭhamamaggeneva hi cattāri agatigamanāni pahīyanti,
analyzed: pana uccinita ttā ti daṭṭhabbam paṭhama maggena iva hi cattāri agati gamanāni pahīyanti
translated: For the four kinds of going to a bad destination are abandoned only by the path of non-returning.

original: tasmā kiñcāpi sekkho, tathāpi thero āyasmantampi ānandaṃ uccinatūti evamettha sambandho
analyzed: tasmā kiñcā api sekkho tathā api theraḥ āyasmantam pi ānandam uccinatu iti evam ettha sambandhaḥ
translated: Therefore, although he is a disciple in higher training, still the elder should censure even the venerable Ananda. This is how the construction should be understood here.

original: veditabbo. Na pana kiñcāpi sekkho, tathāpi abhabbo agatiṃ gantunti yojetabbaṃ. “Abhabbo”tiādinā
analyzed: veditabbaḥ na pana kiñcā api sekkho tathā api abhabbaḥ agatim gantunti yojetabbam abhabba uti ādinā
translated: But it should not be construed thus: “Although he is a disciple in higher training, still he is incapable of going to a bad destination.” “Incapable” and so on are words of praise.

original: pana dhammasaṅgītiyā tassa arahabhāvaṃ dassentā vijjamāne guṇe kathenti. Tattha chandāti
analyzed: pana dhamma saṅgītiyā tassa araha bhāvam dassentā vijjamāne guṇe kathenti tattha chanda ati
translated: but they were speaking of his special qualities, which were actually present, in order to show that he was an Arahant at the time of the Recital of the Dhamma. Herein, “desire” is craving.

original: chandena, sinehenāti attho. Agatiṃ gantunti agantabbaṃ gantuṃ, akattabbaṃ kātunti
analyzed: chandena sinehena ati atthaḥ agatim gantunti a gantabbam gantum a kattabbam kātum
translated: But when they were teaching the Dhamma in the Dhamma-recital, they spoke of his special qualities as they existed. Herein, “By desire” means by affection. “He went by a wrong path” means he went where he should not have gone, he did what he should not have done.

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Imāni pana cattāri agatigamanāni bhaṇḍabhājanīye ca vinicchayaṭṭhāne🔽ca labbhanti. Tattha bhaṇḍabhājanīye tāva attano bhārabhūtānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ amanāpe
analyzed: vuttam hoti imāni pana cattāri agati gamanāni bhaṇḍa bhājanīye ca vinicchaya ṭṭhāne  ca labbhanti tattha bhaṇḍa bhājanīye tāva attanaḥ bhāra bhūtānam bhikkhūnam amanāpe
translated: These four wrong paths are found in the case of the distribution of requisites and in the case of the decision on legal questions.

original: bhaṇḍe sampatte taṃ parivattitvā manāpaṃ dento chandāgatiṃ gacchati nāma. Attano🔽pana abhārabhūtānaṃ manāpe bhaṇḍe sampatte taṃ parivattitvā amanāpaṃ dento dosāgatiṃ
analyzed: bhaṇḍe sampatte tam parivattitvā manāpam dento chandāgatim gacchati nāma  pana abhāra bhūtānam manāpe bhaṇḍe sampatte tam amanāpam dentaḥ dosa āgatim
translated: Herein, in the case of the distribution of requisites, when requisites that are unpalatable to the monks who are his charges come in, if he exchanges them for something else that is palatable, he is said to “go by the wrong path of desire.”🔽But when palatable requisites come in for those who are not his charges, if he exchanges them for something else that is unpalatable, he is said to “go by the wrong path of ill will.”

original: gacchati nāma. Bhaṇḍesu bhājanīyavatthuñca ṭhitikañca ajānanto mohāgatiṃ gacchati
analyzed: gacchati nāma bhaṇḍesu bhājanīya vatthuñca ṭhitikañca a jānantaḥ moha āgatim gacchati
translated: If he does not know the subject of distribution of requisites and the rules for distribution, he is said to “go by the wrong path of confusion.”

original: nāma. Mukharānaṃ vā rājādinissitānaṃ vā “ime me amanāpe bhaṇḍe dinne anatthaṃ kareyyu”nti
analyzed: nāma mukharānam vā rāja ādi nissitānam vā ime me amanāpe bhaṇḍe dinne anattham kareyyuḥ ti
translated: Or if he thinks, “If I give these unpalatable requisites to these monks who are garrulous or who are in the king’s service, they will do me harm,”

original: bhayena parivattitvā manāpaṃ dento bhayāgatiṃ gacchati nāma. Yo pana evaṃ na gacchati,
analyzed: bhayena manāpam dentaḥ bhaya āgatim gacchati nāma yaḥ pana evam na gacchati
translated: One who turns aside through fear and gives a ruling through fear goes by the name of one who goes by fear. But one who does not do so,

original: sabbesaṃ tulābhūto pamāṇabhūto majjhattova hutvā yaṃ yassa pāpuṇāti, tadeva tassa
analyzed: sabbesam tulā bhūtaḥ pamāṇa bhūtaḥ majjhattaḥ uva hutvā yam yassa pāpuṇāti tat eva tassa
translated: and who is a level and impartial judge for all, and who gives to each what he deserves,

original: deti, ayaṃ catubbidhampi agatiṃ na gacchati nāma. Vinicchayaṭṭhāne pana attano bhārabhūtassa🔽garukāpattiṃ lahukāpattiṃ katvā kathento chandāgatiṃ gacchati nāma. Itarassa lahukāpattiṃ
analyzed: deti ayam catubbidham pi agatim na gacchati nāma vinicchaya ṭṭhāne pana attanaḥ bhāra bhūtassa  garuka āpattim lahuka āpattim katvā kathentaḥ chandāgatim gacchati nāma itarassa lahuka āpattim
translated: does not go by any of the four ways. But in the case of a legal question on decision, one who, by making a heavy offence a light one,🔽gives a ruling that is favourable to one who is a burden to him goes by the name of one who goes by favour. One who, by making a light offence a heavy one,

original: garukāpattiṃ katvā kathento dosāgatiṃ gacchati nāma. Āpattivuṭṭhānaṃ pana samuccayakkhandhakañca
analyzed: garuka āpattim katvā kathentaḥ dosa āgatim gacchati nāma āpatti vuṭṭhānam pana samuccaya khandhakam ca
translated: gives a ruling that is favourable to the other goes by the name of one who goes by aversion. But one who, not knowing the section on clearing the Order and the Khandhaka on Settlements,

original: ajānanto mohāgatiṃ gacchati nāma. Mukharassa vā rājapūjitassa vā “ayaṃ me garukaṃ
analyzed: a jānantaḥ moha āgatim gacchati nāma mukharassa vā rāja pūjitassa vā ayam me garukam
translated: goes by the name of one who goes by confusion. One who, thinking, “This man, being important and honoured by the king, might do me an ill turn if I make his offence heavy,”

original: katvā āpattiṃ kathentassa anatthampi kareyyā”ti garukameva lahukāpattiṃ kathento
analyzed: katvā āpattim kathentassa anattham pi kareyya ati garukam eva lahuka āpattim kathento
translated: and who, by making a light offence a heavy one, gives a ruling that is favourable to him,

original: bhayāgatiṃ gacchati nāma. Yo pana sabbesaṃ yathābhūtameva kathesi, ayaṃ catubbidhampi
analyzed: bhayāgatim gacchati nāma yaḥ pana sabbesam yathābhūtam eva kathesi ayam catubbidham pi
translated: goes by the name of one who goes by fear. But one who gives a ruling that is in accordance with the true nature of things for all, does not go by any of the four ways.

original: agatigamanaṃ na gacchati nāma. Theropi tādiso catunnampi agatigamanānaṃ paṭhamamaggeneva
analyzed: agati gamanam na gacchati nāma theraḥ api tādisaḥ catunnam pi agati gamanānam paṭhama maggena iva
translated: He does not go by the way of going that is not a way of going. The Elder was like that, for he had abandoned the four ways of going that are not ways of going by the first way of going that is a way of going.

original: pahīnattā, tasmā saṅgāyanavasena dhammavinayavinicchaye sampatte chandādivasena aññathā
analyzed: tasmā saṅgāyana vasena dhamma vinaya vinicchaye sampatte chanda ādi vasena aññathā
translated: Therefore, when the decision of the Dhamma and Discipline was completed by the recitation, he did not explain it otherwise by favouring and so on,

original: akathetvā yathābhūtameva kathetīti vuttaṃ “abhabbo…pe… agatiṃ gantu”nti. Pariyattoti
analyzed: a kathetvā yathābhūtam eva katheti iti vuttam a bhabba upe agatim gantunti pariyattaḥ ti
translated: but he explained it as it really is. Thus it was said: “He is incapable of … going by the way of going that is not a way of going.”

original: adhīto, uggahitoti attho.🔽Uccinitenāti uccinitvā gahitena. Etadahosīti etaṃ parivitakkanaṃ ahosi. Rājagahaṃ🔽kho mahāgocaranti ettha “rājagahanti rājagahasāmantaṃ gahetvā vutta”nti cūḷagaṇṭhipade
analyzed: adhītaḥ uggahito ti attho  uccinitena ati uccinitvā gahitena etat ahosi iti etam parivitakkanam rājagaham  kho mahā gocaram ti ettha rāja gahanti rāja gaha sāmantam gahetvā vuttanti cūḷagaṇṭhi pade
translated: “He has mastered” means he has learned, the meaning is that he has taken it up.🔽“He has taken up” means he has taken it up and grasped it. “This occurred to him” means this thought occurred to him. “Rājagaha is a great resort” : here it is said in the Cūḷa-gaṇṭhi and Majjhima-gaṇṭhi passages that “Rājagaha is spoken of as including the vicinity of Rājagaha.”

original: majjhimagaṇṭhipade ca vuttaṃ. Gāvo caranti etthāti gocaro, gocaro viya gocaro, bhikkhācaraṇaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: majjhima gaṇṭhi pade ca vuttam gāvaḥ caranti ettha ati gocaraḥ gocaraḥ viya gocaraḥ bhikkhā caraṇa ṭhānam
translated: Cows graze here, thus it is a resort ; a resort is like a resort, a place for going on alms round.

original: So mahanto assa, etthāti vā mahāgocaraṃ, rājagahaṃ. Thāvarakammanti ciraṭṭhāyikammaṃ.
analyzed: saḥ mahantaḥ assa ettha ati vā mahā gocaram rājagaham thāvara kamman ti ciraṭṭhāyi kammam
translated: Or it is a great resort, Rājagaha, because it is great, it is there. “A lasting work” means a work that lasts a long time.

original: Visabhāgapuggalo subhaddasadiso. Ukkoṭeyyāti nivāreyyāti attho. Ñattidutiyena kammena sāvesīti –
analyzed: visabhāga puggalo subhadda sadiso ukkoṭeyya ati nivāreyya ati attho ñatti dutiyena kammena sā āvesi iti
translated: A person of the opposite sex is like Subhadda. Would obstruct: the meaning is, would prevent. By means of a transaction requiring one motion and one announcement:

original: “Suṇātu me, āvuso, saṅgho, yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imāni pañca bhikkhusatāni🔽sammanneyya ‘rājagahe vassaṃ vasantāni dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyituṃ, na aññehi
analyzed: suṇātu me āvuso saṅghaḥ yadi saṅghassa patta kallam saṅghaḥ imāni pañca bhikkhu satāni  rājagahe vassam vasantāni dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyitum na aññehi
translated: “If the venerable ones are ready, let the Order listen to me. If it seems right to the Order, the Order would agree to these five hundred bhikkhus

original: bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassaṃ vasitabba’nti, esā ñatti.
analyzed: bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassam vasitabbanti esā ñatti
translated: to spend the rains at Rājagaha to recite the True Idea and the Discipline, and that no other bhikkhus should spend the rains at Rājagaha. This is the motion.

original: “Suṇātu me, āvuso, saṅgho, saṅgho imāni pañca bhikkhusatāni sammannati ‘rājagahe
analyzed: suṇātu me āvuso saṅghaḥ saṅghaḥ imāni pañca bhikkhu satāni sammannati rājagahe
translated: “If the venerable ones are ready, let the Order listen to me. The Order is agreeing to these five hundred bhikkhus

original: vassaṃ vasantāni dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyituṃ, na aññehi bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassaṃ🔽vasitabba’nti, yassāyasmato khamati imesaṃ pañcannaṃ bhikkhusatānaṃ sammuti ‘rājagahe
analyzed: vassam vasantāni dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyitum na aññehi bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassam  vasitabbanti yassa ayasmataḥ khamati imesam pañcannam bhikkhu satānam sammuti rājagahe
translated: to spend the rains at Rājagaha to recite the True Idea and the Discipline, and that no other bhikkhus should spend the rains at Rājagaha. If the agreement to these five hundred bhikkhus🔽to spend the rains at Rājagaha to recite the True Idea and the Discipline, and that no other bhikkhus should spend the rains at Rājagaha, is pleasing to the venerable ones you should be silent; he to whom it is not pleasing should speak.

original: vassaṃ vasantānaṃ dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyituṃ, na aññehi bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassaṃ
analyzed: vassam vasantānam dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyitum na aññehi bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassam
translated: “These five hundred bhikkhus are agreed upon by the Order to spend the rains at Rājagaha to recite the True Idea and the Discipline, and that no other bhikkhus should spend the rains at Rājagaha.

original: vasitabba’nti, so tuṇhassa. Yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya.🔽“Sammatāni saṅghena imāni pañca bhikkhusatāni ‘rājagahe vassaṃ vasantāni dhammañca
analyzed: vasitabbanti so tuṇhassa yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya  sammatāni saṅghena imāni pañca bhikkhu satāni rājagahe vassam vasantāni dhammam ca
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give permission to these five hundred monks to enter the rainy-season residence at Rājagaha and to do the invitation ceremony there.🔽“The Sangha has given permission to these five hundred monks to enter the rainy-season residence at Rājagaha and to do the invitation ceremony there.

original: vinayañca saṅgāyituṃ, na aññehi bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassaṃ vasitabba’nti, khamati
analyzed: vinayam ca saṅgāyitum na aññehi bhikkhūhi rājagahe vassam vasitabbanti khamati
translated: If it seems right to the Order, the Order may recite Dhamma and Discipline in Rājagaha during the Rains, and no other monks are to take up residence in Rājagaha during the Rains.

original: saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī”ti –🔽Evaṃ ñattidutiyena kammena sāvesi. Idaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “taṃ saṅgītikkhandhake vuttanayeneva ñātabba”nti.🔽Ayaṃ pana kammavācā tathāgatassa parinibbānato ekavīsatime divase katā. Vuttañhetaṃ
analyzed: saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti  evam ñatti dutiyena kammena sāvesi idam sandhāya vuttam tam saṅgīti kkhandhake vutta nayena iva ñātabban ti  ayam pana kamma vācā tathāgatassa parinibbānataḥ ekavīsatime divase katā vuttam ha etam
translated: “The Order has agreed, since it is silent. Thus do I understand this.”🔽This was announced by means of a resolution consisting of one motion and one announcement. This is what is meant by “ should be understood in the way stated in the Khandhaka on Recitals. ”

original: dīghanikāyaṭṭhakathāyaṃ “ayaṃ pana kammavācā tathāgatassa parinibbānato ekavīsatime
analyzed: dīgha nikāya ṭṭhakathā ayam ayam pana kamma vācā tathāgatassa parinibbānato ekavīsatime
translated: But this proclamation of the Kammavācā was made on the twenty-first day after the Tathāgata’s final attainment of Nibbāna. For this is said:

original: divase katā. Bhagavā hi visākhapuṇṇamāyaṃ paccūsasamaye parinibbuto, athassa sattāhaṃ
analyzed: divase katā bhagavā hi visākhapuṇṇamāyam paccūsa samaye parinibbutaḥ athassa sattāham
translated: in the Commentary to the Long Division. For the Blessed One attained final Nibbāna at the time of the moon’s setting on the full-moon night of the month of Visākha, and seven days later

original: suvaṇṇavaṇṇaṃ sarīraṃ gandhamālādīhi pūjayiṃsu. Evaṃ sattāhaṃ sādhukīḷanadivasā nāma🔽ahesuṃ. Tato sattāhaṃ citakāya agginā jhāyi, sattāhaṃ sattipañjaraṃ katvā santhāgārasālāyaṃ

translated: Thinking, ‘Now I am worthy to enter the midst of the assembly,’ he went with a glad and elated mind, having arranged his robe over one shoulder and🔽having loosened the fastenings of his leather sandals, like a gem placed on blue-black cloth, like the full moon risen in a clear sky free from fleecy clouds,🔽like a lotus flower with its pericarp opened by the touch of the morning sun’s rays, with a face that was pure, clear, and bright,

original: sappabhena sassirikena mukhavarena attano arahattappattiṃ ārocayamāno viya ca agamāsi.
analyzed: sappabhena sassirikena mukha varena attanaḥ arahatta ppattim ārocayamānaḥ viya ca agamāsi
translated: as though he were announcing his attainment of Arahantship.

original: Atha naṃ disvā āyasmato mahākassapassa etadahosi ‘sobhati vata bho arahattappatto🔽ānando, sace satthā dhareyya, addhā ajja ānandassa sādhukāraṃ dadeyya, handa imassāhaṃ
analyzed: atha nam disvā āyasmataḥ mahākassapassa etat ahosi sobhati vata bho arahatta ppatto  ānandaḥ sace satthā dhareyya addhā ajja ānandassa sādhukāram dadeyya handa imassa aham
translated: Then, seeing him, the venerable Maha Kassapa thought, ‘How splendid is the one who has attained Arahantship!

original: idāni satthārā dātabbaṃ sādhukāraṃ dadāmī’ti tikkhattuṃ sādhukāramadāsī”ti.
analyzed: idāni satthārā dātabbam sādhukāram dadāmi iti tikkhattum sādhukāram adāsi iti
translated: If the Teacher were alive, he would surely give the venerable Ananda a reward today. Well then, I will give him the reward that the Teacher would give.’ And he gave the reward of the going in the front three times.”

original: Ākāsena āgantvā nisīdītipi eketi ettha pana tesaṃ tesaṃ tathā tathā gahetvā āgatamattaṃ🔽ṭhapetvā visuṃ visuṃ vacane aññaṃ visesakāraṇaṃ natthīti vadanti. Upatissatthero
analyzed: ākāsena āgantvā eke iti ettha pana tesam tesam tathā tathā gahetvā āgata mattam  ṭhapetvā visum visum vacane aññam visesa kāraṇam natthi iti vadanti upatissa thero
translated: Some say that he came through the air and sat down. But here, apart from the fact that they have taken it in this or that way,

original: panāha “sattamāsaṃ katāya dhammasaṅgītiyā kadāci pathaviyaṃ nimujjitvā āgatattā taṃ
analyzed: pana āha satta māsam katāya dhammasaṅgītiyā kadāci pathaviyam nimujjitvā āgata ttā tam
translated: there is no other reason for the distinction in their statements. But the Elder Upatissa says that it was because some said so after the Sangīti had been held for seven months, taking it that he had come up out of the earth,

original: gahetvā eke vadanti. Kadāci ākāsena āgatattā taṃ gahetvā eke vadantī”ti.
analyzed: gahetvā eke vadanti kadāci ākāsena tam gahetvā eke vadanti iti
translated: and some said so taking it that he had come through the air.

original: Bhikkhū āmantesīti bhikkhū ālapi abhāsi sambodhesīti ayamettha attho. Aññatra pana
analyzed: bhikkhū āmantesi iti bhikkhū ālapi abhāsi sambodhesi iti ayam ettha atthaḥ aññatra pana
translated: He addressed the bhikkhus: the meaning is that he spoke to the bhikkhus, he made them understand. But in other instances it is used for announcing:

original: ñāpanepi hoti. Yathāha – “āmantayāmi vo, bhikkhave, paṭivedayāmi vo, bhikkhave”ti.
analyzed: ñāpane api hoti yathā āha āmantayāmi vaḥ bhikkhave paṭivedayāmi vaḥ bhikkhave iti
translated: as in the passage, “I announce to you, bhikkhus, I inform you, bhikkhus” .

original: Pakkosanepi dissati. Yathāha “ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena sāriputtaṃ āmantehī”ti.
analyzed: pakkosane pi dissati yathā āha ehi tvam bhikkhu mama vacanena sāriputtam āmantehi iti
translated: And it is also used for summoning, as in the passage, “Come, bhikkhu, summon Sāriputta in my name” .

original: Āvusoti āmantanākāradīpanaṃ. Kaṃ dhuraṃ katvāti kaṃ jeṭṭhakaṃ katvā. Kiṃ ānando nappahotīti
analyzed: āvuso ti āmantanā ākāra dīpanam kam dhuram katvā ati kam jeṭṭhakam katvā kim ānandaḥ nappahoti iti
translated: The word “friend” is used to indicate the form of address. Who was the chief? Who was the senior?

original: aṭṭhakathācariyehi ṭhapitapucchā. Nappahotīti na sakkoti. Etadagganti eso aggo. Liṅgavipallāsena
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā cariyehi ṭhapita pucchā na pahoti iti na sakkoti etat aggam ti esaḥ aggaḥ liṅga vipallāsena
translated: The questions set by the teachers of the commentary. He was not able: he was not capable. This is the best: this is the best.🔽For this is the description in the opposite sense.

original: hi ayaṃ niddeso. Yadidanti ca yo ayanti attho, yadidaṃ khandhapañcakanti vā yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: hi ayam niddesaḥ yat idam ti ca yaḥ ayam iti atthaḥ yat idam khandha pañcakam ti vā yojetabbam
translated: And the meaning of “what” is “which”; or it should be construed as “what is the five aggregates.”

original: Sammannīti sammataṃ akāsi. Upāliṃ vinayaṃ puccheyyanti pucchadhātussa dvikammakattā
analyzed: sammannī iti sammatam akāsi upālim vinayam puccheyyanti pucchadhātussa dvi kammakattā
translated: He made him accepted: he made him accepted as the one to be asked. He would ask Upāli about the Discipline: because the verbal root “to ask” has a double function,

original: vuttaṃ. Bījaniṃ gahetvāti ettha bījanīgahaṇaṃ dhammakathikānaṃ dhammatāti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam bījanim gahetvā ti ettha bījanī gahaṇam dhamma kathikānam dhamma tā ti veditabbam
translated: it is said. He took up a fan: here the taking up of the fan should be understood as the custom of preachers of the Dhamma.

original: Bhagavāpi hi dhammakathikānaṃ dhammatādassanatthameva vicittabījaniṃ gaṇhāti. Na
analyzed: bhagavā api hi dhamma kathikānam dhamma tā dassana attham eva vicitta bījanim gaṇhāti na
translated: For the Blessed One takes up a variegated fan only in order to show the custom of preachers of the Dhamma.

original: hi aññathā sabbassapi lokassa alaṅkārabhūtaṃ paramukkaṃsagatasikkhāsaṃyamānaṃ buddhānaṃ🔽mukhacandamaṇḍalaṃ paṭicchādetabbaṃ hoti. “Paṭhamaṃ, āvuso upāli, pārājikaṃ kattha
analyzed: hi aññathā sabbassa api lokassa alaṅkāra bhūtam param ukkaṃsa gata sikkhā saṃyamānam buddhānam  mukha canda maṇḍalam paṭicchādetabbam hoti paṭhamam āvuso upāli pārājikam kattha
translated: For otherwise the face-ornament of the Buddhas, the restraint of training that is the best of all ornaments for the whole world,🔽would have to be concealed.

original: paññatta”nti kasmā vuttaṃ, nanu tassa saṅgītiyā purimakāle paṭhamabhāvo na yuttoti?
analyzed: paññattanti kasmā vuttam nanu tassa saṅgītiyā purima kāle paṭhama bhāvaḥ na yuttaḥ ti
translated: Why is it said, “Where, friend Upāli, was the first offense entailing expulsion laid down?” Is it not improper for it to have priority in the rehearsal since it is later than the other offenses entailing expulsion?

original: No na yutto bhagavatā paññattānukkamena pātimokkhuddesānukkamena ca paṭhamabhāvassa
analyzed: no na yuttaḥ bhagavatā paññatta anukkamena pātimokkha uddesa anukkamena ca paṭhama bhāvassa
translated: It is not unsuitable, because the first place is established in the order in which the rules are laid down and in the order in which the Pāṭimokkha is recited.

original: siddhattā. Yebhuyyena hi tīṇi piṭakāni bhagavato dharamānakāle ṭhitānukkameneva saṅgītāni,
analyzed: siddhattā yebhuyyena hi tīṇi piṭakāni bhagavataḥ dharamāna kāle ṭhita anukkamena iva saṅgītāni
translated: For the three Piṭakas were recited in the order in which they were placed by the Blessed One while he was teaching,🔽and especially the Vinaya and Abhidhamma Piṭakas should be regarded in this way.

original: visesato vinayābhidhammapiṭakānīti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Kismiṃ vatthusmiṃ methunadhammeti
analyzed: visesataḥ vinaya abhidhamma piṭakāni iti daṭṭhabbam kismim vatthusmim methuna dhamma iti
translated: In what matter? In the matter of sexual intercourse.

original: ca nimittatthe bhummavacanaṃ.🔽Vatthumpi pucchītiādi “kattha paññatta”ntiādinā dassitena saha tato avasiṭṭhampi
analyzed: ca nimitta tthe bhumma vacanam  vatthum pi pucchi itiādi kattha paññatta nti ādinā dassitena saha tatas avasiṭṭham pi
translated: The locative case is used in the sense of a reason.🔽“He asked about the matter too” is said in order to show that he asked about what remained after what was shown by the question “Where was it laid down?”

original: saṅgahetvā dassanavasena vuttaṃ. Kiṃ panettha paṭhamapārājikapāḷiyaṃ kiñci apanetabbaṃ
analyzed: saṅgahetvā dassana vasena vuttam kim pana ittha paṭhama pārājika pāḷiyam kiñci apanetabbam
translated: Was there anything to be removed or added in the text of the first pārājika rule?

original: vā pakkhipitabbaṃ vā āsi nāsīti? Buddhassa bhagavato bhāsite apanetabbaṃ nāma natthi.
analyzed: vā pakkhipitabbam vā āsi na asi iti buddhassa bhagavataḥ bhāsite apanetabbam nāma natthi
translated: There is nothing to be removed in what was spoken by the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: Na hi tathāgatā ekabyañjanampi niratthakaṃ vadanti, sāvakānaṃ pana devatānaṃ vā bhāsite
analyzed: na hi tathāgatāḥ eka byañjanam pi niratthakam vadanti sāvakānam pana devatānam vā bhāsite
translated: For the Perfect Ones do not speak a single syllable that is meaningless. But in what was spoken by disciples or deities,

original: apanetabbampi hoti, taṃ dhammasaṅgāhakattherā apanayiṃsu, pakkhipitabbaṃ pana sabbatthāpi
analyzed: apanetabbam pi hoti tam dhammasaṅgāhaka therāḥ apanayiṃsu pakkhipitabbam pana sabbattha api
translated: and it was removed by the Elder Dhamma-people. But there is something to be inserted in every place.

original: atthi, tasmā yaṃ yattha pakkhipituṃ yuttaṃ, taṃ tattha pakkhipiṃsuyeva. Kiṃ pana🔽tanti ce? “Tena samayenā”ti vā “tena kho pana samayenā”ti vā “atha kho”iti vā “evaṃ
analyzed: atthi tasmai yam yattha pakkhipitum yuttam tam tattha pakkhipiṃsuyā iva kim pana  ced tena samayena ati vā tena kho pana samayena ati vā atha kho iti vā evam
translated: So they inserted what was suitable to be inserted there. But what?🔽“At that time” or “Then” or “Then the Lord” or “When this was said” or “This was said” and so on.

original: vutte”ti vā “etadavocā”ti vā evamādikaṃ sambandhavacanamattaṃ. Evaṃ pakkhipitabbayuttaṃ
analyzed: vuttā iti vā etat avoca ati vā evamādikam sambandha vacana mattam evam pakkhipitabba yuttam
translated: Having inserted what was suitable to be inserted in this way,

original: pakkhipitvā pana idaṃ paṭhamapārājikanti ṭhapesuṃ. Paṭhamapārājike saṅgahamāruḷhe
analyzed: pakkhipitvā pana idam paṭhama pārājikanti ṭhapesum paṭhama pārājike saṅgaham āruḷhe
translated: they established it as the first Pārājika. When the compilation of the first Pārājika was completed,

original: pañca arahantasatāni saṅgahaṃ āropitanayeneva gaṇasajjhāyamakaṃsu. “Tena samayena
analyzed: pañca arahanta satāni saṅgaham āropita nayena iva gaṇa sajjhāyam akaṃsu tena samayena
translated: five hundred arahants recited the compilation in the same way as it had been arranged. “At that time

original: buddho bhagavā verañjāyaṃ viharatī”ti ca nesaṃ sajjhāyārambhakāleyeva sādhukāraṃ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavā verañjāyam viharati iti ca sādhukāram
translated: the Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying at Verañjā.” As soon as they began to recite,

original: dadamānā viya mahāpathavī udakapariyantaṃ katvā kampittha. Te eteneva nayena sesapārājikānipi
analyzed: dadamānā mahā pathavī udaka pariyantam katvā kampittha te etena iva nayena sesa pārājikāni pi
translated: the great earth shook as if giving a great cheer, as far as the ocean. In the same way they recited the remaining Pārājikas,

original: saṅgahaṃ āropetvā “idaṃ pārājikakaṇḍa”nti ṭhapesuṃ. Evaṃ terasa saṅghādisesāni “terasaka”ntiādīni
analyzed: saṅgaham āropetvā idam pārājika kaṇḍanti ṭhapesum evam terasa saṅgha ādi sesāni terasa kanti ādīni

original: vatvā vīsādhikāni dve sikkhāpadasatāni “mahāvibhaṅgo”ti kittetvā ṭhapesuṃ. Mahāvibhaṅgāvasānepi
analyzed: vatvā vīsa adhikāni dve sikkhāpada satāni mahā vibhaṅgaḥ ti kittetvā ṭhapesum mahā vibhaṅga avasāne pi
translated: and they placed the two hundred and twenty-seven rules under the heading “The Great Analysis.” And when they had finished the Great Analysis,🔽the great earth shook in the same way as before.

original: purimanayeneva mahāpathavī akampittha. Tato bhikkhunivibhaṅge aṭṭha sikkhāpadāni🔽“pārājikakaṇḍaṃ nāmā”tiādīni vatvā tīṇi sikkhāpadasatāni cattāri ca sikkhāpadāni
analyzed: purima nayena iva mahā pathavī akampittha tatas bhikkhuni vibhaṅge aṭṭha sikkhāpadāni  pārājika kaṇḍam nāma ati ādīni vatvā tīṇi sikkhāpada satāni cattāri ca sikkhāpadāni
translated: Then they placed the eight rules for offenses entailing suspension in the nuns’ analysis under the heading “The Chapter on Offenses Involving Defeat,”

original: “bhikkhunivibhaṅgo”ti kittetvā “ayaṃ ubhatovibhaṅgo nāma catusaṭṭhibhāṇavāro”ti ṭhapesuṃ.
analyzed: bhikkhuni vibhaṅgo ti kittetvā ayam ubhatovibhaṅgo nāma catur aṭṭhi bhāṇa vāro ti ṭhapesuṃ
translated: and they placed the three hundred and four rules under the heading “The Analysis of the Nuns’ Rules.” And they placed it under the heading “The Dual Analysis, the forty-sixth recitation section.”

original: Ubhatovibhaṅgāvasānepi vuttanayeneva pathavī akampittha. Etenevupāyena asītibhāṇavāraparimāṇaṃ
analyzed: ubhatas vibhaṅga avasāne pi vutta nayena iva pathavī akampittha etena iva upāyena asīti bhāṇa vāra parimāṇam

analyzed: khandhakam pañcavīsati bhāṇa vāra parimāṇam parivāram ca saṅgaham āropetvā idam vinaya piṭakam
translated: and the Parivāra, which is twenty-five recitation sections in length, under the heading “The Vinaya Piṭaka,”

analyzed: nāma ati ṭhapesum vinaya piṭaka avasāne pi vutta nayena iva pathavī kampaḥ ahosi tam āyasmantam
translated: and they established it. And at the end of the Vinaya Piṭaka there was an earthquake in the same way as before. They made the venerable Upāli confess it,

original: upālittheraṃ paṭicchāpesuṃ “āvuso, idaṃ tuyhaṃ nissitake vācehī”ti evamettha avuttopi viseso veditabbo.🔽Evaṃ vinayapiṭakaṃ saṅgahamāropetvā suttantapiṭakaṃ saṅgāyiṃsu. Idāni taṃ dassento
analyzed: upāli ttheram paṭicchāpesuṃ āvuso idam tuyham nissitake vācehi iti evam ettha a vuttaḥ api visesaḥ veditabbo  evam vinaya piṭakam saṅgaham āropetvā suttanta piṭakam idāni tam dassento
translated: saying, “Friend, you must recite what is yours.” So the difference here should be understood as stated.

original: āha “vinayaṃ saṅgāyitvā”tiādi. Mahākassapatthero ānandattheraṃ dhammaṃ pucchīti ettha
analyzed: āha vinayam mahākassapa theraḥ ānanda theram dhammam pucchi iti ettha
translated: When they had thus imposed the recital of the Vinaya Piṭaka, they recited the Sutta Piṭaka. Now, showing that, he said, “Having recited the Vinaya” and so on. When the Elder Kassapa the Great questioned the Elder Ānanda about the Dhamma,

original: ayamanukkamo veditabbo – ānandatthere dantakhacitaṃ bījaniṃ gahetvā dhammāsane nisinne
analyzed: ayam anukkamaḥ veditabbaḥ ānanda there danta khacitam bījanim gahetvā dhammāsane nisinne
translated: here is the sequence that should be understood: the Elder Ānanda sat down on the Dhamma seat after taking a fan made of yak’s tail.

original: āyasmā mahākassapatthero bhikkhū pucchi “kataraṃ, āvuso, piṭakaṃ paṭhamaṃ saṅgāyāmā”ti?
analyzed: āyasmā mahākassapa theraḥ bhikkhū pucchi kataram āvuso piṭakam paṭhamam saṅgāyāma ati
translated: The Elder Kassapa the Great questioned the bhikkhus, “Friends, which Piṭaka was recited first?”

analyzed: suttanta piṭakam bhante ti suttanta piṭake catasso saṅgītiyaḥ tāsu paṭhamam kataram
translated: “The Sutta Piṭaka, venerable sir.” In the Sutta Piṭaka there are four recitations. Of these, which was the first?

analyzed: saṅgītim ti dīghasaṅgītim bhante ti dīghasaṅgītiyam catuttiṃsa suttāni tayo ca
translated: The Collection? The Long Collection, reverend Sir.” In the Long Collection there are thirty-four Suttas, and three

analyzed: vaggā tesu paṭhamam kataram sīlakkhandha vaggam bhante iti sīlakkhandha vagge
translated: Vaggas, in those (Suttas) which is the first Vagga? The Virtue Section, reverend Sir.” In the Virtue Section there are

original: terasa suttantā, tesu paṭhamaṃ kataraṃ suttanti? Brahmajālasuttaṃ nāma bhante tividhasīlālaṅkataṃ
analyzed: terasa suttantā tesu paṭhamam kataram brahmajāla suttam nāma bhante tividha sīla alaṅkatam
translated: thirteen Suttas, in those which is the first Sutta? The Brahmajāla Sutta, reverend Sir, which is adorned with threefold virtue,

analyzed: nānāvidham icchājīva kuhana lapana ādi viddhaṃsanam dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhi jāla viniveṭhanam dasa sahassi lokadhātu pakampanam
translated: which is a refutation of various kinds of wrong livelihood, deceit, flattery, and so on, which is a binding of the net of the sixty-two views, which is a shaking of the ten thousand world-element,

analyzed: tam paṭhamam saṅgāyāma ati atha khalu āyasmā mahākassapaḥ āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: that was first recited.” Then the venerable Kassapa the Great said this to the venerable Ānanda:

analyzed: brahma jālam āvuso ānanda kattha bhāsitanti  antarā ca bhante rājagaham antarā ca na āḷandanti ettha antarāsaddaḥ kāraṇa khaṇa citta vemajjha vivara ādīsu
translated: “Where was the Brahmajāla, friend Ānanda, spoken?”🔽“Between Rājagaha and Nāḷandā, reverend Sir.” Here the word ‘between’ is seen in the sense of reason, moment, mind, middle, space, and so on. Thus it is said: “Who would know that reason except a Realised One?” and “People having come together🔽 Translation: The Collection? The Long Collection, reverend Sir.” In the Long Collection there are thirty-four Suttas, and three

original: dissati. Tathā hi “tadantaraṃ ko jāneyya aññatra tathāgatā”ti ca, “janā saṅgamma

analyzed: evam nimitta payojana kāla desa kāraka karaṇa ppakārehi paṭhama mahāsaṅgītim dassetvā idāni
translated: Having thus shown the First Great Rehearsal by way of its sign, purpose, time, place, performers, and performance, now,

original: tattha vavatthāpitesu dhammavinayesu nānappakārakosallatthaṃ ekavidhādibhede dassetuṃ🔽“tadetaṃ sabbampī”tiādimāha. Tattha anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhinti ettha anāvaraṇañāṇapadaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: tattha vavatthāpitesu dhamma vinayesu ekavidha ādi bhede dassetuṃ  tat etam sabbam pi iti ādim āha tattha anuttaram sammāsambodhim ti ettha anāvaraṇa ñāṇa padaṭṭhānam
translated: in order to show the classification of the Dhamma and Discipline as one in essence, etc., for the purpose of skill in various ways, he said:🔽“All this is the Buddha’s Dispensation.” Herein, the supreme perfect enlightenment is the path knowledge and the unobstructed knowledge that is its proximate cause, or it is the supreme perfect enlightenment that is the path knowledge and the unobstructed knowledge that is its proximate cause.

original: maggañāṇaṃ maggañāṇapadaṭṭhānañca anāvaraṇañāṇaṃ “sammāsambodhī”ti vuccati. Paccavekkhantena
analyzed: magga ñāṇam magga ñāṇa padaṭṭhānam ca anāvaraṇa ñāṇam sammāsambodhi iti vuccati paccavekkhantena
translated: Or, looking back, he said,

original: vāti udānādivasena pavattadhammaṃ sandhāyāha. Vimuttirasanti arahattaphalassādaṃ
analyzed: vāti udāna ādi vasena pavatta dhammam sandhāya āha
translated: referring to the Dhamma that occurred as the utterance, etc. The summit of liberation is the taste of the fruition of arahatship,

original: vimuttisampattikaṃ vā aggaphalanipphādanato, vimuttikiccaṃ vā kilesānaṃ accantavimuttisampādanato.
analyzed: vimutti sampattikam vā agga phala nipphādanataḥ vimutti kiccam vā kilesānam accanta vimutti sampādanato
translated: or it is the perfection of liberation, or the function of liberation, because it produces the supreme fruit, or because it brings about the complete liberation of defilements.

original: Kiñcāpi avisesena sabbampi buddhavacanaṃ kilesavinayanena vinayo, yathānusiṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: kiñcā api avisesena sabbam pi buddha vacanam kilesa vinayanena vinayaḥ yathānusiṭṭham
translated: And although all the Buddha’s word is discipline in the sense of training in the destruction of defilements,

original: paṭipajjamāne apāyapatanādito dhāraṇena dhammo ca hoti, idhādhippete pana dhammavinaye
analyzed: paṭipajjamāne apāya patana āditaḥ dhāraṇena dhammo ca hoti idha adhippete pana dhamma vinaye
translated: and the Dhamma is so called because it supports by preventing the falling into states of loss, etc., of those who practice it. But here in the Dispensation the Dhamma is the three baskets of learning,

original: niddhāretuṃ “tattha vinayapiṭaka”ntiādimāha. Khandhādivasena sabhāvadhammadesanābāhullato
analyzed: niddhāretum tattha vinaya piṭakan ti ādim āha khandha ādi vasena sa bhāva dhamma desanā bāhullato
translated: and the Vinaya is the collection of the two Piṭakas beginning with the Vinaya Piṭaka. The rest of the Buddha’s word is the Dhamma.

original: āha “avasesaṃ buddhavacanaṃ dhammo”ti. Atha vā yadipi dhammoyeva vinayo pariyattiādibhāvato,
analyzed: āha avasesam buddha vacanam dhammo ti atha vā yadi pi vinayo pariyatti ādi bhāvato
translated: Or, although the Dhamma is the Vinaya as the learning, etc.,

original: tathāpi vinayasaddasannidhāno abhinnādhikaraṇabhāvena payutto dhammasaddo vinayatantiviparītaṃ
analyzed: tathā api vinaya sadda sannidhānaḥ abhinna adhikaraṇa bhāvena payuttaḥ dhamma saddaḥ vinaya tanti viparītam

original: tantiṃ dīpeti yathā “puññañāṇasambhāro, gobalībadda”ntiādi.
analyzed: tantim dīpeti yathā puññañāṇa sambhāraḥ go balī bat danti ādi
translated: like the word “tanti” in the passage, “Puññañāṇasambhāro, gobalībadda” .

original: Anekajātisaṃsāranti ayaṃ gāthā bhagavatā attano sabbaññutaññāṇapadaṭṭhānaṃ arahattappattiṃ
analyzed: aneka jāti saṃsāram ti ayam gāthā bhagavatā attano sabbaññuta ññāṇa padaṭṭhānam arahatta ppattim
translated: This stanza, “Having known thus, ‘There is birth,’” was uttered by the Blessed One when he surveyed his own attainment of the state of arahantship, which is the basis for the knowledge of omniscience,

original: paccavekkhantena ekūnavīsatimassa paccavekkhaṇañāṇassa anantaraṃ bhāsitā. Tenāha
analyzed: paccavekkhantena ekūnavīsatimassa paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇassa anantaram bhāsitā tena āha
translated: immediately after the knowledge of reviewing, which is the nineteenth knowledge. That is why it is said,

original: “idaṃ paṭhamabuddhavacana”nti. Idaṃ kira sabbabuddhehi avijahitaudānaṃ. Ayamassa
analyzed: idam paṭhama buddha vacanam ti idam kira sabba buddhehi a vijahita odānam ayam assa
translated: “This is the first utterance of the Buddha.” This is the exclamation never abandoned by all Buddhas.

original: saṅkhepattho – ahaṃ imassa attabhāvagehassa kārakaṃ taṇhāvaḍḍhakiṃ gavesanto yena
analyzed: saṅkhepa atthaḥ aham imassa atta bhāva gehassa kārakam taṇhā vaḍḍhakim gavesantaḥ yena

original: ñāṇena taṃ daṭṭhuṃ sakkā, tassa bodhiñāṇassatthāya dīpaṅkarapādamūle katābhinīhāro
analyzed: ñāṇena tam daṭṭhum sakkā tassa bodhi ñāṇassa atthāya dīpaṅkara pāda mūle kata abhinīhāraḥ
translated: having made a resolution at the feet of Dīpaṅkara,

analyzed: ettakam kālam aneka jāti saṃsāram aneka jāti sata sahassa saṅkhyam saṃsāra vaṭṭam anibbisam
translated: have been wandering and transmigrating for so long a time, through the round of rebirths numbering many hundreds of thousands of births,🔽without finding a resting place, without finding that knowledge, without obtaining it.

original: anibbisanto taṃ ñāṇaṃ avindanto alabhantoyeva sandhāvissaṃ saṃsariṃ. Yasmā jarābyādhimaraṇamissatāya
analyzed: a nibbisantaḥ tam ñāṇam a vindantaḥ a labhantaḥ yā iva sandhāvissam saṃsarim yasmai jarā byādhi maraṇa missatāya
translated: Because birth, which is mixed with old age, sickness and death,

original: jāti nāmesā punappunaṃ upagantuṃ dukkhā, na ca sā tasmiṃ adiṭṭhe nivattati, tasmā
analyzed: jāti nāma isā punappunam upagantum dukkhā na ca sā tasmin a diṭṭhe nivattati tasmā
translated: is painful, and it does not turn back from that which has not been seen,

original: taṃ gavesanto sandhāvissanti attho.🔽Diṭṭhosīti idāni mayā sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ paṭivijjhantena diṭṭho asi. Puna gehanti puna
analyzed: tam gavesantaḥ sandhāvissanti attho  diṭṭhaḥ asi iti idāni mayā sabbaññuta ññāṇam paṭivijjhantena diṭṭhaḥ asi puna geham ti puna
translated: therefore, searching for it, I have been wandering.🔽You have been seen: now, by me, having penetrated the knowledge of omniscience, you have been seen. You will not make, you will not do,🔽this house of mine called a personality again. All your remaining,

original: imaṃ attabhāvasaṅkhātaṃ mama gehaṃ na kāhasi na karissasi. Tava sabbā anavasesā kilesaphāsukā
analyzed: imam atta bhāva saṅkhātam mama geham na na karissasi tava sabbā anavasesā kilesa phāsukā
translated: unspent,

analyzed: mayā bhaggā imassa tayā katassa atta bhāva gehassa kūṭam avijjā saṅkhātam kaṇṇika maṇḍalam
translated: By me they are broken. The corner of the house of the body called ignorance is destroyed, is broken, is penetrated, is gone, is not present, is abandoned, is given up, is released, is shaken off.

original: visaṅkhataṃ viddhaṃsitaṃ. Visaṅkhāraṃ nibbānaṃ ārammaṇakaraṇavasena gataṃ anupaviṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: visaṅkhatam viddhaṃsitam visaṅkhāram nibbānam ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena gatam anupaviṭṭham
