original: idāni mama cittaṃ, ahañca taṇhānaṃ khayasaṅkhātaṃ arahattamaggaṃ arahattaphalaṃ vā🔽ajjhagā adhigato pattosmīti attho. Gaṇṭhipadesu pana “visaṅkhāragatanti cittameva
analyzed: idāni mama cittam aham ca taṇhānam khaya saṅkhātam arahatta maggam arahatta phalam vā  ajjhagāḥ adhigataḥ patto smi iti attho gaṇṭhi padesu pana cittam eva
translated: Now my mind has gone to, has entered into, the destruction of craving called the path of arahatship or the fruit of arahatship. The meaning is: I have attained, I have reached.

original: taṇhānaṃ khayasaṅkhātaṃ arahattamaggaṃ arahattaphalaṃ vā ajjhagā adhigato patto”ti🔽evampi attho vutto. Ayaṃ manasā pavattitadhammānaṃ ādi. “Yadā have pātubhavanti dhammāti🔽ayaṃ pana vācāya pavattitadhammānaṃ ādī”ti vadanti. Antojappanavasena kira bhagavā
analyzed: khaya saṅkhātam arahatta maggam arahatta phalam vā ajjhagāḥ adhigataḥ patto ti  evam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ ayam manasā pavattita dhammānam ādi yadā have pātubhavanti dhammā ti  ayam pana vācāya pavattita dhammānam ādi iti vadanti antar jappana vasena kira bhagavā
translated: But in the commentary on the verses the meaning is stated thus: “The destruction of the formations is the path of arahatship or the fruit of arahatship called the destruction of craving. The mind has gone to, has entered into, has attained, has reached that.”🔽This is the beginning of the dhammas that are brought to mind by the mind.🔽But the words “When the dhammas become manifest” are the beginning of the dhammas that are brought to mind by speech, they say.

original: “anekajātisaṃsāra”ntiādimāha.
translated: For it is said that the Blessed One spoke the stanza beginning “For many a birth have I wandered in birth and death” by way of a mental recitation.

original: Kecīti khandhakabhāṇakā. Paṭhamaṃ vutto pana dhammapadabhāṇakānaṃ adhippāyoti veditabbo.
analyzed: keci iti khandhaka bhāṇakā paṭhamam vuttaḥ pana dhamma pada bhāṇakānam adhippāyaḥ ti veditabbaḥ
translated: ‘Some’ are the reciters of the Khuddaka Nikāya. But what was said first is the intention of the reciters of the Dhammapada.

original: Ettha ca khandhakabhāṇakā vadanti “dhammapadabhāṇakānaṃ gāthā manasā desitattā tadā
analyzed: ettha ca khandhaka bhāṇakāḥ vadanti dhamma pada bhāṇakānam gāthā manasā desita ttā tadā
translated: And here the reciters of the Khuddaka Nikāya say this: ‘The verse recited by the reciters of the Dhammapada was recited mentally,

original: mahato janassa upakārāya na hoti, amhākaṃ pana gāthā vacībhedaṃ katvā desitattā tadā
analyzed: mahataḥ janassa upakārāya na hoti amhākam pana gāthā vacī bhedam katvā desita ttā tadā
translated: so it was not of help to the great multitude then assembled. But ours was recited by making a sound with the voice,

original: suṇantānaṃ devabrahmānaṃ upakārāya ahosi, tasmā idameva paṭhamabuddhavacana”nti.
analyzed: suṇantānam devabrahmānam upakārāya tasmai idam eva paṭhama buddha vacanam ti
translated: so it was of help to the devas and brahmas who were listening. Therefore this is the first word of the Buddha.’

original: Dhammapadabhāṇakā pana “desanāya janassa upakārānupakārabhāvo lakkhaṇaṃ na hoti,
analyzed: dhamma pada bhāṇakā pana desanāya janassa upakāra anupakāra bhāvaḥ lakkhaṇam na hoti
translated: But the reciters of the Dhammapada say this: ‘Whether or not a teaching is of help to people is not a criterion.

original: bhagavatā manasā desitattāyeva idaṃ paṭhamabuddhavacana”nti vadanti, tasmā ubhayampi
analyzed: bhagavatā manasā desita ttāya iva idam paṭhama buddha vacanan ti vadanti tasmai ubhayam pi
translated: Since it was recited mentally by the Blessed One, it is the first word of the Buddha.’ Therefore both

original: aññamaññaṃ viruddhaṃ na hotīti veditabbaṃ. Nanu ca yadi “anekajātisaṃsāra”nti manasā
analyzed: aññam aññam viruddham na hoti iti veditabbam nanu ca yadi manasā
translated: should be understood as not contradicting each other. But if ‘Wandering through the many a birth’ was recited mentally,

original: desitaṃ, atha kasmā dhammapadaaṭṭhakathāyaṃ “anekajātisaṃsāranti imaṃ dhammadesanaṃ
analyzed: desitam atha kasmā imam dhamma desanam
translated: why is it said in the Dhammapada Commentary that this teaching

original: satthā bodhirukkhamūle nisinno udānavasena udānetvā aparabhāge ānandattherena puṭṭho
analyzed: satthā bodhi rukkha mūle nisinnaḥ udāna vasena udānetvā apara bhāge ānanda therena puṭṭhaḥ
translated: The Teacher, sitting at the foot of the Bodhi Tree, uttered this stanza in the form of a solemn utterance. Later, when asked by the Elder Ananda,

original: kathesī”ti vuttanti? Tatthāpi manasā udānetvāti evamattho gahetabbo. Atha vā manasāva🔽desitanti evaṃ gahaṇe kiṃ kāraṇanti ce? Yadi vacībhedaṃ katvā desitaṃ siyā, udānapāḷiyaṃ
analyzed: kathesi iti vuttanti tattha api manasā udānetvā ati evam atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ atha vā manasā ava  evam gahaṇe kim ce yadi vacī bhedam katvā desitam siyā udāna pāḷiyam
translated: he explained it.” But in this case also the meaning should be taken as “having uttered in mind.” Or else,🔽“in mind” means “in the mind.” If it is asked why it should be taken in this way,

original: āruḷhaṃ bhaveyya, tasmā udānapāḷiyaṃ anāruḷhabhāvoyeva vacībhedaṃ akatvā manasā desitabhāve kāraṇanti vadanti.
analyzed: āruḷham tasmai udāna pāḷiyam vacī bhedam a katvā manasā vadanti
translated: it is because if it had been taught by a verbal utterance, it would have been included in the Udana collection. Therefore they say that the reason why it was not taught by a verbal utterance but was taught “in mind” is that it was not included in the Udana collection.🔽In the passage, “When the ideas become manifest,” the word iti has the meaning of “beginning with.” Thus it includes the three stanzas beginning with:

original: Yadā have pātubhavanti dhammāti ettha itisaddo ādiattho. Tena “ātāpino jhāyato brāhmaṇassa,
analyzed: yadā have pātubhavanti dhammā ati ettha iti saddo ādi attho tena ātāpinaḥ jhāyataḥ brāhmaṇassa
translated: “When the ardent brahmin is absorbed in meditation,

analyzed: athassa kaṅkhāḥ vapayanti sabbāḥ yatas pajānāti sa hetu dhammam ti ādi gāthāttayam saṅgaṇhāti

original: Udānagāthanti pana jātiyā ekavacanaṃ, tatthāpi paṭhamagāthaṃyeva vā gahetvā vuttanti
analyzed: udāna gātham ti pana jātiyāḥ ekavacanam tattha api paṭhama gāthaṃyā iva vā gahetvā vuttan ti
translated: But the word udana is in the singular because it is a type. In this case also, it is said that the stanza was uttered “in mind” by taking only the first stanza.

original: veditabbaṃ. Ettha pana yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ khandhake āvi bhavissati. Pāṭipadadivaseti
analyzed: veditabbam ettha pana yam vattabbam tam khandhake bhavissati pāṭipada divase ti
translated: and it should be understood. But what should be said about this has been said in the Khandha-Vibhanga.🔽On the day of the Observance:

original: idaṃ “sabbaññubhāvappattassā”ti na etena sambandhitabbaṃ, “paccavekkhantassa uppannā”ti
analyzed: idam sabbaññu bhāva ppattassa ati na etena sambandhitabbam paccavekkhantassa uppannā ati
translated: this should not be connected with “when he had attained to omniscience,” but it should be connected with “when he was reviewing.”

original: etena pana sambandhitabbaṃ. Visākhapuṇṇamāyameva hi bhagavā paccūsasamaye sabbaññutaṃ
analyzed: etena pana sambandhitabbam visākhapuṇṇa māyam eva hi bhagavā paccūsa samaye sabbaññu tam
translated: For it was on the full-moon day of the Āsāḷhi month that the Blessed One attained omniscience at the time of the third watch.🔽With knowledge accompanied by happiness: with knowledge accompanied by joy.

original: pattoti. Somanassamayañāṇenāti somanassasampayuttañāṇena. Āmantayāmīti nivedayāmi,🔽bodhemīti attho. Vayadhammāti aniccalakkhaṇamukhena dukkhānattalakkhaṇampi saṅkhārānaṃ
analyzed: patto ti somanassa maya ñāṇena ati somanassa sampayutta ñāṇena āmantayāmi iti nivedayāmi  bodhemi iti atthaḥ vaya dhammā ti anicca lakkhaṇa mukhena dukkha anatta lakkhaṇam pi saṅkhārānaṃ
translated: I announce: I make known,🔽I make it plain, is the meaning.🔽Subject to destruction: by the characteristic of impermanence, and also by the characteristic of pain and by the characteristic of not-self,

analyzed: vibhāveti yat aniccam tam dukkham yam dukkham tat anattā ati vacanataḥ lakkhaṇa ttaya vibhāvana nayena iva
translated: since it is said: “What is impermanent is painful, what is painful is not-self” .🔽By the method of revealing the three characteristics,

original: tadārammaṇaṃ vipassanaṃ dassento sabbatitthiyānaṃ avisayabhūtaṃ buddhāveṇikaṃ catusaccakammaṭṭhānādhiṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: tad ārammaṇam vipassanam dassento sabba titthiyānam avisaya bhūtam buddha āveṇikam catu sacca kammaṭṭhāna adhiṭṭhānam
translated: he shows insight with that as its object, which is the unique Buddha-range that is the foundation of the meditation subject consisting in the Four Noble Truths,

original: aviparītaṃ nibbānagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ pakāsetīti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Idāni tattha sammāpaṭipattiyaṃ🔽niyojeti “appamādena sampādethā”ti. Atha vā “vayadhammā saṅkhārā”ti etena saṅkhepena🔽saṃvejetvā “appamādena sampādethā”ti saṅkhepeneva niravasesaṃ sammāpaṭipattiṃ dasseti.
analyzed: aviparītam nibbāna gāminim paṭipadam pakāseti iti daṭṭhabbam idāni tattha sammāpaṭipattiyam  niyoja iti appamādena sampādetha ati atha vā vaya dhammā saṅkhārā ati etena saṅkhepena  saṃvejetvā appamādena sampādetha ati saṅkhepena iva niravasesam sammāpaṭipattim dasseti
translated: He should be regarded as showing the unperverted way leading to Nibbāna. Now, in the right way of practice he urges them on with “Be diligent” . Or else, having aroused them briefly with “Impermanent are all formations” , he shows the right way of practice in its entirety briefly with “Be diligent” .

original: Appamādapadañhi sikkhattayasaṅgahitaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ sāsanaṃ pariyādiyitvā tiṭṭhatīti.
analyzed: appamāda padam hi sikkhattaya saṅgahitam kevala paripuṇṇam sāsanam pariyādiyitvā tiṭṭhati iti
translated: For the word “diligence” includes the three trainings and stands for the whole of the Dispensation.

original: Antareti antarāḷe, vemajjheti attho.
analyzed: antareti antarāḷe vemajjha iti attho
translated: “In the middle”: in the middle of the assembly, is the meaning.

original: Suttantapiṭakanti ettha yathā kammameva kammantaṃ, evaṃ suttameva suttantanti veditabbaṃ.🔽Asaṅgītanti saṅgītikkhandhakakathāvatthuppakaraṇādi. Keci pana “subhasuttampi paṭhamasaṅgītiyaṃ
analyzed: suttanta piṭakanti ettha yathā kammam eva kammantam evam suttam eva suttantanti veditabbam  a saṅgītam ti saṅgīti khandhaka kathā vatthu ppakaraṇa ādi keci pana subha suttam pi paṭhama saṅgītiyam
translated: “Discourse Collection”: here “discourse” should be understood as a discourse itself, as in the case of “work” for “action” .🔽“Not included in the Collection”: the Khuddaka Nikāya, the stories, the commentaries, etc. But some say that the Suttas of the Long Collection are not included in the First Collection.

original: asaṅgīta”nti vadanti, taṃ na yujjati. “Paṭhamasaṅgītito puretarameva hi āyasmatā
analyzed: vadanti tam na puretaram eva hi āyasmatā
translated: That is incorrect. For they were recited earlier than the First Collection.

original: ānandattherena jetavane viharantena subhassa māṇavassa desita”nti ācariyadhammapālattherena
analyzed: ānanda therena jetavane viharantena subhassa māṇavassa desitanti ācariya dhammapāla ttherena
translated: It was taught by the Elder Ānanda while he was staying at Jeta’s Grove.”

original: vuttaṃ. Subhasuttaṃ pana “evaṃ me sutaṃ – ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ānando sāvatthiyaṃ

original: bhāsitatthapariyāyopi hoti. Ettha hi purimakā pañca atthappabhedā hitapariyāyā, tato
analyzed: bhāsita ttha pariyāyaḥ api hoti ettha hi purimakā pañca attha ppabhedā hita pariyāyā tatas
translated: And in this exposition of meaning the word ‘meaning’ is a synonym for ‘what is said’ . For here the first five divisions of meaning are synonyms for ‘what is beneficial’,🔽the next six are divisions of ‘what is said’, and the last two are a combination of both. Herein,

original: pare cha bhāsitatthabhedā, pacchimakā pana ubhayasabhāvā. Tattha duradhigamatāya
analyzed: pare cha bhāsita ttha bhedā pacchimakā pana ubhaya sabhāvā tattha duradhigama tāya
translated: because of its being hard to get at,

original: vibhāvane agādhabhāvo gambhīro, na vivaṭo guḷho, mūludakādayo viya paṃsunā akkharasannivesādinā🔽tirohito paṭicchanno. Niddhāretvā ñāpetabbo neyyo, yathārutavasena veditabbo nīto.
analyzed: vibhāvane agādha bhāvaḥ gambhīraḥ na vivaṭaḥ guḷhaḥ mūla udaka ādayaḥ viya paṃsunā akkhara sannivesa ādinā  tirohitaḥ paṭicchannaḥ niddhāretvā ñāpetabbaḥ neyyaḥ yathāruta vasena veditabbaḥ nītaḥ
translated: It is deep, not shallow, in its penetration, not obvious, but recondite, like the water in a deep well, not like the water in a puddle on a cow’s footprint.🔽It is covered, not uncovered, like the water in a deep well, not like the water in a pond. It is to be drawn out, not to be drawn out, like the water in a deep well, not like the water in a pond.

original: Anavajjanikkilesavodānā pariyāyavasena vuttā, kusalavipākakiriyadhammavasena vā.
analyzed: anavajja nikkilesa vodānā pariyāya vasena vuttā kusala vipāka kiriya dhamma vasena vā
translated: It is stated by way of a roundabout way, not by the nearest way, like the water in a deep well, not like the water in a pond.

original: Paramattho nibbānaṃ, dhammānaṃ aviparītasabhāvo eva vā.
analyzed: paramatthaḥ nibbānam dhammānam aviparīta sabhāvaḥ eva vā
translated: It is the ultimate, not the superficial, like the water in a deep well, not like the water in a pond.

original: Atha vā attanā ca appiccho hotīti attatthaṃ, appicchākathañca paresaṃ kattā hotīti
analyzed: atha vā attanā ca appicchaḥ hoti iti attattham appicchākatham ca paresam kattā hoti iti
translated: Or alternatively, “He himself is contented” is for his own benefit, and “he speaks in praise of contentment” is for the benefit of others.

original: paratthaṃ sūceti. Evaṃ “attanā ca pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hotī”tiādīni suttāni yojetabbāni.🔽Vinayābhidhammehi ca visesetvā suttasaddassa attho vattabbo, tasmā veneyyajjhāsayavasappavattāya
analyzed: parattham sūceti evam attanā ca pāṇātipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti itiādīni suttāni yojetabbāni  vinaya abhidhammehi ca visesetvā sutta saddassa atthaḥ vattabbaḥ tasmā
translated: Thus the other suttas beginning with “He himself is abstainer from killing living beings” should be construed.🔽And the meaning of the word sutta should be stated by distinguishing it from the Vinaya and the Abhidhamma. Therefore, since the sutta is the means for the attainment of the path, it is stated that the sutta is superior to the Vinaya and the Abhidhamma in the matter of the attainment of the path.

original: desanāya attahitaparahitādīni sātisayaṃ pakāsitāni honti tappadhānabhāvato, na āṇādhammasabhāvavasappavattāyāti
analyzed: desanāya atta hita para hita ādīni sa atisayam pakāsitāni honti tad padhāna bhāvataḥ na āṇā dhamma sabhāva vasa ppavattāya ati
translated: The sutta is the means for the attainment of the path, not the Vinaya and the Abhidhamma. Therefore the sutta is superior to the Vinaya and the Abhidhamma in the matter of the attainment of the path.

original: idameva atthānaṃ sūcanato suttanti vuttaṃ. Evañca katvā “ettakaṃ tassa bhagavato
analyzed: idam eva atthānam sūcanato sutta nti vuttam evam ca katvā ettakam tassa bhagavato
translated: This is called a sutta because it is a clue to the meaning.

original: suttāgataṃ suttapariyāpanna”nti ca “sakavāde pañca suttasatānī”ti ca evamādīsu suttasaddo🔽upacaritoti gahetabbo.
analyzed: sutta āgatam sutta pariyāpannan ti ca saka vāde pañca sutta satāni iti ca evamādīsu sutta saddaḥ  upacaritaḥ iti gahetabbo
translated: And it is in this way that the word sutta is to be regarded as a conventional term in such passages as “So many suttas of his have been handed down, so many suttas have been included” , and “In his own doctrine there are five hundred suttas” .

original: Suttesu āṇādhammasabhāvā ca veneyyajjhāsayaṃ anuvattanti, na vinayābhidhammesu viya🔽veneyyajjhāsayo āṇādhammasabhāve, tasmā veneyyānaṃ ekantahitapaṭilābhasaṃvattanikā
analyzed: suttesu āṇā dhamma sabhāvā ca veneyya ajjhāsayam anuvattanti na vinaya abhidhammesu viya  veneyya ajjhāsayo āṇā dhamma sabhāve tasmā veneyyānam ekanta hita paṭilābha saṃvattanikā
translated: In the case of the Vinaya and the Abhidhamma, the inclination of those who need training does not conform to the nature of the injunctions,🔽but in the case of the suttas the teaching of the suttas does conform to the inclination of those who need training. That is why it is said that “the meanings are well taught here” .

original: suttantadesanā hotīti “suvuttā cettha atthā”tiādi vuttaṃ. “Ekantahitapaṭilābhasaṃvattanikā🔽suttantadesanā”ti idampi veneyyānaṃ hitasampāpane suttantadesanāya tapparabhāvaṃyeva
analyzed: suttanta desanā hoti iti su vuttā ca ittha attha atiādi vuttam ekanta hita paṭilābha saṃvattanikā  suttanta desanā ti idam pi veneyyānam hita sampāpane suttanta desanāya tad para bhāvaṃya iva
translated: And this is said with reference to the fact that the teaching of the suttas is the means to the attainment of the highest welfare for those who need training.🔽And that is the reason why it is said that the teaching of the suttas is the means to the attainment of the highest welfare for those who need training.🔽And that is the reason why it is said that the teaching of the suttas is the means to the attainment of the highest welfare for those who need training.

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tapparabhāvo ca veneyyajjhāsayānulomato daṭṭhabbo. Tenevāha “veneyyajjhāsayānulomena
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam tad para bhāvo ca veneyya ajjhāsayā anulomataḥ daṭṭhabbo tena iva āha veneyya ajjhāsayā anulomena
translated: And that is the reason why it is said that the teaching of the suttas is the means to the attainment of the highest welfare for those who need training.

original: vuttattā”ti. Vinayadesanaṃ viya issarabhāvato āṇāpatiṭṭhāpanavasena adesetvā veneyyānaṃ
analyzed: vutta ttā ti vinaya desanam viya issara bhāvataḥ āṇā patiṭṭhāpana vasena a desetvā veneyyānam
translated: because it is stated.”🔽Not having taught it by way of the Lord’s power as the Vinaya was taught, but by way of establishing the command of the disciples, he taught it

original: ajjhāsayānulomena cariyānurūpaṃ vuttattā desitattāti attho.
analyzed: cariyā anurūpam vutta ttā desita ttā ati attho
translated: because it is stated. The meaning is that it is taught by being stated in accordance with the inclinations of those who are to be trained, in accordance with their conduct, not by being taught by the establishment of a command as a lord’s prerogative as in the case of the teaching of the Vinaya.

original: Anupubbasikkhādivasena kālantare abhinipphattiṃ dassento āha “sassamiva phala”nti.
analyzed: anupubba sikkhā ādi vasena kāla antare abhinipphattim dassentaḥ āha sassam iva phalanti
translated: Showing the ripening in a later time by means of the gradual training, etc., he said: “It ripens like a crop.”

original: Pasavatīti phalati, nipphādetīti attho. Upāyasamaṅgīnaṃyeva nipphajjanabhāvaṃ dassento
analyzed: pasavati iti phalati nipphādeti iti atthaḥ upāya samaṅgīnam yeva nipphajjana bhāvam dassento
translated: “It ripens” : it bears fruit; the meaning is, it produces. Showing that it ripens only for those who are endowed with the means,

original: “dhenu viya khīra”nti āha. Dhenutopi hi upāyavantānaṃyeva khīrapaṭilābho hoti. Anupāyena
analyzed: āha dhenu āha anupāyena
translated: he said: “It yields milk like a cow.” For it is only those who are endowed with the means who obtain milk from a cow. For if one who is not endowed with the means

original: hi akāle ajātavacchaṃ dhenuṃ dohanto kālepi vā visāṇaṃ gahetvā dohanto neva khīraṃ
analyzed: hi akāle ajāta vaccham dhenum dohantaḥ kāle pi vā visāṇam na iva khīram
translated: milks a cow whose calf is not yet born, or if he milks at the wrong time, or if he takes hold of the wrong teat, he does not obtain any milk.

original: paṭilabhati. “Suttāṇā”ti etassa atthaṃ pakāsetuṃ “suṭṭhu ca ne tāyatī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: paṭilabhati suttāṇā ti etassa attham pakāsetum suṭṭhu ca ne tāyati iti vuttam
translated: In order to explain the meaning of “for those who sleep,” it is said: “It protects them well.”

original: Suttasabhāganti suttasadisaṃ. Suttasabhāgataṃyeva dassento āha “yathā hī”tiādi. Tacchakānaṃ
analyzed: sutta sabhāgam ti sutta sadisam dassentaḥ āha yathā hi itiādi tad śakānam
translated: “A gathering of threads” : it is like a gathering of threads. Showing the similarity to a gathering of threads, he said: “For just as,” etc.

original: suttanti vaḍḍhakīnaṃ kāḷasuttaṃ. Pamāṇaṃ hotīti tadanusārena tacchanato. Evametampi🔽viññūnanti yathā kāḷasuttaṃ pasāretvā saññāṇe kate gahetabbaṃ vissajjetabbañca paññāyati,
analyzed: suttam ti vaḍḍhakīnam kāḷa suttam pamāṇam hoti iti tad anusārena tad śanatas evam etam pi  viññūnanti yathā kāḷa suttam pasāretvā saññāṇe kate gahetabbam vissajjetabbam ca paññāyati
translated: Thread is the black thread of the builders. It is a measure for them: it is a standard for them by following it.🔽So too, when the thread is stretched out and the line is made, it is evident that it can be grasped and that it can be departed from.

original: evaṃ vivādesu uppannesu sutte ānītamatte “idaṃ gahetabbaṃ, idaṃ vissajjetabba”nti
analyzed: evam vivādesu uppannesu sutte ānīta matte idam gahetabbam idam vissajjetabbanti
translated: So too, when a dispute has arisen, when the Thread is brought up, it is evident to the wise that ‘This can be grasped and that can be departed from’

original: viññūnaṃ pākaṭattā vivādo vūpasammatīti etampi suttaṃ viññūnaṃ pamāṇaṃ hotīti attho.🔽Idāni aññathāpi suttasabhāgataṃ dassento āha “yathā cā”tiādi. Suttaṃ viya pamāṇattā🔽saṅgāhakattā ca suttamiva suttanti vuttaṃ hoti. Ettha ca attatthādividhāne suttassa
analyzed: viññūnam pākaṭa ttā vivādaḥ vūpasammatī iti etam pi suttam viññūnam pamāṇam hoti iti attho  idāni aññathā api sutta sabhā gatam dassentaḥ āha yathā ca atiādi suttam viya pamāṇa ttā  saṅgāhaka ttā ca suttam iva suttanti vuttam hoti ettha ca atta ttha ādi vidhāne suttassa
translated: and so the dispute is settled. So this Thread too is a measure for the wise. This is the meaning.🔽Now, showing the Thread-like state in another way, he said ‘And just as’ , and so on. It is called ‘a Thread’ because it is a measure like a Thread and because it is a gatherer like a Thread.🔽And here the Thread’s being a measure in the case of the exposition of one’s own good, etc.,

original: pamāṇabhāvo attatthādīnaṃyeva ca saṅgāhakattaṃ yojetabbaṃ tadatthappakāsanapadhānattā
analyzed: pamāṇa bhāvaḥ ca saṅgāhaka ttam yojetabbam tad attha ppakāsana padhāna ttā
translated: and the fact that it is a gatherer of one’s own good, etc., should be construed together, since the Thread is pre-eminent in revealing their meaning.

original: suttassa. Vinayābhidhammehi visesattañca pubbe vuttanayeneva yojetabbaṃ. Etanti “atthānaṃ
analyzed: suttassa vinaya abhidhammehi visesa ttañca pubbe vutta nayena iva yojetabbam etat ti atthānam
translated: And the difference from the Discipline and the Abhidhamma should be construed in the way already stated . ‘This’ is the Thread.

original: sūcanato”tiādikaṃ atthavacanaṃ. Etassāti suttassa.
analyzed: sūcanato ti ādikam attha vacanam etassa ati suttassa
translated: “From the pointing out” is a statement of meaning. “Of this” is of the sutta.

original: Yanti yasmā. Etthāti abhidhamme. Abhikkamantīti ettha abhi-saddo kamanakiriyāya vuḍḍhibhāvaṃ🔽atirekataṃ dīpetīti āha “abhikkamantītiādīsu vuḍḍhiyaṃ āgato”ti. Abhiññātāti aḍḍhacandādinā
analyzed: yanti yasmai ettha ati abhidhamme abhikkamanti iti ettha abhisaddaḥ kamana kiriyāya vuḍḍhi bhāvam  atirekatam dīpeti iti āha abhikkamanti itiādīsu vuḍḍhiyam āgato ti abhiññātā iti aḍḍhacanda ādinā
translated: “Yanti” is because. “Ettha” is in the Abhidhamma. “Abhikkamanti” : here the prefix abhi signifies increase,

original: kenaci saññāṇena ñātā paññātā pākaṭāti attho. Aḍḍhacandādibhāvo hi rattiyā upalakkhaṇavasena
analyzed: kenaci saññāṇena ñātā paññātā pākaṭā ti atthaḥ aḍḍha canda ādi bhāvaḥ hi rattiyā upalakkhaṇa vasena
translated: excess, in the action of going, thus he says “in the sense of increase, in the sense of ‘come forward’ , etc.” “Abhiññātā” : known, recognized, by some sign such as the half-moon, etc.; the meaning is, made evident. For the state of being a half-moon, etc., is a sign by way of characteristic of the night,

original: saññāṇaṃ hoti, yasmā aḍḍho cando, tasmā aṭṭhamī, yasmā ūno, tasmā cātuddasī, yasmā🔽puṇṇo, tasmā pannarasīti. Abhilakkhitāti etthāpi ayamevattho veditabbo. Abhilakkhitasaddapariyāyo🔽abhiññātasaddoti āha “abhiññātā abhilakkhitātiādīsu lakkhaṇe”ti. Ettha ca vācakasaddantarasannidhānena
analyzed: saññāṇam hoti yasmai aḍḍhaḥ cando tasmai aṭṭhamī yasmai ūnaḥ tasmai cātuddasī yasmai  puṇṇaḥ tasmā pannarasī iti abhilakkhitā ti ettha api ayam eva atthaḥ veditabbaḥ abhilakkhita sadda pariyāyaḥ  abhiññāta saddo ti āha abhiññātā abhilakkhitā atiādīsu lakkhaṇā iti ettha ca vācaka sadda antara sannidhānena
translated: since the moon is full on the fifteenth, therefore it is the full moon; since it is waning, therefore it is the fourteenth; since it is increasing, therefore it is the eighth.🔽“Abhiññātā abhilakkhitā” : here too this is the meaning to be understood. The word abhiññātā is a synonym for the word abhilakkhitā . Thus he says “in the sense of characteristic, in the sense of ‘known’ and ‘recognized’ , etc.” And here the prefix abhi, which signifies the meaning of the word lakkhita , occurs in the sense of characteristic,

original: nipātānaṃ tadatthajotakamattattā lakkhitasaddatthajotako abhisaddo lakkhaṇe vattatīti
analyzed: nipātānam tad attha jotaka matta ttā lakkhita sadda attha jotakaḥ abhisaddaḥ lakkhaṇe vattati iti
translated: because of the proximity of the word vācaka , another word that signifies the same meaning as lakkhita . For the words nipāta are merely pointers to the meaning of the word lakkhita .

original: vutto. Rājābhirājāti rājūhi pūjetuṃ araho rājā. Pūjiteti pūjārahe.
analyzed: vuttaḥ rājā abhirājā ati rājūhi pūjetum arahaḥ rājā pūjitā iti pūjā rahe
translated: “King of kings” is a king worthy of being honoured by kings. “Honoured” is worthy of being honoured.

original: Abhidhammeti “supinantena sukkavissaṭṭhiyā anāpattibhāvepi akusalacetanā upalabbhatī”tiādinā
analyzed: abhidhamma iti supin antena sukka vissaṭṭhiyāḥ anāpatti bhāve pi akusala cetanā upalabbhati iti ādinā
translated: “The Abhidhamma” is the Dhamma free from confusion in the enunciation of the Vinaya, such as “Although there is no offence for one who has a wet dream in a dream, there is still an unprofitable thought that can be discovered.”

original: vinayapaññattiyā saṅkaravirahite dhamme. “Pubbāparavirodhābhāvato dhammānaṃyeva ca🔽aññamaññasaṅkaravirahite dhamme”tipi vadanti. “Pāṇātipāto akusala”nti evamādīsu ca
analyzed: vinaya paññattiyā saṅkara virahite dhamme pubba apara virodha abhāvataḥ ca  añña mañña saṅkara virahite vadanti pāṇa atipāto evamādīsu ca
translated: They also say: “The Dhamma free from confusion in the mutual relationship of the teachings, since there is no contradiction between the earlier and later teachings.”

original: maraṇādhippāyassa jīvitindriyupacchedakapayogasamuṭṭhāpikā cetanā akusalaṃ, na pāṇasaṅkhātajīvitindriyassa
analyzed: maraṇa adhippāyassa jīvitindriya upacchedaka payoga samuṭṭhāpikā cetanā akusalam na pāṇa saṅkhāta jīvitindriyassa
translated: And in such passages as “The taking of life is unprofitable” the unprofitable state is the volition that originates the means to the severing of the life faculty in one who intends to kill, not the taking of life consisting in the severing of the life faculty called “living being.”

original: upacchedasaṅkhāto atipāto, tathā adinnassa parasantakassa ādānasaṅkhātā viññatti🔽abyākato dhammo, taṃviññattisamuṭṭhāpikā theyyacetanā akusalo dhammoti evamādināpi
analyzed: upaccheda saṅkhātaḥ atipātaḥ tathā adinnassa para santakassa ādāna saṅkhātā viññatti  abyākataḥ dhammo tad viññatti samuṭṭhāpikā theyya cetanā akusalaḥ dhammo ti evamādinā api
translated: Likewise, the unprofitable state is the volition to steal in one who intends to steal, not the asking consisting in the taking of what has not been given and belongs to another.🔽The Dhamma is indeterminate, but the volition that originates the asking is an unprofitable state.🔽The meaning should be understood in this way as the Dhamma free from confusion in the mutual relationship of the teachings.

original: aññamaññasaṅkaravirahite dhammeti attho veditabbo. Abhivinayeti ettha “jātarūparajataṃ
analyzed: aññamañña saṅkara virahite dhamme ti atthaḥ veditabbaḥ abhivinaya iti ettha jātarūpa rajatam
translated: “The Abhidhamma” is the Dhamma free from confusion in the Vinaya, such as “Gold and silver are not to be touched by an ascetic.”

original: na paṭiggahetabba”nti vadanto vinaye vineti nāma. Ettha “evaṃ paṭiggaṇhato pācittiyaṃ,
analyzed: na paṭiggahetabbanti vadantaḥ vinaye vinā iti nāma ettha evam paṭiggaṇhataḥ pācittiyam
translated: he trains in the Monastic Law.🔽Here they say: “If he says, ‘When you receive it like this, there’s an offense entailing confession.

original: evaṃ dukkaṭanti vadanto ca abhivinaye vineti nāmā”ti vadanti. Tasmā jātarūparajataṃ
analyzed: evam ca abhivinaye vinā iti vadanti tasmai jātarūpa rajatam
translated: When you receive it like this, there’s an offense of wrong conduct,’ he trains in the higher Monastic Law.”🔽Therefore, when receiving gold and silver,

original: theyyacittena parasantakaṃ gaṇhantassa yathāvatthu pārājikathullaccayadukkaṭesu aññataraṃ,
analyzed: theyya cittena para santakam gaṇhantassa yathāvatthu pārājika thullaccaya dukkaṭesu aññataram
translated: if one takes what belongs to another with the intention of stealing, then according to the amount, there is an offense entailing expulsion, an offense entailing suspension, or an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bhaṇḍāgārikasīsena gaṇhantassa pācittiyaṃ, attatthāya gaṇhantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
analyzed: bhaṇḍāgārika sīsena gaṇhantassa pācittiyam atta tthāya gaṇhantassa nissaggiyam pācittiyam
translated: If one takes it as a deposit, there is an offense entailing confession. If one takes it for oneself, there is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: Kevalaṃ lolatāya gaṇhantassa anāmāsadukkaṭaṃ, rūpiyachaḍḍakassa sammatassa anāpattīti
analyzed: kevalam lola tāya gaṇhantassa anāmāsa dukkaṭam rūpiya chaḍḍakassa sammatassa anāpatti iti
translated: If one takes it out of mere frivolity, there is an offense of wrong conduct. If one has given permission to discard the silver, there is no offense.

original: evaṃ aññamaññasaṅkaravirahite vinaye paṭibalo vinetunti attho veditabbo. Abhikkantenāti
analyzed: evam aññamañña saṅkara virahite vinaye paṭibalaḥ vinetun ti atthaḥ veditabbaḥ abhikkantena ati
translated: Thus, one who is able to train in the Monastic Law, which is free from confusion between the different rules, is said to be able to train.🔽In the phrase “when one is superior”,

original: ettha kantiyā adhikattaṃ abhisaddo dīpetīti āha “adhike”ti.
analyzed: ettha kantiyāḥ adhika ttam abhisaddaḥ dīpeti iti āha adhika iti
translated: the prefix abhi indicates a greater degree of affection.

original: Nanu ca “abhikkamantī”ti ettha abhisaddo kamanakiriyāya vuḍḍhibhāvaṃ atirekataṃ dīpeti,
analyzed: nanu ca abhikkamanti iti ettha abhi saddaḥ kamana kiriyāya vuḍḍhi bhāvam atirekataḥ dīpeti
translated: But in the phrase “when one is approaching”, the prefix abhi indicates an increase in the action of approaching, an excess of approaching.

original: “abhiññātā abhilakkhitā”ti ettha ñāṇalakkhaṇakiriyānaṃ supākaṭattā visesaṃ, “abhikkantenā”ti🔽ettha kantiyā adhikattaṃ visiṭṭhataṃ dīpetīti idaṃ tāva yuttaṃ kiriyāvisesakattā🔽upasaggassa, “abhirājā abhivinayo”ti pana pūjitaparicchinnesu rājavinayesu abhisaddo

But how can it be proper in the case of “the well-honored king” and “the well-disciplined man,” where the word abhi occurs in the sense of “honored” and “disciplined”?

translated: Here too there is no fault, since the act of honoring, the act of disciplining, is shown.

analyzed: tāhi ca kiriyāhi rāja vinayānam yutta ttā tasmai ettha ati mālā ādīsu ati saddaḥ viya abhi saddaḥ  saha sādhanena kiriyam vadati iti abhirāja abhivinaya saddā siddhā evam abhidhamma sadde

analyzed: vaḍḍhanam vuttam vuḍḍhimanto ti bhāvanā pharaṇa vuḍḍhīhi vuḍḍhimanto api dhammā vuttā ati  atthaḥ ārammaṇa ādīhi iti ārammaṇa sampayutta kamma dvāra paṭipadā ādīhi lakkhaṇīya ttā ati sañjānitabba ttā  ekantataḥ pūjā raha ttā sekkhāḥ dhammā ati ādinā lokuttarāya iva

analyzed: sambhavataḥ āha itas paresu pi esā iva nayaḥ  vinaya piṭakam te hi dosa bāhullato

translated: And it is of four kinds as follows:🔽The wrong view called eternalism and annihilationism is called “view-point” in the sense of being a view that is a cause for the occurrence in the future of the kind of knowledge called “knowledge of the act of conformity to the truths” .🔽And the right view called “knowledge of the act of conformity to the truths” is called “view-point” in the sense of being a cause for the occurrence in the future of the kind of knowledge called “knowledge of what is the path and what is not the path” .

analyzed: pahānanti kāya duccarita ādi duṭṭhu caritam kilesehi vā dūsitam caritanti duccaritam
translated: Abandoning of the defilement of misconduct: misconduct is bad conduct of body, speech, and mind, or it is conduct defiled by defilements.

original: Tadeva yattha uppannaṃ, taṃ santānaṃ sammā kileseti bādhayati upatāpeti cāti saṃkileso,
analyzed: tat eva yattha uppannam tam santānam sammā kileseti bādhayati upatāpeti ca ati saṃkilesaḥ
translated: It is a defilement because it defiles, that is, it harms and torments, the mental continuity in which it arises.

original: tassa pahānaṃ, kāyavacīduccaritavasena pavattasaṃkilesassa tadaṅgavasena pahānanti🔽vuttaṃ hoti. Samādhissa kāmacchandapaṭipakkhattā suttantapiṭake taṇhāsaṃkilesassa

translated: The word “abandonment” here should be understood as follows: the abandonment of the defilements that occur as bodily and verbal misconduct is the abandonment by suppression.🔽The abandonment of the defilements of craving is stated in the Sutta Piṭaka, because concentration is the opposite of sensual desire.

original: pahānaṃ vuttaṃ. Attādivinimuttasabhāvadhammappakāsanato abhidhammapiṭake diṭṭhisaṃkilesassa pahānaṃ vuttaṃ.

translated: The abandonment of the defilements of views is stated in the Abhidhamma Piṭaka, because the Abhidhamma teaches the dhammas that are free from the self and so on.

original: Ekamekasmiñcetthāti etesu tīsu piṭakesu ekamekasmiṃ piṭaketi attho daṭṭhabbo. Dhammoti🔽pāḷīti ettha pakaṭṭhānaṃ ukkaṭṭhānaṃ sīlādiatthānaṃ bodhanato sabhāvaniruttibhāvato
analyzed: ekam ekasmin ca itthā iti etesu tīsu piṭakesu ekam ekasmin piṭake iti atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo dhammaḥ ti  ettha paka ṭṭhānam ukka ṭṭhānam sīla ādi atthānam bodhanataḥ sabhāva nirutti bhāvato
translated: “In each of these” means in each of the three Piṭakas. The word “Dhamma”🔽Herein, the “text” is the collection of words, phrases, and syllables. It is called “text” because it is the basis for the teaching of virtue and so on. It is called “text” because it is the basis for the teaching of the dhammas that are the dhammas’ own nature, their nature as sounds, and their nature as expressions.

original: buddhādīhi bhāsitattā ca pakaṭṭhānaṃ vacanappabandhānaṃ āḷīti pāḷi, pariyattidhammo.
analyzed: buddha ādīhi bhāsita ttā ca paka ṭṭhānam vacana pabandhānam āḷi iti pariyatti dhammo
translated: It is called “text” because it is spoken by the Buddha and so on.

original: “Dhammoti pāḷīti ettha bhagavatā vuccamānassa atthassa vohārassa ca dīpano saddoyeva
analyzed: dhammaḥ ti pāḷī iti ettha bhagavatā vuccamānassa atthassa vohārassa ca dīpanaḥ
translated: “Herein, the word ‘Dhamma’ refers to the meaning and the expression that are taught by the Blessed One. The word ‘text’ refers to the sound that illuminates that meaning and expression.🔽The sound is called ‘text’ because it is the basis for the teaching of the dhammas that are the dhammas’ own nature, their nature as sounds, and their nature as expressions.”

original: pāḷi nāmā”ti gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Abhidhammaṭṭhakathāya likhite sīhaḷagaṇṭhipade
analyzed: pāḷi nāma ati gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam abhidhamma ṭṭhakathāya likhite sīhaḷa gaṇṭhi pade
translated: This is stated in the Sihala commentary on the Abhidhamma.

original: pana idaṃ vuttaṃ – sabhāvatthassa sabhāvavohārassa ca anurūpavasena bhagavatā manasā🔽vavatthāpitā paṇḍatti pāḷīti vuccati. Yadi saddoyeva pāḷi siyā, pāḷiyā desanāya ca🔽nānattena bhavitabbaṃ. Manasā vavatthāpitāya ca pāḷiyā vacībhedakaraṇamattaṃ ṭhapetvā🔽desanāya nānattaṃ natthi. analyzed: pana idam vuttam sabhāvatthassa sabhāva vohārassa ca anurūpa vasena bhagavatā manasā  vavatthāpitā paṇḍatti pāḷī iti vuccati yadi saddo yā iva pāḷi siyā pāḷiyā desanāya ca  nānattena bhavitabbam manasā vavatthāpitāya ca pāḷiyā vacībheda karaṇa mattam ṭhapetvā  desanāya nānattam natthi tathā hi desanam dassentena manasā vavatthāpitāya pāḷiyā  desanā ati vacībheda karaṇa mattam vinā pāḷiyā saha desanāya anaññathā vuttā tathā ca  upari desanā ati paññatti iti vutta ttā desanāya anañña bhāvena pāḷiyā paṇṇatti bhāvaḥ  kathitaḥ hoti apica yadi pāḷiyā aññāyā iva desanā siyā pāḷiyā ca pāḷi atthassa ca
translated: But this is said: The text is called the “Pāḷi” because it is the “Pāḷi” in the sense of “what is laid down” by the Blessed One in conformity with the meaning of the “Pāḷi” in the sense of “what has individual essence” . If the “Pāḷi” were only the sound, then there would have to be a difference between the “Pāḷi” and the teaching. And apart from the mere fact of its being uttered, there is no difference between the “Pāḷi” as laid down by the mind and the teaching. For when the teaching is shown, it is shown as the “Pāḷi” as laid down by the mind, and as the teaching, without being anything different from the “Pāḷi,” by one who teaches the teaching without making any difference except that of mere utterance. And so it is said above, “The teaching is the description” . So the fact that the “Pāḷi” is the description is stated as being not different from the teaching. Moreover, if the teaching were something different from the “Pāḷi,” then the “Pāḷi” and the meaning of the “Pāḷi” would not be the teaching.🔽

original: desanāya ca yathābhūtāvabodho”ti vattabbaṃ siyā, evaṃ pana avatvā “pāḷiyā ca pāḷiatthassa
analyzed: desanāya ca yathā bhūta avabodhaḥ ti vattabbam siyā evam pana avatvā pāḷiyā ca pāḷi atthassa
translated: But this is said: The text is called the “Pāḷi” because it is the “Pāḷi” in the sense of what is laid down by the Blessed One in the mind in conformity with the meaning and the expression. If the sound were the Pāḷi, then the Pāḷi and the teaching would have to be different. And apart from the mere fact of the utterance, there is no difference between the Pāḷi laid down in the mind and the teaching. For when the teaching is shown, it is said to be the teaching only by the mere fact of the utterance, without making the Pāḷi any different from the teaching. And so it is said above, “The teaching is the enunciation” . So the Pāḷi is stated to be the enunciation without being different from the teaching. Moreover, if the teaching were different from the Pāḷi, it would be necessary to say, “By the Pāḷi and by the teaching there is understanding of the meaning of the Pāḷi as it truly is” . But without saying it in this way, it is said: “By the Pāḷi and by the meaning of the Pāḷi there is understanding of the meaning of the Pāḷi as it truly is” .

original: ca yathābhūtāvabodho”ti vuttattā pāḷiyā desanāya ca anaññabhāvo dassito hoti. Evañca
analyzed: ca yathābhūta avabodho ti vutta ttā pāḷiyā desanāya ca anañña bhāvaḥ dassito hoti evam ca
translated: and the understanding of what is as it is” , the non-difference of the text and the teaching is shown.

original: katvā upari “desanā nāma paññattī”ti dassentena desanāya anaññabhāvato pāḷiyā paṇṇattibhāvo kathitova hotīti.
analyzed: katvā upari desanā nāma paññattī iti dassentena desanāya anañña bhāvato pāḷiyā paṇṇatti bhāvaḥ kathitaḥ iva hoti iti
translated: and the understanding of what is as it is” , the non-difference of the text and the teaching is shown. And when it is put like this, the text’s being a description is also said by the expositor who shows that “the teaching is a description” .

analyzed: vavatthāpitaḥ sadda ppabandhaḥ dhammo pacchā paresam avabodhana attham pavattitaḥ tad attha ppakāsako  saddaḥ desanā iti veditabbam atha vā yathā vutta sadda samuṭṭhāpakaḥ cittuppādaḥ desanā

original: Tīsupi cetesu ete dhammatthadesanāpaṭivedhāti ettha pāḷiattho pāḷidesanā pāḷiatthapaṭivedho
analyzed: tīsu pi ca itesu ete dhamma attha desanā paṭivedhā ti ettha pāḷi atthaḥ pāḷi desanā pāḷi attha paṭivedho
translated: And in these three the penetration of the teaching of the meaning of the True Idea is the penetration of the teaching of the text and the meaning of the text.🔽So these three are the province of the text.

original: cāti ime tayo pāḷivisayā hontīti vinayapiṭakādīnaṃ atthassa desanāya paṭivedhassa🔽ca ādhārabhāvo yutto, piṭakāni pana pāḷiyoyevāti tesaṃ dhammassa ādhārabhāvo kathaṃ
analyzed: ca ati ime pāḷivisayāḥ honti iti vinaya piṭaka ādīnam atthassa desanāya paṭivedhassa  ca ādhāra bhāvaḥ yutto piṭakāni pana tesam dhammassa ādhāra bhāvaḥ katham
translated: The three Piṭakas are the province of the text only.🔽How then can it be proper to say that the True Idea is the province of the Vinaya Piṭaka, etc.?

original: yujjeyyāti ce? Pāḷisamudāyassa avayavapāḷiyā ādhārabhāvato. Avayavassa hi samudāyo
analyzed: yujjeyya ati ce pāḷi samudāyassa avayava pāḷiyā ādhāra bhāvataḥ avayavassa hi samudāyo
translated: Because the text as a whole is the province of the text as a part.

original: ādhārabhāvena vuccati yathā “rukkhe sākhā”ti. Ettha ca dhammādīnaṃ dukkhogāhabhāvato
analyzed: ādhāra bhāvena vuccati yathā rukkhe sākhā ati ettha ca dhamma ādīnam dukkha ugāha bhāvato
translated: For the whole is said to be the province of the part as the support, as in the case of the expression “in the tree, the branch” .🔽And here the Vinaya Piṭaka, etc., are called “profound” because of the profundity of the True Idea, etc., that they contain.

original: tehi dhammādīhi vinayādayo gambhīrāti vinayādīnampi catubbidho gambhīrabhāvo vuttoyeva,🔽tasmā dhammādayo eva dukkhogāhattā gambhīrā, na vinayādayoti na codetabbametaṃ sammukhena
analyzed: tehi dhamma ādīhi vinaya ādayaḥ gambhīrā ati vinaya ādīnam pi catubbidhaḥ gambhīra bhāvaḥ  tasmā dhamma ādayaḥ eva gambhīrāḥ na vinaya ādayaḥ ti na codetabbam etam sammukhena
translated: So the profundity of the Vinaya Piṭaka, etc., is also of four kinds.🔽Therefore it should not be objected that it is only the True Idea, etc., and not the Vinaya Piṭaka, etc., that are profound because of the profundity of the True Idea, etc., that they contain.

original: visayavisayīmukhena ca vinayādīnaṃyeva gambhīrabhāvassa vuttattā. Dhammo hi vinayādayo,
analyzed: visaya visayī mukhena ca vinaya ādīnaṃ yeva gambhīra bhāvassa vutta ttā dhammaḥ hi vinaya ādayaḥ
translated: For the Vinaya Piṭaka, etc., are the True Idea, etc.,

original: tesaṃ visayo attho, dhammatthavisayā ca desanāpaṭivedhāti. Tattha paṭivedhassa dukkarabhāvato
analyzed: tesam visayaḥ atthaḥ dhamma attha visayā ca desanā paṭivedhā ti tattha paṭivedhassa dukkara bhāvato
translated: Their domain is the meaning. And the teaching is the domain of the meaning of the True Idea.🔽Herein, the True Idea is difficult to penetrate because the penetration of it is difficult.

original: dhammatthānaṃ, desanāñāṇassa dukkarabhāvato desanāya ca dukkhogāhabhāvo veditabbo.🔽Paṭivedhassa pana uppādetuṃ asakkuṇeyyattā taṃvisayañāṇuppattiyā ca dukkarabhāvato
analyzed: dhammatthānam desanā ñāṇassa dukkara bhāvataḥ desanāya ca dukkha ugāha bhāvaḥ veditabbo  paṭivedhassa pana uppādetum a sakkuṇeyya ttā tad visaya ñāṇa uppattiyā ca dukkara bhāvato
translated: And the teaching is difficult to grasp because the knowledge of the teaching is difficult.🔽But the penetration is difficult to produce and the knowledge that has it as its domain is difficult to produce.

original: dukkhogāhatā veditabbā. Dukkhena ogayhantīti dukkhogāhā. Ekadesena ogāhantehipi mandabuddhīhi
analyzed: dukkha ugāha tā veditabbā dukkhena ogayhanti iti dukkha ugāhāḥ eka desena ogāhantehi pi manda buddhīhi
translated: So it is difficult to grasp because it is difficult to produce. It is difficult to grasp because it is hard to grasp.🔽Even though it is grasped in part by those of low understanding,

original: patiṭṭhā laddhuṃ na sakkāti āha “alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭhā cā”ti. Ekamekasminti ekekasmiṃ
analyzed: patiṭṭhā laddhum na sakkā iti āha alabbhaneyya patiṭṭhā ca ati ekam ekasmin ti eka ekasmin
translated: it is still not possible for them to find a footing in it. That is why he said ‘and it has no footing to be found in it’.🔽In each one: in each one of the three Baskets.

original: piṭake. Etthāti etesu piṭakesu. Niddhāraṇe cetaṃ bhummavacanaṃ.🔽Idāni hetuhetuphalādīnaṃ vasenapi gambhīrabhāvaṃ dassento āha “aparo nayo”tiādi.🔽Hetūti paccayo. So hi attano phalaṃ dahati vidahatīti dhammoti vuccati. Dhammasaddassa
analyzed: piṭake ettha ati etesu piṭakesu niddhāraṇe ca itam bhumma vacanam 🔽idāni hetu hetu phala ādīnam vasena api gambhīra bhāvam dassentaḥ āha aparaḥ naya uti ādi 🔽hetu uti paccayaḥ so hi attanaḥ phalam dahati vidahati iti dhammaḥ ti vuccati dhamma saddassa
translated: Herein: in these three Baskets. This is a locative in the sense of sphere.

original: cettha hetupariyāyatā kathaṃ viññāyatīti āha “vuttañheta”ntiādi. Nanu ca “hetumhi🔽ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā”ti etena vacanena dhammassa hetubhāvo kathaṃ viññāyatīti
analyzed: ca ittha hetu pariyāya tā katham viññāyati iti āha vuttam hetat tiādi nanu ca hetumhi  ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā ti etena vacanena dhammassa hetu bhāvaḥ katham viññāyati iti
translated: How is it known that the words “in the cause” are a synonym for the cause? He said, “Because it is said” .🔽But is it not known that the Dhamma is a cause by the words “Knowledge of the cause is the discrimination of the Dhamma”?

original: ce? Dhammapaṭisambhidāti etassa samāsapadassa avayavapadatthaṃ dassentena “hetumhi
analyzed: ce dhamma paṭisambhidā ti etassa samāsa padassa avayava pada attham dassentena hetumhi
translated: Because it is said “Knowledge of the cause” in order to show the meaning of the words of the compound dhammapatisambhidā.🔽For in the passage “The discrimination of the Dhamma in the Dhamma is the discrimination of the Dhamma” , the meaning of the words “in the Dhamma” is shown by the words “in the cause” ,

original: ñāṇa”nti vuttattā. “Dhamme paṭisambhidā dhammapaṭisambhidā”ti ettha hi “dhamme”ti🔽etassa atthaṃ dassentena “hetumhī”ti vuttaṃ, “paṭisambhidā”ti etassa atthaṃ dassentena🔽“ñāṇa”nti, tasmā hetudhammasaddā ekatthā ñāṇapaṭisambhidāsaddā cāti imamatthaṃ vadantena🔽sādhito dhammassa hetubhāvo. Hetuphale ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidāti etena vacanena sādhito
analyzed: ñāṇam ti vutta ttā dhamme paṭisambhidā dhamma paṭisambhidā ti ettha hi dhamma iti  etassa attham dassentena hetumhi iti vuttam paṭisambhidā iti etassa attham dassentena  ñāṇanti tasmā hetu dhamma saddāḥ ekatthāḥ ñāṇa paṭisambhidā saddāḥ ca ati imam attham vadantena  sādhitaḥ dhammassa hetu bhāvaḥ hetu phale ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā ati etena vacanena sādhitaḥ
translated: and the meaning of the words “discrimination of the Dhamma” is shown by the words “knowledge” .🔽Thus the meaning of the words “cause” and “Dhamma” is the same, and the meaning of the words “knowledge” and “discrimination” is the same.🔽By this statement the meaning of the words “Knowledge of the cause and fruit is the discrimination of the meaning” is established.

original: atthassa hetuphalabhāvopi evameva daṭṭhabbo. Hetuno phalaṃ hetuphalaṃ. Tañca yasmā
analyzed: atthassa hetu phala bhāvaḥ api evam eva daṭṭhabbaḥ hetuno phalam hetu phalam tat ca yasmā
translated: The meaning of the words “Knowledge of the cause and fruit is the discrimination of the meaning” should be understood in the same way. The fruit of the cause is the cause’s fruit.

original: hetuanusārena arīyati adhigamīyati sampāpuṇīyati, tasmā atthoti vuccati.
analyzed: hetu anusārena arīyati adhigamīyati sampāpuṇīyati tasmai vuccati
translated: It is called “meaning” because it is sought by means of the cause, is reached by means of the cause, is attained by means of the cause.

original: Yathādhammanti ettha dhammasaddo hetuṃ hetuphalañca sabbaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Sabhāvavācako🔽hesa dhammasaddo, na pariyattihetubhāvavācako, tasmā yathādhammanti yo yo avijjādisaṅkhārādidhammo,
analyzed: yathādhammam ti ettha dhamma saddaḥ hetum hetu phalam ca sabbam saṅgaṇhāti sabhāva vācakaḥ  hesa dhamma saddaḥ na pariyatti hetu bhāva vācakaḥ tasmai yathādhammam ti yaḥ yaḥ avijjā ādi saṅkhāra ādi dhammaḥ
translated: Herein, the word “idea” includes both the cause and the fruit of the cause.🔽This word “idea” is a word for individual essence; it is not a word for the cause of learning or for the state of having a cause.🔽So the meaning is “in each case in regard to the idea of ignorance, etc., formations, etc.,”🔽or “in accordance with the idea” .

original: tasmiṃ tasminti attho. Dhammānurūpaṃ vā yathādhammaṃ. Desanāpi hi paṭivedho viya🔽aviparītavisayavibhāvanato dhammānurūpaṃ pavattati, tatoyeva ca aviparītābhilāpoti
analyzed: tasmin tasmin ti atthaḥ dhamma anurūpam vā yathādhammam desanā api hi paṭivedhaḥ viya  aviparīta visaya vibhāvanataḥ dhamma anurūpam pavattati ca aviparīta abhilāpā ti
translated: For the teaching occurs in accordance with the idea, like the penetration,🔽because it reveals the undeluded objective field. And it is called “undeluded expression”

original: vuccati. Dhammābhilāpoti atthabyañjanako aviparītābhilāpo. Ettha ca abhilappatīti🔽abhilāpoti saddo vuccati. Etena “tatra dhammaniruttābhilāpe ñāṇaṃ niruttipaṭisambhidā”ti
analyzed: vuccati dhamma abhilāpo ti attha byañjanakaḥ aviparīta abhilāpo ettha ca abhilappati iti  abhilāpaḥ iti saddo vuccati etena tatra dhamma nirutta abhilāpe ñāṇam nirutti paṭisambhidā ati
translated: because it is undeluded as to the expression. And here the word “expression”🔽is said to be a word for sound. By this he shows the “expression of the language of the ideas” mentioned in the passage, “Knowledge of the language of the ideas there is the discrimination of language” ,

original: ettha vuttaṃ dhammaniruttiṃ dasseti saddasabhāvattā desanāya. Tathā hi niruttipaṭisambhidāya
analyzed: ettha vuttam dhamma niruttim dasseti saddasa bhāva ttā desanāya tathā hi nirutti paṭisambhidāya
translated: because the teaching has the nature of sound. For the discrimination of language

original: parittārammaṇādibhāvo paṭisambhidāvibhaṅgapāḷiyaṃ vutto. Aṭṭhakathāyañca “taṃ sabhāvaniruttiṃ🔽saddaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā”tiādinā saddārammaṇatā dassitā. Tathā hi imassa atthassa ayaṃ🔽saddo vācakoti vacanavacanatthe vavatthapetvā taṃtaṃvacanatthavibhāvanavasena pavattito🔽saddo desanāti vuccati. Adhippāyoti etena “desanāti paññattī”ti etaṃ vacanaṃ dhammaniruttābhilāpaṃ
analyzed: paritta ārammaṇa ādi bhāvo paṭisambhidā vibhaṅga pāḷiyam vuttaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam ca tam sa bhāva niruttim  saddam ārammaṇam katvā iti ādinā sadda ārammaṇa tā dassitā tathā hi imassa atthassa ayaṃ  saddo vācako ti vacana vacana atthe vavatthapetvā taṃ taṃ vacana attha vibhāvana vasena pavattitaḥ  saddaḥ desanā iti vuccati adhippāyaḥ ti etena desanā ati paññatti iti etam vacanam dhamma nirutta abhilāpam
translated: The state of having a limited object, etc., is stated in the text of the Paṭisambhidā. And in the commentary it is shown that the sound is the object: “Making that sound, which is the natural mode of expression, the object” . For when the word is defined as the expression and the thing expressed, it is said that the word occurs by way of revealing the meaning of the various expressions.🔽The “intention” is the statement “The teaching is the expression.”🔽

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ, na tato vinimuttaṃ paññattiṃ sandhāyāti adhippāyaṃ dasseti. Desīyati🔽attho etenāti hi desanā, pakārena ñāpīyati etena, pakārato ñāpetīti vā paññattīti🔽dhammaniruttābhilāpo vuccati. Evaṃ “desanā nāma saddo”ti imasmiṃ pakkhe ayamattho🔽veditabbo. “Desanāti paññattī”ti ettha paññattivādino pana evaṃ vadanti – kiñcāpi
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam na tatas vinimuttam paññattim sandhāya ati adhippāyam dasseti desīyati 🔽atthaḥ etena ati hi desanā pakārena ñāpīyati etena pakārataḥ ñāpeti iti vā paññatti iti 🔽dhamma nirutta abhilāpaḥ vuccati evam desanā nāma saddo ti imasmim pakkhe ayam attho 🔽veditabbaḥ desanā ati paññatti iti ettha paññatti vādinaḥ pana evam vadanti kiñcā api
translated: The state of having a limited object, etc., is stated in the text of the Paṭisambhidā. And in the commentary it is shown that it has sound as its object, with the words: “Taking that sound, which is the natural language, as its object” . For this is the meaning: the sound that is the means of expression for this meaning is called “teaching” because it occurs by way of revealing the various meanings of the words after determining the meaning of the words as means of expression. “Intention” : this shows the intention behind the statement “Teaching is a description” . It is stated with reference to the verbal description of the Dhamma, not with reference to the description that is free from that . For “teaching” is a description because the meaning is taught by it, or because it causes the meaning to be known by way of the description. “Description” is a verbal description of the Dhamma. This is the meaning that should be understood in the case of the statement “Teaching is a sound.” But those who maintain the view that “Description is a description” say this: “Although the verbal description of the Dhamma is called ‘teaching,’ still it is not the only description. For the meaning is also a description, since it is described by the verbal description. And the description that is free from both sound and meaning is also a description, since it is described by the other two descriptions. Therefore all three are descriptions.”

original: “dhammābhilāpo”ti ettha abhilappatīti abhilāpoti saddo vuccati, na paṇṇatti, tathāpi
analyzed: dhamma abhilāpo ti ettha abhilappati iti abhilāpo ti saddo vuccati na tathā api
translated: “Statement of ideas” : here “statement” is a sound, not a concept.

original: sadde vuccamāne tadanurūpaṃ vohāraṃ gahetvā tena vohārena dīpitassa atthassa jānanato🔽sadde kathite tadanurūpā paṇṇattipi kāraṇūpacārena kathitāyeva hoti. Atha vā “dhammābhilāpoti
analyzed: sadde vuccamāne tad anurūpam vohāram gahetvā tena vohārena dīpitassa atthassa jānanato  sadde kathite tad anurūpā kāraṇa upacārena kathitāya iva hoti atha vā dhamma abhilāpo ti
translated: But when a sound is uttered, one understands the meaning indicated by the concept corresponding to the sound.🔽So the concept corresponding to the sound is also called “statement” by a figurative use of the word for its cause.

original: attho”ti avatvā “dhammābhilāpoti adhippāyo”ti vuttattā desanā nāma saddo na hotīti dīpitamevāti.
analyzed: atthaḥ ti avatvā dhamma abhilāpo ti adhippāyo ti vutta ttā desanā nāma saddo na hoti iti dīpitam eva ati
translated: Or alternatively, the meaning is not called “statement of ideas” but “intention in the statement of ideas” . So it is shown that the teaching is not a sound.

original: Idāni paṭivedhaṃ niddisanto āha “paṭivedhoti abhisamayo”ti. Paṭivijjhatīti ñāṇaṃ🔽paṭivedhoti vuccati. Paṭivijjhanti etenāti vā paṭivedho, abhisametīti abhisamayo,🔽abhisamenti etenāti vā abhisamayo. Idāni abhisamayappabhedato abhisamayappakārato
analyzed: idāni paṭivedham niddisantaḥ āha paṭivedhaḥ ti abhisamayaḥ ti paṭivijjhati iti ñāṇam  paṭivedhaḥ ti vuccati paṭivijjhanti etena ati vā paṭivedhaḥ abhisameti iti abhisamayaḥ  abhisamenti etena ati vā abhisamayaḥ idāni abhisamaya ppabhedataḥ abhisamaya ppakārato
translated: Now, in order to point out the penetration, he said, “Penetration is penetration to the end.” The knowledge that penetrates is called “penetration.”🔽Or penetration is that by which one penetrates. Penetration to the end is penetration to the end of the four noble truths.

original: ārammaṇato sabhāvato ca pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ “so ca lokiyalokuttaro”tiādimāha. Visayato
analyzed: ārammaṇataḥ sabhāvataḥ ca pākaṭam kātum saḥ ca lokiya lokuttara uti ādim āha visayataḥ
translated: Or penetration to the end is that by which one penetrates to the end. Now, in order to make clear the kinds of penetration by way of the kinds of penetration, by way of object, and by way of individual essence, he said, “It is mundane and supramundane.” By way of object.

original: asammohato ca avabodhoti sambandho. Tattha visayato atthādianurūpaṃ dhammādīsu avabodho🔽nāma avijjādidhammārammaṇo saṅkhārādiatthārammaṇo tadubhayapaññāpanārammaṇo lokiyo🔽avabodho. Asammohato atthādianurūpaṃ dhammādīsu avabodho pana nibbānārammaṇo maggayutto
analyzed: asammohato ca avabodho ti sambandho tattha visayataḥ attha ādi anurūpam dhamma ādīsu avabodho  nāma avijjā ādi dhamma ārammaṇaḥ saṅkhāra ādi attha ārammaṇaḥ tad ubhaya paññāpana ārammaṇaḥ lokiyaḥ  avabodhaḥ asammohataḥ attha ādi anurūpam dhamma ādīsu avabodho pana nibbāna ārammaṇaḥ magga yutto
translated: The construction of the words is: “Understanding is in regard to the object, and non-delusion is in regard to the object.” Herein, understanding is in regard to the object, that is to say, in regard to the states beginning with ignorance, in accordance with their meaning beginning with “states”;🔽in regard to the meanings beginning with formations, in accordance with their meaning beginning with “meanings”; and in regard to the designation of both, in accordance with its meaning beginning with “designation.” It is mundane understanding.

original: yathāvuttadhammatthapaññattīsu sammohaviddhaṃsano lokuttaro abhisamayo. Tathā hi
analyzed: yathā vutta dhamma attha paññattīsu sammoha viddhaṃsanaḥ lokuttaraḥ abhisamayaḥ tathā hi
translated: But non-delusion is in regard to the object, that is to say, in regard to Nibbāna, in accordance with its meaning beginning with “Nibbāna.” It is supramundane understanding.

original: “ayaṃ hetu, idamassa phalaṃ, ayaṃ tadubhayānurūpo vohāro”ti evaṃ ārammaṇakaraṇavasena🔽lokiyañāṇaṃ visayato paṭivijjhati, lokuttarañāṇaṃ pana hetuhetuphalādīsu sammohassa
analyzed: ayam hetu idam assa phalam ayam tad ubhaya anurūpaḥ vohāraḥ ti evam ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena  lokiya ñāṇam visayataḥ paṭivijjhati lokuttara ñāṇam pana hetu hetu phala ādīsu sammohassa
translated: For it is said: “This is the cause, this is the fruit, this is the cause-and-fruit in their sequential order” .🔽Mundane knowledge penetrates in the sense of making its object in this way. But supramundane knowledge penetrates in the sense of non-delusion, because delusion in regard to cause, fruit, etc., is eradicated by path knowledge.

original: maggañāṇena samucchinnattā asammohato paṭivijjhati. Atthānurūpaṃ dhammesūti avijjā
analyzed: magga ñāṇena samucchinna ttā asammohataḥ paṭivijjhati attha anurūpam dhammesu iti avijjā
translated: In regard to states in accordance with their meaning beginning with “states” is in regard to the cause, ignorance, and in regard to the fruit, formations.

original: hetu, saṅkhārā hetusamuppannā, saṅkhāre uppādeti avijjāti evaṃ kāriyānurūpaṃ kāraṇesūti
analyzed: hetu saṅkhārā hetu samuppannā saṅkhāre uppādeti evam kāriya anurūpam kāraṇesu iti
translated: In regard to meanings in accordance with their meaning beginning with “meanings” is in regard to the cause, ignorance, and in regard to the fruit, formations.🔽In regard to the designation of both in accordance with its meaning beginning with “designation” is in regard to the cause, ignorance, and in regard to the fruit, formations.

original: attho. Atha vā puññābhisaṅkhāraapuññābhisaṅkhāraāneñjābhisaṅkhāresu tīsu apuññābhisaṅkhārassa
analyzed: atthaḥ atha vā puñña abhisaṅkhāra apuñña abhisaṅkhāra āneñja abhisaṅkhāresu tīsu apuñña abhisaṅkhārassa
translated: Or else, in the three kinds of formations, namely, meritorious, demeritorious, and imperturbable , ignorance is a condition for the demeritorious formations,

original: sampayuttaavijjā paccayo, itaresaṃ yathānurūpantiādinā kāriyānurūpaṃ kāraṇesu paṭivedhoti🔽attho. Dhammānurūpaṃ atthesūti “avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā”tiādinā kāraṇānurūpaṃ kāriyesu
analyzed: sampayutta avijjā paccayaḥ itaresam yathā anurūpam ti ādinā kāriya anurūpam kāraṇesu paṭivedhaḥ ti  atthaḥ dhamma anurūpam atthesu iti avijjā paccayā saṅkhāra ati ādinā kāraṇa anurūpam kāriyesu
translated: and for the other two it is a condition according to the case. This is the meaning of “in accordance with the cause in the fruit.” “In accordance with the state in the teaching” means the penetration of the teaching in accordance with the state.🔽This is the meaning of “in accordance with the state in the teaching.” “In accordance with the designation in the desanā” means the penetration of the desanā in accordance with the teaching that is being taught.

original: avabodhoti attho. Paññattipathānurūpaṃ paññattīsūti paññattiyā vuccamānadhammānurūpaṃ🔽paṇṇattīsu avabodhoti attho.
analyzed: avabodhaḥ ti attho paññatti patha anurūpam paññattīsu iti paññattiyāḥ vuccamāna dhamma anurūpam  paṇṇattīsu avabodho ti attho
translated: This is the meaning of “in accordance with the designation in the desanā.”

original: Yathāvuttehi dhammādīhi piṭakānaṃ gambhīrabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “idāni yasmā etesu piṭakesū”tiādimāha.🔽Dhammajātanti kāraṇappabhedo kāraṇameva vā. Atthajātanti kāriyappabhedo kāriyameva
analyzed: yathā vuttehi dhamma ādīhi piṭakānam gambhīra bhāvam dassetuṃ idāni yasmai etesu piṭakesu iti ādim āha  dhamma jātanti kāraṇa ppabhedaḥ kāraṇam eva vā attha jātanti kāriya ppabhedaḥ kāriyam eva
translated: In order to show the profundity of the Piṭakas by means of the aforementioned teaching, etc., he says, “Now, since in these Piṭakas.”

original: vā. Yā cāyaṃ desanāti sambandho. Yo cetthāti etāsu taṃtaṃpiṭakagatāsu dhammatthadesanāsu
analyzed: vā yā ca ayam desanā ati sambandhaḥ yaḥ ca itthā ati etāsu taṃ taṃpiṭaka gatāsu dhamma attha desanāsu
translated: The “kinds of dhammas” are the different kinds of causes, or they are the causes themselves. The “kinds of states” are the different kinds of effects, or they are the effects themselves. And this is the connection: “And this is the teaching.” “And this” refers to the teaching of the dhammas and the states found in the various Piṭakas.

original: yo paṭivedhoti attho. Dukkhogāhanti ettha avijjāsaṅkhārādīnaṃ dhammatthānaṃ duppaṭivijjhatāya🔽dukkhogāhatā. Tesaṃ paññāpanassa dukkarabhāvato desanāya paṭivedhanasaṅkhātassa paṭivedhassa
analyzed: yaḥ paṭivedhaḥ ti attho dukkha ugāhanti ettha avijjā saṅkhāra ādīnam dhammatthānam duppaṭivijjha tāya  dukkha ugāha tā tesam paññāpanassa dukkara bhāvataḥ desanāya paṭivedhana saṅkhātassa paṭivedhassa
translated: The meaning is: the penetration of it. “Hard to penetrate” : here, because of the difficulty of penetrating the meaning of the states beginning with ignorance and formations,

original: ca uppādanavisayīkaraṇānaṃ asakkuṇeyyatāya dukkhogāhatā veditabbā. Evampīti pisaddo
analyzed: ca uppādana visayīkaraṇānam a sakkuṇeyya tāya dukkha ugāha tā veditabbā evam pi iti pi saddaḥ
translated: they are hard to penetrate. Because of the difficulty of teaching the explanation of them, and because of the impossibility of making the penetration consisting in the arising of the penetration called teaching,🔽the object of the penetration should be understood as hard to penetrate. “In this way” : the word “also”

original: pubbe vuttappakārantaraṃ sampiṇḍeti. Etthāti etesu tīsu piṭakesu. Vuttatthāti vutto🔽saṃvaṇṇito attho assāti vuttatthā.
analyzed: pubbe vutta pakāra antaram sampiṇḍeti ettha ati etesu tīsu piṭakesu vutta atthā ati vuttaḥ  saṃvaṇṇitaḥ atthaḥ assa ti vutta tthā
translated: combines the other kinds of difficulty mentioned above. “Herein” : in these three Piṭakas. “The meaning stated” : the meaning that is stated,

original: Tīsu piṭakesūti ettha “ekekasmi”nti adhikārato pakaraṇato vā veditabbaṃ. Pariyattibhedoti
analyzed: tīsu piṭakesu iti ettha eka ekasmin ti adhikārataḥ pakaraṇataḥ vā veditabbam pariyatti bhedaḥ ti
translated: explained. “In the three Piṭakas” : here, “in each” should be understood by implication or by context. “The division of the study” :

original: pariyāpuṇanaṃ pariyatti. Pariyāpuṇanavācako hettha pariyattisaddo, na pāḷipariyāyo,
analyzed: pariyāpuṇanam pariyatti pariyāpuṇana vācakaḥ ha ittha pariyatti saddaḥ na pāḷi pariyāyaḥ
translated: the learning is the study. The word study here denotes learning, not the study of the texts.

original: tasmā evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo “tīsu piṭakesu ekekasmiṃ pariyāpuṇanappakāro daṭṭhabbo
analyzed: tasmai evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo tīsu piṭakesu ekekasmin pariyāpuṇana ppakāraḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: Therefore the meaning here should be regarded thus: “The way of learning in each of the three Piṭakas should be seen

original: ñātabbo”ti. Tatoyeva ca “pariyattiyo pariyāpuṇanappakārā”ti tīsupi gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ñātabbaḥ ti ca pariyattiyaḥ pariyāpuṇana pakārā ti tīsu pi gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam
translated: and it is said in the three Commentaries: “The learning is the way of learning.”

original: Atha vā tīhi pakārehi pariyāpuṇitabbā pāḷiyo eva pariyattīti vuccanti, tatoyeva ca
analyzed: atha vā tīhi pakārehi pariyāpuṇitabbā pāḷiyaḥ eva pariyattī iti vuccanti ca
translated: Or alternatively, the texts that have to be learned in three ways are called “the learning.”

original: “pariyattiyo pāḷikkamā”ti abhidhammaṭṭhakathāya likhite sīhaḷagaṇṭhipade vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pariyattiyaḥ pāḷikkamā ti abhidhamma ṭṭhakathāya likhite sīhaḷagaṇṭhi pade vuttam
translated: And it is said in the Sihala Commentary: “The learning is the text.”

original: Evampi hi alagaddūpamāpariyāpuṇanayogato alagaddūpamā pariyattīti pāḷipi sakkā vattuṃ,🔽evañca katvā “duggahitā upārambhādihetu pariyāpuṭā alagaddūpamā”ti parato niddesavacanampi
analyzed: evam pi hi a lagat dūpamā pariyāpuṇana yogataḥ a lagat dūpamā pariyatti iti sakkā vattum  evam ca katvā duggahitā upārambha ādi hetu pariyāpuṭā paratas niddesa vacanam pi
translated: For in this way the learning can be called “the learning” in the sense of the learning of the kind called “like the catching of a crocodile.”🔽And when it is so taken, the description in the Niddesa of the learning as “misapprehended, mislearned, like the catching of a crocodile”

original: upapannaṃ hoti. Tattha hi pāḷiyeva duggahitā pariyāpuṭāti vattuṃ vaṭṭati. Alagaddūpamāti🔽alagaddo alagaddaggahaṇaṃ upamā etissāti alagaddūpamā. Alagaddassa gahaṇañhettha
analyzed: upapannam hoti tattha hi pāḷiyā iva duggahitā pariyāpuṭā ati vattum vaṭṭati a lagat dūpamā ati  alagaddaḥ alagadda gahaṇam upamā etissa ati alagaddu upamā alagaddassa gahaṇam ha itthā
translated: is appropriate. For in that passage it is the text that can be called “misapprehended, mislearned.”🔽The simile of the crocodile is like the catching of a crocodile.🔽The catching of a crocodile is a simile for the catching of a crocodile. The catching of a crocodile is here called “the catching of a crocodile”

original: alagaddasaddena vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. “Āpūpiko”ti ettha apūpasaddena apūpakhādanaṃ
analyzed: alagadda saddena vuttanti daṭṭhabbam āpūpiko ti ettha apūpa saddena apūpa khādanam
translated: by the word “crocodile.” “The nibbling” : here the nibbling is called “the nibbling” by the word “nibblers.”

original: viya alagaddaggahaṇena gahitapariyatti upamīyati, na pana alagaddena. “Alagaddaggahaṇūpamā”ti
analyzed: upamīyati na pana alagaddena
translated: The learning is likened to the snake’s seizing with its fangs, not to the snake itself.

original: vā vattabbe majjhepadalopaṃ katvā “alagaddūpamā”ti vuttaṃ “oṭṭhamukho”tiādīsu viya.
analyzed: vā vattabbe majjhe pada lopam katvā alagat dūpamā iti vuttam oṭṭha mukhā uti ādīsu viya
translated: Or the expression “like the seizing of a snake” may be taken as a truncated compound like the words “ox-mouth” , etc.

original: Alagaddoti cettha āsīviso vuccati. Gadoti hi visassa nāmaṃ. Tañca tassa alaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ
analyzed: alagaddo ti ca ittha āsīvisaḥ vuccati gado ti hi visassa nāmam tat ca tassa alam paripuṇṇam
translated: Herein, “snake” is a poisonous serpent. For “poison” is called “gada” .🔽And that is complete, sufficient, for it,

original: atthi, tasmā alaṃ pariyatto paripuṇṇo gado assāti anunāsikalopaṃ dakārāgamañca katvā
analyzed: atthi tasmai alam pariyattaḥ paripuṇṇaḥ gadaḥ assa iti anunāsika lopam dakāra āgamam ca katvā
translated: thus it is called “alagaḍḍa” , by elision of the middle syllable and addition of the suffix -a.

original: “alagaddo”ti vuccati. Atha vā alaṃ jīvitaharaṇe samattho gado assāti alagaddo. Nissaraṇatthāti🔽vaṭṭadukkhato nissaraṇaṃ attho payojanaṃ etissāti nissaraṇatthā. Bhaṇḍāgārikapariyattīti
analyzed: alagaddo ti vuccati atha vā alam jīvita haraṇe samatthaḥ gadaḥ assa ati alagaddaḥ nissaraṇa atthā ati  vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ nissaraṇam attho payojanam etissa ati nissaraṇa atthā bhaṇḍāgārika pariyattī iti
translated: Or alternatively, it is a “snake” because it is “gada” , that is, able to take life, and “ala” , that is, sufficient.🔽“For the purpose of escape”: the purpose, the reason, for which it is taught is escape from the suffering of the round of rebirths.

original: ettha bhaṇḍāgāre niyutto bhaṇḍāgāriko, bhaṇḍāgāriko viya bhaṇḍāgāriko, dhammaratanānupālako.
analyzed: ettha bhaṇḍāgāre niyuttaḥ bhaṇḍāgārikaḥ bhaṇḍāgārikaḥ viya bhaṇḍāgārikaḥ dhamma ratana anupālako
translated: “The learning of the storekeeper”: the storekeeper is one appointed to a storehouse; he is “like the storekeeper” in that he is the guardian of the jewel of the Dhamma.

original: Aññaṃ atthaṃ anapekkhitvā bhaṇḍāgārikasseva sato pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti.
analyzed: aññam attham an apekkhitvā bhaṇḍāgārikassa iva sataḥ pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti
translated: The learning of one who is a storekeeper, not having regard for any other meaning, is learning of a storekeeper.

original: Duggahitāti duṭṭhu gahitā. Duggahitabhāvameva vibhāvento āha “upārambhādihetu pariyāpuṭā”ti,🔽upārambhā itivādappamokkhādihetu uggahitāti attho. Lābhasakkārādihetu pariyāpuṇanampi
analyzed: duggahitā ati duṭṭhu gahitā duggahita bhāvam eva vibhāventaḥ āha upārambha ādi hetu pariyāpuṭā ti  upārambhāḥ itivāda pamokkha ādi hetu uggahitā ati atthaḥ lābha sakkāra ādi hetu pariyāpuṇanam pi
translated: Mislearned: learned wrongly. Explaining the state of being mislearned, he said, “Mislearned because of the reason of misinterpretation, etc.,”🔽the meaning is that it is learned because of the reason of misinterpretation, of the escape from the assertion of views, etc. Learning for the sake of gain, honour, etc.,

original: ettheva saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Vuttañhetaṃ alagaddasuttaṭṭhakathāyaṃ –
analyzed: ettha iva saṅgahitanti daṭṭhabbam vuttam ha etam alagadda sutta ṭṭhakathāyam
translated: should be regarded as included here too. For this is said in the Commentary on the Alagaddūpama Sutta:

original: “Yo hi buddhavacanaṃ ‘evaṃ cīvarādīni vā labhissāmi, catuparisamajjhe vā maṃ jānissantī’ti🔽lābhasakkārādihetu pariyāpuṇāti, tassa sā pariyatti alagaddapariyatti nāma. Evaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ hi buddha vacanam evam cīvara ādīni vā labhissāmi catu parisamajjhe vā mama jānissanti iti  lābha sakkāra ādi hetu pariyāpuṇāti tassa sā pariyatti alagaddapariyatti nāma evam
translated: “One who learns the word of the Buddha for the sake of gain, honour, etc., thinking ‘Thus I shall get robes, etc., or people will know me as a man of distinction,’🔽his learning is called ‘learning of a crocodile.’ For it is better not to learn the word of the Buddha at all than to learn it

original: pariyāpuṇanato hi buddhavacanaṃ apariyāpuṇitvā niddokkamanaṃ varatara”nti.
analyzed: pariyāpuṇanataḥ hi buddha vacanam a pariyāpuṇitvā niddokkamanam varataranti
translated: in this way.”

original: Nanu ca alagaddaggahaṇūpamā pariyatti alagaddūpamāti vuccati, evañca sati suggahitāpi
analyzed: nanu ca alagat dagga haṇu upamā pariyatti alagat dūpamā ati vuccati evam ca sati suggahitā api
translated: But is not learning that is a simile for the seizing of a crocodile called “learning of a crocodile”? And if that is so, then how can it be said that learning that is well learned is learning of a crocodile?

original: pariyatti alagaddūpamāti vattuṃ vaṭṭati tatthāpi alagaddaggahaṇassa upamābhāvena
analyzed: vattum vaṭṭati tattha api upamā bhāvena
translated: It is proper to say that the learning is like the catching of the snake.🔽For the catching of the snake is mentioned in the text as a simile.

original: pāḷiyaṃ vuttattā. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: pāḷiyam vuttattā vuttam ha etam
translated: For this is said:

original: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso alagaddatthiko alagaddagavesī alagaddapariyesanaṃ
analyzed: seyyathāpi bhikkhave purisaḥ alagaddatthikaḥ alagadda gavesī alagadda pariyesanam
translated: “Bhikkhus, just as if a man needing a snake, seeking a snake, wandering in search of a snake,

original: caramāno, so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ, tamenaṃ ajapadena daṇḍena suniggahitaṃ🔽niggaṇheyya, ajapadena daṇḍena suniggahitaṃ niggahetvā gīvāya suggahitaṃ gaṇheyya.
analyzed: caramānaḥ saḥ passeyya mahantam alagaddam tam enam aja padena daṇḍena su niggahitam  niggaṇheyya aja padena daṇḍena su niggahitam niggahetvā gīvāya suggahitam gaṇheyya
translated: should see a large snake and catch it by the body with a firm grip,

original: Kiñcāpi so, bhikkhave, alagaddo tassa purisassa hatthaṃ vā bāhaṃ vā aññataraṃ vā
analyzed: kiñca api saḥ bhikkhave alagaddaḥ tassa purisassa hattham vā bāham vā aññataram vā
translated: so that the snake, twisting and turning, might reach up and strike his hands, arms, or any other part of his body,

original: aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ bhogehi paliveṭheyya, atha kho so neva tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigaccheyya
analyzed: aṅga paccaṅgam bhogehi paliveṭheyya atha kho saḥ na iva tatonidānam maraṇam vā nigaccheyya
translated: yet he would not on that account let go of the snake and would not suffer death or deadly pain.

original: maraṇattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ. Taṃ kissa hetu, suggahitattā, bhikkhave, alagaddassa, evameva
analyzed: maraṇa attam vā dukkham tam kissa hetu suggahita ttā bhikkhave alagaddassa evam eva
translated: And why is that? Because of the firm grip with which he caught the snake. So too, bhikkhus,

original: kho, bhikkhave, idhekacce kulaputtā dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti suttaṃ geyya”ntiādi.
analyzed: kho bhikkhave idha ekacce kula puttāḥ dhammam pariyāpuṇanti suttam geyya ntiādi
translated: here some clansmen learn the Dhamma … the discourses … the expositions … the verses … the inspired utterances … the analytical expositions … the testimonies … the ethical discourses … the birth stories … the marvels … the unclassifiable sayings” .

original: Tasmā idha duggahitā eva pariyatti alagaddūpamāti ayaṃ viseso kuto viññāyati, yena
analyzed: tasmai eva ayam viseso kutas viññāyati yena
translated: So how is it known that the distinction is only between the wrong and the right taking of the scriptures,

original: duggahitā upārambhādihetu pariyāpuṭā alagaddūpamāti vuccatīti? Saccametaṃ, idaṃ pana🔽pārisesañāyena vuttanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tathā hi nissaraṇatthabhaṇḍāgārikapariyattīnaṃ
analyzed: duggahitā upārambha ādi hetu pariyāpuṭā a lagat dūpamā ati vuccati iti saccam etam idam pana  pārisesa ñāyena vuttanti daṭṭhabbam tathā hi nissaraṇa attha bhaṇḍa āgārika pariyattīnam
translated: and that the wrong taking is called “like the catching of a snake” because it is a cause for censure, etc.?🔽It is true that this is so, but it should be regarded as said by way of a remainder;

original: visuṃ gahitattā pārisesato alagaddassa duggahaṇūpamā pariyatti alagaddūpamāti viññāyati.
analyzed: visum gahita ttā pārisesataḥ alagaddassa duggahaṇa upamā pariyatti alagaddūpamā ti viññāyati
translated: for it is known that the distinction is between the wrong taking of the scriptures and the catching of the snake because the scriptures intended for escape and the scriptures intended for a storehouse are separately mentioned,

original: Suggahaṇūpamā hi pariyatti nissaraṇatthā vā hoti bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti vā, tasmā
analyzed: su gahaṇa upamā hi pariyatti nissaraṇa atthā vā hoti bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti vā tasmā
translated: and the right taking of the scriptures is either intended for escape or intended for a storehouse.

original: suvuttametaṃ “duggahitā upārambhādihetu pariyāpuṭā alagaddūpamā”ti. Yaṃ sandhāyāti
analyzed: su vuttam etam yam sandhāya ati
translated: So it is well said that the wrong taking is “like the catching of a snake” because it is a cause for censure, etc.

original: yaṃ pariyattiduggahaṇaṃ sandhāya. Vuttanti alagaddasutte vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yam pariyatti duggahaṇam sandhāya vuttanti alagadda sutte vuttam
translated: “With reference to which it was said”: with reference to which wrong taking of the scriptures.🔽“Was said”: was stated in the Alagaddūpama Sutta.

original: Alagaddatthikoti āsīvisatthiko. Alagaddaṃ gavesati pariyesati sīlenāti alagaddagavesī.
analyzed: alagaddatthikaḥ ti āsīvisatthikaḥ alagaddam gavesati pariyesati sīlena ati alagadda gavesī
translated: “In search of a snake”: in search of a poisonous snake. “In search of a snake” is a compound consisting of alocana and a noun

original: Alagaddapariyesanaṃ caramānoti alagaddapariyesanatthaṃ caramāno. Bhogeti sarīre.
analyzed: alagadda pariyesanam caramāno ti alagadda pariyesana attham caramānaḥ bhogeti sarīre
translated: He was seeking a flaying knife: he was seeking a flaying knife for the purpose of flaying. In the body: in the physical frame.

original: Hatthe vā bāhāya vāti ettha maṇibandhako yāva agganakhā “hattho”ti veditabbo, saddhiṃ🔽aggabāhāya avasesā “bāhā”ti. Katthaci pana “kapparato paṭṭhāyapi yāva agganakhā hattho”ti🔽vuccati. Aññatarasmiṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgeti vuttalakkhaṇaṃ hatthañca bāhañca ṭhapetvā
analyzed: hatthe vā bāhāya vā ati ettha maṇibandhakaḥ yāva agga nakhā hatthaḥ ti veditabbo saddhim  agga bāhāya avasesā bāhā ati katthaci pana kapparato yāva agga nakhā hattho ti  vuccati aññatarasmim vā aṅga paccaṅge iti vutta lakkhaṇam hatthañca bāhañca ṭhapetvā
translated: In the hand or on the arm: here the hand should be understood as far as the finger-tips, and the arm as far as the shoulder-joint.🔽In some places it is said that the hand is from the wrist to the finger-tips.🔽In the rest of the physical frame apart from the hand and the arm, which has the characteristics stated in the passage beginning, “Any other limb or part of a limb” , the “limb or part of a limb” should be understood.

original: avasesaṃ sarīraṃ “aṅgapaccaṅga”nti veditabbaṃ. Tatonidānanti taṃnidānaṃ, taṃkāraṇāti
analyzed: avasesam sarīram aṅga paccaṅgam ti veditabbam tatonidānam ti tad nidānam tad kāraṇā ati
translated: From that cause: from that cause, from that reason, is what is meant.

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Purimapade hi vibhattialopaṃ katvā niddeso. Taṃ hatthādīsu ḍaṃsanaṃ🔽nidānaṃ kāraṇaṃ etassāti taṃnidānanti hi vattabbe “tatonidāna”nti purimapade paccatte
analyzed: vuttam hoti purima pade hi vibhatti a lopam katvā niddesaḥ tam hattha ādīsu ḍaṃsanam  nidānam kāraṇam etassa ati tat nidānam ti hi vattabbe tatonidānam ti purima pade paccatte
translated: For in the first part of the sentence the demonstrative pronoun is used with elision of the case-ending.🔽That flaying of the hand, etc., is the cause, the reason, for this, thus it should be said that it is “from that cause.” But in the first part of the sentence the demonstrative pronoun is used with the accusative case-ending,🔽and the elision is not made.
