original: nissakkavacanaṃ katvā tassa ca lopaṃ akatvā niddeso. Taṃ kissa hetūti yaṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: nissakka vacanam katvā tassa ca lopam a katvā niddeso tam kissa hetu iti yam vuttam
translated: Why is that?

original: hatthādīsu ḍaṃsanaṃ taṃnidānañca maraṇādiupagamanaṃ, taṃ kissa hetu kena kāraṇenāti
analyzed: hattha ādīsu ḍaṃsanam tad nidānam ca maraṇa ādi upagamanam tam kissa hetu kena kāraṇena ati
translated: and the dying, etc., that result from that. Why is that? For what reason?🔽Here in this Dispensation some worthless men,

original: ce. Idhāti imasmiṃ sāsane. Ekacce moghapurisāti ekacce tucchapurisā. Dhammanti pāḷidhammaṃ.
analyzed: ce idha ati imasmin sāsane ekacce mogha purisā ati ekacce tuccha purisā dhammanti pāḷi dhammam
translated: some empty men, learn the texts of the Dhamma,🔽but they do not examine the meaning,

original: Pariyāpuṇantīti uggaṇhantīti attho, sajjhāyanti ceva vācuggatā karontā dhārenti cāti
analyzed: pariyāpuṇanti iti uggaṇhanti iti attho sajjhāyanti ca iva karontā dhārenti ca ati
translated: they do not investigate the meaning.

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Atthanti yathābhūtaṃ bhāsitatthaṃ payojanatthañca. Na upaparikkhantīti
analyzed: vuttam hoti attham ti yathābhūtam bhāsita ttham payojana ttham ca na upaparikkhanti iti
translated: They do not understand the meaning of what is said, the purpose of what is said.

original: na pariggaṇhanti na vicārenti. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – “imasmiṃ ṭhāne sīlaṃ kathitaṃ,
analyzed: na pariggaṇhanti na vicārenti idam vuttam hoti imasmin ṭhāne sīlam kathitam
translated: They do not grasp it, they do not consider it. This is what is said: “Here virtue is taught,

original: idha samādhi, idha paññā kathitā, mayañca taṃ pūressāmā”ti evaṃ bhāsitatthaṃ payojanatthañca
analyzed: idha samādhi idha paññā kathitā mayam ca tam pūressāma ati evam bhāsita attham payojana attham ca
translated: here concentration is taught, here wisdom is taught, and we will fulfil it.” They do not grasp the meaning of what is said, the purpose of what is said,

original: “sīlaṃ samādhissa kāraṇaṃ, samādhi vipassanāyā”tiādinā na pariggaṇhantīti. Anupaparikkhatanti
analyzed: sīlam samādhissa kāraṇam samādhi vipassanāya ati ādinā na pariggaṇhanti iti
translated: “Virtue is the cause of concentration, concentration is the cause of insight,” and so on. Not investigating,🔽not investigating, they do not understand the meaning,

original: anupaparikkhantānaṃ. Na nijjhānaṃ khamantīti nijjhānapaññaṃ nakkhamanti, nijjhāyitvā
analyzed: an upaparikkhantānam na nijjhānam khamanti iti nijjhāna paññam na khamanti nijjhāyitvā
translated: they do not understand the meaning by investigating.

original: paññāya disvā rocetvā gahetabbā na hontīti adhippāyo. Tena imamatthaṃ dīpeti “tesaṃ
analyzed: paññāya disvā rocetvā gahetabbāḥ na honti iti adhippāyaḥ tena imam attham dīpeti tesam
translated: The intention is that they are not to be grasped by being pointed out after being seen with understanding.🔽He illustrates the matter thus:

original: paññāya atthaṃ anupaparikkhantānaṃ te dhammā na upaṭṭhahanti, ‘imasmiṃ ṭhāne sīlaṃ,
analyzed: paññāya attham an upaparikkhantānam te dhammāḥ na upaṭṭhahanti imasmin ṭhāne sīlam
translated: “When they have not investigated the meaning with understanding, those ideas do not appear to them in such a way that they can know thus: ‘In this place virtue was taught,

original: samādhi, vipassanā, maggo, phalaṃ, vaṭṭaṃ, vivaṭṭaṃ kathita’nti evaṃ jānituṃ na sakkā hontī”ti.
analyzed: samādhi vipassanā maggo phalam vaṭṭam vivaṭṭam kathitanti evam jānitum na sakkā honti iti
translated: concentration was taught, understanding was taught, the path was taught, fruition was taught, becoming was taught, cessation of becoming was taught.’🔽And they learn them only for the purpose of criticizing others and for the purpose of boasting and showing off and despising others” .

original: Te upārambhānisaṃsā cevāti te paresaṃ vāde dosāropanānisaṃsā hutvā pariyāpuṇantīti
analyzed: te upārambhā nisaṃsā ca iva ati te paresam vāde dosa āropanā nisaṃsāḥ hutvā pariyāpuṇanti iti
translated: And they learn them only for the purpose of criticizing others and for the purpose of boasting and showing off and despising others” .🔽The meaning is that they learn them as having the purpose of criticizing others’ doctrines.

original: attho. Itivādappamokkhānisaṃsā cāti iti evaṃ etāya pariyattiyā vādappamokkhānisaṃsā,
analyzed: atthaḥ itivāda pamokkha anisaṃsā ca ati iti evam etāya pariyattiyā vāda ppamokkha anisaṃsā
translated: And they learn them only for the purpose of escape from argument thus:🔽“We shall escape from the argument that others will advance against us” .

original: attano upari parehi āropitavādassa niggahassa pamokkhappayojanā hutvā dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇantīti🔽attho. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – parehi sakavāde dose āropite taṃ dosaṃ evañca evañca mocessāmāti
analyzed: attanaḥ upari parehi āropita vādassa niggahassa pamokkha ppayojanāḥ hutvā dhammam pariyāpuṇanti iti  attho idam vuttam hoti parehi saka vāde dose āropite tam dosam evañca evañca mocessāma ati
translated: The meaning is that they learn the True Idea with the purpose of escaping from the check that others will make on them by advancing an argument against them.🔽This is what is said: they learn it for this reason, namely, that they think “ In this way and that we shall escape from the faults that others will advance against our own doctrine” .

original: iminā ca kāraṇena pariyāpuṇantīti. Atha vā so so vādo itivādo, itivādassa pamokkho
analyzed: iminā ca kāraṇena pariyāpuṇanti iti atha vā saḥ saḥ vādaḥ itivādaḥ itivādassa pamokkho
translated: Or alternatively, each argument is an “ argument thus” , and the escape from the argument thus is the escape from the argument thus .

original: itivādappamokkho, itivādappamokkho ānisaṃso etesanti itivādappamokkhānisaṃsā, taṃtaṃvādappamocanānisaṃsā
analyzed: itivāda pamokkho itivāda pamokkhaḥ ānisaṃsaḥ etesan ti itivāda ppamokkha anisaṃsā taṃ taṃ vāda pamocana anisaṃsā
translated: The benefit of the escape from argument is the benefit of the escape from argument. The meaning is that it is the benefit of the escape from the various arguments.

original: cāti attho. Yassa catthāya dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇantīti yassa ca sīlādipūraṇassa maggaphalanibbānassa🔽vā atthāya imasmiṃ sāsane kulaputtā dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti. Tañcassa atthaṃ nānubhontīti
analyzed: ca ati atthaḥ yassa ca atthāya dhammam pariyāpuṇanti iti yassa ca sīla ādi pūraṇassa magga phala nibbānassa  vā atthāya imasmim sāsane kula puttāḥ dhammam pariyāpuṇanti tat ca assa attham na anubhonti iti
translated: “For the sake of which they learn the Dhamma”: for the sake of the fulfilment of virtue, etc., and of the paths, fruits, and Nibbāna.

original: tañca assa dhammassa sīlādiparipūraṇasaṅkhātaṃ atthaṃ ete duggahitagāhino nānubhonti na vindanti.🔽Atha vā yassa upārambhassa itivādappamokkhassa vā atthāya ye moghapurisā dhammaṃ
analyzed: tat ca assa dhammassa sīla ādi paripūraṇa saṅkhātam attham ete duggahita gāhinaḥ na anubhonti na vindanti  atha vā yassa upārambhassa itivāda ppamokkhassa vā atthāya ye mogha purisāḥ dhammaṃ
translated: “And do not experience that benefit”: they do not experience that benefit called the fulfilment of virtue, etc.

original: pariyāpuṇanti, te parehi “ayamattho na hotī”ti vutte duggahitattāyeva soyevatthoti
analyzed: pariyāpuṇanti te parehi ayam attho na hoti iti vutte duggahita ttāya iva
translated: Or alternatively, for the sake of the argument or the escape from argument, those foolish people learn the Dhamma. When others say to them, “This is not the meaning,” they are unable to prove that it is the meaning because they have misunderstood it.

original: paṭipādanakkhamā na hontīti parassa vāde upārambhaṃ āropetuṃ attano vādā taṃ mocetuñca
analyzed: paṭipādana khamāḥ na honti iti parassa vāde upārambham āropetum attanaḥ vādā tam mocetum ca
translated: Or alternatively, when others impute an argument to them or when they themselves wish to escape from an argument, they are unable to do so because of their misunderstanding.

original: asakkontāpi taṃ atthaṃ nānubhontiyevāti evamattho daṭṭhabbo. Dīgharattaṃ ahitāya🔽dukkhāya saṃvattantīti tesaṃ te dhammā duggahitattā upārambhamānadappamakkhapalāsādihetubhāvena🔽dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanti. Ettha hi kāraṇe phalavohārena “te dhammā
analyzed: a sakkontā api tam attham na anubhontiyā iva ati evamatthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ dīgharattam ahitāya  dukkhāya saṃvattanti iti tesam te dhammā duggahita ttā upārambha māna dappa makkha palāsa ādi hetu bhāvena  dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanti ettha hi kāraṇe phala vohārena te dhammā
translated: and even those who are unable to do so still do not experience that meaning.🔽They lead to harm and suffering for a long time.🔽Because of their wrong grasp of those ideas, they lead to harm and suffering for a long time by being a cause for the arising of such unprofitable things as resentment, contempt, and obstinacy.

original: ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattantī”ti vuttaṃ. Tathā hi kiñcāpi na te dhammā ahitāya dukkhāya🔽saṃvattanti, tathāpi vuttanayena pariyāpuṇantānaṃ sajjhāyakāle vivādasamaye ca taṃmūlakānaṃ
analyzed: ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanti iti vuttam tathā hi kiñcā api na te dhammāḥ ahitāya dukkhāya  saṃvattanti tathā api vutta nayena pariyāpuṇantānam sajjhāya kāle vivāda samaye ca taṃmūlakānam
translated: Herein, the words “they lead to harm and suffering” are a description of a cause in terms of an effect.

original: upārambhādīnaṃ anekesaṃ akusalānaṃ uppattisabbhāvato “te dhammā ahitāya dukkhāya🔽saṃvattantī”ti kāraṇe phalavohārena vuttaṃ. Taṃ kissa hetūti ettha tanti yathāvuttassatthassa
analyzed: upārambha ādīnam anekesam akusalānam uppatti sabbhāvataḥ te dhammāḥ ahitāya dukkhāya  saṃvattanti iti kāraṇe phala vohārena vuttam tam kissa hetu uti ettha tam ti yathā vuttassa atthassa
translated: For although those ideas do not lead to harm and suffering, still they do so for those who learn them in the way described above, since they are a cause for the arising of the many unprofitable things beginning with resentment that have them as their root at the time of the discussion and at the time of the dispute.🔽That is why it is said in terms of the cause with a description of the effect.

original: anabhisambhuṇanaṃ tesañca dhammānaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanaṃ parāmasati.
analyzed: an abhisambhuṇanam tesaṃ ca dhammānaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya saṃvattanam parāmasati
translated: Why is that? Herein, the word “why” refers back to the meaning stated thus “They lead to harm and suffering for a long time” and to the ideas that lead to harm and suffering.

original: Sīlakkhandhādipāripūriṃyevāti ettha ādisaddena samādhivipassanādīnaṃ saṅgaho veditabbo.
analyzed: sīlakkhandha ādi pāripūriṃya eva āti ettha ādi saddena samādhi vipassanā ādīnam saṅgahaḥ veditabbo
translated: “To the fulfilment of the aggregate of virtue, etc.”: the word “etc.” should be understood to include concentration, insight, and so on.

original: Yo hi buddhavacanaṃ uggaṇhitvā sīlassa āgataṭṭhāne sīlaṃ pūretvā samādhino āgataṭṭhāne🔽samādhigabbhaṃ gaṇhāpetvā vipassanāya āgataṭṭhāne vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā maggaphalānaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ hi buddha vacanam uggaṇhitvā sīlassa āgata ṭṭhāne sīlam pūretvā samādhinaḥ āgata ṭṭhāne  samādhi gabbham gaṇhāpetvā vipassanāya āgata ṭṭhāne vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā magga phalānaṃ
translated: One who learns the Buddha’s word thinking, “I will fulfil virtue in the place where virtue is to be fulfilled,🔽I will take up concentration in the place where concentration is to be taken up,

original: āgataṭṭhāne maggaṃ bhāvessāmi, phalaṃ sacchikarissāmīti uggaṇhāti, tasseva sā pariyatti
analyzed: āgata ṭṭhāne maggam bhāvessāmi phalam sacchikarissāmi iti uggaṇhāti tassa iva sā pariyatti
translated: I will develop insight in the place where insight is to be developed, I will develop the path in the place where the path is to be developed, and I will realize the fruits in the place where the fruits are to be realized,”🔽his learning is called “the going forth to the scriptures.”

original: nissaraṇatthā nāma hoti. Yaṃ sandhāya vuttanti yaṃ pariyattisuggahaṇaṃ sandhāya alagaddasutte
analyzed: nissaraṇa atthā nāma hoti yam sandhāya vuttam ti yam pariyatti su gahaṇam sandhāya alagadda sutte
translated: “With reference to which it is said”: with reference to the proper learning of the scriptures.

original: vuttaṃ. Dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya saṃvattantīti sīlādīnaṃ āgataṭṭhāne sīlādīni pūrentānampi
analyzed: vuttam dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya saṃvattanti iti sīla ādīnam āgata ṭṭhāne sīla ādīni
translated: “For a long time for the welfare and happiness of the multitude” : for those who fulfil virtue, etc., in the places where virtue, etc., are to be fulfilled,

original: arahattaṃ patvā parisamajjhe dhammaṃ desetvā dhammadesanāya pasannehi upanīte cattāro
analyzed: arahattam patvā parisamajjhe dhammaṃ desetvā dhamma desanāya pasannehi upanīte cattāro
translated: after attaining arahatship, teach the Dhamma in the midst of the Saṅgha, and, when the listeners are gladdened by the Dhamma teaching, offer them the four requisites,

original: paccaye paribhuñjantānampi paresaṃ vāde sahadhammena upārambhaṃ āropentānampi sakavādato🔽dosaṃ harantānampi dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya saṃvattanti. Tathā hi na kevalaṃ suggahitapariyattiṃ
analyzed: paccaye paribhuñjantānam pi paresam vāde sahadhammena upārambham āropentānam pi saka vādato  dosam harantānam pi dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya saṃvattanti tathā hi na kevalam sugga hita pariyattim
translated: They lead to welfare and happiness for a long time even for those who use requisites and for those who refute the doctrines of others with reason and for those who remove faults from their own doctrines.🔽For it is not only the development of the path and the realization of the fruits that are successful by depending on the well-grasped scriptures,

original: nissāya maggabhāvanāphalasacchikiriyādīneva, paravādaniggahasakavādapatiṭṭhāpanānipi
analyzed: nissāya magga bhāvanā phala sacchikiriyā ādīn eva paravāda niggaha sakavāda patiṭṭhāpanāni pi
translated: but also the refutation of the doctrines of others and the establishment of one’s own doctrines.

original: ijjhanti. Tathā ca vuttaṃ “uppannaṃ parappavādaṃ sahadhammena suniggahitaṃ niggahetvā”tiādi.
analyzed: ijjhanti tathā ca vuttam uppannam para pavādam sahadhammena su niggahitam niggahetvā atiādi
translated: And it is said accordingly: “Having refuted with reasons any doctrine of others that may have arisen” , etc.🔽“With aggregates fully known”: with aggregates fully known through the full-understanding of suffering.

original: Pariññātakkhandhoti dukkhaparijānanena pariññātakkhandho. Pahīnakilesoti samudayappahānena🔽pahīnakileso. Paṭividdhākuppoti paṭividdhaarahattaphalo. Na kuppatīti akuppanti hi
analyzed: pariññāta khandhoti dukkha parijānanena pariññāta kkhandho pahīna kileso ti samudaya ppahānena  pahīna kileso paṭividdha akuppo ti paṭividdha arahatta phalaḥ na kuppati iti akuppanti hi
translated: “With defilements abandoned”: with defilements abandoned through the abandoning of the origin.🔽“With cankers destroyed”: with cankers destroyed through the realization of the fruit of arahantship.🔽“Does not tremble”: the fruit of arahantship is called “non-trembling” .

original: arahattaphalassetaṃ nāmaṃ. Satipi hi catunnaṃ maggānaṃ catunnañca phalānaṃ akuppasabhāve
analyzed: arahatta phalassa itam nāmam sati api hi catunnam maggānam catunnam ca phalānam a kuppa sabhāve
translated: Although the four paths and the four fruits have the nature of non-trembling,

original: sattannaṃ sekkhānaṃ sakasakanāmapariccāgena uparūpari nāmantarappattito tesaṃ maggaphalāni
analyzed: sattannam sekkhānam saka saka nāma pariccāgena upari upari nāma ntara ppattitaḥ tesam magga phalāni
translated: The paths and fruits of the seven trainees are called “the fruits of once-returner, etc.” because they are attained by the relinquishing of the respective names of the seven trainees and by the acquisition of the higher names.

original: “akuppānī”ti na vuccanti, arahā pana sabbadāpi arahāyeva nāmāti tasseva phalaṃ “akuppa”nti
analyzed: akuppāni iti na vuccanti arahā pana sabbadā api arahāya iva nāma ati tassa iva phalam akuppanti
translated: The paths and fruits of the seven kinds of trainers are not called “unshakable” because they are still subject to regression and because they have not yet relinquished their personal names. But the fruit of the non-returner is called “unshakable” because it is unshakable and because it is the fruit of one who has relinquished his personal name. The fruit of the arahant is called “unshakable” because it is unshakable and because he is always an arahant.

original: vuttaṃ. Iminā ca imamatthaṃ dasseti “khīṇāsavasseva pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti🔽nāmā”ti. Tassa hi apariññātaṃ appahīnaṃ abhāvitaṃ asacchikataṃ vā natthi, tasmā buddhavacanaṃ
analyzed: vuttam iminā ca imam attham dasseti khīṇāsavassa iva pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti  nāma ati tassa hi a pariññātam appahīnam abhāvitam asacchikatam vā natthi tasmā buddha vacanam
translated: By this he shows the meaning of the following statement: “The learning of those whose cankers are destroyed is the learning of the storekeeper, the learning of the guardian of the threshing-floor.”

original: pariyāpuṇanto tantidhārako paveṇīpālako vaṃsānurakkhako ca hutvā uggaṇhāti. Tenevāha
analyzed: pariyāpuṇantaḥ tanti dhārako paveṇī pālako vaṃsa anurakkhako ca hutvā uggaṇhāti tena iva āha
translated: For they have nothing that is un-known, un-abandoned, un-developed, or un-realized. Therefore, when they learn the Buddha’s word, they learn it as the storekeeper, the guardian of the threshing-floor, and the protector of the lineage.🔽Hence it is said: “For the purpose of guarding the lineage.”

original: “paveṇīpālanatthāyā”tiādi. Tattha paveṇīti dhammasantati, dhammassa avicchedena pavattīti
analyzed: paveṇī pālana tthāya atiādi tattha paveṇī iti dhamma santati dhammassa avicchedena pavatti iti
translated: Herein, lineage is the continuity of the Dhamma, the meaning being the occurrence of the Dhamma without interruption.

original: attho. Vaṃsānurakkhaṇatthāyāti buddhassa bhagavato vaṃsānurakkhaṇatthaṃ. Tassa vaṃsopi🔽atthato paveṇīyevāti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: atthaḥ vaṃsa anurakkhaṇa tthāya ati buddhassa bhagavataḥ vaṃsa anurakkhaṇa ttham tassa vaṃsaḥ api 🔽atthataḥ paveṇīyā iva ati veditabbam
translated: For the purpose of protecting the lineage of the Blessed One: the lineage of the Blessed One should be understood as the same in meaning as the lineage of the Dhamma.

original: Nanu ca yadi paveṇīpālanatthāya buddhavacanassa pariyāpuṇanaṃ bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti,
analyzed: nanu ca yadi paveṇī pālana tthāya buddha vacanassa pariyāpuṇanam bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti
translated: But if the learning of the Buddha’s word is the storeman’s learning if it is for the purpose of preserving the tradition,

original: kasmā “khīṇāsavo”ti visesetvā vuttaṃ. Ekaccassa puthujjanassapi hi ayaṃ nayo labbhati.
analyzed: kasmā khīṇa āsavaḥ ti visesetvā vuttam ekaccassa puthujjanassa api hi ayam nayaḥ labbhati
translated: why is it said with the distinction “of one whose cankers are destroyed”? For this method is found in some ordinary men too.

original: Tathā hi ekacco bhikkhu chātakabhayādīsu ganthadharesu ekasmiṃ ṭhāne vasituṃ asakkontesu
analyzed: tathā hi ekaccaḥ bhikkhu chātakabhaya ādīsu ganthadharesu ekasmin ṭhāne vasitum a sakkontesu
translated: For example, there were some who were bearers of the texts such as Cūḷapanthaka who were unable to live in one place because of fear of slander, etc.,

original: sayaṃ bhikkhācārena akilamamāno atimadhuraṃ buddhavacanaṃ mā nassatu, tantiṃ dhāressāmi,
analyzed: sayam bhikkhā ācārena a kilamamānaḥ ati madhuram buddha vacanam mā nassatu tantim dhāressāmi
translated: and who, without being troubled by going for alms, learned the Buddha’s word, which is very sweet, thinking, “Let it not be lost; I shall bear it in mind;

original: vaṃsaṃ ṭhapessāmi, paveṇiṃ pālessāmīti pariyāpuṇāti, tasmā tassapi pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti🔽nāma kasmā na hotīti? Vuccate – evaṃ santepi puthujjanassa pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārikapariyatti
analyzed: vaṃsam ṭhapessāmi paveṇim pālessāmi iti pariyāpuṇāti tasmai tassa api pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti  nāma kasmā na hoti iti vuccate evam sante pi puthujjanassa pariyatti bhaṇḍāgārika pariyatti
translated: I shall establish the tradition; I shall preserve the tradition.” So why should not their learning be called the storeman’s learning?🔽It is said: nevertheless the ordinary man’s learning is not called the storeman’s learning.

original: nāma na hoti. Kiñcāpi hi puthujjano “paveṇiṃ pālessāmī”ti ajjhāsayena pariyāpuṇāti,
analyzed: nāma na hoti kiñcā api hi puthujjanaḥ paveṇim pālessāmi iti ajjhāsayena pariyāpuṇāti
translated: For although the ordinary man learns with the intention “I shall preserve the tradition,”

original: attano pana bhavakantārato anittiṇṇattā tassa pariyatti nissaraṇapariyatti nāma hoti,
analyzed: attanaḥ pana bhava kantārataḥ anittiṇṇa ttā tassa pariyatti nissaraṇapariyatti nāma hoti
translated: But since he himself has not crossed the desert of existence, his learning is called learning that is an escape from the desert of existence.🔽So the learning of the worldling is like the snake, or it is for the purpose of escape,

original: tasmā puthujjanassa pariyatti alagaddūpamā vā hoti nissaraṇatthā vā, sattannaṃ sekkhānaṃ🔽nissaraṇatthāva, khīṇāsavānaṃ bhaṇḍāgārikapariyattiyevāti veditabbaṃ. Khīṇāsavo ca
analyzed: tasmā puthujjanassa pariyatti a lagat dūpamā vā hoti nissaraṇa tthā vā sattannam sekkhānam  nissaraṇa tthā ava khīṇa āsavānam bhaṇḍāgārika pariyattiyā iva ati veditabbam khīṇa āsavaḥ ca
translated: while that of the seven kinds of noble persons is for the purpose of escape.🔽And that of those whose cankers are destroyed is the learning of the storekeeper.

original: bhaṇḍāgārikasadisattā bhaṇḍāgārikoti vuccati. Yathā hi bhaṇḍāgāriko alaṅkārabhaṇḍaṃ
analyzed: bhaṇḍa āgārika sadisa ttā bhaṇḍa āgārikaḥ iti vuccati yathā hi bhaṇḍa āgārikaḥ alaṅkāra bhaṇḍam
translated: And the one whose cankers are destroyed is called a storekeeper because he is like a storekeeper.

original: paṭisāmetvā pasādhanakāle tadupiyaṃ alaṅkārabhaṇḍaṃ rañño upanāmetvā alaṅkaroti,
analyzed: paṭisāmetvā pasādhana kāle tad upiyam alaṅkāra bhaṇḍam raññaḥ upanāmetvā alaṅkaroti
translated: For just as the storekeeper stores away the ornaments and then at the time of dressing brings out the appropriate ornaments and presents them to the king to dress him,

original: evaṃ khīṇāsavopi dhammaratanabhaṇḍaṃ sampaṭicchitvā mokkhādhigamassa bhabbarūpe sahetuke
analyzed: evam khīṇāsavaḥ api dhamma ratana bhaṇḍam sampaṭicchitvā mokkha adhigamassa bhabba rūpe sa hetuke
translated: so too the one whose cankers are destroyed, having accepted the jewel of the Dhamma, sees that some being is capable of attaining deliverance and has the requisite causes,

original: satte passitvā tadanurūpaṃ dhammadesanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā maggaṅgabojjhaṅgādisaṅkhātena
analyzed: satte passitvā tad anurūpam dhamma desanam vaḍḍhetvā maggaṅga bojjhaṅga ādi saṅkhātena
translated: and he increases his teaching of the Dhamma in accordance with that being’s temperament and adorns him with the supramundane ornament consisting of the path factors, enlightenment factors, and so on.

original: lokuttarena alaṅkārena alaṅkarotīti bhaṇḍāgārikoti vuccati.
analyzed: lokuttarena alaṅkārena alaṅkaroti iti vuccati
translated: That is why he is called a storekeeper.

original: Evaṃ tisso pariyattiyo vibhajitvā idāni tīsupi piṭakesu yathārahaṃ sampattivipattiyo
analyzed: evam tissaḥ pariyattiyaḥ vibhajitvā idāni tīsu pi piṭakesu yathāraham sampatti vipattiyaḥ
translated: Having thus analyzed the three kinds of tradition, he now proceeds to show the success and failure in each of the three Piṭakas,

original: vitthāretvā dassento āha “vinaye panā”tiādi. Sīlasampattiṃ nissāya tisso vijjā pāpuṇātītiādīsu🔽yasmā sīlaṃ visujjhamānaṃ satisampajaññabalena kammassakataññāṇabalena ca saṃkilesamalato
analyzed: vitthāretvā dassentaḥ āha vinaye pana atiādi sīla sampattim nissāya tissaḥ vijjā pāpuṇāti itiādīsu  yasmā sīlam visujjhamānam sati sampajañña balena kammassakata ññāṇa balena ca saṃkilesa malataḥ
translated: beginning with the words “But in the Vinaya” . In the passage beginning “By depending on the success of virtue, one attains the three kinds of clear knowledge” ,🔽virtue, when being purified, is purified from the stain of defilement and reaches fulfilment by means of the power of mindfulness and the power of the knowledge of the ownership of kamma .

original: visujjhati, pāripūriñca gacchati, tasmā sīlasampadā sijjhamānā upanissayasampattibhāvena
analyzed: visujjhati pāripūriñca gacchati tasmā sīla sampadā sijjhamānā upanissaya sampatti bhāvena
translated: Therefore, when the success of virtue is being accomplished, it establishes the power of mindfulness and the power of knowledge as the success of the support.

original: satibalaṃ ñāṇabalañca paccupaṭṭhapetīti tassā vijjattayūpanissayatā veditabbā sabhāgahetusampadānato.🔽Satibalena hi pubbenivāsavijjāsiddhi, sampajaññena sabbakiccesu sudiṭṭhakāritāparicayena
analyzed: sati balam ñāṇa balañca paccupaṭṭhapeti iti tassāḥ vijjatta yūpa nissaya tā veditabbā sa bhāga hetu sampadānato  sati balena hi pubbenivāsa vijjā siddhi sampajaññena sabba kiccesu su diṭṭha kāri tā paricayena
translated: Thus its dependence on the three kinds of clear knowledge should be understood as the success of the homogeneous cause.🔽For by the power of mindfulness the clear knowledge of recollection of past lives is accomplished, and by the power of full awareness the clear knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings is accomplished, because of the practice of seeing well all activities.

original: cutūpapātañāṇānubaddhāya dutiyavijjāya siddhi, vītikkamābhāvena saṃkilesappahānasabbhāvato
analyzed: cutūpapāta ñāṇa anubaddhāya dutiya vijjāya siddhi vītikkama abhāvena saṃkilesa pahāna sabbhāvato
translated: And because of the absence of transgression, the clear knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is accomplished, since it is similar to the abandoning of defilements.

original: vivaṭṭūpanissayatāvasena ajjhāsayasuddhiyā tatiyavijjāsiddhi. Puretarasiddhānaṃ samādhipaññānaṃ
analyzed: vivaṭṭu upanissaya tā vasena ajjhāsaya suddhiyā puretara siddhānam samādhi paññānam
translated: The third knowledge is successful by the purification of his heart by way of the condition of the opening of the door of the Dhamma.

original: pāripūriṃ vinā sīlassa āsavakkhayañāṇūpanissayatā sukkhavipassakakhīṇāsavehi dīpetabbā.
analyzed: pāripūrim vinā sīlassa āsava kkhaya ñāṇa upanissaya tā sukkha vipassaka khīṇa āsavehi dīpetabbā
translated: The condition of the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers by way of the condition of the three knowledges should be shown by the dry insight meditator who has destroyed the cankers without perfecting the concentration and wisdom that have already been accomplished.

original: “Samāhito yathābhūtaṃ pajānātī”ti vacanato samādhisampadā chaḷabhiññatāya upanissayo.🔽“Yogā ve jāyati bhūrī”ti vacanato pubbayogena garuvāsadesabhāsākosallauggahaṇaparipucchādīhi
analyzed: samāhitaḥ yathābhūtam pajānāti iti vacanataḥ samādhi sampadā chaḷabhiñña tāya upanissayo  yogā ve jāyati bhūri iti vacanato pubba yogena garu vāsa desa bhāsā kosalla oggahaṇa paripuccha ādīhi
translated: The perfection of concentration is the condition for the six kinds of direct knowledge by the statement: “He who is concentrated knows and sees correctly.”🔽The perfection of wisdom, which is developed by previous effort, by the practice of the duties of respect, by the skill in the arts of speech, by the taking of the burden, by the asking of questions, etc., is the condition for the analytical knowledges.

original: ca paribhāvitā paññāsampatti paṭisambhidāppabhedassa upanissayo. Ettha ca “sīlasampattiṃ🔽nissāyā”ti vuttattā yassa samādhivijambhanabhūtā anavasesā cha abhiññā na ijjhanti,
analyzed: ca paribhāvitā paññā sampatti paṭisambhidā appabhedassa upanissayaḥ ettha ca sīla sampattim  nissāya ati vutta ttā yassa samādhi vijambhana bhūtā anavasesā cha abhiññāḥ na ijjhanti
translated: And here, since it is said: “depending on the perfection of virtue,”🔽there is no perfection of concentration in the sense of the highest limit for one in whom the six direct knowledges, which are the opening of the door of concentration, are not successful.

original: tassa ukkaṭṭhaparicchedavasena na samādhisampadā atthīti satipi vijjānaṃ abhiññekadesabhāve
analyzed: tassa ukkaṭṭha pariccheda vasena na samādhi sampadā atthi iti sati pi vijjānam abhiññā eka desa bhāve
translated: Even though the three knowledges are a part of the direct knowledges,

original: sīlasampattisamudāgatā eva tisso vijjā gahitā. Yathā hi paññāsampattisamudāgatā catasso
analyzed: sīla sampatti samudāgatāḥ eva tissaḥ vijjāḥ gahitāḥ yathā hi paññā sampatti samudāgatā catasso
translated: The three knowledges are included in the perfection of virtue.

original: paṭisambhidā upanissayasampannassa maggeneva ijjhanti maggakkhaṇe eva tāsaṃ paṭilabhitabbato.
analyzed: paṭisambhidāḥ upanissaya sampannassa maggena iva ijjhanti magga kkhaṇe eva tāsam paṭilabhitabbato
translated: Just as the four discriminations, which are included in the perfection of wisdom, are successful only through the path, because they must be obtained only at the moment of the path,

original: Evaṃ sīlasampattisamudāgatā tisso vijjā samādhisampattisamudāgatā ca cha abhiññā
analyzed: evam sīla sampatti samudāgatā tissaḥ vijjā samādhi sampatti samudāgatā ca cha abhiññā
translated: so the three knowledges, which are included in the perfection of concentration, and the six kinds of direct knowledge,

original: upanissayasampannassa maggeneva ijjhantīti maggādhigameneva tāsaṃ adhigamo veditabbo.🔽Paccekabuddhānaṃ sammāsambuddhānañca paccekabodhisammāsambodhidhammasamadhigamasadisā
analyzed: upanissaya sampannassa maggena iva ijjhanti iti magga adhigamena iva tāsam adhigamaḥ veditabbo  paccekabuddhānam sammāsambuddhānam ca pacceka bodhi sammāsambodhi dhamma samadhigama sadisā
translated: which are included in the perfection of virtue, are successful only through the path, because their attainment must be known only through the attainment of the path.

original: hi imesaṃ ariyānaṃ ime visesādhigamāti.
analyzed: hi imesam ariyānam ime
translated: For the attainment of these distinctions by these Noble Ones is like the attainment of the states of a Paccekabuddha and a Sammāsambuddha by the Paccekabodhisatta and the Sammāsambodhisatta.🔽And because they are distinguished there in the same way.

original: Tāsaṃyeva ca tattha pabhedavacanatoti ettha tāsaṃyevāti avadhāraṇaṃ pāpuṇitabbānaṃ
analyzed: tāsam yeva ca tattha pabheda vacanato ti ettha tāsam yeva ati avadhāraṇam pāpuṇitabbānam
translated: Here, the word “only” in the words “of those only” should be supplied.

original: chaḷabhiññācatupaṭisambhidānaṃ vinaye pabhedavacanābhāvaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Verañjakaṇḍe
analyzed: vinaye pabheda vacana abhāvam sandhāya vuttam verañja kaṇḍe
translated: It is said with reference to the fact that in the Vinaya there is no distinction made between the six kinds of direct knowledge and the four discriminations, which are the things to be attained.

original: hi tisso vijjāva vibhattāti. Dutiye tāsaṃyevāti avadhāraṇaṃ catasso paṭisambhidā
analyzed: hi tissaḥ vijjāva vibhattā ati dutiye tāsam yeva ati avadhāraṇam catasso paṭisambhidā
translated: For the three kinds of clear knowledge are distinguished in the Suttas.

original: apekkhitvā kataṃ, na tisso vijjā. Tā hi chasu abhiññāsu antogadhattā sutte vibhattāyevāti.
analyzed: apekkhitvā katam na tissaḥ vijjā tāḥ hi chasu abhiññāsu antogadhattā sutte vibhattāya eva ati
translated: In the second case the word “only” is used in order to restrict the meaning to the four kinds of analytical knowledge, not to the three kinds of clear knowledge. For the latter are included among the six kinds of direct-knowledge and are therefore distinguished in the Suttas.

original: Tāsañcāti ettha ca-saddena sesānampi tattha atthibhāvaṃ dīpeti. Abhidhammapiṭake
analyzed: tāsam ca iti ettha ca saddena sesānam pi tattha atthi bhāvam dīpeti abhidhammapiṭake
translated: And by the word “and” in the phrase “and in the Abhidhamma” the other matters dealt with in the Abhidhamma are also indicated.

original: hi tisso vijjā cha abhiññā catasso ca paṭisambhidā vuttāyeva. Paṭisambhidānaṃ pana
analyzed: hi tissaḥ vijjā cha abhiññā catasso ca paṭisambhidā vuttāya iva paṭisambhidānam pana
translated: For the three kinds of clear knowledge, the six kinds of direct-knowledge, and the four analytical knowledges are mentioned in the Abhidhamma Piṭaka.🔽But the analytical knowledges are mentioned in the Paṭisambhidā only.

original: aññattha pabhedavacanābhāvaṃ tattheva ca sammā vibhattabhāvaṃ dīpetukāmo heṭṭhā vuttanayena
analyzed: aññattha pabheda vacana abhāvam tattha iva ca sammā vibhatta bhāvam dīpetu kāmo heṭṭhā vutta nayena
translated: Desiring to show that they are not mentioned in any other place and that they are properly distinguished there, he did not repeat the word “only” as he had done above,

original: avadhāraṇaṃ akatvā “tatthevā”ti parivattetvā avadhāraṇaṃ ṭhapesi.🔽Idāni “vinaye duppaṭipanno ‘mudukānaṃ attharaṇādīnaṃ samphasso viya itthisamphassopi
analyzed: avadhāraṇam a katvā tattha eva ati parivattetvā avadhāraṇam ṭhapesi  idāni vinaye duppaṭipannaḥ mudukānam attharaṇa ādīnam samphassaḥ viya itthi samphassaḥ api
translated: but he used the word “there” to restrict the meaning.

original: vaṭṭatī’ti methunavītikkame dosaṃ adisvā sīlavipattiṃ pāpuṇātī”ti dassento āha “vinaye
analyzed: vaṭṭati iti methuna vītikkame dosam a disvā sīla vipattim pāpuṇāti iti dassentaḥ āha vinaye
translated: Now, in order to show that “one who is badly trained in the Discipline is like one who has no regard for the contact of soft bedding, etc., and so, not seeing the danger in transgressing the rules of the Pārājika offense, he falls into moral failure,” he said: “In the Discipline,

original: pana duppaṭipanno”tiādi. Tattha sukho samphasso etesanti sukhasamphassāni, attharaṇapāvuraṇādīni.
analyzed: pana duppaṭipannaḥ tiādi tattha sukhaḥ samphasso etesanti sukha samphassāni attharaṇa pāvuraṇa ādīni
translated: and “But he is difficult to correct” . Herein, they have pleasant contact are the pleasant contacts, namely, the bedding, the seats, etc.

original: Upādinnaphasso itthiphasso, methunadhammoti vuttaṃ hoti. Vuttampi hetanti ariṭṭhena🔽bhikkhunā vuttaṃ. So hi bahussuto dhammakathiko kammakilesavipākaupavādaāṇāvītikkamavasena
analyzed: upādinna phassaḥ itthi phassaḥ methuna dhammo ti vuttam hoti vuttam api hetan ti ariṭṭhena  bhikkhunā vuttam saḥ hi bahu ssutaḥ dhamma kathikaḥ kamma kilesa vipāka aupavāda āṇā vītikkama vasena
translated: Contact by clinging is contact with a woman, which is what is meant by “sexual intercourse.”🔽What is stated is this: the bhikkhu named Ariṭṭha

original: pañcavidhesu antarāyikesu sesantarāyike jānāti, vinaye pana akovidattā paṇṇattivītikkamantarāyike
analyzed: pañcavidhesu antarāyikesu sesa ntarāyike jānāti vinaye pana a kovida tā paṇṇatti vītikkama ntarāyike
translated: who was learned, a preacher, and a man of the discourses. He knew the five impediments that are impediments because they are a transgression of the training precepts, because they are defilements of kamma, and because they are ripening of results.🔽But because he was unskilled in the Discipline he did not know the impediment that is an impediment because it is a transgression of the rules.

original: na jānāti, tasmā rahogato evaṃ cintesi “ime agārikā pañca kāmaguṇe paribhuñjantā
analyzed: na jānāti tasmā rahogataḥ evam cintesi ime agārikā pañca kāmaguṇe paribhuñjantā
translated: So he thought thus in private: “These laymen enjoy the five kinds of heavenly sensual desires.🔽They become stream-enterers and once-returners and non-returners.

original: sotāpannāpi sakadāgāminopi anāgāminopi honti. Bhikkhūpi manāpikāni cakkhuviññeyyāni
analyzed: sotāpannāḥ api sakadāgāminaḥ api anāgāminaḥ api honti bhikkhū pi manāpikāni cakkhu viññeyyāni
translated: The bhikkhus see visible objects cognizable by the eye that are likeable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing;

original: rūpāni passanti…pe… kāyaviññeyye phoṭṭhabbe phusanti, mudukāni attharaṇapāvuraṇādīni
analyzed: rūpāni kāya viññeyye phoṭṭhabbe phusanti mudukāni attharaṇa pāvuraṇa ādīni
translated: they hear sounds cognizable by the ear … smell smells cognizable by the nose … taste tastes cognizable by the tongue … touch tangible objects cognizable by the body that are likeable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing;🔽they use soft bedding, seats, etc.,

original: paribhuñjanti, etaṃ sabbaṃ vaṭṭati, kasmā itthīnaṃyeva rūpasaddagandharasaphoṭṭhabbā🔽na vaṭṭanti, etepi vaṭṭantī”ti anavajjena paccayaparibhuñjanarasena sāvajjakāmaguṇaparibhogarasaṃ
analyzed: paribhuñjanti etam sabbam vaṭṭati kasmai rūpa sadda gandha rasa phoṭṭhabbā  na vaṭṭanti ete api vaṭṭanti iti anavajjena paccaya paribhuñjana rasena sāvajja kāma guṇa paribhoga rasam
translated: All this is allowable. Why are the visible forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangibles of women not allowable? These are allowable.”

original: saṃsanditvā sacchandarāgaparibhogañca nicchandarāgaparibhogañca ekaṃ katvā thūlavākehi
analyzed: saṃsanditvā sa chanda rāga paribhogam ca nicchanda rāga paribhogam ca ekam katvā thūlavākehi
translated: And he combined the enjoyment of requisites that is blameless with the enjoyment of sensual desires that is blameless,🔽and he combined the enjoyment of sensual desires with lust with the enjoyment of sensual desires without lust, and he combined the atisukhamasutta with the thūlavākas,

original: saddhiṃ atisukhumasuttaṃ ghaṭento viya sāsapena saddhiṃ sineruno sadisataṃ upasaṃharanto
analyzed: saddhim ati sukhuma suttam ghaṭentaḥ viya sāsapena saddhim sineruno sadisa tam upasaṃharantaḥ
translated: and he combined the sāsapamitta with the sinerusaddisa,

original: viya pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ uppādetvā “kiṃ bhagavatā mahāsamuddaṃ bandhantena viya mahatā
analyzed: viya pāpakam diṭṭhigatam uppādetvā kim bhagavatā mahā samuddam bandhantena viya mahatā
translated: and he produced a bad view thus: “What is the point of the Blessed One’s laying down the first pārājika rule with such great effort as though he were damming up water? There is no harm in that.”

original: ussāhena paṭhamapārājikaṃ paññattaṃ, natthi ettha doso”ti sabbaññutaññāṇena saddhiṃ
analyzed: ussāhena paṭhama pārājikam paññattam na atthi ettha doso ti sabbaññuta ññāṇena saddhiṃ
translated: And he combined the knowledge of omniscience with the view that there is no harm in that,

original: paṭivirujjhanto vesārajjañāṇaṃ paṭibāhanto ariyamagge khāṇukaṇṭakādīni pakkhipanto
analyzed: paṭivirujjhantaḥ vesārajja ñāṇam paṭibāhantaḥ ariya magge khāṇu kaṇṭaka ādīni pakkhipantaḥ
translated: and he combined the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers with the knowledge of omniscience, and he combined the noble path with stumps, thorns, etc.,

original: “methunadhamme doso natthī”ti jinassa āṇācakke pahāramadāsi. Tenāha “tathāhaṃ bhagavatā
analyzed: methuna dhamme doso natthi iti jinassa āṇā cakke tena āha tathā aham bhagavatā
translated: “There is no harm in sexual intercourse,” and struck the Buddha with the wheel. Therefore it is said:🔽

original: dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmī”tiādi.🔽Tattha antarāyikāti taṃtaṃsampattiyā vibandhanavasena sattasantānassa antare vemajjhe🔽eti āgacchatīti antarāyo, diṭṭhadhammikādianattho. Anatikkamanaṭṭhena tasmiṃ antarāye
analyzed: dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi itiādi  tattha antarāyikā ti taṃ taṃ sampattiyāḥ vibandhana vasena satta santānassa antare vemajjhe  eti āgacchati iti antarāyaḥ diṭṭhadhammika ādi anatthaḥ an atikkamana aṭṭhena tasmin antarāye
translated: “There is no harm in sexual intercourse,” and he struck the wheel of the Dhamma with his fist. That is why he said, “I understand the Dhamma taught by the Lord thus” .🔽Herein, obstructive is what is called an obstacle because it comes between , that is, because it comes between and in the middle of the continuity of existence of beings in the way of an obstruction to this or that kind of success.

original: niyuttā, antarāyaṃ vā phalaṃ arahanti, antarāyassa vā karaṇasīlāti antarāyikā, saggamokkhānaṃ
analyzed: niyuttāḥ antarāyam vā phalam arahanti antarāyassa vā karaṇa sīlā ati antarāyikā sagga mokkhānam
translated: It is an obstacle because it is not to be passed beyond , and it is called obstructive because it is bound up with that obstacle or because it is of the nature to cause the obstacle to be made to the success of heaven and the path, etc.,

original: antarāyakarāti vuttaṃ hoti. Te ca kammakilesavipākaupavādaāṇāvītikkamavasena pañcavidhā.
analyzed: antarāya karā ti vuttam hoti te ca kamma kilesa vipāka aupavāda āṇā vītikkama vasena pañcavidhā
translated: which is what is meant. And they are of five kinds as blameworthy action, defilement, result, and as a prohibition, and as transgression of a rule.

original: Tesaṃ vitthārakathā parato ariṭṭhasikkhāpade āvi bhavissati. Ayaṃ panettha padatthasambandho
analyzed: tesam vitthāra kathā paratas ariṭṭha sikkhāpade bhavissati ayam pana ittha padattha sambandho
translated: The detailed explanation of them will come later in the Ariṭṭha Sutta in the Paṭhamavagga .🔽Here is the word meaning:

original: – ye ime dhammā antarāyikā antarāyakarāti bhagavatā vuttā desitā ceva paññattā ca,
analyzed: ye ime dhammā antarāyikāḥ antarāya karā ti bhagavatā vuttā desitā ca iva paññattā ca
translated: These ideas that have been stated, taught, and exhibited by the Blessed One as obstructive, as causing an obstacle,

original: te dhamme paṭisevato paṭisevantassa yathā yena pakārena te dhammā antarāyāya saggamokkhānaṃ
analyzed: te dhamme paṭisevataḥ paṭisevantassa yathā yena pakārena te dhammāḥ antarāyāya sagga mokkhānaṃ
translated: for one who practises those things, as he practises, in whatever way those things are an obstacle to the attainment of heaven or liberation,

original: antarāyakaraṇatthaṃ nālaṃ samatthā na honti, tathā tena pakārenāhaṃ bhagavatā desitaṃ🔽dhammaṃ ājānāmīti. Tato dussīlabhāvaṃ pāpuṇātīti tato anavajjasaññībhāvahetuto vītikkamitvā
analyzed: antarāya karaṇa attham nālam samatthāḥ na honti tathā tena pakārena aham bhagavatā desitam  dhammaṃ ājānāmi iti tatas dussīla bhāvam pāpuṇāti iti tatas anavajja saññī bhāva hetutaḥ vītikkamitvā
translated: When he practises those things, he understands the Dhamma taught by the Exalted One thus: ‘The things which the Exalted One has taught for the attainment of heaven and liberation are not able to bring about heaven and liberation in the way he has taught them.’

original: dussīlabhāvaṃ pāpuṇāti.🔽Cattārome, bhikkhavetiādinā –🔽“Cattārome, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ. Katame cattāro, attahitāya🔽paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya, parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya, neva attahitāya
analyzed: dussīla bhāvam pāpuṇāti  cattāro me bhikkhave tiādinā  cattāro me bhikkhave puggalā santaḥ saṃvijjamānāḥ lokasmim katame cattāraḥ atta hitāya  paṭipannaḥ hoti no para hitāya para hitāya paṭipannaḥ hoti no atta hitāya na iva atta hitāya
translated: Then he falls into immorality.

original: paṭipanno hoti no parahitāya, attahitāya ceva paṭipanno hoti parahitāya cā”ti –
analyzed: paṭipannaḥ hoti no para hitāya atta hitāya ca iva paṭipannaḥ hoti para hitāya ca ati
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these four kinds of persons found existing in the world. What four? There is the person who practises for his own benefit but not for the benefit of others, there is the person who practises for the benefit of others but not for his own benefit, there is the person who practises neither for his own benefit nor for the benefit of others, and there is the person who practises both for his own benefit and for the benefit of others.”

original: Ādinā puggaladesanāpaṭisaṃyuttasuttantapāḷiṃ nidasseti. Adhippāyaṃ ajānantoti “ayaṃ
analyzed: ādinā puggala desanā paṭisaṃyutta suttanta pāḷim nidasseti adhippāyam a jānanto ti ayam

analyzed: puggalaḥ sattaḥ itthī purisaḥ khattiyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ devaḥ māraḥ iti evarūpā sammuti desanā

translated: Teaching in terms of ultimate reality is such as: “impermanent, painful, not-self, aggregates, bases, elements, foundations of mindfulness” .🔽Herein, the Blessed One teaches in terms of what is commonly agreed to those who are able to penetrate the meaning by learning the teaching in terms of what is commonly agreed, to abandon delusion, and to reach distinction.

original: paṭivijjhitvā mohaṃ pahāya visesamadhigantuṃ samatthā, tesaṃ paramatthadesanaṃ deseti.
analyzed: paṭivijjhitvā moham pahāya visesam adhigantum samatthā tesam paramattha desanam deseti
translated: But he teaches in terms of ultimate reality to those who are able to penetrate the meaning by learning the teaching in terms of ultimate reality, to abandon delusion, and to reach distinction.

analyzed: aññatarāya tesam tāya bhāsāya evam te māṇavā chekam byattam ācariyam āgamma khippam eva

analyzed: ṭhitāni tīṇi piṭakāni desa bhāsāya kosallam iva sammuti paramattha kosallam nānā desa bhāsā māṇavakā  sammuti paramattha vasena paṭivijjhana samatthā veneyya sattā ācariyassa damiḷa bhāsa ādi ācikkhanam

translated: Because it is the cause of things as they are.🔽Therefore, for one skilled in usage,

translated: For the Lord of the World, the Teacher,🔽When he speaks in terms of conventional usage,

analyzed: sammutim voharantassa musāvādaḥ na jāyati iti
translated: There is no falsehood.

original: Apica aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi bhagavā puggalakathaṃ katheti – hirottappadīpanatthaṃ kammassakatādīpanatthaṃ

analyzed: ottappati purisaḥ khattiyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ devaḥ māro ti vutte mahā janaḥ jānāti na sammoham āpajjati
translated: a man, a noble, a brahmin, a god, or Mara is ashamed and fearful, the multitude understands, is not confused, and

analyzed: na paṭisattu hoti tasmai bhagavā hirā uttappa dīpana attham puggala katham kathā iti khandhāḥ
translated: and there is no one to be the object of the action, therefore the Blessed One tells the story of the person in order to illustrate shame and moral dread.

analyzed: kammassakāḥ dhātuyaḥ āyatanāni iti vutte pi esa iva nayaḥ tasmā bhagavā kammassaka tā dīpana attham  puggala katham kathā iti veḷuvana ādayaḥ mahāvihārā khandhehi kārāpitā dhātūhi āyatanehi iti

analyzed: vutte api esā iva nayaḥ tasmai bhagavā paccatta purisakāra dīpana attham puggala katham katheti  khandhāḥ mātaram jīvitā voropenti pitaram arahantam ruhira uppāda kammam saṅgha bhedam
translated: When it is said, “The great monasteries such as the Bamboo Grove are built by the aggregates, the elements, and the bases,” the same method applies. Therefore the Blessed One tells the story of the person in order to illustrate the doer of the action.

original: karonti, dhātuyo āyatanānī”ti vuttepi eseva nayo. Tasmā bhagavā ānantariyadīpanatthaṃ🔽puggalakathaṃ katheti.

translated: When it is said, “The aggregates kill their mother, their father, and an arahat, commit the crime of shedding the blood of a Buddha, and cause a schism in the Saṅgha; the elements and the bases do the same,” the same method applies. Therefore the Blessed One tells the story of the person in order to illustrate the immediate offenses.

original: “Khandhā mettāyanti, dhātuyo āyatanānī”ti vuttepi eseva nayo. Tasmā bhagavā brahmavihāradīpanatthaṃ
analyzed: khandhāḥ mettāyanti dhātuyaḥ āyatanāni iti vutte pi esa iva nayaḥ tasmai bhagavā brahmavihāra dīpana attham
translated: When it is said, “The aggregates are the object of loving-kindness, the elements and the bases are the object of loving-kindness,” the same method applies. Therefore the Blessed One tells the story of the person in order to illustrate the divine abodes.

original: puggalakathaṃ katheti. “Khandhā pubbenivāsaṃ anussaranti, dhātuyo āyatanānī”ti vuttepi
analyzed: puggala katham kathā iti khandhāḥ pubbenivāsam anussaranti dhātuyaḥ āyatanāni iti vutte api
translated: When it is said that the aggregates remember the past life, the elements and the sense-spheres do not understand.

original: eseva nayo. Tasmā bhagavā pubbenivāsadīpanatthaṃ puggalakathaṃ katheti. “Khandhā
analyzed: esa iva nayaḥ tasmai bhagavā pubbenivāsa dīpana attham puggala katham kathā iti khandhāḥ
translated: Therefore the Blessed One speaks of a person in order to illustrate the past life.
