original: pañcahi satehi yena katā saṅgītā, tena pañcasatāni etissā atthīti “pañcasatā”ti ca,🔽thereheva katattā therā mahākassapādayo etissā atthīti “therikā”ti ca loke vuccati,
analyzed: pañcahi satehi yena katā saṅgītā tena pañca satāni etissā atthi iti pañca satā ati ca  therehi iva kata ttā therāḥ mahākassapa ādayo etissā atthi iti therikā ati ca loke vuccati
translated: It was composed by the elders, thus it is called “the elders’ text” .

original: ayaṃ paṭhamamahāsaṅgīti nāmāti sambandho.
analyzed: ayam paṭhama mahāsaṅgī iti nāma ati sambandho
translated: This is called the First Great Recital.

original: Evaṃ paṭhamamahāsaṅgītiṃ dassetvā yadatthaṃ sā idha nidassitā, taṃ nigamanavasena
analyzed: evam paṭhama mahā saṅgītim dassetvā yadattham sā idha nidassitā tam nigamana vasena
translated: Having thus shown the First Great Recital, he now shows the purpose for which it is mentioned here, by way of a conclusion,

original: dassento “imissā”tiādimāha. Āyasmatā upālittherena vuttanti “tena samayenā”tiādi
analyzed: dassentaḥ imissā atiādim āha āyasmatā upāli ttherena vuttanti tena samayena atiādi
translated: saying “In this” , etc. “Told by the venerable Elder Upali” : all the words of introduction beginning with “At that time” are said.

original: vakkhamānaṃ sabbaṃ nidānavacanaṃ vuttaṃ. Kimatthaṃ panettha dhammavinayasaṅgahe kathiyamāne
analyzed: vakkhamānam sabbam nidāna vacanam vuttam kimattham pana ittha dhamma vinaya saṅgahe kathiyamāne
translated: But why is the introduction told here when the recital of the Dhamma and Discipline is being given?🔽Should not the recital be made only of the words spoken by the Blessed One?

original: nidānavacanaṃ vuttaṃ, nanu ca bhagavatā bhāsitavacanasseva saṅgaho kātabboti? Vuccate
analyzed: nidāna vacanam vuttam nanu ca bhagavatā bhāsita vacanassa iva saṅgahaḥ kātabbaḥ iti vuccate
translated: It is said:🔽in order to establish the teaching, to prevent its corruption, and to perfect the disciples’ confidence.

original: – desanāya ṭhitiasammosasaddhaeyyabhāvasampādanatthaṃ. Kāladesadesakaparisāpadesehi
analyzed: desanāya ṭhiti asammosa saddhaeyya bhāva sampādana ttham kāla desa desaka parisā apadesehi
translated: By the time, the place, the teacher, the audience, and the teaching,

original: upanibandhitvā ṭhapitā hi desanā ciraṭṭhitikā hoti asammosadhammā saddheyyā ca, desakālakattuhetunimittehi🔽upanibandho viya vohāravinicchayo. Teneva ca āyasmatā mahākassapena “paṭhamapārājikaṃ
analyzed: upanibandhitvā ṭhapitā hi desanā cira ṭṭhitikā hoti asammosa dhammā saddheyyā ca desa kāla kattu hetu nimittehi  upanibandhaḥ viya vohāra vinicchayo tena iva ca āyasmatā mahākassapena paṭhama pārājikam
translated: just as a legal case lasts long when it is given a basis with place, time, action, reason, and cause.🔽That is why, when the venerable Maha Kassapa asked the venerable Upali about the place, etc., where the first offence involving defeat was laid down,

original: āvuso, upāli, kattha paññatta”ntiādinā desādipucchāsu katāsu tāsaṃ visajjanaṃ karontena
analyzed: āvuso upāli kattha paññatta nti ādinā desa ādi pucchāsu katāsu tāsam visajjanam karontena
translated: and the venerable Upali, in replying,

original: āyasmatā upālittherena “tena samayenā”tiādinā paṭhamapārājikassa nidānaṃ bhāsitaṃ.
analyzed: āyasmatā upāli ttherena tena samayena ati ādinā paṭhama pārājikassa nidānam bhāsitam
translated: said: “On that occasion,” etc., he gave the introduction to the first offence involving defeat.

original: Apica sāsanasampattipakāsanatthaṃ nidānavacanaṃ. Ñāṇakaruṇāpariggahitasabbakiriyassa🔽hi bhagavato natthi niratthakā paṭipatti attahitatthā vā, tasmā paresaṃyevatthāya
analyzed: apica sāsana sampatti pakāsana ttham nidāna vacanam ñāṇa karuṇā pariggahita sabba kiriyassa  hi bhagavataḥ natthi niratthakā paṭipatti atta hita tthā vā tasmā
translated: Besides, the introduction is stated in order to show the excellence of the Dispensation.🔽For the Blessed One, whose every act is accompanied by knowledge and compassion,🔽has no purposeless conduct or conduct for his own benefit. Therefore,

original: pavattasabbakiriyassa sammāsambuddhassa sakalampi kāyavacīmanokammaṃ yathāpavattaṃ
analyzed: pavatta sabba kiriyassa sammāsambuddhassa sakalam pi kāya vacī manaḥ kammam yathāpavattam
translated: all the Blessed One’s conduct, which occurs only for the benefit of others,🔽is, when described as it occurs,

original: vuccamānaṃ diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaparamatthehi yathārahaṃ sattānaṃ anusāsanaṭṭhena
analyzed: vuccamānam diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika paramatthehi yathāraham sattānam anusāsana ṭṭhena
translated: instructon for beings in the way proper to each in the highest sense, either here and now or in the life to come.

original: sāsanaṃ, na kabbaracanā. Tayidaṃ satthuracitaṃ kāladesadesakaparisāpadesehi saddhiṃ
analyzed: sāsanam na kabba racanā tayā idam satthu racitam kāla desa desaka parisā apadesehi saddhim
translated: and not a mere composition of words.

original: tattha tattha nidānavacanehi yathārahaṃ pakāsīyati.
analyzed: tattha tattha nidāna vacanehi yathāraham
translated: And this is set forth here and there in the Nidāna, which is the story of the occasion, together with the story of the place, the story of the person, and the story of the time.

original: Apica satthuno pamāṇabhāvappakāsanena sāsanassa pamāṇabhāvadassanatthaṃ nidānavacanaṃ,
analyzed: apica satthuno pamāṇa bhāva ppakāsanena sāsanassa pamāṇa bhāva dassana attham nidāna vacanam
translated: Moreover, the story of the occasion is told in order to show the authority of the Dispensation by showing the authority of the Teacher.

original: tañcassa pamāṇabhāvadassanaṃ “buddho bhagavā”ti iminā padadvayena vibhāvitanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: tat ca assa pamāṇa bhāva dassanam buddhaḥ bhagavā ti iminā pada dvayena vibhāvitan ti veditabbam
translated: And that authority of his should be understood to be demonstrated by the two terms “Buddha” and “Bhagavā.”

original: Buddhoti hi iminā tathāgatassa anaññasādhāraṇasuparisuddhañāṇādiguṇavisesayogaparidīpanena,
analyzed: buddhaḥ ti hi iminā tathāgatassa anañña sādhāraṇa su parisuddha ñāṇa ādi guṇa visesa yoga paridīpanena
translated: For by the word “Buddha” the Blessed One is shown to possess the special qualities of such and such kinds of purified knowledge, etc., not shared by disciples and others,

original: bhagavāti ca iminā rāgadosamohādisabbakilesamaladuccaritādidosappahānadīpanena, tato🔽eva ca sabbasattuttamabhāvadīpanena ayamattho sabbathā pakāsito hotīti idamettha
analyzed: bhagavā ati ca iminā rāga dosa moha ādi sabba kilesa mala duccarita ādi dosa ppahāna dīpanena tatas  eva ca sabba satta uttama bhāva dīpanena ayam attho sabbathā pakāsitaḥ hoti iti idam ettha
translated: and by the word “Bhagavā” he is shown to have abandoned all defilements, such as lust, hate, and delusion, and all bad conduct, such as the pārājikas, etc.,

original: nidānavacanappayojanassa mukhamattanidassanaṃ.
analyzed: nidāna vacana ppayojanassa mukha matta nidassanam
translated: and thereby to be the most excellent of all beings. So the meaning is shown in all its aspects. This is a mere indication of the purpose of the story of the occasion.

original: Tatrāyaṃ ācariyaparamparāti tasmiṃ jambudīpe ayaṃ ācariyānaṃ paramparā paveṇī paṭipāṭi.
analyzed: tatra ayam tasmin jambudīpe ayam paramparā paveṇī paṭipāṭi
translated: Herein, this is the succession of teachers in Jambudīpa:

original: Upāli dāsakotiādīsu upālitthero pākaṭoyeva, dāsakattherādayo pana evaṃ veditabbā.
analyzed: upāli dāsakaḥ ti ādīsu upāli ttheraḥ dāsaka tthera ādayaḥ pana evam veditabbā
translated: In the case of the words “Upāli, Dāsaka, etc.,” the Elder Upāli is well known. But the Elder Dāsaka and the rest should be understood in this way.

original: Vesāliyaṃ kira eko dāsako nāma brāhmaṇamāṇavo tiṇṇaṃ antevāsikasatānaṃ jeṭṭhantevāsiko
analyzed: vesāliyam kira ekaḥ dāsakaḥ nāma brāhmaṇa māṇavaḥ tiṇṇam antevāsika satānam jeṭṭha antevāsiko
translated: It seems that in Vesālī there was a brāhmaṇa student named Dāsaka who was the senior pupil of three hundred pupils.

original: hutvā ācariyassa santike sippaṃ uggaṇhanto dvādasavassikoyeva tiṇṇaṃ vedānaṃ pāragū🔽ahosi. So ekadivasaṃ antevāsikaparivuto dhammavinayaṃ saṅgāyitvā vālikārāme nivasantaṃ
analyzed: hutvā ācariyassa santike sippam uggaṇhantaḥ tiṇṇam vedānam pāragū  ahosi saḥ eka divasam antevāsika parivutaḥ dhamma vinayam saṅgāyitvā vālikā ārāme nivasantam
translated: He was only twelve years old when he had mastered the three Vedas🔽after making his living by reciting the three Vedas. One day, surrounded by his pupils, he was reciting the Dhamma and the Discipline.

original: āyasmantaṃ upālittheraṃ upasaṅkamitvā attano vedesu sabbāni gaṇṭhiṭṭhānāni theraṃ
analyzed: āyasmantam upāli theram upasaṅkamitvā attanaḥ vedesu sabbāni gaṇṭhi ṭṭhānāni theram
translated: He went to the Elder Upāli, who was living in the Vālikārāma,🔽and asked the Elder about all the difficult passages in the three Vedas.

original: pucchi. Theropi sabbaṃ byākaritvā sayampi ekaṃ pañhaṃ pucchanto nāmaṃ sandhāya imaṃ
analyzed: pucchi theraḥ api sabbam byākaritvā sayam pi ekam pañham pucchantaḥ nāmam sandhāya imam
translated: The Elder explained everything. And when he himself asked a question, he asked this question, referring to a name:

original: pañhaṃ pucchi “ekadhammo kho, māṇava, sabbesu dhammesu anupatati, sabbepi, māṇava,
analyzed: pañham pucchi eka dhammaḥ kho māṇava sabbesu dhammesu anupatati sabbe api māṇava
translated: “Student, one idea follows after all ideas. All ideas, student,

original: dhammā ekadhammasmiṃ osaranti, katamo nu kho so, māṇavaka, dhammo”ti. Sopi kho māṇavo
analyzed: dhammāḥ eka dhammasmiṃ osaranti katamaḥ nu kho saḥ māṇavaka dhammaḥ iti saḥ api kho māṇavaḥ
translated: “The three things, friend, are included in a single thing. What is that one thing?”🔽The student, not knowing the meaning of the question, said, “What is this, Reverend Sir?”

original: pañhassa atthaṃ ajānanto “kimidaṃ bho pabbajitā”ti āha. Buddhamantoyaṃ māṇavāti.
analyzed: pañhassa attham a jānantaḥ kim idam bho pabbajita ati āha buddham antoyam māṇava ati
translated: “This is the Buddha’s word, student.”🔽“But, Reverend Sir, can you give this to me?”

original: Sakkā panāyaṃ bho mayhampi dātunti. Sakkā, māṇava, amhehi gahitapabbajjaṃ gaṇhantassa
analyzed: sakkā pana ayam bho mayham pi dātun ti sakkā māṇava amhehi gahita pabbajjam gaṇhantassa
translated: “Yes, student, we can give it to one who takes the going forth that we take.”

original: dātunti. “Sādhu kho bho pabbajitā”ti māṇavo sampaṭicchitvā attano mātaraṃ pitaraṃ
analyzed: dātunti sādhu kho bho pabbajitā ati māṇavaḥ sampaṭicchitvā attanaḥ mātaram pitaram
translated: “Very well, Reverend Sirs,” said the student. He obtained the consent of his mother and father and teacher,

original: ācariyañca anujānāpetvā tīhi antevāsikasatehi saddhiṃ therassa santike pabbajitvā
analyzed: ācariyam ca anujānāpetvā tīhi antevāsika satehi saddhim therassa santike pabbajitvā
translated: and taking with him three hundred pupils, he went forth into the homeless state under the Elder.

original: paripuṇṇavīsativasso upasampadaṃ labhitvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Thero taṃ dhuraṃ katvā
analyzed: paripuṇṇa vīsati vassaḥ upasampadam labhitvā arahattam pāpuṇi theraḥ tam dhuram katvā
translated: After he had received the full admission, and had completed the requisite number of years, he attained Arahatship. The Elder made him his chief attendant,

original: khīṇāsavasahassassa piṭakattayaṃ vācesi.
analyzed: khīṇāsava sahassassa piṭakattayam vācesi
translated: and taught him the Three Pitakas.

original: Soṇako pana dāsakattherassa saddhivihāriko. So kira kāsīsu ekassa vāṇijakassa putto
analyzed: soṇakaḥ pana dāsaka therassa saddhivihāriko so kira kāsīsu ekassa vāṇijakassa putto
translated: Soṇa was the pupil of the Elder Dāsaka. He was the son of a certain merchant of Kāsi.

original: hutvā pañcadasavassuddesiko ekaṃ samayaṃ mātāpitūhi saddhiṃ vāṇijjāya giribbajaṃ
analyzed: hutvā pañcadasa vassuddesikaḥ ekam samayam mātā pitūhi saddhim vāṇijjāya giribbajam
translated: and when he was fifteen years old he went with his parents on business to Giribbaja.

original: gato. Tato pañcapaññāsadārakehi saddhiṃ veḷuvanaṃ gantvā tattha dāsakattheraṃ saparisaṃ🔽disvā ativiya pasanno pabbajjaṃ yācitvā therena mātāpitaro anujānāpetvā “pabbajāhī”ti
analyzed: gataḥ tatas pañca paññāsa dārakehi saddhim veḷuvanam gantvā tattha dāsakattheram sa parisam  disvā ativiya pasanno pabbajjam yācitvā therena mātā pitaraḥ anujānāpetvā pabbajāhi iti
translated: Then he went to the Bamboo Grove with fifty other boys, and there he saw the Elder Dāsaka with his retinue.🔽Seeing them he was filled with joy, and he asked for the going forth. The Elder had his parents give their consent, and then he said, “Go forth.”

original: vutto mātāpitusantikaṃ gantvā tamatthaṃ ārocetvā tesu anicchantesu chinnabhatto hutvā
analyzed: vuttaḥ mātā pitu santikam gantvā tam attham ārocetvā tesu an icchantesu chinna bhattaḥ hutvā
translated: So he went to his parents and told them, and when they would not give their consent, he refused to eat.

original: mātāpitaro anujānāpetvā pañcapaññāsāya dārakehi saddhiṃ therassa santike pabbajitvā
analyzed: mātā pitaraḥ anujānāpetvā pañcapaññāsāya dārakehi saddhim therassa santike pabbajitvā
translated: Then he got his parents to give their consent, and he went forth with the fifty boys under the Elder,

original: laddhūpasampado arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Taṃ thero sakalaṃ buddhavacanaṃ uggaṇhāpesi. Sopi
analyzed: laddha upasampadaḥ arahattam pāpuṇi tam theraḥ sakalam buddha vacanam uggaṇhāpesi saḥ api
translated: and when he had received the full admission he attained arahatship. The Elder had him learn the whole of the Buddha’s word.

original: gaṇapāmokkho hutvā bahūnaṃ dhammavinayaṃ vācesi.
analyzed: gaṇa pāmokkhaḥ hutvā bahūnam dhamma vinayam vācesi
translated: He became a chief of the multitude and taught the Dhamma and Discipline to many.

original: Siggavatthero pana soṇakattherassa saddhivihāriko ahosi. So kira pāṭaliputte siggavo
analyzed: siggava theraḥ pana soṇaka therassa saddhivihārikaḥ ahosi saḥ kira pāṭaliputte siggavaḥ
translated: The Elder Siggava was the pupil of the Elder Soṇa. He was born in Pāṭaliputta, and his father was a merchant.

original: nāma amaccaputto hutvā tiṇṇaṃ utūnaṃ anucchavikesu tīsu pāsādesu sampattiṃ anubhavamāno
analyzed: nāma amacca puttaḥ hutvā tiṇṇam utūnam anucchavikesu tīsu pāsādesu sampattim anubhavamānaḥ
translated: and became a minister’s son. He experienced the perfection of the three palaces, which were suitable for the three seasons.

original: ekadivasaṃ attano sahāyena caṇḍavajjinā seṭṭhiputtena saddhiṃ saparivāro kukkuṭārāmaṃ
analyzed: eka divasam attano sahāyena caṇḍavajjinā seṭṭhi puttena saddhim sa parivāro kukkuṭārāmam
translated: One day, together with his friend Caṇḍavajjī, the son of a merchant, and his retinue, he went to the Kukkuṭārāma.

original: gantvā tattha soṇakattheraṃ nirodhasamāpattiṃ samāpajjitvā nisinnaṃ disvā vanditvā
analyzed: gantvā tattha soṇakattheram nirodha samāpattim samāpajjitvā nisinnam disvā vanditvā
translated: There he saw the Elder Soṇa sitting in the attainment of cessation. He paid homage to him and

original: attanā saddhiṃ anālapantaṃ ñatvā gantvā taṃ kāraṇaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ pucchitvā bhikkhūhi
analyzed: attanā saddhim an ālapantam ñatvā gantvā tam kāraṇam bhikkhu saṅgham pucchitvā bhikkhūhi
translated: since he did not speak to him, he went away. He asked the Community of monks the reason for that, and the monks

original: “samāpattiṃ samāpannā nālapantī”ti vutto “kathaṃ, bhante, samāpattito vuṭṭhahantī”ti
analyzed: samāpattim samāpannāḥ na ālapanti iti vuttaḥ katham bhante samāpattitaḥ vuṭṭhahanti iti
translated: said, “He does not speak while in attainment.” He asked again, “How does he emerge from attainment?”

original: puna pucchitvā tehi ca bhikkhūhi “satthuno ceva saṅghassa ca pakkosanāya yathāparicchinnakālato
analyzed: puna pucchitvā tehi ca bhikkhūhi satthuno ca iva saṅghassa ca pakkosanāya yathā paricchinna kālataḥ
translated: The monks said, “He emerges from attainment when summoned by the Teacher or the Community, or from the time he has determined,

original: āyusaṅkhayā ca vuṭṭhahantī”ti vatvā tassa saparivārassa upanissayaṃ disvā saṅghassa
analyzed: āyu saṅkhayā ca vuṭṭhahanti iti vatvā tassa sa parivārassa upanissayam disvā saṅghassa
translated: or from the exhaustion of his life.” Seeing his own and his retinue’s support, he asked the Community🔽of monks to summon the Elder Soṇa from his attainment.

original: vacanena nirodhā vuṭṭhāpitaṃ soṇakattheraṃ disvā “kasmā, bhante, mayā saddhiṃ nālapitthā”ti🔽pucchitvā therena “bhuñjitabbakaṃ kumāra bhuñjimhā”ti vutte “sakkā nu kho, bhante,
analyzed: vacanena nirodhā vuṭṭhāpitam soṇakattheram disvā kasmai bhante mayā saddhim na alapittha ati  pucchitvā therena bhuñjitabbakam kumāra bhuñjimha ati vutte sakkā nu kho bhante
translated: and saw the Elder Soṇa who had been dismissed by the Order. He asked the Elder, “Why, venerable Sir, did you not speak to me?”🔽and when the Elder said, “Prince, we have eaten what was to be eaten,” he asked, “Venerable Sir,

original: amhehipi taṃ bhojetu”nti pucchitvā “sakkā, kumāra, amhādise katvā bhojetu”nti vutte🔽tamatthaṃ mātāpitūnaṃ ārocetvā tehi anuññāto attano sahāyena caṇḍavajjinā tehi ca
analyzed: amhehi pi tam bhojetunti pucchitvā sakkā kumāra amhādise katvā bhojetunti vutte  tam attham mātā pitūnam ārocetvā tehi anuññātaḥ attano sahāyena caṇḍa vajjinā tehi ca
translated: is it possible for us also to eat that?” and when the Elder said, “It is possible, Prince, to eat it after making it ours,”

original: pañcahi purisasatehi saddhiṃ soṇakattherassa santike pabbajitvā upasampanno ahosi.
analyzed: pañcahi purisa satehi saddhim soṇaka ttherassa santike pabbajitvā upasampannaḥ ahosi
translated: he told his parents, and when they gave their consent, he went forth into homelessness in the Elder Soṇa’s presence together with his friend Caṇḍavajjī and with those five hundred men, and he was admitted to the state of a novice.

original: Tattha siggavo ca caṇḍavajjī ca dve upajjhāyasseva santike dhammavinayaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā
analyzed: tattha siggavaḥ ca caṇḍavajjī ca dve upajjhāyassa iva santike dhamma vinayam pariyāpuṇitvā
translated: There Siggava and Caṇḍavajjī, after learning the Dhamma and Discipline in the presence of the two preceptors,

original: aparabhāge chaḷabhiññā ahesuṃ.
analyzed: aparabhāge chaḍabhiññāḥ ahesuṃ
translated: later became possessed of the six kinds of direct knowledge.

original: Tissassa pana moggaliputtassa anupubbakathā parato āvi bhavissati. Vijitāvinoti vijitasabbakilesapaṭipakkhattā
analyzed: tissassa pana moggaliputtassa anupubba kathā paratas āvi bhavissati vijita āvino ti vijita sabba kilesa paṭipakkha ttā
translated: But the story of Tissa, Moggaliputta, will be told later on. Vijitāvino means that he had conquered all the defilements that are opponents to the path.

original: vijitavanto. Paramparāyāti paṭipāṭiyā, anukkamenāti vuttaṃ hoti. Jambusirivhayeti🔽jambusadisanāme, jambunāmaketi vuttaṃ hoti. Mahantena hi jamburukkhena abhilakkhitattā
analyzed: vijitavantaḥ paramparāyā ati paṭipāṭiyā anukkamena ati vuttam hoti jambu siri vhayā iti  jambu sadisa nāme jambu nāmaka iti vuttam hoti mahantena hi jambu rukkhena abhilakkhita ttā
translated: They were victorious. By succession: by order, is what is meant. In the Rose-Apple Island:

original: dīpopi “jambū”ti vuccati. Acchijjamānaṃ avinassamānaṃ katvā.
analyzed: dīpaḥ api jambu iti vuccati a chijjamānam a vinassamānam katvā
translated: in the island named after the Rose-Apple Tree, in the Rose-Apple-named island, is what is meant. For because of a great rose-apple tree the island is called “Rose-Apple.”🔽Without interruption: without ceasing.

original: Vinayavaṃsantiādīhi tīhi vinayapāḷiyeva kathitā pariyāyavacanattā. Pakataññutanti🔽veyyattiyaṃ, paṭubhāvanti vuttaṃ hoti. Dhuraggāho ahosīti padhānaggāhī ahosi, sabbesaṃ
analyzed: vinaya vaṃsanti ādīhi tīhi vinaya pāḷiyā iva kathitā pariyāya vacana ttā  veyyattiyam paṭu bhāvanti vuttam hoti dhura ggāho ahosi iti padhāna ggāhī ahosi sabbesam
translated: The Vinaya-pitaka, etc.: by these three terms the Vinaya-Piṭaka itself is referred to, because it is a synonym for it. He was skilled in the extent:

original: pāmokkho hutvā gaṇhīti vuttaṃ hoti. Bhikkhūnaṃ samudāyo samūho bhikkhusamudāyo, samaṇagaṇoti attho.🔽Iti samantapāsādikāya vinayaṭṭhakathāya sāratthadīpaniyaṃ
analyzed: pāmokkhaḥ hutvā gaṇhi iti vuttam hoti bhikkhūnam samudāyaḥ samūhaḥ bhikkhu samudāyo samaṇa gaṇaḥ ti attho  iti samantapāsādikāya vinaya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: he was skilled in the details, is what is meant. He was a leader in the burden: he was a leader in the effort, is what is meant. He was a leader who took the lead of all. The community of bhikkhus: the collection, the multitude of bhikkhus, is what is meant.

original: Paṭhamamahāsaṅgītikathāvaṇṇanā samattā.🔽Dutiyasaṅgītikathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: 🔽dutiya saṅgīti kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: Thus ends the commentary on the first chapter in the Sāratthapakāsinī, the commentary on the Dīgha Nikāya.

original: “Yadā nibbāyiṃsū”ti sambandho. Jotayitvā ca sabbadhīti tameva saddhammaṃ sabbattha
analyzed: yadā nibbāyiṃsu iti sambandhaḥ jotayitvā ca sabbadhi iti tam eva saddhammam sabbattha
translated: And having lit it up in every way: having caused that True Idea to shine everywhere.

original: pakāsayitvā. “Jutimanto”ti vattabbe gāthābandhavasena “jutīmanto”ti vuttaṃ, paññājotisampannāti
analyzed: pakāsayitvā jutimantaḥ ti vattabbe gāthābandha vasena jutīmantaḥ ti vuttam paññā joti sampannā ti
translated: Though it should be said “Jutimanta,” it is said “Jutimanta” in the verse for the sake of the metre; the meaning is that they were endowed with the light of understanding.

original: attho, tejavantoti vā, mahānubhāvāti vuttaṃ hoti. Nibbāyiṃsūti anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā
analyzed: tejavanto ti vā mahā anubhāvā ti vuttam hoti nibbāyiṃsu iti anupādisesāya nibbāna dhātuyā
translated: Or alternatively, they were “tejavanta,” which is to say, they were “mahānubhāvā” .🔽They had passed away: they had attained final extinction in the element of extinction without residue of clinging left.

original: parinibbāyiṃsu. Pahīnasabbakilesattā natthi etesaṃ katthaci ālayo taṇhāti anālayā,
analyzed: parinibbāyiṃsu pahīna sabba kilesa ttā natthi etesam katthaci ālayaḥ taṇhā ati anālayā
translated: They had no attachment anywhere because they had abandoned all defilements.

original: vītarāgāti vuttaṃ hoti.🔽Vassasataparinibbute bhagavatīti vassasataṃ parinibbutassa assāti vassasataparinibbuto,
analyzed: vīta rāgā iti vuttam hoti  vassa sata parinibbute bhagavati iti vassa satam parinibbutassa assa ati vassa sata parinibbutaḥ
translated: They were “anālayā,” which is to say, they were “vītarāgā” .🔽A hundred years after the Blessed One had passed away: a hundred years after the Blessed One had attained final extinction is “vassasata-parinibbuto,”

original: bhagavā, tasmiṃ parinibbānato vassasate atikkanteti vuttaṃ hoti. Vesālikāti vesālīnivāsino.
analyzed: bhagavā tasmim parinibbānataḥ vassa sate atikkantā iti vuttam hoti vesālikā ati vesālī nivāsinaḥ
translated: which is to say, a hundred years having elapsed since his final extinction.🔽The Vajjians: the inhabitants of Vesall.🔽The Vajji-puttas: the sons of clans in Vesall in the Vajji country.

original: Vajjiputtakāti vajjiraṭṭhe vesāliyaṃ kulānaṃ puttā. Kappati siṅgīloṇakappoti siṅgena
analyzed: vajjiputtakā ati vajji raṭṭhe vesāliyam kulānam puttā kappati siṅgīloṇakappā iti siṅgena
translated: “Is the Siṅgīliṇika allowed?”

original: loṇaṃ pariharitvā pariharitvā aloṇakapiṇḍapātena saddhiṃ bhuñjituṃ kappati, na sannidhiṃ🔽karotīti adhippāyo. Kappati dvaṅgulakappoti dvaṅgulaṃ atikkantāya chāyāya vikāle🔽bhojanaṃ bhuñjituṃ kappatīti attho. Kappati gāmantarakappoti “gāmantaraṃ gamissāmī”ti🔽pavāritena anatirittabhojanaṃ bhuñjituṃ kappatīti attho. Kappati āvāsakappoti ekasīmāyaṃ🔽nānāsenāsanesu visuṃ visuṃ uposathādīni saṅghakammāni kātuṃ vaṭṭatīti attho. Kappati
analyzed: loṇam pariharitvā pariharitvā a loṇaka piṇḍapātena saddhim bhuñjitum kappati na sannidhim  karoti iti adhippāyaḥ kappati dvaṅgula kappo ti dvaṅgulam atikkantāya chāyāya vikāle  bhojanam bhuñjitum kappati iti kappati gāmantara kappo ti gāmantaram gamissāmi iti  pavāritena an atiritta bhojanam bhuñjitum kappati iti attho kappati āvāsa kappo ti eka sīmāyam  nānā senāsanesu visum visum uposatha ādīni saṅgha kammāni kātum vaṭṭati iti attho kappati
translated: It is allowable to eat salt, having taken it out and having taken it out, together with a lump of saltless food. The meaning is: he does not make a store. It is allowable to eat by the two-finger breadth rule. The meaning is: it is allowable to eat at the wrong time by the two-finger breadth rule when the shadow is more than two finger breadths long. It is allowable to eat by the village-to-village rule. The meaning is: it is allowable to eat food that is not left, having been invited, saying, “I will go from village to village.” It is allowable to eat by the monastery rule. The meaning is: it is allowable to do the various acts of the Community, such as the Uposatha, separately in the various monasteries within the same territory.

original: anumatikappoti “anāgatānaṃ āgatakāle anumatiṃ gahessāmī”ti tesu anāgatesuyeva vaggena🔽saṅghena kammaṃ katvā pacchā anumatiṃ gahetuṃ kappati, vaggakammaṃ na hotīti adhippāyo.🔽Kappati āciṇṇakappoti ācariyupajjhāyehi āciṇṇo kappatīti attho. So pana ekacco kappati
analyzed: anumati kappo ti anāgatānam āgata kāle anumatim gahessāmi iti tesu vaggena 🔽saṅghena kammam katvā pacchā anumatim gahetum kappati vagga kammam na hoti iti adhippāyaḥ 🔽kappati āciṇṇakappo ti ācariya upajjhāyehi āciṇṇaḥ kappati iti attho so pana ekacco kappati
translated: It is allowable to eat salt, having taken it out and having taken it out, together with a mouthful of non-salt. The intention is that it is not allowable to store it. It is allowable by the two-finger breadth rule: it is allowable to eat food out of time when the shadow is two finger-breadths past noon. It is allowable by the village-boundary rule: it is allowable to eat food that is not left, having been invited, with the thought “I will go to another village”. It is allowable by the monastery rule: it is allowable to do the various acts of the Community such as the Uposatha within the one boundary in the various monasteries. It is allowable by the consent rule: it is allowable to do an act of the Community with a faction after having done it with a faction, thinking “I will get the consent of those who have not come when they come”. The intention is that it is not an act of a faction. It is allowable by the rule of what is customary: it is allowable if it is customary with the teachers and preceptors. But that is allowable

original: dhammiko, ekacco na kappati adhammikoti veditabbo. Kappati amathitakappoti yaṃ khīraṃ🔽khīrabhāvaṃ vijahitaṃ dadhibhāvaṃ asampattaṃ, taṃ bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittaṃ🔽bhuñjituṃ kappatīti attho. Kappati jalogiṃ pātunti ettha jalogīti taruṇasurā. Yaṃ
analyzed: dhammikaḥ ekaccaḥ na kappati adhammikaḥ iti veditabbaḥ kappati a mathita kappaḥ ti yam khīram  khīra bhāvam vijahitam dadhi bhāvam a sampattam tam bhuttāvinā pavāritena an atirittam  bhuñjitum kappati iti kappati jalogim pātunti ettha jalogī iti taruṇa surā yaṃ
translated: It should be understood that one is allowable and one is not. “Is allowable as long as it is not mixed” means that milk which has lost its milkness and has not yet reached curdness is allowable to eat by one who has finished his meal, if he is invited to partake of it, without it being a transgression of the rules. “Is allowable to drink the scum of boiled rice” means that the scum of boiled rice is young palm-spirit. “

original: majjasambhāraṃ ekato kataṃ majjabhāvamasampattaṃ, taṃ pātuṃ vaṭṭatīti adhippāyo.🔽Jātarūparajatanti sarasato vikāraṃ anāpajjitvā sabbadā jātaṃ rūpameva hotīti jātaṃ
analyzed: majja sambhāram ekatas katam majja bhāvam a sampattam tam pātum vaṭṭati iti adhippāyaḥ  jātarūpa rajatanti sarasataḥ vikāram an āpajjitvā sabbadā jātam rūpam eva hoti iti jātam
translated: It should be understood that one is allowable and the other is not. ‘Is allowable when unfermented’: milk that has lost its milkness and has not yet acquired the nature of curd is allowable for one who has finished his meal to eat without making a ceremony of it. This is the meaning. ‘Is allowable to drink the dregs’: here ‘dregs’ is young palm-spirit. The intention is that it is allowable to drink the mixture of yeast and water that has not yet acquired the nature of palm-spirit.

original: rūpametassāti jātarūpaṃ, suvaṇṇaṃ. Dhavalasabhāvatāya rājatīti rajataṃ, rūpiyaṃ.
analyzed: rūpam etassa ati jātarūpam suvaṇṇam dhavala sabhāvatāya rājati iti rajatam rūpiyam
translated: ‘Gold and silver’: it is always material form, without taking on the nature of a product. It is material form that is born , thus it is gold . It is silver because it shines , thus it is silver .

original: Susunāgaputtoti susunāgassa putto.
analyzed: susunāga putto ti susunāgassa putto
translated: ‘The son of Susunāga’: the son of Susunāga the elephant.

original: Kākaṇḍakaputtoti kākaṇḍakabrāhmaṇassa putto. Vajjīsūti janapadavacanattā bahuvacanaṃ
analyzed: kākaṇḍaka putto ti kākaṇḍaka brāhmaṇassa puttaḥ vajjīsu iti janapada vacana ttā bahuvacanam
translated: ‘The son of Kākaṇḍakā’: the son of the brahmin Kākaṇḍakā. ‘The Vajjis’: the plural form is because of the country.

original: kataṃ. Ekopi hi janapado ruḷhīsaddattā bahuvacanena vuccati. Yena vesālī, tadavasarīti
analyzed: ekaḥ api hi janapadaḥ bahuvacanena vuccati yena vesālī tad avasarī iti
translated: for a single country is spoken of in the plural because of the word “people” .

original: yena disābhāgena vesālī avasaritabbā, yasmiṃ vā padese vesālī, tadavasari, taṃ pattoti
analyzed: yena disā bhāgena vesālī avasaritabbā yasmin vā padese vesālī tad avasari tam
translated: By which direction Vesālī is to be approached, or in which direction Vesālī is situated, he approached that direction, he reached that place, is the meaning.

original: attho. Mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyanti ettha mahāvanaṃ nāma sayaṃjātamaropimaṃ saparicchedaṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ mahā vane ettha mahāvanam nāma sa paricchedam
translated: In the Great Wood, in the Gabled Hall: here the Great Wood is a large wood with a boundary,

original: mahantaṃ vanaṃ. Kapilavatthusāmantā pana mahāvanaṃ himavantena saha ekābaddhaṃ aparicchedaṃ
analyzed: mahantam vanam kapilavatthu sāmantā pana mahā vanam himavantena saha eka ābaddham a paricchedam
translated: grown up by itself, not planted by human beings. But the Great Wood near Kapilavatthu is connected with the Himalayas and has no boundary,

original: hutvā mahāsamuddaṃ āhacca ṭhitaṃ, idaṃ tādisaṃ na hotīti saparicchedaṃ mahantaṃ vananti🔽mahāvanaṃ. Kūṭāgārasālā pana mahāvanaṃ nissāya kate ārāme kūṭāgāraṃ anto katvā haṃsavaṭṭakacchannena
analyzed: hutvā mahā samuddaṃ ṭhitam idam tādisam na hoti iti sa paricchedam mahantam vananti  mahā vanam kūṭāgāra sālā pana mahā vanam nissāya kate ārāme kūṭāgāram antar katvā haṃsa vaṭṭaka channena
translated: and it extends from the Himalayas to the great ocean. This is not like that, so it is a large wood with a boundary.

original: haṃsamaṇḍalākārena katā.
analyzed: haṃsa maṇḍala ākārena katā
translated: The Gabled Hall was built in a monastery situated near the Great Wood. It was built with a gabled roof inside and was covered with a roof shaped like a swan’s outspread wings.🔽On the Uposatha day: here the word tadahuposathaṃ is to be analysed as tad ahūposathaṃ . The meaning is: on that day, on that occasion.

original: Tadahuposatheti ettha tadahūti tasmiṃ ahani, tasmiṃ divaseti attho. Upavasanti etthāti
analyzed: tadahu uposatha iti ettha tadahu uti tasmin ahani tasmin divase iti upavasanti ettha ati
translated: Upavasanti ettha = uposathaṃ .

original: uposatho, upavasitabbadivaso. Upavasantīti ca sīlena vā sabbaso āhārassa ca abhuñjanasaṅkhātena
analyzed: uposathaḥ upavasitabba divasaḥ upavasanti iti ca sīlena vā sabbasas āhārassa ca abhuñjana saṅkhātena
translated: Observance day: the day of observance, the Uposatha day. “Observing” means observing by means of virtue or by means of complete abstinence from food,

original: anasanena vā khīrapānamadhupānādimattena vā upetā hutvā vasantīti attho. So panesa🔽divaso aṭṭhamīcātuddasīpannarasībhedena tividho. Katthaci pana pātimokkhepi sīlepi🔽upavāsepi paññattiyampi uposathasaddo āgato. Tathā hesa “āyāmāvuso kappina, uposathaṃ
analyzed: an asanena vā khīra pāna madhu pāna ādi mattena vā upetāḥ hutvā vasanti iti attho so pana isa  divasaḥ aṭṭhamī cātuddasī pannarasī bhedena tividho katthaci pana pātimokkhe pi sīle pi  upavāse pi paññattiyam pi uposatha saddo āgato tathā ha esa āyāma āvuso kappinaḥ uposatham
translated: Uposatha is the day of the Uposatha observance. The meaning is that they live having approached it either by means of virtue or by means of fasting, which is called non-eating because of the non-eating of food, or by means of the drinking of milk, honey, etc.🔽This day is of three kinds as the fifteenth, fourteenth, and eighth of the lunar half-month. But in some Pāṭimokkhas it is found in the text of the virtue and in the text of the observance, too. For it is found in the directions for the Uposatha observance in the words, “Come, friends, let us go to the Uposatha” , etc.,

original: gamissāmā”tiādīsu pātimokkhuddese āgato. “Evaṃ aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgato kho visākhe uposatho
analyzed: gamissāma ati ādīsu pātimokkha uddese āgataḥ evam aṭṭhaṅga samannāgataḥ kho visākhe uposatho
translated: in the text of the virtue in the words, “Thus, Visākhā, the Uposatha observance is undertaken with eight component factors” , etc.,

original: upavuttho”tiādīsu sīle. “Suddhassa ve sadā pheggu, suddhassuposatho sadā”tiādīsu🔽upavāse. “Uposatho nāma nāgarājā”tiādīsu paññattiyañca āgato. Tattha upecca vasitabbato
analyzed: upavutthaḥ tiādīsu sīle suddhassa ve sadā pheggu suddhassa uposathaḥ sadā iti ādīsu  upavāse uposathaḥ nāma nāga rājā ati ādīsu paññattiyam ca āgataḥ tattha upecca vasitabbataḥ
translated: in the text of the observance in the words, “The pure one’s virtue is always pure, The pure one’s observance is always pure” ,

original: uposatho pātimokkhuddeso. Upetena samannāgatena hutvā vasitabbato santāne vāsetabbato
analyzed: uposathaḥ pātimokkha uddeso upetena samannāgatena hutvā vasitabbato santāne vāsetabbato
translated: and in the text of the designation in the words, “The king of nāgas called Uposatha” , etc. Herein, the Uposatha observance is the recital of the Pāṭimokkha because it is to be lived in by approaching it. It is virtue because it is to be lived in by means of what is approached, that is, by means of what is possessed, or because it is to be lived in by means of what is made to last in one’s life.

original: uposatho sīlaṃ. Asanādisaṃyamādiṃ vā upecca vasantīti uposatho upavāso. Tathārūpe🔽hatthiassavisese uposathoti samaññāmattato uposatho paññatti. Idha pana “na, bhikkhave,🔽tadahuposathe sabhikkhukā āvāsā”tiādīsu viya uposathadivaso adhippeto, tasmā tadahuposatheti
analyzed: uposathaḥ sīlam asana ādi saṃyama ādim vā upecca vasanti iti uposathaḥ upavāsaḥ tathārūpe  hatthi assa visese uposatho ti samaññā mattataḥ uposatho paññatti idha pana na bhikkhave  tadahu uposathe sa bhikkhukāḥ āvāsa ati ādīsu viya uposatha divaso adhippeto tasmā tadahu uposatha iti
translated: The observance day is virtue. Or else, “observance” is “uposatha” because one dwells having undertaken restraint in the sense of not doing such things as lying down on a high couch.🔽In the case of such special elephants and horses, the observance day is a mere designation.🔽Here, however, the observance day is intended as in such passages as “Bhikkhus, on that observance day, in an inhabited region where there are bhikkhus … ” , and therefore the meaning of “on that observance day” is “on that observance day.”

original: tasmiṃ uposathadivaseti attho. Kaṃsapātinti suvaṇṇapātiṃ. Kahāpaṇampītiādīsu kahāpaṇassa
analyzed: tasmin uposatha divase iti attho kaṃsapātim ti suvaṇṇa pātim kahāpaṇam pi itiādīsu kahāpaṇassa
translated: A golden bowl. In such passages as “a kahāpaṇa coin” ,🔽a kahāpaṇa coin is a half- kahāpaṇa coin. A quarter is a fourth part. A māsaka is just a māsaka coin.

original: samabhāgo aḍḍho. Pādo catutthabhāgo. Māsakoyeva māsakarūpaṃ. Sabbaṃ tāva vattabbanti
analyzed: sama bhāgaḥ aḍḍhaḥ pādo catuttha bhāgaḥ māsako yā iva māsaka rūpam sabbam tāva vattabbanti
translated: All this should be stated.

original: iminā sattasatikakkhandhake āgatā sabbāpi pāḷi idha ānetvā vattabbāti dasseti. Sā
analyzed: iminā sattasatika khandhake āgatā sabbā api pāḷi idha ānetvā vattabbā iti dasseti sā
translated: By this he shows that all the text given in the Book of the Discipline in the Seven Hundred should be brought in here and stated.🔽But where is that to be stated?

original: kuto vattabbāti āha “yāva imāya pana vinayasaṅgītiyā”tiādi. Saṅgāyitasadisameva saṅgāyiṃsūti sambandho.
analyzed: kutas vattabbā iti āha yāva imāya pana vinaya saṅgītiyā itiādi saṅgāyita sadisam eva saṅgāyiṃsu iti sambandhaḥ
translated: He says “up to the recitation of this Vinaya,” and so on. The construction is: they recited it as if they were reciting it together.

original: Pubbe kataṃ upādāyāti pubbe kataṃ paṭhamasaṅgītimupādāya. Sā panāyaṃ saṅgītīti sambandho.
analyzed: pubbe katam upādāya ati pubbe katam paṭhama saṅgītim upādāya sā pana ayam saṅgīti iti sambandhaḥ
translated: Pubbe kataṃ upādāyā ti pubbe kataṃ paṭhamasaṅgītiṃ upādāya. Sā panāyaṃ saṅgītī ti sambandho.

original: Tesūti tesu saṅgītikārakesu theresu. Vissutāti gaṇapāmokkhatāya vissutā sabbattha
analyzed: tesu iti tesu saṅgīti kārakesu theresu vissutā ati gaṇa pāmokkha tāya vissutā sabbattha
translated: Tesū ti tesu saṅgītikārakesu theresu. Vissutā ti gaṇapāmokkhatāya vissutā sabbattha

original: pākaṭā. Tasmiñhi sannipāte aṭṭheva gaṇapāmokkhā mahātherā ahesuṃ, tesu ca vāsabhagāmī
analyzed: pākaṭā tasmin hi sannipāte aṭṭha iva gaṇapāmokkhāḥ mahā therāḥ ahesum tesu ca vāsabhagāmī
translated: pākaṭā. Tasmiñhi sannipāte aṭṭheva gaṇapāmokkhā mahātherā ahesuṃ, tesu ca vāsabhagāmī

original: sumanoti dve therā anuruddhattherassa saddhivihārikā, avasesā cha ānandattherassa.
analyzed: sumanā ti dve therā anuruddha therassa saddhivihārikā avasesā cha ānanda therassa
translated: sumano ti dve therā anuruddhattherassa saddhivihārikā, avasesā cha ānandattherassa.

original: Ete pana sabbepi aṭṭha mahātherā bhagavantaṃ diṭṭhapubbā. Idāni te there sarūpato
analyzed: ete pana sabbe api aṭṭha mahā therāḥ bhagavantam diṭṭha pubbāḥ idāni te there sarūpato
translated: Ete pana sabbepi aṭṭha mahātherā bhagavantaṃ diṭṭhapubbā. Idāni te there sarūpato

original: dassento āha “sabbakāmī cā”tiādi. Sāṇasambhūtoti sāṇadesavāsī sambhūtatthero. Dutiyo
analyzed: dassentaḥ āha sabba kāmī ca atiādi sāṇa sambhūto ti sāṇa desa vāsī sambhūta theraḥ dutiyaḥ
translated: dassento āha “sabbakāmī cā” tiādi. Sāṇasambhūto ti sāṇadesavāsī sambhūtatthero. Dutiyo

original: saṅgahoti sambandho. Pannabhārāti patitakkhandhabhārā. “Bhārā have pañcakkhandhā”ti
analyzed: saṅgahaḥ iti sambandho panna bhārā ati patita kkhandha bhārāḥ bhārāḥ have pañca kkhandhā iti
translated: saṅgaho ti sambandho. Pannabhārā ti patitakkhandhabhārā. “Bhārā have pañcakkhandhā” ti

original: hi vuttaṃ. Katakiccāti catūsu saccesu catūhi maggehi kattabbassa pariññāpahānasaachakiriyābhāvanāsaṅkhātassa
analyzed: hi vuttam kata kiccā ati catūsu saccesu catūhi maggehi kattabbassa
translated: For this is said: “What is the function of the noble search? It is the function of abandoning the four kinds of search, namely, the search for sensual desires, the search for existence, the search for a false view, and the search for the undertaking of precepts and observances.”

original: soḷasavidhassapi kiccassa pariniṭṭhitattā katakiccā.🔽Abbudanti upaddavaṃ vadanti corakammampi bhagavato vacanaṃ thenetvā attano vacanassa
analyzed: soḷasavidhassa api kiccassa pariniṭṭhita ttā kata kiccā  abbudanti upaddavam vadanti cora kammam pi bhagavataḥ vacanam thenetvā attanaḥ vacanassa
translated: For this is said: “They have done what had to be done” : because the sixteen duties consisting in full-understanding, abandoning, full-enlightenment, and development, which have to be done in regard to the four truths, have been completed by them.🔽“A boil” : they call a boil a calamity. They also call a boil a thief, because it breaks out and causes pain.

original: dīpanato. Gaṇṭhipade pana “abbudaṃ gaṇḍo”ti vuttaṃ. Imanti vakkhamānanidassanaṃ.
analyzed: dīpanataḥ gaṇṭhi pade pana abbudam gaṇḍo ti vuttam iman ti vakkhamāna nidassanam
translated: But in the Gaṇṭhipaṭṭhāna it is said: “A boil is a tumour” . “This” : this refers to what is being spoken of.

original: Sandissamānā mukhā sammukhā. Uparibrahmalokūpapattiyā bhāvitamagganti uparibrahmaloke🔽upapattiyā uppāditajjhānaṃ. Jhānañhi tatrūpapattiyā upāyabhāvato idha “maggo”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Upāyo hi “maggo”ti vuccati. Vacanattho panettha – taṃ taṃ upapattiṃ maggati gavesati
analyzed: sandissamānāḥ mukhā sammukhāḥ upari brahmaloka upapattiyā bhāvita magganti upari brahmaloke  upapattiyā uppādita jhānam jhānam hi tatra upapattiyāḥ upāya bhāvataḥ idha maggaḥ ti vuttam  upāyaḥ hi maggaḥ ti vuccati vacana atthaḥ pana ittha tam tam upapattim maggati gavesati
translated: “Appearing” : appearing, coming into presence. “The path developed for rebirth in the upper Brahma-world” : the jhāna produced for rebirth in the upper Brahma-world.🔽For the jhāna is called “path” here because it is the means for rebirth there.🔽For a means is called a “path” . But the meaning of the word “path” here is to be understood as follows: it goes , it seeks , it generates , it produces that and that rebirth,

original: janeti nipphādetīti maggoti evaṃ veditabbo. Atthato cāyaṃ maggo nāma cetanāpi hoti
analyzed: janeti nipphādeti iti maggaḥ iti evam veditabbaḥ atthataḥ ca ayam maggaḥ nāma cetanā api hoti
translated: thus it is a path . And in the sense of volition also this path is a path.

original: cetanāsampayuttadhammāpi tadubhayampi. “Nirayañcāhaṃ, sāriputta, jānāmi nirayagāmiñca
analyzed: cetanā sampayutta dhammā api tat ubhayam pi nirayañca aham sāriputta jānāmi niraya gāmin ca
translated: and also the states associated with the volition are the path.

original: magga”nti hi ettha cetanā maggo nāma.
analyzed: magganti hi ettha cetanā maggaḥ nāma
translated: For in the passage “I know, Sāriputta, and I see that there is hell, and the way leading to hell” , volition is called the path.

original: “Saddhā hiriyaṃ kusalañca dānaṃ,
analyzed: saddhā hiriyam kusalam ca dānam
translated: “Faith, conscience, and the giving of what is good,

original: Dhammā ete sappurisānuyātā;
analyzed: dhammāḥ ete sappurisa anuyātā
translated: These things are followed by the noble ones;

original: Etañhi maggaṃ diviyaṃ vadanti,
analyzed: etat hi maggam diviyam vadanti
translated: This is the way to heaven, they say,

original: Etena hi gacchati devaloka”nti. –
analyzed: etena hi gacchati
translated: By this one goes to the world of the gods” .

original: Ettha cetanāsampayuttadhammā maggo nāma. “Ayaṃ bhikkhave maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā”ti saṅkhārūpapattisuttādīsu
analyzed: ettha cetanā sampayutta dhammā maggaḥ nāma ayam bhikkhave maggaḥ ayam paṭipadā ti saṅkhāra upapatti sutta ādīsu
translated: Herein, the states associated with the volition are called the path. In the passage “This, bhikkhus, is the way, this is the path for the purification of beings, for the surmounting of sorrow and lamentation, for the disappearance of pain and grief, for the attainment of the true way, for the realization of Nibbāna” ,

original: cetanāpi cetanāsampayuttadhammāpi maggo nāma. Imasmiṃ ṭhāne jhānassa adhippetattā
analyzed: cetanā api cetanā sampayutta dhammā api maggaḥ nāma imasmiṃ ṭhāne jhānassa adhippeta ttā
translated: both the volition and the states associated with the volition are called the path. But here only the states associated with the volition should be taken,

original: cetanāsampayuttadhammā gahetabbā.🔽Moggalibrāhmaṇassāti lokasammatassa aputtakassa moggalināmabrāhmaṇassa. Nanu ca kathametaṃ
analyzed: cetanā sampayutta dhammā gahetabbā  moggali brāhmaṇassa ati loka sammatassa aputtakassa moggali nāma brāhmaṇassa nanu ca katham etam
translated: because the jhāna is intended.🔽Moggallī the brahmin: Moggallī was his name, and he was a brahmin. But how is it that it is said, “He will be reborn in the house of Moggallī the brahmin” ?

original: nāma vuttaṃ “moggalibrāhmaṇassa gehe paṭisandhiṃ gahessatī”ti. Kiṃ uparūpapattiyā
analyzed: nāma vuttam moggali brāhmaṇassa gehe paṭisandhim gahessati iti kim uparu upapattiyā
translated: What is meant is that he will be reborn in the house of a brahmin named Moggallī.

original: paṭiladdhasamāpattīnampi kāmāvacare uppatti hotīti? Hoti. Sā ca katādhikārānaṃ mahāpuññānaṃ
analyzed: paṭiladdha samāpattīnam pi kāmāvacare uppatti hoti iti hoti sā ca kata adhikārānam mahā puññānam
translated: And does it occur in the sense sphere to those who have obtained jhāna attainment? It does. And that is for those who have done their duty and are great in merit,

original: cetopaṇidhivasena hoti, na sabbesanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Atha mahaggatassa garukakammassa
analyzed: cetaḥ upaṇidhi vasena hoti na sabbesanti daṭṭhabbam atha mahaggatassa garuka kammassa
translated: And does it occur in the sense-desire existence for those who have attained jhāna? It occurs. And that is to be seen as occurring only for those who have done meritorious deeds and who have a strong aspiration, not for all.

original: vipākaṃ paṭibāhitvā parittakammaṃ kathamattano vipākassa okāsaṃ karotīti? Ettha ca
analyzed: vipākam paṭibāhitvā paritta kammam katham attanaḥ vipākassa okāsam karoti iti ettha ca
translated: Then, does a minor deed make room for its own result by preventing the result of a major deed?

original: tāva tīsupi gaṇṭhipadesu idaṃ vuttaṃ “nikantibaleneva jhānā parihāyati, tato parihīnajjhānā🔽nibbattantī”ti. Keci pana “anīvaraṇāvatthāya nikantiyā jhānassa parihāni vīmaṃsitvā🔽gahetabbā”ti vatvā evamettha kāraṇaṃ vadanti “satipi mahaggatakammuno vipākapaṭibāhanasamatthassa
analyzed: tāva tīsu pi gaṇṭhi padesu idam vuttam nikanti balena iva jhānā parihāyati tatas parihīna jhānā  nibbattanti iti keci pana anīvaraṇa avatthāya nikantiyā jhānassa vīmaṃsitvā  gahetabbā iti vatvā evam ettha kāraṇam vadanti sati api mahaggata kammunaḥ vipāka paṭibāhana samatthassa
translated: And here, in the first three sections, this is said: “Jhāna is lost only through the power of rebirth-linking. Then those who have lost jhāna are reborn.

original: parittakammassapi abhāve ‘ijjhati, bhikkhave, sīlavato cetopaṇidhi visuddhattā’ti
analyzed: paritta kammassa api abhāve ijjhati bhikkhave sīlavato cetopaṇidhi
translated: ” But some, after considering the loss of jhāna through aspiration for a state free from hindrances, have taken it thus and have given the reason in this way: “Although there is no minor deed capable of preventing the result of a major deed, still, since it is said, ‘Bhikkhus, the aspiration of one who is virtuous succeeds because of the purity of his character’ ,

original: vacanato kāmabhave cetopaṇidhi mahaggatakammassa vipākaṃ paṭibāhitvā parittakammuno
analyzed: vacanataḥ kāma bhave cetaḥ paṇidhi mahaggata kammassa vipākam paṭibāhitvā paritta kammunaḥ
translated: the aspiration in the sense-desire existence prevents the result of a major deed and makes room for the result of a minor deed.

original: vipākassa okāsaṃ karotī”ti.🔽Sādhu sappurisāti ettha sādhūti āyācanatthe nipāto, taṃ yācāmāti attho. Haṭṭhapahaṭṭhoti
analyzed: vipākasya okāsam karoti iti  sādhu sappurisa ati ettha sādhu iti āyācana atthe nipātaḥ tam yācāma ati atthaḥ haṭṭha pahaṭṭhā iti
translated: He makes a chance for the result.”

original: cittapīṇanavasena punappunaṃ santuṭṭho. Udaggudaggoti sarīravikāruppādanapītivasena
analyzed: citta pīṇana vasena punappunam santuṭṭhaḥ udaggu udaggo iti sarīra vikāra uppādana pīti vasena
translated: Herein, “Good people” is a vocative expressing entreaty, the meaning is “I entreat you.” “Delighted, elated” means satisfied again and again by the delight of the mind. “With uplifted faces” means with the appearance of joy.

original: udaggudaggo. Pītimā hi puggalo kāyacittānaṃ uggatattā abbhuggatattā “udaggo”ti vuccati.
analyzed: udagga udaggaḥ pītimā hi puggalo kāya cittānam uggata ttā abbhuggata ttā udaggaḥ iti vuccati
translated: For a person who is delighted is said to be “uplifted” because of the uplifting, the raising up, of body and mind.

original: Sādhūti paṭissuṇitvāti “sādhū”ti paṭivacanaṃ datvā. Tīretvāti niṭṭhapetvā. Puna paccāgamiṃsūti
analyzed: sādhu iti paṭissuṇitvā ati sādhu iti paṭivacanam da tvā tīretvā ati niṭṭhapetvā puna paccāgamiṃsu iti
translated: “Having agreed” means having given assent by saying “Good.” “Having crossed over” means having finished. “They came back” means they came back again.

original: puna āgamiṃsu. Tena kho pana samayenāti yasmiṃ samaye dutiyasaṅgītiṃ akaṃsu, tasmiṃ
analyzed: punar āgamiṃsu tena khalu pana samayena ati yasmin samaye dutiya saṅgītim akaṃsu tasmin
translated: At that time means at the time when they held the second council.

original: samayeti attho. Navakāti vuttamevatthaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “daharabhikkhū”ti vuttaṃ. Taṃ
analyzed: samaya iti atthaḥ navakā iti vuttam eva attham vibhāvetum dahara bhikkhū iti vuttam tam
translated: The meaning is: at that time. “Young bhikkhus” is said to illustrate the meaning already stated as “new.”

original: adhikaraṇaṃ na sampāpuṇiṃsūti taṃ vajjiputtakehi uppāditaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vinicchinituṃ
analyzed: adhikaraṇam na sampāpuṇiṃsu iti tam vajji puttakehi uppāditam adhikaraṇam vinicchinitum
translated: They did not reach a decision on that legal question means they did not reach a decision on the legal question raised by the Vajjians.

original: na sampāpuṇiṃsu nāgamiṃsu. No ahuvatthāti sambandho. Idaṃ daṇḍakammanti idāni vattabbaṃ🔽sandhāya vuttaṃ. Yāvatāyukaṃ ṭhatvā parinibbutāti sambandho, yāva attano attano āyuparimāṇaṃ,
analyzed: na sampāpuṇiṃsu na āgamiṃsu no sambandho idam daṇḍa kamman ti idāni vattabbam  sandhāya vuttam yāvatāyukam ṭhatvā parinibbutā iti sambandhaḥ yāva attanaḥ attanaḥ āyu parimāṇam
translated: They did not reach it, they did not come to it. The construction is: “No ahuvatthā.” The present is said with reference to the future.

analyzed: kim pana katvā te therā parinibbutā iti āha dutiyam saṅgaham katvā ati ādi anāgate pi  saddhamma vuḍḍhiyā hetum katvā parinibbutā ati sambandhaḥ idāni te api nāma evam mahā anubhāvā

translated: The doctrines of the Hemavatas, the Rajagirikas, the Siddhatthikas, the Pubbaseliyas, the Aparaseliyas, and the Vajiriyas,🔽These six doctrines arose in succession.

original: pavattamāne sāsane asoko dhammarājā paṭiladdhasaddho divase divase buddhapūjāya satasahassaṃ,
analyzed: pavattamāne sāsane asokaḥ dhamma rājā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ divase divase buddha pūjāya sata sahassam
translated: In the Dispensation which continued in this way with the eighteen doctrines of the Elders, King Asoka, having obtained faith, gave a hundred thousand pieces of money every day for the worship of the Buddha,

original: dhammapūjāya satasahassaṃ, saṅghapūjāya satasahassaṃ, attano ācariyassa nigrodhattherassa
analyzed: dhamma pūjāya sata sahassam saṅgha pūjāya sata sahassam attano ācariyassa nigrodha ttherassa
translated: a hundred thousand for the worship of the Dhamma, a hundred thousand for the worship of the Sangha, and a hundred thousand for his own teacher, the Elder Nigrodha,

original: satasahassaṃ, catūsu dvāresu bhesajjatthāya satasahassanti pañca satasahassāni pariccajanto
analyzed: sata sahassam catūsu dvāresu bhesajja tthāya sata sahassanti pañca sata sahassāni pariccajanto
translated: and at the four gates of the city he gave a hundred thousand pieces of money for the sake of medicine. Thus he gave five hundred thousand pieces of money every day.

original: sāsane uḷāraṃ lābhasakkāraṃ pavattesi. Tadā hatalābhasakkārehi titthiyehi uppāditaṃ🔽anekappakāraṃ sāsanamalaṃ visodhetvā moggaliputtatissatthero tipiṭakapariyattidharānaṃ
analyzed: sāsane uḷāram lābha sakkāram pavattesi tadā hata lābha sakkārehi titthiyehi uppāditam  aneka ppakāram sāsana malam visodhetvā moggaliputta tissa theraḥ
translated: and he caused to be proclaimed in the Dispensation the high gain and honour . Then the Elder Moggaliputtatissa, having purified the Dispensation of the Master from the many kinds of stains that had arisen through the heretics who had been deprived of gain and honour,

original: pabhinnapaṭisambhidānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ sahassamekaṃ gahetvā yathā mahākassapatthero ca
analyzed: pabhinna paṭisambhidānam bhikkhūnam sahassam ekam gahetvā yathā mahākassapa thero ca
translated: and having taken a thousand monks who had mastered the three baskets of the scriptures and who had attained the analytical knowledges ,

original: yasatthero ca dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyiṃsu, evameva saṅgāyanto tatiyasaṅgītiṃ akāsi.
analyzed: ca dhammam ca vinayam ca evam eva saṅgāyantaḥ tatiya saṅgītim akāsi
translated: just as the Elder Mahākassapa and the Elder Yasas had compiled the Dhamma and the Vinaya, so he too compiled them and made the Third Rehearsal.

original: Idāni taṃ tatiyasaṅgītiṃ mūlato pabhuti vitthāretvā dassento āha “tissopi kho mahābrahmā
analyzed: idāni tam tatiya saṅgītim mūlataḥ vitthāretvā dassentaḥ āha tissaḥ api kho mahābrahmā
translated: Now, in order to show that Third Rehearsal in detail from the beginning, he said: “Tissa the Great Brahma,

original: brahmalokato cavitvā moggalibrāhmaṇassa gehe paṭisandhiṃ aggahesī”tiādi.🔽Tattha gehe paṭisandhiṃ aggahesīti moggalibrāhmaṇassa gehe brāhmaṇiyā kucchimhi paṭisandhiṃ
analyzed: brahma lokataḥ cavitvā moggali brāhmaṇassa gehe paṭisandhim aggahesi itiādi  tattha gehe paṭisandhim aggahesi iti moggali brāhmaṇassa gehe brāhmaṇiyā kucchimhi paṭisandhim
translated: having passed away from the Brahma-world, took rebirth in the house of Moggali the brahman.”🔽Herein, he took rebirth in the house means he took rebirth in the womb of the brahman’s wife in the house of Moggali the brahman.

original: aggahesīti attho. Gehassa pana tannissayattā nissite nissayavohāravasena “gehe paṭisandhiṃ
analyzed: aggahesi iti atthaḥ gehassa pana tad nissaya ttā nissite nissaya vohāra vasena gehe paṭisandhim
translated: The meaning is that he took rebirth in the house of Moggali the brahman. But because the house is the support of the womb, the womb is figuratively spoken of as the house. “He took rebirth in the house” is said by way of the usage of support for the supported.

original: aggahesī”ti vuttaṃ yathā “mañcā ukkuṭṭhiṃ karonti, sabbo gāmo āgato”ti. Sattavassānīti🔽accantasaṃyoge upayogavacanaṃ. Aticchathāti atikkamitvā icchatha, idha bhikkhā na
analyzed: aggahesi iti vuttam yathā mañcāḥ ukkuṭṭhim karonti sabbaḥ gāmaḥ āgataḥ ti satta vassāni iti  ac c anta saṃyoge upayoga vacanam aticchatha ati atikkamitvā icchatha idha bhikkhā na
translated: “He took it” is said as in the case of the statement: “The beds make a noise, the whole village has come.” “For seven years”

original: labbhati, ito aññattha gantvā bhikkhaṃ pariyesathāti adhippāyo. “Bho pabbajitā”tiādi
analyzed: labbhati itas aññattha gantvā bhikkham pariyesatha ati adhippāyaḥ bho pabbajita atiādi
translated: is a statement of the length of time in the case of the most extreme connection. “You have gone beyond” means you have exceeded; the intention is: “Here alms are not obtained; go elsewhere and seek alms.” “Good recluses” and so on

original: brāhmaṇo attano gehe bhikkhālābhaṃ anicchanto āha. Paṭiyāditabhattatoti sampādetvā🔽ṭhapitabhattato. Tadupiyanti tadanurūpaṃ. Upasamaṃ disvāti therassa kāyacittavūpasamaṃ🔽punappunaṃ disvā, ñatvāti attho. Iriyāpathavūpasamasandassanena hi tannibandhino🔽cittassa yoniso pavattiupasamopi viññāyati. Bhiyyoso mattāya pasīditvāti punappunaṃ
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ attanaḥ gehe bhikkhā lābham an icchantaḥ āha sampādetvā  tad upiyanti tad anurūpam upasamam disvā ati therassa kāya citta vūpasamam  punappunam disvā ñatvā iti atthaḥ iriyāpatha vūpasama sandassanena hi tad nibandhinaḥ  cittassa yonisas pavatti upasamaḥ api viññāyati bhiyyosas mattāya pasīditvā ati punappunam
translated: is what the brahmin said, not wanting to give alms in his own house. “From the meal that was prepared” means from the meal that was made ready🔽and set aside. “In accordance with that” means in accordance with that. “Seeing his peace” means seeing again and again the peace of the elder’s body and mind; the meaning is, knowing. For by showing the peace of his deportment, the peace of his mind bound up with that deportment is also known, its proper functioning. “He became even more confident” means he became more confident again and again,

original: visesato adhikataraṃ pasīditvā. Bhattavissaggakaraṇatthāyāti bhattakiccakaraṇatthāya.
analyzed: visesataḥ adhikataram pasīditvā bhatta vissagga karaṇa tthāya ati bhatta kicca karaṇa tthāya
translated: more so than before. “In order to give the meal” means in order to do the duty of the meal.

original: Adhivāsetvāti sampaṭicchitvā.🔽Soḷasavassuddesikoti soḷasavassoti uddisitabbo voharitabboti soḷasavassuddeso, soyeva
analyzed: adhivāsetvā ati sampaṭicchitvā  soḷasa vassuddesiko ti soḷasa vassaḥ ti uddisitabbaḥ voharitabbaḥ iti soḷasa vassuddeso saḥ yā iva
translated: Having consented: having agreed.🔽One who is sixteen years old: one who should be called or spoken of as sixteen years old is one who is sixteen years old.

original: soḷasavassuddesiko. Soḷasavassoti vā uddisitabbataṃ arahatīti soḷasavassuddesiko,🔽soḷasavassāni vā uddisitabbāni assāti soḷasavassuddesiko, soḷasavassoti uddeso vā
analyzed: soḷasa vassuddesiko soḷasa vassaḥ ti vā uddisitabbatam arahati iti soḷasa vassuddesiko  soḷasa vassāni vā uddisitabbāni assa ati soḷasa vassuddesikaḥ soḷasa vassaḥ ti uddesaḥ vā
translated: He is one who is sixteen years old. Or he is fit to be called sixteen years old, thus he is one who is sixteen years old.

original: assa atthīti soḷasavassuddesiko, atthato pana soḷasavassikoti vuttaṃ hoti. Tiṇṇaṃ
analyzed: assa atthi iti soḷasa vassuddesiko atthato pana soḷasa vassiko ti vuttam hoti tiṇṇam
translated: Or sixteen years should be called his, thus he is one who is sixteen years old. Or he has sixteen years to be called, thus he is one who is sixteen years old. But in the sense of the words he is one who is sixteen years old, he is one who is sixteen years old.

original: vedānaṃ pāragūti iruvedayajuvedasāmavedasaṅkhātānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ vedānaṃ paguṇakaraṇavasena
analyzed: vedānam iru veda yaju veda sāmaveda saṅkhātānam tiṇṇam vedānam paguṇa karaṇa vasena
translated: Having mastered the three Vedas: having gone to the other side by means of making the three Vedas, called the Rg Veda, the Yajus Veda, and the Sama Veda, familiar.🔽He is one who has gone to the other side, thus he is one who has mastered the three Vedas. Herein, the compound should be understood as a copulative one with the meaning of a genitive one, since it is a constant requirement.

original: pāraṃ gatoti pāragū. Pāragūti cettha niccasāpekkhatāya samāsādikaṃ veditabbaṃ. Laggetvāti
analyzed: pāram gataḥ ti pāragū pāragū iti ca ittha nicca sāpekkha tāya samāsa ādikam veditabbam laggetvā iti
translated: Having hung up: having suspended.

original: olambetvā. Na ca kācīti ettha ca-saddo avadhāraṇe, kāci kathā neva uppajjatīti attho.
analyzed: olambetvā na ca kāci iti ettha ca saddaḥ avadhāraṇe kāci kathā na iva uppajjati iti atthaḥ
translated: And no conversation: the word and in the text is for the purpose of including; the meaning is, no conversation arises.

original: Pallaṅkanti nisīditabbāsanaṃ. Uppajjissatīti etthāpi “kathā”ti idaṃ ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ.
analyzed: pallaṅkanti nisīditabba āsanam uppajjissati iti ettha api kathā ati idam ānetvā sambandhitabbam
translated: “A seat” is a seat to sit on. “Will arise” : here too the word “talk” should be brought in and connected.

original: Kupito anattamanoti kopena kupito, anattamano domanassena. Domanassasamaṅgī hi puggalo
analyzed: kupitaḥ anatta manoti kopena kupitaḥ anatta manaḥ domanassena domanassa samaṅgī hi puggalo
translated: Angry, displeased: angry through anger, displeased through displeasure. For a person who is possessed of displeasure

original: pītisukhehi na attamano na attacittoti anattamanoti vuccati. Na sakamanoti vā anattamano
analyzed: pīti sukhehi na atta manaḥ na atta citto ti anattamano ti vuccati na sa kamano ti vā anattamano
translated: is not pleased, not delighted, with happiness and joy, and so he is called “displeased.” Or “not pleased with himself” means “displeased.”

original: attano vase aṭṭhitacittattā.🔽Caṇḍikkabhāveti caṇḍiko vuccati caṇḍo thaddhapuggalo, tassa bhāvo caṇḍikkaṃ, thaddhabhāvoti
analyzed: attanaḥ vase aṭṭhita citta ttā  caṇḍikka bhāveti caṇḍikaḥ vuccati caṇḍaḥ thaddha puggalo tassa bhāvo caṇḍikkam thaddha bhāvo ti
translated: Because his mind is not established in his own will.

original: attho. Idha pana “caṇḍikkabhāve”ti vuttattā caṇḍikoyeva caṇḍikkanti gahetabbaṃ, tena
analyzed: atthaḥ idha pana caṇḍikka bhāve ti vutta ttā caṇḍiko yā iva caṇḍikkam ti gahetabbam tena
translated: “In a state of anger” : one who is angry is called “angry,” “fierce,” “hard-hearted.” The state of that is “a state of anger,” the meaning is, “a state of being hard-hearted.” But here, since it is said “in a state of anger,” “angry” itself should be taken as “a state of anger.” Therefore

original: “caṇḍikkabhāve”ti ettha thaddhabhāveti attho veditabbo. Kiñci mantanti kiñci vedaṃ.
analyzed: caṇḍikka bhāvā iti ettha thaddha bhāvā iti atthaḥ veditabbo kiñci mantanti kiñci
translated: the meaning of “a state of anger” should be understood as “a state of being hard-hearted.” “Some spell”: some charm.

original: Aññe ke jānissantīti na keci jānissantīti adhippāyo. Pucchitvā sakkā jānitunti attano
analyzed: aññe ke jānissanti iti na keci jānissanti iti adhippāyaḥ pucchitvā sakkā jānitunti attanaḥ
translated: “Who else will know?” : the intention is that no one else will know. “It can be known by asking” : by asking

original: padesañāṇe ṭhitattā thero evamāha. Sabbaññubuddhā eva hi “puccha, māṇava, yadākaṅkhasī”tiādinā
analyzed: padesa ñāṇe theraḥ evam āha sabbaññu buddhāḥ eva hi puccha māṇava yat ākaṅkhasi itiādinā
translated: The Elder said this because he was limited to knowledge of a part.🔽For only the Omniscient Buddhas invite with the invitation of omniscience, which is not shared by Paccekabuddhas and others, with the words: “Ask, student, whatever you wish.”

original: paccekabuddhādīhi asādhāraṇaṃ sabbaññupavāraṇaṃ pavārenti. Sāvakā pana padesañāṇe
analyzed: paccekabuddha ādīhi asādhāraṇam sabbaññu pavāraṇam pavārenti sāvakāḥ pana padesa ñāṇe
translated: But disciples, because they are limited to knowledge of a part,

original: ṭhitattā “sutvā vedissāmā”ti vā “pucchitvā sakkā jānitu”nti vā vadanti.
analyzed: ṭhita ttā sutvā vedissāma ati vā pucchitvā sakkāḥ jānitunti vā vadanti
translated: say, “We will know when we have heard,” or “It is possible to know when we have asked.”🔽In the three Vedas, etc.: the three Vedas are as already stated.

original: Tīsu vedesūtiādīsu tayo vedā pubbe vuttanayā eva. Nighaṇḍūti nāmanighaṇḍurukkhādīnaṃ
analyzed: tīsu vedesu utiādīsu tayaḥ vedā pubbe vutta nayāḥ eva nighaṇḍu uti nāma nighaṇḍu rukkha ādīnam
translated: The Nighaṇḍu is a book that reveals the synonyms of names, trees, etc.

original: vevacanappakāsakaṃ satthaṃ, vevacanappakāsakanti ca pariyāyasaddadīpakanti attho,
analyzed: vevacana ppakāsakam sattham vevacana ppakāsakanti ca pariyāya sadda dīpakanti attho
translated: The meaning of “reveals synonyms” is “illuminates synonyms,”

original: ekekassa atthassa anekapariyāyavacanavibhāvakanti vuttaṃ hoti. Nidassanamattañcetaṃ
analyzed: ekekassa atthassa aneka pariyāya vacana vibhāvakan ti vuttam hoti nidassana mattam ca itam
translated: which is the same as “reveals the various ways of expressing the same meaning.”🔽But this is only a mere indication,

original: anekesaṃ atthānaṃ ekasaddassa vacanīyatāvibhāvanavasenapi tassa ganthassa pavattattā.
analyzed: anekesam atthānam eka saddassa vacanīya tā vibhāvana vasena api tassa ganthassa pavatta ttā
translated: because that book is also composed in order to reveal the various ways of expressing the same meaning by means of a single word for many meanings.

original: Vacanīyavācakabhāvena atthaṃ saddañca nikhaṇḍeti bhindati vibhajja dassetīti nikhaṇḍu,
analyzed: vacanīya vācaka bhāvena attham saddam ca nikhaṇḍeti bhindati vibhajja dasseti iti nikhaṇḍu
translated: It is called Nighaṇḍu because it “breaks” , “divides,” and “reveals” the meaning and the word by means of the relation of the expressed and the expresser.

original: so eva idha kha-kārassa gha-kāraṃ katvā nighaṇḍūti vutto. Keṭubhanti kiriyākappavikappo
analyzed: saḥ eva idha khakārassa ghakāram katvā nighaṇḍu iti vuttaḥ keṭubhanti kiriyā kappa vikappo
translated: and that is what is called Nighaṇḍu here by changing the kha- to gha-. Keṭubha is a treatise on the analysis of the mode of action.

original: kavīnaṃ upakārasatthaṃ. Ettha ca kiriyākappavikappoti vacībhedādilakkhaṇā kiriyā🔽kappīyati vikappīyati etenāti kiriyākappo, so pana vaṇṇapadabandhapadatthādivibhāgato
analyzed: kavīnam upakāra sattham ettha ca vacī bheda ādi lakkhaṇā kiriyā  kappīyati vikappīyati etena ati kiriyākappo so pana vaṇṇa pada bandha pada attha ādi vibhāgato
translated: And here the analysis of the mode of action is the mode of action that has the characteristic of the analysis of the various kinds of words, etc.,🔽because it is analysed, is analysed out, by that. But because it is analysed out in many ways by the division into the analysis of phonemes, the analysis of words, the analysis of word-meanings, etc.,

original: bahuvikappoti kiriyākappavikappoti vuccati. Idañca mūlakiriyākappaganthaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: bahu vikappo ti kiriyā kappa vikappo ti vuccati idam ca mūla kiriyā kappa gantham sandhāya
translated: it is called the analysis of the mode of action. And this is said with reference to the root text on the analysis of the mode of action.

original: vuttaṃ. So hi satasahassaparimāṇo nayādicariyādikaṃ pakaraṇaṃ. Vacanatthato pana
analyzed: vuttam saḥ hi sata sahassa parimāṇaḥ naya ādi cariyā ādikam pakaraṇam vacana atthataḥ pana
translated: For that is a treatise consisting of a hundred thousand lines on the method of the three Vedas, etc., and on the method of the three Vedas, etc., with Nighaṇḍu and Keṭubha.

original: kiṭati gameti kiriyādivibhāgaṃ, taṃ vā anavasesapariyādānato gamento pūretīti keṭubhanti
analyzed: kiriyā ādi vibhāgam tam vā anavasesa pariyādānataḥ pūreti iti
translated: But in the sense of the meaning of the words it is called Keṭubha because it goes to the village of the analysis of the mode of action, or because it goes to fill it up by completely exhausting it.

original: vuccati, saha nighaṇḍunā keṭubhena ca sanighaṇḍukeṭubhā, tayo vedā. Tesu sanighaṇḍukeṭubhesu.🔽Ṭhānakaraṇādivibhāgato nibbacanavibhāgato ca akkharā pabhedīyanti etenāti akkharappabhedo,
analyzed: vuccati saha nighaṇḍunā keṭubhena ca sa nighaṇḍu keṭubhā tayaḥ vedā tesu sa nighaṇḍu keṭubhesu 🔽ṭhāna karaṇa ādi vibhāgataḥ nibbacana vibhāgataḥ ca akkharā etena ati akkharappabhedaḥ
translated: And with Nighaṇḍu and Keṭubha it is the three Vedas with Nighaṇḍu and Keṭubha. In those three Vedas with Nighaṇḍu and Keṭubha.🔽The analysis of phonemes is that by which phonemes are divided according to the division of place of articulation, organ of articulation, etc., and according to the division of the mode of pronunciation.

original: sikkhā ca nirutti ca. Saha akkharappabhedenāti sākkharappabhedā, tesu sākkharappabhedesu.
analyzed: sikkhā ca nirutti ca saha akkhara ppabhedena ati sākkhara ppabhedā tesu sākkhara ppabhedesu
translated: and the training and the language. Together with the analysis of the letters: with the analysis of the letters, in the analysis of the letters.

original: Itihāsapañcamesūti athabbanavedaṃ catutthaṃ katvā “itiha āsa itiha āsā”ti īdisavacanapaṭisaṃyutto
analyzed: itihāsa pañcamesu iti athabbana vedam catuttham katvā iti ha āsa iti ha āsa ati īdisa vacana paṭisaṃyuttaḥ
translated: In the five with the Itihasa: the Atharva Veda is the fourth. “Itiha asa itiha asa” is a statement connected with such words.

original: purāṇakathāsaṅkhāto itihāso pañcamo etesanti itihāsapañcamā, tayo vedā. Tesu itihāsapañcamesu.
analyzed: purāṇa kathā saṅkhātaḥ itihāsaḥ pañcamaḥ etesanti itihāsa pañcamā tayaḥ vedā tesu itihāsa pañcamesu
translated: The fifth is the Itihasa, which is called the ancient stories, of these. In the five with the Itihasa, in the three Vedas.

original: Neva attanā passatīti neva sayaṃ passati, neva jānātīti attho. Puccha, byākarissāmīti
analyzed: na iva attanā passati iti na iva sayam passati na iva jānāti iti attho puccha byākarissāmi iti
translated: He does not see for himself: he does not see for himself, he does not know, is the meaning. Ask, I will explain.

original: “sabbāpi pucchā vedesuyeva antogadhā”ti sallakkhento evamāha.
analyzed: sabbā api pucchā vedesu yeva antogadhā ti sallakkhentaḥ evam āha
translated: “All questions are included in the Vedas,” considering thus, he said this.

original: Yassa cittantiādipañhadvayaṃ cuticittasamaṅgino khīṇāsavassa cuticittassa uppādakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: yassa citta nti ādi pañha dvayam cuti citta samaṅgino khīṇāsavassa cuti cittassa uppāda kkhaṇam
translated: The pair of questions beginning with “Whose consciousness” is said with reference to the arising of the death consciousness of the one who is an Arahant and has exhausted the taints.

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tattha paṭhamapañhe uppajjatīti uppādakkhaṇasamaṅgitāya uppajjati.
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam tattha paṭhama pañhe uppajjati iti uppāda khaṇa samaṅgi tāya uppajjati
translated: Herein, in the first question, “Arises” is said because of the possession of the moment of arising.

original: Na nirujjhatīti nirodhakkhaṇaṃ appattatāya na nirujjhati. Tassa cittanti tassa puggalassa
analyzed: na nirujjhati iti nirodha kkhaṇam appatta tāya na nirujjhati tassa cittam ti tassa puggalassa
translated: “Does not cease” is said because of the non-arrival at the moment of cessation. “That consciousness” is the consciousness of that person.

original: tato paṭṭhāya cittaṃ nirujjhissati nuppajjissatīti pucchati. Yassa vā panātiādike
analyzed: tatas paṭṭhāya cittam nirujjhissati nuppajjissati iti pucchati yassa vā pana atiādike
translated: He asks whether the consciousness of that person will cease without arising.

original: pana dutiyapañhe nirujjhissatīti yassa cittaṃ bhaṅgakkhaṇaṃ patvā nirujjhissati.🔽Nuppajjissatīti bhaṅgato parabhāge sayaṃ vā aññaṃ vā nuppajjissati, tassa puggalassa
analyzed: pana dutiya pañhe nirujjhissati iti yassa cittam bhaṅga kkhaṇam patvā nirujjhissati  nuppajjissati iti bhaṅgataḥ parabhāge sayam vā aññam vā nuppajjissati tassa puggalassa
translated: In the second question, “Whose consciousness will cease without arising?”🔽he asks whether the consciousness of that person will cease after reaching the moment of dissolution.🔽“Without arising” means that it will not arise either by itself or through another after the moment of dissolution.

original: cittaṃ uppajjati na nirujjhatīti pucchati. Imesaṃ pana pañhānaṃ paṭhamo pañho vibhajjabyākaraṇīyo,

original: tasmā “yassa cittaṃ uppajjati na nirujjhati, tassa cittaṃ nirujjhissati nuppajjissatī”ti
analyzed: tasmā yassa cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati tassa cittam nirujjhissati na uppajjissati iti
translated: Therefore, when asked, “Is it the case that the consciousness of one whose consciousness arises without ceasing will cease without arising?”

original: evaṃ puṭṭhena satā evamayaṃ pañho ca vissajjetabbo “pacchimacittassa uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: evam puṭṭhena satā evam ayam pañho ca vissajjetabbo pacchimacittassa uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: this question should be answered as follows: “At the arising moment of the last consciousness,

original: tesaṃ cittaṃ uppajjati na nirujjhati nirujjhissati na uppajjissati, itaresaṃ cittassa
analyzed: tesam cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati nirujjhissati na uppajjissati itaresam cittassa
translated: the consciousness of those whose consciousness arises without ceasing will cease without arising.🔽At the arising moment of the other consciousnesses, the consciousness of those

original: uppādakkhaṇe tesaṃ cittaṃ uppajjati na nirujjhati, nirujjhissati ceva uppajjissati
analyzed: uppāda kkhaṇe tesam cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati nirujjhissati ca iva uppajjissati
translated: whose consciousness arises without ceasing will cease as well as arise.”

original: cā”ti. Yesañhi paricchinnavaṭṭadukkhānaṃ khīṇāsavānaṃ sabbapacchimassa cuticittassa🔽uppādakkhaṇe vattati, tesaṃ tadeva cuticittaṃ nirujjhissati nuppajjissatīti. Uppādappattatāya
analyzed: ca ati yesam hi paricchinna vaṭṭa dukkhānam khīṇa āsavānam sabba pacchimassa cuti cittassa  uppāda kkhaṇe vattati tesam tat eva cuti cittam nirujjhissati na uppajjissati iti uppāda ppatta tāya
translated: at the moment of arising of the last consciousness of passing away,🔽that consciousness is called “arising” because it has reached arising, and it is called “not ceasing” because it has not reached cessation.

original: uppajjati nāma, bhaṅgaṃ appattatāya na nirujjhati. Bhaṅgaṃ pana patvā taṃ tesaṃ cittaṃ
analyzed: uppajjati nāma bhaṅgam appatta tāya na nirujjhati bhaṅgam pana patvā tam tesam cittam
translated: But when it has reached cessation, that consciousness of theirs will have ceased, and because they will not be reborn, it will not arise again.

original: nirujjhissati, tato appaṭisandhikattā aññaṃ na uppajjissati. Ṭhapetvā pana pacchimacittasamaṅgikhīṇāsavaṃ🔽itaresaṃ sekkhāsekkhaputhujjanānaṃ uppādakkhaṇasamaṅgicittaṃ uppādappattatāya uppajjati
analyzed: nirujjhissati tatas appaṭisandhika ttā aññam na uppajjissati ṭhapetvā pana pacchima citta samaṅgi khīṇa āsavam  itaresam sekkha asekkha puthujjanānam uppāda khaṇa samaṅgi cittam uppāda ppatta tāya uppajjati
translated: But apart from those whose cankers are destroyed who are possessed of the last consciousness,

original: nāma, bhaṅgaṃ appattatāya na nirujjhati. Bhaṅgaṃ pana patvā nirujjhissateva, aññaṃ
analyzed: nāma bhaṅgam appatta tāya na nirujjhati bhaṅgam pana patvā nirujjhissatā iva aññam
translated: the consciousness of those who are possessed of the moment of arising, whether in training, beyond training, or as ordinary persons, is called “arising” because it has reached arising, and it is called “not ceasing” because it has not reached cessation.🔽But when it has reached cessation, it will have ceased, and it will arise and cease again in that same individual life or in another individual life.

original: pana tasmiṃ vā aññasmiṃ vā attabhāve uppajjissati ceva nirujjhissati ca. Dutiyo pana
analyzed: pana tasmin vā aññasmin vā attabhāve uppajjissati ca iva nirujjhissati ca dutiyaḥ pana
translated: But the second kind of consciousness,

original: pañho arahato cuticittassa uppādakkhaṇe niyamitattā ekaṃsabyākaraṇīyo, tasmā “yassa🔽vā pana cittaṃ nirujjhissati na uppajjissati, tassa cittaṃ uppajjati na nirujjhatī”ti🔽puṭṭhena “āmantā”ti vattabbaṃ. Khīṇāsavassa hi uppādakkhaṇasamaṅgicuticittaṃ bhaṅgaṃ🔽patvā nirujjhissati nāma, tato paraṃ nuppajjissati. Uppādakkhaṇasamaṅgitāya pana
analyzed: pañho arahataḥ cuti cittassa uppāda kkhaṇe tasmai yassa  vā pana cittam nirujjhissati na uppajjissati tassa cittam uppajjati na nirujjhati iti  puṭṭhena āmantā ati vattabbam khīṇāsavassa hi uppāda khaṇa samaṅgi cuti cittam bhaṅgam  patvā nirujjhissati nāma tatas param nu uppajjissati uppāda khaṇa samaṅgi tāya pana
translated: The question “Will there be a time when the mind of an Arahant will cease without arising?” is to be answered categorically, since the arising of the death consciousness of an Arahant is determined. Therefore, if one is asked, “Will there be a time when the mind of one will cease without arising?” he should answer, “Yes, there will be.” For the death consciousness of an Arahant, which is associated with the moment of arising, will cease after it has reached the state of dissolution. After that, it will not arise. But the death consciousness of an Arahant, which is associated with the moment of arising, is called “ceasing” when it reaches the state of dissolution.

original: uppajjati ceva bhaṅgaṃ appattatāya na nirujjhati cāti vuccati.🔽Ayaṃ pana māṇavo evamime pañhe vissajjetumasakkonto vighātaṃ pāpuṇi, tasmā vuttaṃ🔽“māṇavo uddhaṃ vā adho vā harituṃ asakkonto”tiādi. Tattha uddhaṃ vā adho vā harituṃ
analyzed: uppajjati ca iva bhaṅgam appatta tāya na nirujjhati ca ati vuccati  ayam pana māṇavaḥ evam ime pañhe vissajjetum a sakkontaḥ vighātam pāpuṇi tasmai vuttam  māṇavaḥ uddham vā adhas vā haritum a sakkontā iti ādi tattha uddham vā adhas vā haritum
translated: The question “When consciousness ceases without arising again, does consciousness arise or not?” is to be answered categorically, since it is limited to the death consciousness of an Arahant. Therefore, if he is asked, “When consciousness ceases without arising again, does consciousness arise or not?” he should answer, “Yes, sir.” For the death consciousness of an Arahant, which is associated with the state of arising, ceases when it reaches the state of presence, and it does not arise again after that. But because it is associated with the state of arising, it is said to arise; and because it has not reached the state of presence, it is said not to cease.

original: asakkontoti uparimapade vā heṭṭhimapadaṃ, heṭṭhimapade vā uparimapadaṃ atthato samannāharituṃ
analyzed: a sakkontā iti uparima pade vā heṭṭhima padam heṭṭhima pade vā uparima padam atthataḥ samannāharitum
translated: But this student, being unable to answer these questions, was confounded. That is why it is said, “The student was unable to take up the discussion either by going up or by going down” . Herein, unable to take up the discussion either by going up or by going down means unable to bring together the upper and the lower terms in the sense of the meaning.

original: asakkontoti attho, pubbenāparaṃ yojetvā pañhassa atthaṃ paricchindituṃ asakkontoti🔽vuttaṃ hoti. Dvattiṃsākārakammaṭṭhānaṃ tāva ācikkhīti “atthi imasmiṃ kāye”tiādikaṃ
analyzed: asakkonto ti atthaḥ pubbena aparam yojetvā pañhassa attham paricchinditum asakkonto ti  vuttam hoti dvattiṃsa ākāra kammaṭṭhānam tāva ācikkhi iti atthi imasmin kāye iti ādikam
translated: The meaning is that he was unable. The words should be construed in this way: “unable to determine the meaning of the question by inference from the preceding question.”

original: dvattiṃsākārakammaṭṭhānaṃ “mantassa upacāro aya”nti paṭhamaṃ ācikkhi. Sotāpannānaṃ
analyzed: dvattiṃsa ākāra kammaṭṭhānam mantassa upacāraḥ ayanti paṭhamam ācikkhi sotāpannānam
