analyzed: sa attham kapila mata ādi viya tuccham niratthakam a hutvā attha sampanna nti katvā pariyattiyā ati
translated: unlike the empty, useless, and false doctrines of the Kapila, Alāra, and so on.🔽By the extent of the learning: by the extent of the learning, which is the state of being endowed with the discovery of the learning,🔽unlike the confusion of one who is learning the Dhamma that is not well expounded.

original: pariyattidhammaparicayena. Āgamabyattitoti durakkhātadhammesu paricayaṃ karontassa
analyzed: pariyatti dhamma paricayena āgama byattito ti durakkhāta dhammesu paricayam karontassa
translated: By the extent of the tradition: by the extent of the tradition, which is the state of being endowed with the discovery of the tradition,🔽unlike the confusion of one who is learning the Dhamma that is not well expounded.🔽By the extent of the learning: by the extent of the learning, which is the state of being endowed with the discovery of the learning,🔽unlike the confusion of one who is learning the Dhamma that is not well expounded.🔽By the extent of the tradition: by the extent of the tradition, which is the state of being endowed with the discovery of the tradition,🔽unlike the confusion of one who is learning the Dhamma that is not well expounded.

original: viya sammohaṃ ajanetvā bāhusaccaveyyattiyasabbhāvato sabyañjanaṃ. Byañjanasampattiyā
analyzed: sammoham a janetvā bāhu sacca veyyattiya sabbhāvato sa byañjanam byañjana sampattiyā
translated: By the extent of the learning: by the extent of the learning, which is the state of being endowed with the discovery of the learning,🔽unlike the confusion of one who is learning the Dhamma that is not well expounded.🔽By the extent of the tradition: by the extent of the tradition, which is the state of being endowed with the discovery of the tradition,🔽unlike the confusion of one who is learning the Dhamma that is not well expounded.

original: hi sati āgamabyattīti. Sīlādipañcadhammakkhandhayuttatoti sīlādīhi pañcahi dhammakoṭṭhāsehi
analyzed: hi sati āgama byatti iti sīla ādi pañca dhamma kkhandha yuttato ti sīla ādīhi pañcahi dhamma koṭṭhāsehi
translated: By the extent of the learning: by the extent of the learning, which is the state of being endowed with the discovery of the learning,🔽unlike the confusion of one who is learning the Dhamma that is not well expounded.🔽By the extent of the tradition: by the extent of the tradition, which is the state of being endowed with the discovery of the tradition,

original: avirahitattā. Kevalaparipuṇṇanti anavasesena samantato puṇṇaṃ pūritaṃ. Nirupakkilesatoti
analyzed: avirahita ttā kevala paripuṇṇa anti anavasesena samantataḥ puṇṇam pūritam
translated: unlike the confusion of one who is learning the

original: diṭṭhimānādiupakkilesābhāvato. Nittharaṇatthāyāti vaṭṭadukkhato nissaraṇāya. Lokāmisanirapekkhatoti🔽kathañcipi taṇhāsannissayassa anissayato parisuddhaṃ. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yo “imaṃ
analyzed: diṭṭhi māna ādi upakkilesa abhāvataḥ nittharaṇa atthāya ati vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ nissaraṇāya loka āmisa nirapekkhato ti  kathañcipi taṇhā sannissayassa anissayato parisuddham idam vuttam hoti yaḥ imaṃ
translated: Without regard for worldly gain :

original: dhammadesanaṃ nissāya lābhaṃ vā sakkāraṃ vā labhissāmī”ti deseti, tassa aparisuddhā
analyzed: dhamma desanam nissāya lābham vā sakkāram vā labhissāmi iti deseti tassa a parisuddhā
translated: This is what is meant: the teaching of one who teaches thinking, “By means of this teaching I will obtain gain and honor,” is impure.

original: desanā hoti. Bhagavā pana lokāmisanirapekkho hitapharaṇena mettābhāvanāya muduhadayo
analyzed: desanā hoti bhagavā pana loka āmisa nirapekkho hita pharaṇena mettā bhāvanāya mudu hadayaḥ
translated: But the Blessed One, without regard for worldly gain, with a heart softened by the exercise of loving-kindness,

original: ullumpanasabhāvasaṇṭhitena cittena deseti, tasmā tassa desanā parisuddhāti.🔽Sādhūti ayaṃ saddo “sādhu me bhante bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetū”tiādīsu āyācane🔽dissati. “Sādhu bhanteti kho so bhikkhu bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā”tiādīsu
analyzed: ullumpana sabhāva saṇṭhitena cittena deseti tasmā tassa desanā parisuddhā ati  sādhu iti ayam saddaḥ sādhu me bhante bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammam desetu uti ādīsu āyācane  dissati sādhu bhante iti kho saḥ bhikkhu bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā atiādīsu
translated: teaches with a mind full of the nature of uplifting. Therefore his teaching is pure.🔽The word “good” is seen in the sense of “approval” in such passages as “It would be good, venerable sir, if the Blessed One would teach me the Dhamma in brief” .🔽It is seen in the sense of “acceptance” in such passages as “Very well, venerable sir,” and he delighted and rejoiced in the Blessed One’s words .

original: sampaṭicchane. “Sādhu sādhu sāriputtā”tiādīsu sampahaṃsane. “Tena hi brāhmaṇa sādhukaṃ
analyzed: sampaṭicchane sādhu sādhu sāriputta ati ādīsu sampahaṃsane tena hi brāhmaṇa sādhukam
translated: It is seen in the sense of “commendation” in such passages as “Good, good, Sāriputta” .

original: suṇohī”tiādīsu daḷhīkamme āṇattiyañca dissati.
analyzed: suṇohi iti ādīsu daḷhīkamme āṇattiyam ca dissati
translated: in such passages as “Listen, you who are firm in action” , and in such passages as “You are commanded” .

original: “Sādhu dhammaruci rājā, sādhu paññāṇavā naro;
analyzed: sādhu dhammaruci rājā sādhu paññāṇavā naraḥ
translated: “Excellent is the king who loves the Dhamma, excellent is the man who has understanding,

original: Sādhu mittānamaddubbho, pāpassākaraṇaṃ sukha”nti. –🔽Ādīsu sundare. Idhāpi sundareyeva daṭṭhabboti āha “sādhu kho panāti sundaraṃ kho
analyzed: sādhu pāpassa akaraṇam sukhanti  ādīsu sundare idha api sundarā iya iva daṭṭhabbā iti āha sādhu kho pana ati sundaram kho
translated: Excellent is the man who does not deceive his friends, and happiness is the doing of good” .

original: panā”ti. Tattha sundaranti bhaddakaṃ. Bhaddakatā ca passantassa hitasukhāvahabhāvenāti
analyzed: pana ati tattha sundaram ti bhaddakam bhaddaka tā ca passantassa hita sukha āvaha bhāvena ati
translated: Here it is in the sense of “beautiful.” So he said “Sādhu kho panā”ti, taking it in the sense of “beautiful.” Herein, “beautiful” is excellent. And its excellence is to be seen in its being the source of welfare and pleasure.

original: āha “atthāvahaṃ sukhāvaha”nti. Tattha atthāvahanti diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaparamatthasaññitahitāvahaṃ.
analyzed: āha attha āvaham sukha āvahanti tattha attha āvahanti diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika paramattha saññita hita āvaham
translated: So he said “Atthāvahaṃ sukhāvaha” . Herein, “the source of welfare” is the source of welfare described as the ultimate good in the present life and the life to come.🔽“The source of pleasure” is the source of the three kinds of pleasure stated above.

original: Sukhāvahanti yathāvuttatividhasukhāvahaṃ. Tathārūpānanti tādisānaṃ. Yādisehi pana
analyzed: sukha āvahanti tathārūpa ananti tādisānam pana
translated: “Such as these”: such as these.

original: guṇehi bhagavā samannāgato, tehi catuppamāṇikassa lokassa sabbakālepi accantāya pasādanīyo
analyzed: guṇehi bhagavā samannāgataḥ tehi catuppamāṇikassa lokassa sabba kāle api accantāya pasādanīyaḥ
translated: But the Blessed One is inspiring to all the world in every way by means of such special qualities as he possesses.🔽So, showing that he is inspiring to the world in every way by means of such special qualities as he possesses, he said “Yathārūpehi …pe…

original: tesaṃ yathābhūtasabhāvattāti dassento “yathārūpo”tiādimāha. Tattha yathābhucca…pe…
analyzed: tesam yathābhūta sabhāva ttā ati dassentaḥ yathārūpā iti ādim āha tattha
translated: Herein, “in accordance with reality” , etc., is said in order to show the special qualities of the Blessed One’s inspiring nature.

original: arahatanti iminā dhammappamāṇānaṃ lūkhappamāṇānañca sattānaṃ bhagavato pasādāvahataṃ
analyzed: arahatam ti iminā dhamma ppamāṇānam lūkha ppamāṇānam ca sattānam bhagavato pasāda avahatam
translated: By the word “worthy one” he shows the faith in the Blessed One that is produced in those who are of little intelligence and in those who are of great intelligence.

original: dasseti, taṃdassanena ca itaresampi rūpappamāṇaghosappamāṇānaṃ pasādāvahatā dassitā
analyzed: dasseti tad dassanena ca itaresam pi rūpa ppamāṇa ghosa ppamāṇānam pasāda āvaha tā dassitā
translated: By the word “worthy of worship” he shows the faith of beings of little understanding in the Blessed One’s qualities that are beyond measure. And by showing that, he shows the faith of beings of great understanding in the Blessed One’s form and voice, which are also beyond measure. For the latter are inseparable from the former.

original: hotīti daṭṭhabbaṃ tadavinābhāvato. Brahmacariyaṃ pakāsetīti kittisaddo abbhuggatoti
analyzed: hoti iti daṭṭhabbam tad avinābhāvataḥ brahmacariyam pakāseti iti kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ ti
translated: The words “the life of purity has been revealed” mean that the Blessed One’s fame has spread.

original: evamettha sambandhoti āha “dassanamattampi sādhu hotīti evamajjhāsayaṃ katvā”tiādi.
analyzed: evam ettha sambandhaḥ iti āha dassana mattam pi sādhu hoti iti evam ajjhāsayam katvā atiādi
translated: This is the connection. Therefore the commentator says: “Thinking, ‘It is good to see him even once,’ … ”

original: Tattha dassanamattampi sādhu hotīti ettha kosiyasakuṇavatthu kathetabbaṃ.🔽2. Yena vā kāraṇenāti hetumhi idaṃ karaṇavacanaṃ. Hetuattho hi kiriyākāraṇaṃ, na🔽karaṇaṃ viya kiriyattho, tasmā nānappakāraguṇavisesādhigamatthā idha upasaṅkamanakiriyāti
analyzed: tattha dassana mattam pi sādhu hoti iti ettha kosiya sakuṇa vatthu kathetabbam  yena vā kāraṇena ati hetumhi idam karaṇa vacanam hetu atthaḥ hi kiriyā kāraṇam na  karaṇam viya tasmā nānā pakāra guṇa visesa adhigama tthā idha upasaṅkamana kiriyā ti
translated: Herein, the story of the bird of the Kosīya clan should be told in the passage beginning, “It is good to see him even once.”🔽By what means? The instrumental case is used here in the sense of cause. For the meaning of cause is the means of an action, not the agent of the action. Therefore the act of approaching is the means for the attainment of the various kinds of special qualities.

original: “annena vasatī”tiādīsu viya hetuatthamevetaṃ karaṇavacanaṃ yuttaṃ, na karaṇatthaṃ
analyzed: annena vasati itiādīsu hetu attham eva itam karaṇa vacanam yuttam na karaṇa attham
translated: Thus the instrumental case is appropriate here in the sense of cause, not in the sense of agent, as in such passages as “He lives by alms” .

original: tassa ayujjamānattāti vuttaṃ “yena vā kāraṇenā”ti. Avibhāgato hi satatappavattaniratisayasāduvipulāmatarasasaddhammaphalatāyassa
analyzed: tassa ayujjamāna ttā iti vuttam yena vā kāraṇena ati avibhāgataḥ hi satata ppavatta nirati saya sādu vipula amata rasa saddhamma phala tāyassa
translated: “Or for what reason” is said because of the unsuitability of that.

original: sāduphalaniccaphalitamahārukkhena bhagavā upamito. Sāduphalūpabhogādhippāyaggahaṇeneva
analyzed: sādu phala nicca phalita mahā rukkhena bhagavā upamitaḥ sādu phala upabhoga adhippāya ggahaṇena iva
translated: For the Blessed One is compared to a great tree with sweet fruit that is always available, that is delightful, that is distinguished, that is very sweet, that is abundant, that is not far away, and that has the fruit of the True Dhamma.

original: hi mahārukkhassa sāduphalatā gahitāti. Upasaṅkamīti upasaṅkamanto. Sampattakāmatāya
analyzed: hi mahā rukkhassa sādu phala tā gahitā ati upasaṅkamīti upasaṅkamantaḥ sampatta kāma tāya
translated: For the sweetness of the fruit of the great tree is taken up by the mere taking up of the desire to enjoy the sweet fruit.

original: hi kiñci ṭhānaṃ gacchanto taṃtaṃpadesātikkamanena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamantoti vattabbataṃ
analyzed: hi kiñci ṭhānam gacchanto tad tad padesa atikkamanena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamanto ti vattabba tam
translated: “Approached” : one who is approaching is approaching by the act of passing beyond a certain place because of the desire to reach it.

original: labhati. Tenāha “gatoti vuttaṃ hotī”ti, upagatoti attho. Upasaṅkamitvāti pubbakālakiriyāniddesoti
analyzed: labhati tena āha gataḥ iti vuttam hoti iti upagataḥ ti atthaḥ upasaṅkamitvā ati pubba kāla kiriyā niddesaḥ ti
translated: Therefore it is said, “it is as if he had gone” . The meaning is: he has gone up to.🔽“Having approached” : this is the description of the action done in the past.🔽Therefore it is said, “it shows the end of the approaching” .

original: āha “upasaṅkamanapariyosānadīpana”nti. Tatoti yaṃ ṭhānaṃ patto upasaṅkamīti vutto,
analyzed: āha upasaṅkamana pariyosāna dīpanam ti tatas ti yam ṭhānam patto upasaṅkami iti vutto
translated: “From there” : from the place reached by the approaching spoken of as “having approached” .

original: tato upagataṭṭhānato. Āsannataraṃ ṭhānanti pañhaṃ vā pucchituṃ dhammaṃ vā sotuṃ sakkuṇeyyaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: tatas upagata ṭṭhānataḥ āsannataram ṭhānam ti pañham vā pucchitum dhammam vā sotum sakkuṇeyya ṭṭhānam
translated: “A nearer place” : a place where one can ask a question or listen to the Dhamma.

original: Yathā khamanīyādīni pucchantoti yathā bhagavā “kacci te brāhmaṇa khamanīyaṃ, kacci
analyzed: yathā khamanīya ādīni pucchanti iti yathā bhagavā kacci te brāhmaṇa khamanīyam kacci
translated: As he asked about what was to be approved, etc.,🔽so he asked about what was to be approved, etc.,

original: yāpanīya”ntiādinā khamanīyādīni pucchanto tena brāhmaṇena saddhiṃ samappavattamodo
analyzed: khamanīya ādīni pucchantaḥ tena brāhmaṇena saddhim
translated: As he who questions about what is to be endured, etc., is as the Blessed One who, by asking “I trust it is bearable for you, brahmin, I trust you are getting better,” etc.,

original: ahosi. Pubbabhāsitāya tadanukaraṇena evaṃ sopi brāhmaṇo bhagavatā saddhiṃ samappavattamodo
analyzed: ahosi pubba bhāsitāya tad anukaraṇena evam saḥ api brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavatā saddhim sama ppavatta modaḥ
translated: was friendly with that brahmin. By repeating what was said first, he too was friendly with the Blessed One.

original: ahosīti yojanā. Taṃ pana samappavattamodataṃ upamāya dassetuṃ “sītodakaṃ viyā”tiādi
analyzed: ahosi iti yojanā tam pana upamāya dassetum sīta udakam viya ātiādi
translated: The meaning is that he was friendly with him. But in order to illustrate that friendliness by a simile, “like cool water” is said.

original: vuttaṃ. Sammoditanti saṃsanditaṃ. Ekībhāvanti sammodanakiriyāya samānataṃ ekarūpataṃ.🔽Khamanīyanti “idaṃ catucakkaṃ navadvāraṃ sarīrayantaṃ dukkhabahulatāya sabhāvato🔽dussahaṃ, kacci khamituṃ sakkuṇeyyanti pucchati. Yāpanīyanti paccayāyattavuttikaṃ
analyzed: vuttam sammoditanti saṃsanditam ekībhāvanti sammodana kiriyāya samāna tam eka rūpa tam  idam catu cakkam nava dvāram sarīrayantam dukkha bahula tāya sabhāvataḥ  dussaham kacci khamitum sakkuṇeyyanti pucchati yāpanīya nti paccaya āyatta vuttikam
translated: Friendly means in contact. In unison means in the same way, in one mode, by the act of being friendly.

original: cirappabandhasaṅkhātāya yāpanāya kacci yāpetuṃ sakkuṇeyyaṃ. Sīsarogādiābādhābhāvena
analyzed: cira ppabandha saṅkhātāya yāpanāya kacci yāpetum sakkuṇeyyam sīsa roga ādi ābādha abhāvena
translated: Endurable means “This body, which has four sides, nine openings, and is covered with flesh, is by nature hard to endure because of the great amount of suffering in it. I wonder if you can endure it.” Bearable means “It is to be lived with, depending on conditions. I wonder if you can live with it, by living with it for a long time.”🔽By the absence of such sicknesses as head-disease, etc.,

original: kacci appābādhaṃ. Dukkhajīvikābhāvena kacci appātaṅkaṃ. Taṃtaṃkiccakaraṇe uṭṭhānasukhatāya🔽kacci lahuṭṭhānaṃ. Tadanurūpabalayogato kacci balaṃ. Sukhavihārasambhavena kacci
analyzed: kacci appa ābādham dukkha jīvikā bhāvena kacci appa ātaṅkam taṃtaṃ kicca karaṇe uṭṭhāna sukha tāya  kacci lahu ṭṭhānam tad anurūpa bala yogato kacci balam sukha vihāra sambhavena kacci
translated: “I hope you are free from illness,” he says, referring to their freedom from the kind of illness that makes its victims a burden to themselves and others.🔽“I hope you are vigorous,” he says, referring to their being easy to rouse in the morning for the performance of duties.🔽“I hope you are strong,” he says, referring to their strength in accordance with their food.🔽“I hope you are dwelling in bliss,” he says, referring to their dwelling in the bliss of jhāna.

original: phāsuvihāro atthīti tattha tattha kaccisaddaṃ yojetvā attho veditabbo. Balappattā🔽pīti pītiyeva. Taruṇapīti pāmojjaṃ. Sammodaṃ janeti karotīti sammodanikaṃ, tadeva🔽sammodanīyanti āha “sammodajananato”ti. Sammoditabbato sammodanīyanti idaṃ pana atthaṃ🔽dassento “sammodituṃ yuttabhāvato”ti āha. Saritabbabhāvatoti anussaritabbabhāvato.🔽“Saraṇīya”nti vattabbe dīghaṃ katvā “sāraṇīya”nti vuttaṃ. Suyyamānasukhatoti āpāthamadhuratamāha.🔽Anussariyamānasukhatoti vimaddaramaṇīyataṃ. Byañjanaparisuddhatāyāti sabhāvaniruttibhāvena
analyzed: phāsu vihāraḥ atthi iti tattha tattha kacci saddam yojetvā atthaḥ veditabbaḥ bala ppattā 🔽pīti pītiyā iva taruṇa pīti pāmojjam sammodam janeti karoti iti sammodanikam tat eva 🔽sammodanīyanti āha sammoda jananato ti sammoditabbato sammodanīyanti idam pana attham 🔽dassentaḥ sammoditum yutta bhāvataḥ ti āha saritabba bhāvataḥ ti anussaritabba bhāvataḥ 🔽saraṇīyanti vattabbe dīgham katvā sāraṇīyanti vuttam suyyamāna sukhataḥ iti āpātha madhuratam āha 🔽byañjana parisuddha tāya ati sabhāva nirutti bhāvena
