original: gahetvā na gamissati, evāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ upaṭṭhahissāmī”ti vatvā “kaṃ panettha, ānanda,🔽ādīnavaṃ addasā”ti vutte āha “sacāhaṃ, bhante, imāni vatthūni labhissāmi, bhavissanti

original: upaṭṭhāti, ko evaṃ upaṭṭhahato bhāro”’ti. Ime cattāro paṭikkhepe yāci.

analyzed: tam tam nipphādentaḥ mahatim daṇḍadīpikam gahetvā eka rattim gandhakuṭi pariveṇam nava
translated: He made this or that ready, and taking a large torch, he went round the Perfumed Cell and the surrounding verandah nine times each night.

analyzed: vāre anupariyāyati evam hissa ahosi sace me thinam iddham okkameyya bhagavati pakkosante

analyzed: paṭivacanam dātum na aham tasmai sabbarattim daṇḍadīpikam hatthena na  muñcati evam etassa nibaddha upaṭṭhāka ṭṭhānassa aladdha bhāvam sandhāya vuttam no ca

original: kho upaṭṭhākaṭṭhānaṃ laddhā”ti. Nibaddhupaṭṭhāko nāma natthīti niyatupaṭṭhāko nāma

translated: “Sometimes the Elder Nāgasamāla” , etc. He is a kinsman and the best because of his possession of the most excellent qualities.

original: ñātakeneva kātuṃ yuttataranti adhippāyo.

translated: The intention is that in such cases it is more fitting to give gifts after having prepared material things in times of adversity, saying: “This alone is suitable.”

translated: “By Mara’s deluding”: by Mara’s deluding the mind, by Mara’s deluding the mind through his own power.

translated: This is what is meant. Therefore he said: “Having deluded, having deceived,” etc. Let alone… Mara would have deluded him.

original: Vuttañhetaṃ apadāne –

translated: When invited by a brahmin, I lived in Verañjā then.”

translated: “With his mind obsessed” means with his mind overwhelmed; the meaning is, with his mind conquered.🔽“When the end of the turn had come” means when the end of the turn of the day had come.🔽“They came back” means they came back after Māra had turned them away.

original: āgamiṃsūti mārena āvaṭṭetvā gate pacchā āgamiṃsu. Avisahatāyāti asakkuṇeyyatāya.🔽Abhihaṭabhikkhāyāti pacitvā abhihariyamānabhikkhāya. Nibaddhadānassāti “ettakaṃ kālaṃ
analyzed: āgamiṃsu iti mārena āvaṭṭetvā gate pacchā āgamiṃsu a visaha tāya ati a sakkuṇeyya tāya  abhihaṭa bhikkhāya ati pacitvā abhihariyamāna bhikkhāya nibaddha dānassa ati ettakam kālam
translated: “Unable to bear it” means unable to endure it.🔽“The prepared alms” means the alms that were prepared by cooking.

original: bhagavato dassāmā”ti niccabhattavasena paricchinditvā ṭhapitadānassa. Appitavatthassāti
analyzed: bhagavataḥ dassāma ati niccabhatta vasena paricchinditvā ṭhapita dānassa appita vatthassa ati
translated: “The regular gift” means the gift that was set aside as a regular meal, thinking, “We will give this to the Blessed One at such and such a time.”

original: “idaṃ buddhassa catupaccayaparibhogattha”nti vihāraṃ netvā dinnavatthuno. Na visahatīti
analyzed: idam buddhassa catu paccaya paribhoga atthan ti vihāram netvā dinna vatthunaḥ na visahati iti
translated: “The offered robe-material” means the robe-material that was brought to the monastery, thinking, “This is for the Buddha’s use of the four requisites.”🔽“Unable to bear it” means unable to endure it.

original: na sakkoti. Abhihaṭabhikkhāsaṅkhepenāti abhihaṭabhikkhānīhārena. Byāmappabhāyāti🔽samantato byāmamattāya pabhāya. Ettha ca anubyañjanānaṃ byāmappabhāya ca nippabhākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: na sakkoti abhihaṭa bhikkhā saṅkhepena ati abhihaṭa bhikkhā nīhārena byāma ppabhāya ati  samantataḥ byāma mattāya pabhāya ettha ca anubyañjanānam byāma ppabhāya ca nippabha karaṇam
translated: “By the method of the prepared alms” means by the method of the prepared alms.🔽“The light of the moon and sun” means the light of the moon and sun extending a league all around.🔽And here the obscuring of the minor marks and the light of the moon and sun should be regarded as an obstruction.

original: antarāyoti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tenevāha “candimasūriyadevabrahmānampi hī”tiādi. Anubyañjanānaṃ
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam tena iva āha hi itiādi
translated: That is why he says, “Even the gods, the moon and sun, and the great brahma, etc.”

original: byāmappabhāya ekābaddhattā vuttaṃ “anubyañjanabyāmappabhāppadesaṃ patvā”ti. Sabbaññutaññāṇassa
analyzed: byāma ppabhāya eka ābaddha ttā vuttam anubyañjana byāma ppabhā appadesam patvā iti sabbaññu ta ññāṇassa
translated: “Having reached the place of the radiance of the details of the radiance of the all-seeing knowledge” is said because of the non-separation of the radiance of the all-seeing knowledge.

original: antarāyo nāma ñeyyadhammesu āvaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: antarāyaḥ nāma ñeyya dhammesu āvaraṇam
translated: An obstruction to the knowledge of omniscience is a hindrance to the objects of knowledge.

original: Assosi kho bhagavā udukkhalasaddanti kiṃ sayameva uppannaṃ udukkhalasaddaṃ assosīti🔽ceti āha “patthapatthapulakaṃ koṭṭentāna”ntiādi. Atthasañhitanti payojanasādhakaṃ.
analyzed: assosi kho bhagavā udukkhala saddan ti kim sayam eva uppannam udukkhala saddam assosi iti  ca iti āha pattha pattha pulakam koṭṭenta ananti ādi attha sañhitan ti payojana sādhakam
translated: The Blessed One heard the sound of the mortar. If it is asked, did he hear the sound of the mortar that arose by itself?🔽He said “by one who was pounding the rice-grains that had husks and were still joined together” and so on. “Conducive to welfare” means conducive to the accomplishment of the purpose.

original: Anatthasañhiteti anatthanissite vacane. Ghātāpekkhaṃ bhummavacanaṃ. Yasmiñca yena🔽ghāto nipphādīyati, tasseva tena ghāto kato nāma hotīti āha “maggeneva tādisassa🔽vacanassa ghāto samucchedoti vuttaṃ hotī”ti. Sāmiatthe vā bhummavacananti maññamāno
analyzed: anattha sañhita iti anattha nissite vacane ghāta apekkham bhumma vacanam yasmin ca yena  ghātaḥ nipphādīyati tassa iva tena ghāto kataḥ nāma hoti iti āha maggena iva tādisassa  vacanassa ghātaḥ samucchedaḥ ti vuttam hoti iti sāmi atthe vā bhumma vacanan ti maññamāno
translated: “Conducive to harm” means based on harm. The locative case is a statement of one who is desirous of killing.

original: evamāhāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Vacanassa ca samugghāto tammūlakilesānaṃ samugghātenāti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: evam āha ati daṭṭhabbam vacanassa ca samugghāto tad mūla kilesānam samugghātena ati veditabbam
translated: And when killing is produced by someone with something, it is said that killing has been done by him with that. Therefore it is said: “By that very means, the killing, the cutting off, of such a statement is said.” Or it should be seen that he said this thinking that the locative case is a statement of ownership. And the cutting off of the statement should be understood as the cutting off of the defilements rooted in it.

original: Ākaroti attano anurūpatāya samariyādaṃ saparicchedaṃ phalaṃ nipphattetīti ākāro kāraṇanti
analyzed: ākaroti attanaḥ anurūpa tāya sa mariyādam sa paricchedam phalam nipphattā iti iti
translated: It is a cause since it causes the noble fruit, which is in conformity with itself, to be generated, having a limit.

original: āha “ākārehīti kāraṇehī”ti. Aṭṭhuppattiyuttanti paccuppannavatthuṃ nissāya pavattaṃ.🔽Tāya pucchāya vītikkamaṃ pākaṭaṃ katvāti “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ bhikkhū”tiādipucchāya
analyzed: āha ākārehi iti kāraṇehi iti aṭṭhuppatti yuttam ti paccuppanna vatthum nissāya pavattam  tāya pucchāya vītikkamam pākaṭam katvā ati saccam kira tvam bhikkhu iti ādi pucchāya
translated: He says, “By means of the cause” means by means of the reason. “Connected with the origination of the offence” means that which occurs in dependence on a present situation.

original: tena bhikkhunā katavītikkamaṃ pakāsetvā, vītikkamappakāsanañca kimatthamidaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ
analyzed: tena bhikkhunā kata vītikkamam pakāsetvā vītikkama ppakāsanam ca kimattham idam sikkhāpadaṃ
translated: Having made the transgression in the question clear: having made the transgression committed by that bhikkhu clear by means of the question, “Is it true, as they say, that you, bhikkhu … ?”

original: paññapetīti anujānanatthaṃ.
analyzed: paññapeti iti anujānana attham
translated: And the purpose of making the transgression clear is for the purpose of permission.

original: Natthi kiñci vattabbanti pubbe vuttanayattā na kiñci ettha apubbaṃ vattabbamatthīti
analyzed: na atthi kiñci vattabbanti pubbe vutta naya ttā na kiñci ettha apubbam vattabbam atthi iti
translated: There is nothing to be said: he shows that there is nothing to be said here that has not already been said in the previous method.

original: dasseti. Tenāha “pubbe vuttameva hī”tiādi. Sādhu sādhūti idaṃ pasaṃsāyaṃ āmeḍitavacananti
analyzed: dasseti tena āha pubbe vuttam eva hi itiādi sādhu sādhu iti idam pasaṃsāyam āmeḍita vacananti
translated: Therefore he says, “For the rest it is just as was said before.” “Good, good” is a word of approval.

original: āha “āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ sampahaṃsento”ti. Dvīsu ākāresūti dhammadesanasikkhāpadapaññattisaṅkhātesu
analyzed: āha āyasmantam ānandam sampahaṃsento ti dvīsu ākāresu uti dhamma desana sikkhāpada paññatti saṅkhātesu
translated: Therefore he says, “Commending the venerable Ananda.” In the two ways: in the two ways called the laying down of the training rule and the teaching of the Dhamma.

original: dvīsu kāraṇesu. Ekaṃ gahetvāti dhammaṃ vā desessāmāti evaṃ vuttakāraṇaṃ gahetvā.🔽Evaṃdubbhikkheti evaṃ dukkhena labhitabbā bhikkhā etthāti evaṃdubbhikkhe kāle, dese
analyzed: dvīsu kāraṇesu ekam gahetvā ati dhammam vā desessāma ati evam vutta kāraṇam gahetvā  evaṃdubbhikkhā iti evam dukkhena labhitabbā bhikkhā ettha ati evaṃdubbhikkhe kāle dese
translated: In two ways: “Having taken one” means having taken the reason stated thus, “I will teach the Dhamma.”🔽“In a time of famine” means in a place where alms are difficult to obtain, in a place where alms are scarce.🔽“With difficulty, with hardship” explains the meaning of “in a time of famine.”

original: vā. Dullabhapiṇḍeti etasseva atthadīpanaṃ. Bhājanādipariharaṇavasena bahubhaṇḍikatāya
analyzed: vā dullabha piṇḍā iti etassa iva attha dīpanam bhājana ādi pariharaṇa vasena bahu bhaṇḍika tāya
translated: Because of the lack of vessels, etc., he has few belongings.

original: abhāvato vuttaṃ “imāya sallahukavuttitāyā”ti. Ettakameva alaṃ yāpetunti uttari patthanābhāvato🔽pana “iminā ca sallekhenā”ti vuttaṃ. Dubbhikkhaṃ vijitanti ettha hi bhikkhānaṃ abhāvo
analyzed: abhāvataḥ vuttam imāya sallahuka vutti tāya ati ettakam eva alam yāpetun ti uttari patthanā bhāvato  pana iminā ca sallekhena ati vuttam dubbhikkham vijitanti ettha hi bhikkhānam abhāvo
translated: “With this simplicity” is said because he has no further ambition.🔽“Having conquered famine” : here the absence of bhikkhus is famine,🔽as in the passage, “without guile” , etc.

original: dubbhikkhaṃ “nimmakkhika”ntiādīsu viya. Bhikkhābhāvoyeva hi taṃnimittacittavighātānaṃ
analyzed: dubbhikkham nimmakkhikan ti ādīsu viya hi tad nimitta citta vighātānam
translated: For it is the absence of alms that is called “famine,” because it is the cause of the mental anguish of bhikkhus.🔽“Having conquered famine” means that he has lived, has acted, having conquered famine by means of bhikkhus.

original: abhāvato bhikkhūhi vijito vase vattito. Lobho vijitoti āmisahetu ratticchedavassacchedasamuṭṭhāpako
analyzed: abhāvataḥ bhikkhūhi vijitaḥ vase vattitaḥ lobho vijitaḥ ti āmisa hetu ratti cheda vassa cheda samuṭṭhāpako
translated: “Having conquered greed” : greed that arises on account of material things, that causes the interruption of the rains, and that causes the interruption of the night,

analyzed: tesam tesam āmisa lola tā saṅkhātaḥ lobhaḥ vijitaḥ icchā ācāraḥ vijitaḥ iti āmisa hetu
translated: And greed did not arise in them: the greed called “greed for indulgence” was conquered.

original: aññamaññassa uttarimanussadhammappakāsanavasena guṇavaṇijjaṃ katvā jīvikaṃ kappessāmā”ti
analyzed: aññamaññassa uttari manussa dhamma ppakāsana vasena guṇa vaṇijjam katvā jīvikam kappessāma ati

analyzed: na ahosi iti dassana attham vighāto vā ti vuttam  ratti chedaḥ vāti satta aha karaṇīya vasena gantvā bahi aruṇuṭṭhāpana vasena ratti chedaḥ
translated: The thought of going is mentioned in order to show that the mere thought of going did not arise.🔽The thought of going is mentioned in order to show that the mere thought of going did not arise.🔽The thought of going is mentioned in order to show that the mere thought of going did not arise.🔽The thought of going is mentioned in order to show that the mere thought of going did not arise.

analyzed: vā na kato sattāha kicca vasena api katthaci a gata ttā sattāha kicca vasena

analyzed: sandhāya ratti chedo ti aṭṭhakathā vohāro ca vassūpanāyika khandhaka vaṇṇanā ayam
translated: The thought of going is mentioned in order to show that the mere thought of going did not arise.🔽The thought of

original: “ayaṃ panettha pāḷimuttakaratticchedavinicchayo”ti vatvā “dhammassavanatthāya animantitena
analyzed: ayam pana ittha pāḷimuttaka ratti cheda vinicchayo ti vatvā dhammassavana tthāya a nimantitena
translated: “This is the decision on the matter of the breaking of the continuity of the observance day. ”🔽“One should not go to hear the Dhamma when not invited. ”

original: gantuṃ na vaṭṭatī”tiādinā sattāhakaraṇīyameva vibhattaṃ. Mahāaṭṭhakathāyampi vuttaṃ🔽“sattāhakiccena gantvā ekabhikkhunāpi ratticchedo vā na kato”ti. Evañca katvā ratticchedo
analyzed: gantum na vaṭṭati iti ādinā satta aha karaṇīyam eva vibhattam mahā aṭṭhakathāyam pi vuttam  sattāha kiccena gantvā eka bhikkhunā api ratti chedaḥ vā na kato ti evañca katvā ratti chedaḥ
translated: And in the Maha-atthakatha it is said:🔽“Having gone on seven-day business, the continuity of the observance day has not been broken even by a single bhikkhu.”

original: nāma sattāhakaraṇīyavasena hoti, na aññathāti ratticchedalakkhaṇañca kathitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: nāma satta aha karaṇīya vasena hoti na aññathā iti ratti cheda lakkhaṇam ca kathitan ti daṭṭhabbaṃ
translated: And thus it should be understood that the characteristic of the breaking of the continuity of the observance day is stated as follows: the breaking of the continuity of the observance day is by means of seven-day business, not otherwise.

original: Ettha ca paccayavekallasaṅkhāte vassacchedakāraṇe sati ratticchedassapi vuttattā
analyzed: ettha ca paccaya vekalla saṅkhāte vassa cheda kāraṇe sati ratti chedassa api vutta ttā
translated: And since the breaking of the continuity of the observance day is mentioned in the case of the cause of the breaking of the Rains residence called the deficiency of requisites,

original: yattha vassacchedakāraṇaṃ labbhati, tattha sattāhakiccena gantumpi vaṭṭatīti siddhanti
analyzed: yattha vassa cheda kāraṇam labbhati tattha satta aha kiccena gantum pi vaṭṭati iti
translated: it is established that it is allowable to go on seven-day business even where there is a cause for the breaking of the Rains residence.🔽And what is said in the Culla-ganthi and the Majjhima-ganthi is well said.

original: cūḷagaṇṭhipade majjhimagaṇṭhipade ca vuttaṃ, taṃ suvuttaṃ vassūpanāyikakkhandhake🔽vassacchedādhikāre –
analyzed: cūḷa gaṇṭhi pade majjhima gaṇṭhi pade ca vuttam tam su vuttam vassūpanāyika khandhake 🔽vassa cheda adhikāre
translated: In the Khandhaka on the Invitation and the Entry for the Rains it is said:🔽“If a bhikkhu, having entered for the Rains in one residence, should go away on the fourteenth, thinking ‘I shall not keep the Invitation here,’ and if he should arrive at another residence on the fifteenth, he should not keep the Invitation there either.

original: “Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassūpagatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gāmo corehi vuṭṭhāsi. Bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ. Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yena gāmo tena gantu”nti –
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmin āvāse vassu upagatānam bhikkhūnam gāmaḥ corehi vuṭṭhāsi bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesuṃ anujānāmi bhikkhave yena gāmaḥ tena gantunti
translated: “Monks, on a certain occasion a village was attacked by thieves in a residence where monks had entered for the Rains. They reported the matter to the Blessed One. The Blessed One said, ‘Monks, I allow you to go to the village where the village has been attacked by thieves.’“

original: Ettha “sace gāmo avidūragato hoti, tattha piṇḍāya caritvā vihārameva āgantvā vasitabbaṃ.
analyzed: ettha sace gāmaḥ avidūra gataḥ hoti tattha piṇḍāya caritvā vihāram eva āgantvā vasitabbaṃ
translated: Herein, if the village is not far away, then after wandering for alms there, they should return to the dwelling and live there.

original: Sace dūragato, sattāhavārena aruṇo uṭṭhāpetabbo. Na sakkā ce hoti, tattheva sabhāgaṭṭhāne🔽vasitabba”nti iminā aṭṭhakathāvacanenapi saṃsandanato. Tathā hi gāme vuṭṭhite bhikkhāya🔽abhāvato vassacchedepi anāpattiṃ vadantena bhagavatā “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yena🔽gāmo tena gantu”nti vuttattā bhikkhāya abhāvo vassacchedakāraṇaṃ. Tattha “sace dūragato,
analyzed: sace dūra gataḥ satta aha vārena aruṇaḥ uṭṭhāpetabbo na sakkā ce hoti tattha iva sa bhāga ṭṭhāne  vasitabban ti iminā aṭṭhakathā vacanena api saṃsandanato tathā hi gāme vuṭṭhite bhikkhāya  abhāvataḥ vassa chede pi anāpattim vadantena bhagavatā anujānāmi bhikkhave yena  gāmaḥ tena gantunti vutta ttā bhikkhāya abhāvaḥ vassa cheda kāraṇam tattha sace dūra gato
translated: But if it is far away, then the dawn should be made to arrive by means of the seven-day rule. If that is not possible, then they should live there in the place that is suitable.

original: sattāhavārena aruṇo uṭṭhāpetabbo”ti idaṃ aṭṭhakathāvacanaṃ vassacchedakāraṇe sati
analyzed: satta aha vārena aruṇaḥ uṭṭhāpetabbo ti idam aṭṭhakathā vacanam vassa cheda kāraṇe sati
translated: This is the text of the commentary. For when the Blessed One, who said that there is no offence in the interruption of the Rains because there is no alms food, said, ‘Monks, I allow you to go to the village where the village has been attacked by thieves,’ then the absence of alms food is the reason for the interruption of the Rains. Herein, the text of the commentary, ‘If it is far away, then the dawn should be made to arrive by means of the seven-day rule,’ is the reason for the interruption of the Rains.

original: sattāhakiccena gantumpi vaṭṭatīti imamatthaṃ sādheti.
analyzed: satta aha kiccena gantum pi vaṭṭati iti imam attham sādha iti
translated: and so he establishes the meaning that it is allowable to go on seven-day business even if it means breaking the rains.

original: Yaṃ pana vuttaṃ kenaci –🔽“Ratticchedoti sattāhakiccaṃ sandhāya vutto, sattāhakaraṇīyena gantvā ratticchedo🔽vā vassacchedo vā ekabhikkhunāpi na katoti vuttaṃ kira mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ, tasmā vassacchedassa
analyzed: yam pana vuttam kenacid  ratti chedo ti sattāha kiccam sandhāya vuttaḥ sattāha karaṇīyena gantvā ratti chedo  vā vassa chedaḥ vā eka bhikkhunā api na kataḥ iti vuttam kira mahā aṭṭhakathāyam tasmā vassa chedassa
translated: But someone says this:

original: kāraṇe sati sattāhakiccaṃ kātuṃ vaṭṭatīti eke. Vinayadharā pana na icchanti, tasmā
analyzed: kāraṇe sati sattāha kiccam kātum vaṭṭati iti eke vinaya dharāḥ pana na icchanti tasmā
translated: “The breaking of the rains is mentioned with reference to seven-day business. One who goes on seven-day business does not break the rains or the residence of the rainy season, it is said in the Mahā-Aṭṭhakathā. Therefore, if there is a reason for breaking the rains, it is allowable to go on seven-day business. But the Vinaya experts do not agree. Therefore

original: aṭṭhakathādhippāyo vīmaṃsitabbo”ti.
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā adhippāyaḥ vīmaṃsitabbaḥ ti
translated: the purport of the commentary should be investigated.”

original: Taṃ pana sayaṃ sammūḷhassa paresaṃ mohuppādanamattaṃ. Na hi vinayadharānaṃ anicchāya🔽kāraṇaṃ dissati aṭṭhakathāya virujjhanato yuttiabhāvato ca. Yañhi kāraṇaṃ vassacchedepi
analyzed: tam pana sayam sammūḷhassa paresam moha uppādana mattam na hi anicchāya  kāraṇam dissati aṭṭhakathāya virujjhanataḥ yutti abhāvataḥ ca yat hi kāraṇam vassa chede pi
translated: But that is just the production of confusion by one who is himself confused. For no reason is seen for rejecting the opinion of the Vinaya experts,

original: anāpattiṃ sādheti, tasmiṃ sati vinā vassacchedaṃ sattāhakiccena gantuṃ na vaṭṭatīti
analyzed: anāpattim sādha iti tasmin sati vinā vassa chedam satta aha kiccena gantum na vaṭṭati iti
translated: because it contradicts the commentary and is unreasonable. For when there is a reason that establishes that there is no offence in breaking the rains, then it is not allowable to go on seven-day business even if it means breaking the rains.

original: kā nāma yutti. “Pacchimikāya tattha vassaṃ upagacchāmā”ti idaṃ tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ anurūpaparivitakkanapaadīpanaṃ,
analyzed: kā nāma yutti pacchimikāya tattha vassam upagacchāma ti idam tesam bhikkhūnam anurūpa parivitakkana paadīpanam

original: Nanu ca uttarakuruṃ piṇḍāya gamanaṃ paṭisedhetvā vipallāsampi sattā paṭilabheyyunti
analyzed: nanu ca uttarakurum piṇḍāya gamanam paṭisedhetvā vipallāsam pi sattā paṭilabheyyunti
translated: But didn’t the Buddha prohibit going to Uttarakuru for alms, and would beings not attain perversion?

original: kāraṇaṃ na vuttaṃ, tasmā kimettha kāraṇanti āha “tattha kiñcāpī”tiādi. Yadipi na
analyzed: kāraṇam na vuttam tasmā kim ettha kāraṇan ti āha tattha kiñcā api itiādi yadi api na
translated: The reason is not stated, so he asks, “But why is that?” and answers, “Although that is so.” If they

original: vuttaṃ, tathāpi “vipallāsampi sattā paṭilabheyyu”nti pubbe adhikatattā teneva kāraṇena
analyzed: vuttam tathā api vipallāsam pi sattā paṭilabheyyunti pubbe adhika tattā tena iva kāraṇena
translated: Still, it is said that “beings would acquire perversion,” because of the greater amount of it in the past.

original: piṇḍāya uttarakurugamanampi bhagavatā paṭisiddhanti viññāyati, tasmā tadeva kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: piṇḍāya uttarakuru gamanam pi bhagavatā paṭisiddhan ti viññāyati tasmā tat eva kāraṇam
translated: It is evident that the Blessed One has prohibited the going to Uttarakuru for alms, for that very reason. Therefore, showing that that very reason

original: idhāpi gahetabbanti dassento āha “pubbe vuttanayeneva gahetabba”nti. Vipallāsampi
analyzed: idha api gahetabbanti dassentaḥ āha pubbe vutta nayena iva gahetabbanti vipallāsam pi
translated: should be taken here also, he said, “It should be taken in the way stated previously.”

original: sattā paṭilabheyyunti idaṃ idha avuttampi ānetvā sambandhitabbanti adhippāyo. Atthopi
analyzed: sattā paṭilabheyyunti idam idha avuttam pi ānetvā sambandhitabbanti adhippāyaḥ atthaḥ api
translated: The meaning of the words “beings would acquire perversion” should be brought in here, even though it is not stated, and connected with the passage. And its meaning should be understood as stated.

original: cassa vuttasadisameva veditabboti. “Evaṃ pana vipallāsaṃ paṭilabheyyu”ntiādinā pacchā🔽vuttameva atthavikappaṃ sandhāya vadati. Yaṃ pana tattha vuttaṃ “te guṇe nibbattetvā🔽dubbhikkhakāle pathaviṃ parivattetvā pappaṭakojaṃ paribhuñjiṃsū”ti, taṃ apanetvā
analyzed: cassa vutta sadisam eva veditabbaḥ ti evam pana vipallāsam paṭilabheyyuṃ tiādinā pacchā  vuttam eva attha vikappam sandhāya vadati yam pana tattha vuttam te guṇe nibbattetvā  dubbhikkha kāle pathavim parivattetvā pappaṭaka ojam paribhuñjiṃsu iti tam apanetvā
translated: “But they would acquire perversion” and so on, he says, referring to the same permutation of meaning stated later.🔽But what was said there, namely, “having produced those qualities, they turned the earth upside down and ate the roots of the sugar cane,” should be omitted.

original: te guṇe nibbattetvā dubbhikkhakāle uttarakuruṃ gantvā piṇḍāya caritvā paribhuñjiṃsūti
analyzed: te guṇe nibbattetvā dubbhikkha kāle uttarakurum gantvā piṇḍāya caritvā paribhuñjiṃsu iti
translated: Instead, it should be said: “having produced those qualities, they went to Uttarakuru during a famine, went for alms, and ate.”

original: evamettha yojanā kātabbā. Ekena padavītihārenāti ettha padassa vītiharaṇaṃ nikkhipanaṃ
analyzed: evam ettha yojanā kātabbā ekena pada vītihārena ati ettha padassa vītiharaṇam nikkhipanam
translated: This is how the interpretation should be understood here. By a single step: here the step is the placing down.

original: padavītihāro, padanikkhepo, tasmā ekena padanikkhepenāti vuttaṃ hoti. Ekena padavītihārena
analyzed: padavī tihāraḥ pada nikkhepaḥ tasmai ekena pada nikkhepena ati vuttam hoti ekena padavī tihārena
translated: The step is the placing down, the placing of the foot. Therefore it is said: “By a single placing of the foot.” By a single step

original: atikkamitabbaṭṭhānañca samagamanena dvinnaṃ padānaṃ antare muṭṭhiratanamattaṃ, tasmā.
analyzed: atikkamitabba ṭṭhānam ca sama gamanena dvinnam padānam antare muṭṭhi ratanam attam tasmā
translated: is the distance between the two feet when one has gone as far as one should go. Therefore,

original: Mātikāmattaṃ adhiṭṭhahitvāti muṭṭhiratanappamāṇaṃ mātikāmattaṃ adhiṭṭhāyāti attho.
analyzed: mātikā mattam adhiṭṭhahitvā ti muṭṭhi ratana ppamāṇam mātikā mattam adhiṭṭhāya ati attho
translated: Having determined the extent of the mat: the meaning is, having determined the extent of the mat, which is the size of a handspan.

original: Niṭṭhitā mahāmoggallānassa sīhanādakathā.
analyzed: niṭṭhitā mahāmoggallānassa sīhanāda kathā
translated: The explanation of the lion’s roar of Mahā Moggallāna is finished.

original: Vinayapaññattiyācanakathā
analyzed: vinaya paññatti yācana kathā
translated: The explanation of the request for the laying down of the training rules

original: 18. Vinayapaññattiyāti pubbe apaññattasikkhāpadaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Thero hi paññattasikkhāpadāni🔽ṭhapetvā idāni paññapetabbasikkhāpadāni pātimokkhuddesañca sandhāya “etassa bhagavā
analyzed: vinaya paññattiyā ti pubbe a paññatta sikkhāpadam sandhāya vuttam theraḥ hi paññatta sikkhāpadāni  ṭhapetvā idāni paññapetabba sikkhāpadāni pātimokkha uddesañca sandhāya etassa bhagavā
translated: The laying down of the training rules: this is said with reference to the training rules that had not previously been laid down. For the elder, setting aside the training rules that had been laid down,🔽with reference to the training rules that were to be laid down and the recitation of the Pāṭimokkha, said, “This is the time, Blessed One,

original: kālo, etassa sugata kālo, yaṃ bhagavā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeyya, uddiseyya
analyzed: kālo etassa sugata kālaḥ yam bhagavā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapeyya uddiseyya
translated: this is the time, Sublime One, for the Blessed One to lay down a training rule for the bhikkhus and to recite a Pāṭimokkha:

original: pātimokkha”nti āha. Bhagavatāpi –🔽“Ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo, yena pubbe appatarāni ceva sikkhāpadāni ahesuṃ,🔽bahutarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahiṃsu. Ko pana, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo, yena etarahi
analyzed: āha bhagavatā api  kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena pubbe appatarāni ca iva sikkhāpadāni ahesuṃ  bahutarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahiṃsu kaḥ pana bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena etarahi
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽“What is the reason, venerable sir, what is the cause, why formerly there were fewer training rules and more bhikkhus were established in final knowledge,

original: bahutarāni ceva sikkhāpadāni honti, appatarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahantīti. Evametaṃ,
analyzed: bahutarāni ca iva sikkhāpadāni honti appatarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahanti iti evam etam
translated: and what is the reason, venerable sir, what is the cause, why now there are more training rules and fewer bhikkhus are established in final knowledge?”

original: bhaddāli, hoti, sattesu hāyamānesu saddhamme antaradhāyamāne bahutarāni ceva sikkhāpadāni🔽honti, appatarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahantīti. Na tāva, bhaddāli, satthā sāvakānaṃ
analyzed: bhaddāli hoti sattesu hāyamānesu saddhamme antaradhāyamāne bahutarāni ca iva sikkhāpadāni  honti appatarā ca bhikkhū aññāya saṇṭhahanti iti na tāva bhaddāli satthā sāvakānaṃ
translated: “Bhaddāli, when beings are declining and the true Dhamma is disappearing, there are more training rules🔽and fewer bhikkhus are established in final knowledge.”

original: sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeti, yāva na idhekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā saṅghe pātubhavantī”ti –🔽Imasmiṃ bhaddālisutte viya ekaccesu paññattesupi tato paraṃ paññapetabbāni sandhāya
analyzed: sikkhāpadam paññapeti yāva naḥ idha ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammāḥ saṅghe pātubhavanti iti 🔽imasmim bhaddāli sutte viya ekaccesu paññattesu pi tatas param paññapetabbāni sandhāya
translated: “Bhaddāli, a teacher does not lay down a training rule for his disciples until some bhikkhu has transgressed.🔽In this Bhaddāli Sutta, the Blessed One said that training rules were laid down after some bhikkhus had transgressed.

original: “na tāva, sāriputta, satthā sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapetī”ti vuttaṃ. Idheva ca
analyzed: na tāva sāriputta satthā sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññapeti iti vuttam idha iva ca
translated: “Sāriputta, the Teacher does not lay down training rules for his disciples until the offense has been committed” . And in the commentary to this sutta,

original: aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “sāmampi pacanaṃ samaṇasāruppaṃ na hoti, na ca vaṭṭatī”ti vacanaṃ “ratticchedo🔽vā vassacchedo vā na kato”ti vacanañca pubbe paññattasikkhāpadānaṃ sabbhāve pamāṇanti
analyzed: pacanam samaṇa sāruppam na hoti na ca vaṭṭati iti vacanam ratti chedo  vā vassa chedaḥ vā na kataḥ ti vacanam ca pubbe paññatta sikkhāpadānam sabbhāve pamāṇam ti
translated: the statement “cooking for oneself is not suitable for a monastic and is not allowed” and the statement “the rains residence has not been entered” are to be regarded as the measure of the existence of the training rules laid down previously.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Sesasikkhāpadānañceva pātimokkhuddesassa ca therassa āyācanena paññattattā
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam sesa sikkhāpadānam ca iva pātimokkha uddesassa ca therassa āyācanena paññatta ttā
translated: The other training rules and the recitation of the Pāṭimokkha were laid down by the request of the elder.🔽Therefore it is said, “The source should be shown from the beginning.”

original: “mūlato pabhuti nidānaṃ dassetu”nti āha. Rahogatassāti raho janavivittaṃ ṭhānaṃ upagatassa.🔽Tena gaṇasaṅgaṇikābhāvena therassa kāyavivekamāha. Paṭisallīnassāti nānārammaṇacārato
analyzed: mūlataḥ pabhuti nidānam dassetunti āha rahogatassa ati rahaḥ jana vivittam ṭhānam upagatassa  tena gaṇa saṅgaṇikā bhāvena therassa kāya vivekam āha paṭisallīnassa ati nānā ārammaṇa cārataḥ
translated: “In private” means in a place that is secluded from people.🔽By this he shows the elder’s bodily seclusion through the absence of a crowd.🔽“In seclusion” means that his mind has turned away from wandering among the various objects of the senses.

original: cittassa nivattiyā paṭi sammadeva nilīnassa tattha avisaṭacittassa. Tena cittasaṅgaṇikābhāvenassa
analyzed: cittassa nivattiyā paṭi sammat eva nilīnassa tattha a visaṭa cittassa tena
translated: He is well secluded, his mind not wandering there. By this he shows the elder’s mental seclusion through the absence of mental distraction.

original: pubbabhāgiyaṃ cittavivekamāha. Ciranti kālāpekkhaṃ accantasaṃyoge upayogavacanaṃ.
analyzed: pubbabhāgiyam citta vivekam āha ciram ti kāla apekkham accanta saṃyoge upayoga vacanam
translated: and the first part of the phrase is said of the kind of seclusion of mind that is preliminary to the jhānas.🔽“For a long time” : the expression “for a long time” is used in the sense of a long period of time.

original: Cirāti cirakālayuttā ṭhiti abhedena vuttā.
analyzed: cirā ati cira kāla yuttā ṭhiti abhedena vuttā
translated: “For a long time” : the expression “for a long time” is used in the sense of a long period of time.🔽“He is not able”: he is not able to determine.

original: Etaṃ na sakkotīti etaṃ vinicchinituṃ na sakkoti. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttanayaṃ dassetvā
analyzed: etam na sakkoti iti etam vinicchinitum na sakkoti aṭṭhakathāyam vutta nayam dassetvā
translated: Having shown the method of the commentary,🔽he now shows the Theravāda, saying “But the Elder Maha-Paduma” and so on.

original: idāni theravādaṃ dassento āha “mahāpadumatthero panā”tiādi. Aṭṭhakathāyampi “na sakkotī”ti
analyzed: idāni thera vādam dassentaḥ āha mahāpaduma theraḥ pana atiādi aṭṭhakathāyam pi na sakkoti iti
translated: In the commentary too it is said “he is not able.”

original: idaṃ yasmā jānamānopi sammadeva paricchindituṃ na sakkoti, tasmā vuttanti vadanti.
analyzed: idam yasmā jānamānaḥ api sammat eva paricchinditum na sakkoti tasmā vuttam ti vadanti
translated: This is said because, although he is one who knows, he is not able to determine it properly.

original: Soḷasavidhāya paññāya matthakaṃ pattassāti majjhimanikāye anupadasuttantadesanāya –
analyzed: soḷasavidhāya paññāya matthakam pattassa ati majjhima nikāye anupada suttanta desanāya
translated: “Who has reached the peak of the sixteen kinds of understanding”: in the Majjhima Nikaya, in the Anupada Sutta,

original: “Mahāpañño bhikkhave sāriputto, puthupañño bhikkhave sāriputto, hāsapañño bhikkhave
analyzed: mahā paññaḥ bhikkhave sāriputto puthu paññaḥ bhikkhave sāriputto hāsa paññaḥ bhikkhave
translated: “Sariputta is greatly wise, bhikkhus, Sariputta is wise in many ways, Sariputta is wise in understanding,

original: sāriputto, javanapañño bhikkhave sāriputto, tikkhapañño bhikkhave sāriputto, nibbedhikapañño
analyzed: sāriputto javana paññaḥ bhikkhave sāriputto tikkha paññaḥ bhikkhave sāriputto nibbedhika pañño
translated: Sariputta is wise in ready speech, Sariputta is wise in penetration,

original: bhikkhave sāriputto”ti –
analyzed: bhikkhave sāriputtoti
translated: Sariputta is wise in deliverance.”

original: Evamāgatā mahāpaññādikā cha, tasmiṃyeva sutte āgatā navānupubbavihārasamāpattipaññā, arahattamaggapaññāti imāsaṃ soḷasappabhedānaṃ paññānaṃ sāvakavisaye ukkaṭṭhakoṭippattassa.
analyzed: evam āgatā mahāpaññā ādikā cha tasmin yeva sutte āgatā nava anupubba vihāra samāpatti paññā arahatta magga paññā ati imāsam soḷasa ppabhedānam paññānam sāvaka visaye ukkaṭṭha koṭi ppattassa
translated: The six beginning with great understanding come in this way. The nine kinds of understanding of the successive attainments come in this sutta itself . The understanding of the path of arahatship. This is the highest grade of understanding in the disciples’ field.

original: Kasmā panettha bhagavā vipassīādīnaṃ sattannaṃyeva buddhānaṃ brahmacariyassa ciraṭṭhitikāciraṭṭhitikabhāvaṃ
analyzed: kasmā pana ittha bhagavā vipassī ādīnam sattannam yeva buddhānam brahmacariyassa ciraṭṭhitika aciraṭṭhitika bhāvam
translated: But why did the Exalted One here tell of the long-enduring and short-enduring of the holy life of only seven Buddhas beginning with Vipassi,

original: kathesi, na buddhavaṃsadesanāyaṃ viya pañcavīsatiyā buddhānaṃ, tato vā pana bhiyyoti?🔽Yesaṃ sammāsambuddhānaṃ paṭivedhasāsanaṃ ekaṃsato nicchayena ajjāpi dharati, na antarahitaṃ,
analyzed: kathesi na buddha vaṃsa desanāyam viya pañcavīsatiyāḥ buddhānam tatas vā pana bhiyyas ti  yesam sammāsambuddhānam paṭivedha sāsanam ekaṃsataḥ nicchayena ajja api dharati na antarahitam
translated: and not of twenty-five Buddhas as in the Buddhavamsa, or of more than that?🔽The Exalted One told of the long-enduring and short-enduring of the holy life of only those seven Buddhas beginning with Vipassi🔽because the dispensation of the Perfectly Enlightened Ones, whose teaching endures in one unbroken tradition, has not yet disappeared.

original: te eva kittento vipassīādīnaṃyeva bhagavantānaṃ brahmacariyassa ciraṭṭhitikāciraṭṭhitikabhāvaṃ🔽idha kathesi. Tesaṃyeva hi sāvakā tadā ceva etarahi ca suddhāvāsabhūmiyaṃ ṭhitā,
analyzed: te eva kittentaḥ vipassī ādīnam yeva bhagavantānam brahmacariyassa ciraṭṭhitika aciraṭṭhitika bhāvam 🔽idha kathesi tesaṃyeva hi sāvakā tadā ca iva etarahi ca suddha āvāsa bhūmiyam ṭhitā
translated: For the disciples of those Buddhas alone, both then and now, are established in the plane of the Pure Abodes.

original: na aññesaṃ parinibbutattā. Siddhatthatissaphussānaṃ kira buddhānaṃ sāvakā suddhāvāsesu
analyzed: na aññesam parinibbuta ttā siddhattha tissa phussānam kira buddhānam sāvakā suddhāvāsesu
translated: not because of the others’ attainment of Nibbāna. For it is said that the disciples of the Buddhas Siddhattha, Tissa, and Phussa were reborn in the Pure Abodes,

original: uppannā uppattisamanantarameva imasmiṃ sāsane upakādayo viya arahattaṃ adhigantvā
analyzed: uppannāḥ uppatti samanantaram eva imasmin sāsane upaka ādayaḥ arahattam adhigantvā
translated: attained Arahantship immediately on being reborn there, as did Upavāṇa and his companions in this Dispensation,

original: na cirasseva parinibbāyiṃsu, na tattha tattha sāvakā yāvatāyukaṃ aṭṭhaṃsūti vadanti.
analyzed: na cirassa iva parinibbāyiṃsu na tattha tattha sāvakāḥ yāvatā āyukam vadanti
translated: and then they were extinguished, without remaining there for the whole of their lives as the disciples of other Buddhas did.

original: Apubbācarimaniyamo pana aparāparaṃ saṃsaraṇakasattāvāsavasena ekissā lokadhātuyā
analyzed: pana apara aparam saṃsaraṇaka sattāvāsa vasena ekissā lokadhātuyā
translated: But the restriction on the order of succession should be regarded as applying to the world of becoming, which is the abode of beings who pass on from one existence to another.

original: icchitoti na tenetaṃ virujjhatīti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: icchito ti na tena itam virujjhati iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: So there is no contradiction here.

original: 19. Asādhāraṇo hetu, sādhāraṇo paccayoti evamādivibhāgena idha payojanaṃ natthi,
analyzed: asādhāraṇaḥ hetu sādhāraṇaḥ paccayo ti evamādi vibhāgena idha payojanam natthi
translated: As to the purpose of the question, there is none here in the way of a distinction such as, “The cause is not common to all, but the condition is common.”

original: vipassīādīnaṃ pana brahmacariyassa aciraṭṭhitikatāya ciraṭṭhitikatāya ca kāraṇapucchāparattā
analyzed: vipassī ādīnam pana brahmacariyassa aciraṭṭhitika tāya ciraṭṭhitika tāya ca kāraṇa pucchā aparattā
translated: But the question is asked because of the short duration and the long duration of the life of purity of Vipassī and so on.

original: codanāyāti āha “hetu paccayoti ubhayametaṃ kāraṇādhivacana”nti. Hinoti tena phalanti
analyzed: codanāya iti āha hetu paccayo ti ubhayam etam kāraṇa adhivacananti hinoti tena phalanti
translated: The answer is given in terms of cause and condition, which are words for reason.

original: hetūti karaṇasādhanoyaṃ hetusaddoti āha “tena tassa phala”ntiādi. Kattusādhanopi
analyzed: hetu iti karaṇa sādhanaḥ yam hetu saddo ti āha tena tassa phala nti ādi kattu sādhanaḥ api
translated: The word ‘cause’ is a means of doing. Therefore he said ‘by that, its fruit’ . The word ‘cause’ is also a means of making.

original: hetusaddo no na yujjati hinoti phalassa hetubhāvaṃ upagacchatīti hetūti. Taṃ paṭicca
analyzed: hetu saddaḥ no na yujjati hinoti phalassa hetu bhāvam upagacchati iti hetu uti tam paṭicca
translated: It is not unsuitable. It is a cause because it is a cause of the fruit. It is a cause because it is a cause of the fruit.

original: eti pavattatīti taṃ kāraṇaṃ paṭicca tassa phalaṃ eti pavattati nibbattatīti attho.
analyzed: eti pavattati iti tam kāraṇam paṭicca tassa phalam eti pavattati nibbattati iti attho
translated: It is said that ‘it is by that cause that the fruit is obtained, that it occurs, that it is generated.’

original: Kilāsuno ahesunti appossukkā ahesuṃ, nirussāhā ahesunti attho. Sā pana nirussāhatā
analyzed: kilāsunaḥ ahesunti appossukkāḥ ahesum nirussāhāḥ ahesunti attho sā pana nirussāha tā
translated: They were not lazy. They were not slack, is the meaning. But that slackness

original: na ālasiyavasenāti āha “na ālasiyakilāsuno”ti, ālasiyavasena kilāsuno nāhesunti attho.
analyzed: na ālasiya vasena ati āha na ālasiya kilāsuno ti ālasiya vasena kilāsuno na ahesunti attho
translated: was not due to idleness. Therefore he said ‘they were not lazy and slack.’ The meaning is: they were not slack due to idleness.

original: Tattha kāraṇamāha “na hī”tiādi. Ālasiyaṃ vāti iminā thinamiddhavasappavattānaṃ akusalānaṃ
analyzed: tattha kāraṇam āha na hi itiādi ālasiyam vā ti iminā thinam iddha vasa pavattānam akusalānam
translated: Herein, he gives the reason, ‘not low’ , etc. By ‘idleness’ he shows the absence of unwholesome states that occur through sloth and torpor.

original: abhāvamāha. Osannavīriyatā vāti iminā pana “ālasiyābhāvepi antamaso annabhāranesādānampi
analyzed: abhāvam āha osanna vīriya tā vāti iminā pana ālasiya abhāve api antamasaḥ anna bhāra nesādānam pi
translated: By ‘slackness of energy’ he shows that even in the absence of idleness, there is slackness in the mere acquisition of the bare necessities of life.

original: sakkaccaṃyeva dhammaṃ desetī”ti vacanato yassa kassacipi dhammadesanāya nirussāhatā
analyzed: sakkaccaṃyeva dhammam deseti iti vacanataḥ yassa kassaci pi dhamma desanāya nirussāha tā

translated: he now said “He is not violent” in order to show it by way of result.

original: Tena yathā sattānaṃ jīvitā voropanaṃ paraṃ pāṇileḍḍudaṇḍādīhi viheṭhanañca “parūpaghāto
analyzed: tena yathā jīvitā voropanam param pāṇi leḍḍu daṇḍa ādīhi viheṭhanam ca
translated: For just as the taking of life and the harming of others with blows, sticks, etc., are called “violence” and “harming others,”

original: paraṃ viheṭhana”nti vuccati, evaṃ tesaṃ sāpateyyāvaharaṇaṃ parāmasanaṃ visaṃvādanaṃ🔽aññamaññabhedanaṃ pharusavacanena mammaghaṭṭanaṃ niratthakavippalāpo parasantakābhijjhānaṃ
analyzed: param viheṭhana nti vuccati evam tesam sāpateyya avaharaṇam parāmasanam visaṃvādanam  aññamañña bhedanam pharusa vacanena mamma ghaṭṭanam niratthaka vippalāpaḥ para santaka abhijjhānam
translated: so too the taking of others’ goods, the molesting of others, the deceiving of others,🔽the sowing of dissension among others, the wounding of others’ feelings with harsh words, the talking nonsense, the coveting of others’ goods,

original: ucchedacintanaṃ micchābhinivesanañca upaghāto paraviheṭhanañca hotīti yassa kassaci
analyzed: uccheda cintanam micchā abhinivesanam ca upaghāto para viheṭhanañca hoti iti yassa kassaci
translated: the thinking of annihilation, and the adherence to false doctrines are violence and harming others.

original: akusalassa kammapathassa kammassa ca karaṇena pabbajito samaṇo ca na hotīti dasseti.
analyzed: akusalassa kamma pathassa kammassa ca karaṇena pabbajitaḥ samaṇo ca na hoti iti dasseti
translated: Therefore, by the performance of any unprofitable course of action and of any action, one is not a monk or a brāhmaṇa.

original: Dutiyagāthāya sabbapāpassāti sabbākusalassa sabbassapi dvādasākusalassa sabbacittuppādasaṅgahitassa🔽sāvajjadhammassa. Akaraṇanti anuppādanaṃ. Karaṇañhi nāma tassa attano santāne uppādananti
analyzed: dutiya gāthāya sabba pāpassa ati sabba akusalassa sabbassa api dvādasa akusalassa sabba cittuppāda saṅgahitassa  sāvajja dhammassa a karaṇam ti anuppādanam karaṇam hi nāma tassa attano santāne uppādanam ti
translated: In the second stanza, “of all evil” is all unprofitable, all twelve unprofitable kinds of consciousness included in the aggregate of mental formations.🔽“Not doing” is non-arising. For “doing” is called the arising of that in one’s own continuity.

original: tappaṭikkhepato akaraṇaṃ anuppādanaṃ. Kusalassāti catubhūmikakusalassa. “Kusalassā”ti
analyzed: tad paṭikkhepataḥ a karaṇam an uppādanam kusalassa ati catu bhūmika kusalassa kusalassa ati
translated: So “not doing” is non-arising as the opposite of doing. “Of good” is of the four-constituent kind.

original: hi idaṃ “etaṃ buddhāna sāsana”nti vakkhamānattā ariyamaggadhamme tesañca sambhārabhūte
analyzed: hi idam etam buddhāna sāsananti ariya magga dhamme tesam ca sambhāra bhūte
translated: For this “of good” is said in order to state “this is the Enlightened One’s dispensation.”

original: tebhūmikakusale dhamme bodheti. Upasampadāti upasampādanaṃ. Taṃ pana atthato tassa🔽kusalassa samadhigamo paṭilābho. Sacittapariyodapananti attano cittassa jotanaṃ cittassa
analyzed: tebhūmika kusale dhamme bodheti upasampadā ati upasampādanam tam pana atthataḥ tassa  kusalassa samadhigamaḥ paṭilābho attanaḥ cittassa jotanam cittassa
translated: It inspires the states of the noble path and the states of the four-constituent kind of good that are the requisites for the path.🔽“Realizing” is realization. But that is in the sense of the attainment of that good.

original: pabhassarabhāvakaraṇaṃ sabbaso parisodhanaṃ. Taṃ pana arahattena hoti. Ettha ca yasmā
analyzed: pabhassara bhāva karaṇam sabbaso parisodhanam tam pana arahattena hoti ettha ca yasmā
translated: “Purifying one’s mind” is illuminating one’s own mind, making one’s mind bright, completely purifying it. But that is done by the state of Arahantship. And here

original: aggamaggasamaṅgino cittaṃ sabbaso pariyodapīyati nāma, aggaphalakkhaṇe pana pariyodapitaṃ🔽hoti puna pariyodapetabbatāya abhāvato, tasmā pariniṭṭhitapariyodapanataṃ sandhāya🔽vuttaṃ “taṃ pana arahattena hotī”ti. Iti sīlasaṃvarena sabbapāpaṃ pahāya lokiyalokuttarāhi
analyzed: agga magga samaṅgino cittam sabbaso pariyodapīyati nāma agga phala kkhaṇe pana pariyodapitam  hoti puna pariyodapetabba tāya abhāvato tasmā pariniṭṭhita pariyodapana tam sandhāya  vuttam tam pana arahattena hoti iti iti sīla saṃvarena sabba pāpam pahāya
translated: The heart of one who possesses the path to Arahantship is said to be “purified” in every way. But it is purified in the characteristic of the highest fruit,

original: samathavipassanāhi kusalaṃ sampādetvā arahattaphalena cittaṃ pariyodapetabbanti etaṃ
analyzed: samatha vipassanāhi kusalam sampādetvā arahatta phalena cittam pariyodapetabbanti etam
translated: because there is no need to purify it again. Therefore it is said: “But that is by means of Arahantship.” Thus, having abandoned all evil by means of restraint in the Pātimokkha, having developed the wholesome by means of the mundane and supramundane jhānas, and having purified the heart by means of the fruit of Arahantship,

original: buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ ovādo anusiṭṭhi.🔽Tatiyagāthāya anupavādoti vācāya kassaci anupavadanaṃ. Anupaghātoti kāyena manasā
analyzed: buddhānam sāsanam ovādaḥ anusiṭṭhi  tatiya gāthāya anupavādaḥ ti vācāya kassaci anupavadanam anupaghātaḥ ti kāyena manasā
translated: this is the teaching, the advice, the instruction of the Buddhas.

original: ca kassaci upaghātākaraṇaṃ manasāpi paresaṃ anatthacintanādivasena upaghātakaraṇassa
analyzed: ca kassaci upaghāta akaraṇam manasā api paresam anattha cintana ādi vasena upaghāta karaṇassa
translated: In the third stanza, “blameless” means not blaming anyone by speech. “Harmless” means not harming anyone by body or mind. Because harming by mind is to be avoided, too, by such means as not thinking of others’ misfortune.

original: vajjetabbattā. Pātimokkheti yaṃ taṃ paatimokkhaṃ atipamokkhaṃ uttamaṃ sīlaṃ, pāti
analyzed: vajjetabba ttā pātimokkha iti yam tam paatimokkham atipamokkham uttamam sīlam pāti
translated: “The Pātimokkha” is that Pātimokkha which is the supreme virtue, the transcending of evil.

original: vā sugatibhayehi mokkheti duggatibhayehi, yo vā naṃ pāti, taṃ mokkhetīti pātimokkhanti🔽vuccati, tasmiṃ pātimokkhe ca. Saṃvaroti sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ avītikkamalakkhaṇo🔽saṃvaro. Mattaññutāti bhojane mattaññutā paṭiggahaṇaparibhogavasena pamāṇaññutā.🔽Pantañca sayanāsananti janasaṅghaṭṭavirahitaṃ nijjanasambādhaṃ vivittaṃ senāsanañca.
analyzed: vā sugati bhayehi mokkheti duggati bhayehi yaḥ vā nam pāti tam mokkheti iti  vuccati tasmin pātimokkhe ca saṃvaroti sattannam āpatti kkhandhānam a vītikkama lakkhaṇo  saṃvaraḥ mattaññu tā ati bhojane mattaññu tā paṭiggahaṇa paribhoga vasena pamāṇaññu tā  sayana āsananti jana saṅghaṭṭa virahitam nij jana sambādham vivittam senāsanam ca

Adhicitte ca āyogoti vipassanāpādakaṃ🔽aṭṭhasamāpatticittaṃ adhicittaṃ, tatopi ca maggaphalacittameva adhicittaṃ, tasmiṃ🔽yathāvutte adhicitte āyogo ca, anuyogoti attho. Etaṃ buddhāna sāsananti etaṃ parassa
