original: anupavadanaṃ anupaghātanaṃ pātimokkhe saṃvaro paṭiggahaṇaparibhogesu mattaññutā vivittasenāsanasevanaṃ
analyzed: an upavadanam an upaghātanam pātimokkhe saṃvaro paṭiggahaṇa paribhogesu mattaññu tā vivitta senāsana sevanam
translated: knowing the right amount in taking food,

original: adhicittānuyogo ca buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ ovādo anusiṭṭhi.
analyzed: adhi citta anuyogaḥ ca buddhānam sāsanam ovādaḥ
translated: and devotion to wakefulness: this is the teaching of the Buddhas.

original: Imā pana sabbabuddhānaṃ pātimokkhuddesagāthā hontīti veditabbā. Tenāha “eteneva upāyenā”tiādi.🔽Yāva sāsanapariyantāti dharamānakabuddhānaṃ anusāsanapariyantaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ,
analyzed: imāḥ pana sabba buddhānam pātimokkha uddesa gāthāḥ honti iti veditabbā tena āha etena iva upāyena atiādi  yāva sāsana pariyantā iti dharamānaka buddhānam anusāsana pariyantam sandhāya vuttam
translated: But these verses should be understood as the Pāṭimokkha recitation of all the Buddhas. Hence it is said, “By this very method” .🔽As long as the Dispensation lasts: this is said with reference to the end of the Dispensation of the Buddhas who are present at any given time.

original: yāva buddhā dharanti, tāva uddisitabbataṃ āgacchantīti vuttaṃ hoti. Ovādapātimokkhañhi
analyzed: yāva buddhāḥ dharanti tāva uddisitabbatam āgacchanti iti vuttam hoti ovāda pātimokkham hi
translated: What is meant is that they will have to be recited as long as the Buddhas last. For the recitation of the Pāṭimokkha

original: buddhāyeva uddisanti, na sāvakā. Paṭhamabodhiyaṃyeva uddesamāgacchantīti sambandho.
analyzed: buddhāya iva uddisanti na sāvakā uddesam āgacchanti iti sambandhaḥ
translated: is done only by the Buddhas, not by disciples. The connection is this: they will have to be recited at the first Uposatha held after the enlightenment.

original: Paṭhamabodhi cettha vīsativassaparicchinnāti mahāgaṇṭhipade vuttaṃ. Tañca heṭṭhā
analyzed: paṭhama bodhi ca ittha vīsati vassa paricchinnā ti mahāgaṇṭhi pade vuttam tat ca heṭṭhā
translated: And here the first enlightenment is limited to twenty years, as stated in the Mahāgaṇṭhi Commentary.🔽And that is explained in the commentary below:

original: aṭṭhakathāyameva “bhagavato hi paṭhamabodhiyaṃ vīsativassantare nibaddhupaṭṭhāko
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā ayam eva bhagavataḥ hi paṭhama bodhiyam vīsati vassa antare nibaddha upaṭṭhāko
translated: “For the Blessed One’s first Uposatha was held twenty years after his enlightenment.

original: nāma natthī”ti kathitattā “paṭhamabodhi nāma vīsativassānī”ti gahetvā vuttaṃ. Ācariyadhammapālattherena🔽pana “pañcacattālīsāya vassesu ādito pannarasa vassāni paṭhamabodhī”ti vuttaṃ. Evañca
analyzed: nāma natthi iti kathita ttā paṭhamabodhi nāma vīsati vassāni iti gahetvā vuttam ācariya dhammapāla ttherena  pana pañcacattālīsāya vassesu āditas pannarasa vassāni paṭhama bodhī iti vuttam evam ca
translated: since it was said that there is no such name, it is taken to mean that the first enlightenment was twenty years.🔽But the teacher Dhammapāla says that in the fifty-four years, the first enlightenment was the first fifteen years.

original: sati majjhe pannarasa vassāni majjhimabodhi, ante pannarasa vassāni pacchimabodhīti
analyzed: sati majjhe pannarasa vassāni majjhimabodhi ante pannarasa vassāni pacchimabodhi iti
translated: And if that is so, the middle enlightenment was the middle fifteen years and the last enlightenment was the last fifteen years.🔽So the three enlightenments would be of equal duration.

original: tiṇṇaṃ bodhīnaṃ samappamāṇatā siyāti tampi yuttaṃ. Pannarasattikena hi pañcacattālīsa
analyzed: tiṇṇam bodhīnam samappamāṇa tā siyā ti tat pi yuttam pannarasa ttikena hi pañcacattālīsa
translated: For fifteen times fifteen makes one hundred and fifty, and one hundred and fifty fifteen-year periods make two thousand and four hundred years.

original: vassāni pūrenti. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana pannarasavassappamāṇāya paṭhamabodhiyā vīsativassesuyeva
analyzed: vassāni pūrenti aṭṭhakathā ayam pana pannarasa vassa ppamāṇāya paṭhama bodhiyā
translated: But in the commentary the first enlightenment, which is fifteen years long, is included in the twenty years,

original: antogadhattā “paṭhamabodhiyaṃ vīsativassantare”ti vuttanti evampi sakkā viññātuṃ.
analyzed: paṭhama bodhiyam vīsati vassa antare ti vuttam ti evam pi sakkā viññātum
translated: and so it is said, “In the first enlightenment, which is twenty years long.” It can be understood in this way too.

original: Nanu ca kānici sikkhāpadāni paññapetvāpi na tāva āṇāpātimokkhaṃ anuññātaṃ pacchā
analyzed: nanu ca kānici sikkhāpadāni paññapetvā api na tāva āṇāpātimokkham anuññātam pacchā
translated: But were not some training precepts laid down and the Pāṭimokkha not recited for some time afterwards,🔽since it was only after the elder’s request that the Buddha allowed the Pāṭimokkha to be recited?

original: therassa āyācanena anuññātattā, tasmā kathametaṃ vuttaṃ “sikkhāpadapaññattikālato
analyzed: therassa āyācanena anuññāta ttā tasmā katham etam vuttam sikkhāpada paññatti kālataḥ
translated: So how can it be said that the Pāṭimokkha was recited from the time the training precepts were laid down?

original: pana pabhuti āṇāpātimokkhameva uddisīyatī”ti, yadipi kānici sikkhāpadāni paññapetvāva
analyzed: pana pabhuti āṇāpātimokkham eva uddisīyati iti yadi api kānici sikkhāpadāni paññapetvā ava
translated: But from the time of the announcement of the training precept onwards the Pātimokkha is announced.”

original: āṇāpātimokkhaṃ na anuññātaṃ, tathāpi apaññatte sikkhāpade āṇāpātimokkhaṃ natthi,
analyzed: āṇāpātimokkham na anuññātam tathā api a paññatte sikkhāpade āṇāpātimokkham natthi
translated: Although the announcement of the Pātimokkha was not allowed after the laying down of some training precepts, still there is no announcement of the Pātimokkha when the training precept has not been laid down.

original: kintu paññatteyevāti imamatthaṃ dassetuṃ “sikkhāpadapaññattikālato pana pabhutī”ti
analyzed: kintu paññattā iya iva ati imam attham dassetum sikkhāpada paññatti kālato pana pabhuti iti
translated: But it is only when it has been laid down. This is the meaning that is shown by the words “But from the time of the announcement of the training precept onwards.”

original: vuttaṃ. Pubbārāmeti sāvatthiyā pācīnadisābhāge katattā evaṃladdhavohāre mahāvihāre.
analyzed: vuttam pubbārāme ti sāvatthiyā pācīna disā bhāge kata ttā evaṃladdha vohāre mahāvihāre
translated: The Eastern Monastery: because it was built in the eastern direction from Sāvatthī, it got the name “Eastern Monastery” in the Great Monastery.

original: Migāramātupāsādeti migāraseṭṭhino mātuṭṭhāniyattā migāramātāti saṅkhyaṃ gatāya visākhāmahāupāsikāya
analyzed: migāra mātu pāsādā iti migāra seṭṭhinaḥ mātuṭṭhā niyattā migāra mātā ati saṅkhyam gatāya visākhā mahā upāsikāya
translated: The nun Migāra’s mother’s pavilion: the nun Migāra’s mother was known as Migāra’s mother because she was the wife of Migāra the money-lender. The nun Migāra’s mother’s pavilion was built for her by the laywoman Migāra’s mother.

original: kārite pāsāde. Aṭṭhānanti hetupaṭikkhepo. Anavakāsoti paccayapaṭikkhepo. Ubhayenapi
analyzed: kārite pāsāde aṭṭhānanti hetu paṭikkhepaḥ anavakāsaḥ ti paccaya paṭikkhepaḥ ubhayena api
translated: “No grounds” is a rejection of the reason. “No opportunity” is a rejection of the condition.

original: kāraṇameva paṭikkhipati. Yanti yena kāraṇena.
analyzed: kāraṇam eva paṭikkhipati yanti yena kāraṇena
translated: By both he rejects the reason. “For what reason?”

original: Tesanti bhikkhūnaṃ. Sammukhasāvakānaṃ santike pabbajitāti sabbantimānaṃ subhaddasadisānaṃ
analyzed: tesanti bhikkhūnam sammukha sāvakānam santike pabbajitā ati sabbantimānam subhadda sadisānam
translated: “For them” means for the monks. “Who have gone forth in the presence of the Teacher” means all those who have gone forth in the presence of the Teacher, who are like Subhadda.

original: sammukhasāvakānaṃ santike pabbajite sandhāya vadati. Khattiyakulādivaseneva vividhā
analyzed: sammukha sāvakānam santike pabbajite sandhāya vadati khattiya kula ādi vasena iva vividhā
translated: The various kinds of families are to be construed as follows:

original: kulāti sambandho. Uccanīcauḷāruḷārabhogādikulavasena vāti uccanīcakulavasena uḷāruḷārabhogādikulavasena🔽vāti yojetabbaṃ. Tattha khattiyabrāhmaṇavasena vā khattiyabrāhmaṇagahapatikānaṃ vasena
analyzed: sambandhaḥ ucca nīca oḷāra uḷāra bhoga ādi kula vasena vāti ucca nīca kula vasena uḷāra uḷāra bhoga ādi kula vasena  vā iti yojetabbam tattha khattiya brāhmaṇa vasena vā khattiya brāhmaṇa gahapatikānam vasena
translated: either as “high and low families” or as “families with much or little wealth, etc.”🔽Herein, the high families are to be understood as the noble families and the brahmin families, or the noble, brahmin, and wealthy families; the low families are the rest.

original: vā uccakulatā veditabbā, sesānaṃ vasena nīcakulatā. Uḷāruḷārabhogādikulavasena vāti🔽uḷārataratamaupabhogavantādikulavasena. Uḷārātisayajotanatthañhi puna uḷāraggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: vā ucca kula tā veditabbā sesānam vasena nīca kula tā uḷāra uḷāra bhoga ādi kula vasena vāti  uḷārataratama aupabhogavanta ādi kula vasena punar uḷāra ggahaṇam
translated: Families with much or little wealth, etc., are families with much or little wealth, etc.🔽The repetition of “much” is for the purpose of emphasis,🔽like the repetition of “painful” in the passage beginning, “Painful, very painful, is bodily pain” .

original: “dukkhadukkha”ntiādīsu viya. Ādi-saddena uḷārānuḷārānaṃ gahaṇaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: dukkha dukkha nti ādīsu viya ādi saddena uḷāra anuḷārānam gahaṇam veditabbam
translated: The word “etc.” should be understood to include families with little wealth.

original: Brahmacariyaṃ rakkhantīti vuttamevatthaṃ pakāsetvā dassento āha “ciraṃ pariyattidhammaṃ
analyzed: brahmacariyam rakkhanti iti vuttam eva attham pakāsetvā dassentaḥ āha ciram pariyatti dhammam
translated: “Observing the spiritual life” : having shown the meaning already stated, he says, “keeping the scriptures long in mind.”

original: pariharantī”ti. Apaññattepi sikkhāpade yadi samānajātiādikā siyuṃ, attano attano
analyzed: pariharanti iti a paññatte pi sikkhāpade yadi samāna jāti ādikā siyum attanaḥ attanaḥ
translated: Even though the training precepts have not been laid down, if they have the same nature, etc., they are to be understood as “observing the spiritual life” .

original: kulānugataganthaṃ viya na nāseyyuṃ. Yasmā pana sikkhāpadampi apaññattaṃ, ime ca bhikkhū
analyzed: kula anugata gantham viya na na āseyyum yasmā pana sikkhāpadam pi a paññattam ime ca bhikkhū
translated: They would not have been destroyed like the text of the Dhammapada. But since the training precepts were not laid down and these bhikkhus

original: na samānajātiādikā, tasmā vināsesunti imamatthaṃ dassetuṃ “yasmā ekanāmā…pe… tasmā🔽aññamaññaṃ viheṭhentā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yadi evaṃ kasmā ciraṭṭhitikavārepi “nānānāmā”tiādi
analyzed: na samāna jāti ādikā tasmā imam attham dassetum yasmā tasmā  aññam aññam viheṭhentā atiādi vuttam yadi evam kasmā ciraṭṭhitika vāre pi nānā nāma atiādi
translated: were not of the same kind, they were destroyed. The meaning of this is given in the following passage: “Because they had the same name …🔽and they were of the same kind, therefore they destroyed each other.”🔽If that is so, why is it said in the section on long duration that they had different names, etc.?

original: vuttanti? Satipi tesaṃ nānājaccādibhāve sikkhāpadapaññattiyā eva sāsanassa cirappavattīti🔽dassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Sikkhāpadapaññattivaseneva sāsanassa cirappavatti. Yasmā buddhā
analyzed: vuttam ti sati pi tesam nānājacca ādi bhāve sikkhāpada paññattiyāḥ eva sāsanassa cira ppavatti iti  dassana attham vuttam sikkhāpada paññatti vasena iva sāsanassa cira ppavatti yasmai buddhā
translated: Although they were of different birth, etc., the Dispensation lasted long because the training precepts were laid down.

original: attano parinibbānato uddhampi vinetabbasattasambhave sati sikkhāpadaṃ paññapenti,🔽asati na paññapenti, tasmāti veditabbo. Yathā kāyavacīdvārasaṅkhātaṃ viññattiṃ samuṭṭhāpetvā
analyzed: attanaḥ parinibbānataḥ uddham pi vinetabba satta sambhave sati sikkhāpadam paññapenti  asati na paññapenti tasmā iti veditabbaḥ yathā kāya vacī dvāra saṅkhātam viññattim samuṭṭhāpetvā
translated: The Dispensation lasts long because of the laying down of the training precepts. For when there are beings to be trained even after the Buddha’s final attainment of Nibbāna,🔽the training precepts are laid down; but when there are none, they are not laid down. This is how it should be understood.🔽Although the mind occurs by arousing the intimation called bodily and verbal conduct,

original: pavattamānampi cittaṃ tassāyeva viññattiyā vasena pavattanato “kāyavacīdvārehi pavatta”nti
analyzed: pavattamānam api cittam tassāya eva viññattiyāḥ vasena pavattanataḥ kāya vacī dvārehi pavattanti
translated: it occurs by the influence of that intimation itself. Therefore it is said that it occurs by means of the bodily and verbal doors.

original: vuccati, evaṃsampadamidaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Yathā tanti ettha tanti nipātamattaṃ. Vaggasaṅgahapaṇṇāsasaṅgahādīhīti
analyzed: vuccati evaṃsampadam idam daṭṭhabbam yathā tanti ettha tanti nipāta mattam vagga saṅgaha paṇṇāsa saṅgaha ādīhi iti
translated: “In the vagga collections, the Paṇṇāsas, etc.”:

original: sīlakkhandhavaggamahāvaggādivaggasaṅgahavasena mūlapaṇṇāsamaajhamapaṇṇāsādipaṇṇāsasaṅgahavasena.
analyzed: sīla kkhandha vagga mahā vagga ādi vagga saṅgaha vasena mūla paṇṇāsa ma ajhama paṇṇāsa ādi paṇṇāsa saṅgaha vasena
translated: in the collections of the vaggas such as the Sīlakkhandhavagga and the Mahāvagga, and in the collections of the Paṇṇāsas such as the Mūlapaṇṇāsa and the Majjhimapaṇṇāsa.

original: Ādi-saddena saṃyuttādisaṅgaho veditabbo.
analyzed: ādi saddena saṃyutta ādi saṅgahaḥ veditabbo
translated: The word “etc.” should be understood to include the Saṃyutta collections, etc.

original: Evaṃ vitakketha, mā evaṃ vitakkayitthāti ettha evanti yathānusiṭṭhāya anusāsaniyā🔽vidhivasena paṭisedhanavasena ca pavattitākāraparāmasanaṃ, sā ca sammāvitakkānaṃ
analyzed: evam vitakketha mā evam vitakkayittha ati ettha evanti yathā anusiṭṭhāya anusāsaniyā  vidhi vasena paṭisedhana vasena ca pavatti tā ākāra parāmasanam sā ca sammā vitakkānam
translated: “Think like this, not like that”: here the word “like this” refers to the mode of occurrence of the teaching by way of the method of instruction given,🔽and the word “like that” refers to the mode of occurrence of the prohibition. And this occurs in order to show the mode of occurrence of right thoughts

original: micchāvitakkānañca pavattiākāradassanavasena pavattati atthaānisaṃsassa ādīnavassa
analyzed: micchā vitakkānam ca pavatti ākāra dassana vasena pavattati attha ānisaṃsassa ādīnavassa
translated: and wrong thoughts, and in order to point out the benefit and the danger.

original: ca vibhāvanatthaṃ. Tenāha “nekkhammavitakkādayo tayo vitakke vitakkethā”tiādi. Ettha
analyzed: ca vibhāvana attham tena āha nekkhamma vitakka ādayaḥ tayaḥ vitakke vitakketha atiādi ettha
translated: Therefore it is said: “Think thoughts of renunciation, etc.”

original: ādi-saddena abyāpādavitakkaavihiṃsāvitakkānaṃ gahaṇaṃ veditabbaṃ. Tattha nekkhammaṃ
analyzed: ādi saddena abyāpāda vitakka avihiṃsā vitakkānam gahaṇam veditabbam tattha nekkhammam
translated: The word “etc.” should be understood to include thoughts of non-ill will and thoughts of harmlessness. Herein, renunciation

original: vuccati lobhato nikkhantattā alobho, nīvaraṇehi nikkhantattā paṭhamajjhānaṃ, sabbākusalehi
analyzed: vuccati lobhataḥ nikkhanta ttā alobhaḥ nīvaraṇehi nikkhanta ttā paṭhamajjhānam sabba akusalehi
translated: It is said that non-greed is the opposite of greed, and the first jhana is the opposite of the hindrances, and the second jhana is the opposite of all the unprofitable things

original: nikkhantattā sabbo kusalo dhammo, sabbasaṅkhatehi nikkhantattā nibbānaṃ, upanissayato
analyzed: nikkhanta ttā sabbaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ sabba saṅkhatehi nikkhanta ttā nibbānam upanissayato
translated: It is called “without greed” because it has gone out from greed, “the first jhāna” because it has gone out from the hindrances, “all unprofitable things” because it has gone out from all unprofitable things, “all that is formed” because it has gone out from all that is formed, and “Nibbāna” because it has gone out from all the kinds of being. It is “associated with renunciation” because it is associated with renunciation by conascence, etc., and because it has renunciation as its object.

original: sampayogato ārammaṇakaraṇato ca nekkhammena paṭisaṃyutto vitakko nekkhammavitakko,
analyzed: sampayogataḥ ārammaṇa karaṇataḥ ca nekkhammena paṭisaṃyuttaḥ vitakkaḥ nekkhamma vitakko
translated: The thought associated with renunciation is renunciation-born thought.

original: sammāsaṅkappo. So asubhajjhānassa pubbabhāge kāmāvacaro hoti, asubhajjhāne rūpāvacaro,
analyzed: sammāsaṅkappo so asubha jhānassa pubbabhāge kāmāvacaraḥ hoti asubha jhāne rūpāvacaro
translated: Right thinking is the same. It is in the sense sphere in the preliminary stage of foulness meditation. It is in the fine-material sphere in foulness jhāna.🔽It is supramundane when it arises in the path and fruition consciousness that has foulness jhāna as its proximate cause.

original: taṃ jhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā uppannamaggaphalakāle lokuttaro. Byāpādassa paṭipakkho abyāpādo,
analyzed: tam jhānam pādakam katvā uppanna magga phala kāle lokuttaraḥ byāpādassa paṭipakkhaḥ a byāpādaḥ
translated: “Absence of ill will” is the opposite of ill will.🔽Or alternatively, it is the non-doing of ill will, the non-occurrence of ill will, in this way too it is absence of ill will. It is loving-kindness.

original: kañcipi na byāpādenti etenāti vā abyāpādo, mettā. Yathāvuttena abyāpādena paṭisaṃyutto🔽vitakko abyāpādavitakko. So mettājhānassa pubbabhāge kāmāvacaro hoti, mettābhāvanāvasena
analyzed: kañcipi na byāpādenti etena ati vā abyāpādaḥ mettā yathā vuttena abyāpādena paṭisaṃyuttaḥ  vitakko a byāpāda vitakko so mettā jhānassa pubbabhāge kāmāvacaraḥ hoti mettā bhāvanā vasena
translated: The thought associated with the absence of ill will in the way just stated is the thought of absence of ill will.🔽It is in the sense sphere in the preliminary stage of loving-kindness meditation. It is in the fine-material sphere in the first jhāna obtained by the development of loving-kindness.

original: adhigate paṭhamajjhāne rūpāvacaro, taṃ jhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā uppannamaggaphalakāle
analyzed: adhigate paṭhama jhāne rūpāvacaraḥ tam jhānam pādakam katvā uppanna magga phala kāle
translated: It is supramundane when it arises in the path and fruition consciousness that has loving-kindness as its proximate cause.

original: lokuttaro. Vihiṃsāya paṭipakkhā, na vihiṃsanti vā etāya satteti avihiṃsā, karuṇā.
analyzed: lokuttaraḥ vihiṃsāya paṭipakkhā na vihiṃsanti vai etāya sattā iti avihiṃsā karuṇā
translated: The opposite of violence is non-violence . Or alternatively, it does not harm beings, thus it is non-violence , which is compassion .

original: Tāya paṭisaṃyutto vitakko avihiṃsāvitakko. So karuṇājhānassa pubbabhāge kāmāvacaro,
analyzed: tāya paṭisaṃyuttaḥ vitakkaḥ avihiṃsā vitakko so karuṇā jhānassa pubbabhāge kāmāvacaro
translated: The applied thought associated with that is non-violence applied thought. That is of the sense sphere when it arises in the preliminary stage of compassion .

original: karuṇābhāvanāvasena adhigate paṭhamajjhāne rūpāvacaro, taṃ jhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā uppannamaggaphalakāle lokuttaro.
analyzed: karuṇā bhāvanā vasena adhigate paṭhama jhāne rūpāvacaraḥ tam jhānam pādakam katvā uppanna magga phala kāle lokuttaraḥ
translated: It is of the fine-material sphere when it arises in the first jhāna obtained by the development of compassion . It is supramundane when it arises in the path at the time of the first jhāna that is the basis for direct-knowledge.

original: Nanu ca alobhādosāmohānaṃ aññamaññāvirahato nesaṃ vasena uppajjanakānaṃ imesaṃ nekkhammavitakkādīnaṃ
analyzed: nanu ca alobha a dosa a mohānam aññamaññā virahataḥ nesam vasena uppajjanakānam imesam nekkhamma vitakka ādīnam
translated: But surely, since greed, hate and delusion are not separate from each other, there is no distinction of these three kinds of applied thought, namely, renunciation, etc.,

original: aññamaññaṃ asaṅkarato vavatthānaṃ na hotīti? No na hoti. Yadā hi alobho padhāno hoti
analyzed: aññam aññam asaṅkarataḥ vavatthānam na hoti iti no na hoti yadā hi alobhaḥ padhānaḥ hoti
translated: because of their arising with that distinction? No, there is no lack of distinction. For when greed is predominant

original: niyamitapariṇatasamudācārādivasena, tadā itare dve tadanvāyikā bhavanti. Tathā hi
analyzed: niyamita pariṇata samudācāra ādi vasena tadā itare dve tad anvāyikāḥ bhavanti tathā hi
translated: and the other two are subordinate, then the applied thought is of renunciation.

original: yadā alobhappadhāno nekkhammagaruko cittuppādo hoti, tadā laddhāvasaro nekkhammavitakko
analyzed: yadā alobha ppadhānaḥ nekkhamma garukaḥ cittuppādaḥ hoti tadā laddha avasaraḥ nekkhamma vitakko
translated: For when there is a state of consciousness that is dominated by greed and that is heavy with greed, then the applied thought of renunciation, having got an opportunity,🔽is able to arise in the way already described.

original: patiṭṭhahati. Taṃsampayuttassa pana adosalakkhaṇassa abyāpādassa vasena yo tasseva🔽abyāpādavitakkabhāvo sambhaveyya, sati ca abyāpādavitakkabhāve kassacipi aviheṭhanajātikatāya
analyzed: patiṭṭhahati tad sampayuttassa pana adosa lakkhaṇassa abyāpādassa vasena yaḥ tassa iva  a byāpāda vitakka bhāvo sambhaveyya sati ca a byāpāda vitakka bhāve kassaci pi a viheṭhana jātika tāya
translated: But the presence of the absence of ill will, which is the characteristic of non-hate associated with it, is implied by the presence of that

original: avihiṃsāvitakkabhāvo ca sambhaveyya. Te itare dve tasseva nekkhammavitakkassa anugāmino
analyzed: avihiṃsā vitakka bhāvaḥ ca te itare dve tassa iva nekkhamma vitakkassa anugāminaḥ
translated: absence of ill will itself. And when there is the absence of ill will, then the presence of the absence of cruelty, which is the nature of non-cruelty, is implied by the presence of the absence of ill will, which is the nature of non-cruelty. So these two are inferred to be present when the absence of ill will is present and absent when it is absent. In the same way,🔽when the thought of renunciation is present, the other two are inferred to be present because they are its companions.

original: sarūpato adissanato tasmiṃ sati honti, asati na hontīti anumāneyyā bhavanti. Evameva🔽yadā mettāpadhāno cittuppādo hoti, tadā itare dve tadanvāyikā bhavanti. Yadā karuṇāpadhāno
analyzed: sarūpataḥ a dissanataḥ tasmin sati honti asati na honti iti anumāneyyāḥ bhavanti evam eva  yadā mettā apadhānaḥ cittuppādaḥ hoti tadā itare dve tad anvāyikāḥ bhavanti yadā karuṇā apadhānaḥ
translated: And when the thought of renunciation is absent, they are absent.

original: cittuppādo hoti, tadā itare dve tadanvāyikā bhavanti.
analyzed: cittuppādaḥ hoti tadā itare dve tad anvāyikāḥ bhavanti
translated: So too, when the thought that is headed by loving-kindness is present, the other two are its companions. When the thought that is headed by compassion is present, the other two are its companions.

original: Kāmavitakkādayoti ettha ādi-saddena byāpādavitakkavihiṃsāvitakkānaṃ gahaṇaṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: kāma vitakka ādayaḥ ti ettha ādi saddena byāpāda vitakka vihiṃsā vitakkānam gahaṇam veditabbam
translated: The thought of sensual desire, etc., here: the word “etc.” should be understood as including the thought of ill will and the thought of cruelty.

original: Tattha kāmapaṭisaṃyutto vitakko kāmavitakko. Ettha hi dve kāmā vatthukāmo ca kilesakāmo
analyzed: tattha kāma paṭisaṃyuttaḥ vitakkaḥ kāma vitakko ettha hi dve kāmā vatthu kāmo ca kilesa kāmo
translated: Herein, the thought associated with sense desire is the thought of sensual desire. For there are two kinds of sense desires, namely, as objects and as defilements.

original: ca. Tattha vatthukāmapakkhe ārammaṇavasena kāmehi paṭisaṃyutto vitakko kāmavitakko,🔽kilesakāmapakkhe pana sampayogavasena kāmena paṭisaṃyuttoti yojetabbaṃ. Byāpādapaṭisaṃyutto
analyzed: ca tattha vatthu kāma pakkhe ārammaṇa vasena kāmehi paṭisaṃyuttaḥ vitakko kāma vitakko  kilesa kāma pakkhe pana sampayoga vasena kāmena paṭisaṃyuttaḥ ti yojetabbam byāpāda paṭisaṃyuttaḥ
translated: Herein, in the case of the first two kinds of lust, the thinking associated with the object is thinking associated with sensual desires,🔽and in the case of the second two kinds of lust, the thinking associated with the defilement is thinking associated with sensual desires.

original: vitakko byāpādavitakko. Vihiṃsāpaṭisaṃyutto vitakko vihiṃsāvitakko. Tesu dve sattesupi
analyzed: vitakkaḥ byāpāda vitakkaḥ vihiṃsā paṭisaṃyuttaḥ vitakkaḥ vihiṃsā vitakko tesu dve sattesu pi
translated: The thinking associated with ill will is thinking of ill will. The thinking associated with cruelty is thinking of cruelty.🔽These three kinds of thinking occur in relation to both living beings and formations.

original: saṅkhāresupi uppajjanti. Kāmavitakko hi piye manāpe satte vā saṅkhāre vā vitakkentassa
analyzed: saṅkhāresu pi uppajjanti kāma vitakkaḥ hi piye manāpe satte vā saṅkhāre vā vitakkentassa
translated: For thinking of sensual desires occurs in one who thinks about a dear and beloved living being or formation.

original: uppajjati, byāpādavitakko appiye amanāpe satte vā saṅkhāre vā kujjhitvā olokanakālato🔽paṭṭhāya yāva vināsanā uppajjati, vihiṃsāvitakko saṅkhāresu nuppajjati. Saṅkhāro🔽hi dukkhāpetabbo nāma natthi, “ime sattā haññantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā
analyzed: uppajjati byāpāda vitakkaḥ appiye amanāpe satte vā saṅkhāre vā kujjhitvā olokana kālataḥ  paṭṭhāya yāva vināsanā uppajjati vihiṃsā vitakkaḥ saṅkhāresu na uppajjati saṅkhāraḥ  hi dukkha apetabbaḥ nāma natthi ime sattā haññantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā
translated: Thinking of ill will occurs in one who, having felt anger towards an undelightful and unlovely living being or formation, looks at it from the point of view of its destruction.🔽Thinking of cruelty does not occur in relation to formations.🔽For a formation is not something that can be killed. But it occurs in relation to living beings when one thinks, “May these living beings be killed, perish, be destroyed, die, or disappear” .

original: mā vā ahesu”nti cintanakāle pana sattesu uppajjati. Atha kasmā vuttaṃ “saṅkhāro dukkhāpetabbo
analyzed: mā vā ahesun ti cintana kāle pana sattesu uppajjati atha kasmā vuttam saṅkhāraḥ dukkha apetabbaḥ
translated: So why is it said that “a formation is to be killed” ?

original: nāma natthī”ti, nanu ye dukkhāpetabbāti icchitā sattasaññitā, tepi atthato saṅkhārā
analyzed: nāma natthi iti nanu ye dukkha apetabbā ati icchitā satta saññitā te pi atthataḥ saṅkhārā
translated: “No, there are no beings,” then are not the beings who are supposed to be made to suffer in fact formations?

original: evāti? Saccametaṃ, te pana indriyabaddhā saviññāṇakatāya dukkhaṃ paṭisaṃvedenti,
analyzed: eva ati saccam etam te pana indriya baddhā sa viññāṇaka tāya dukkham paṭisaṃvedenti
translated: —It is true that they are formations, but they are bound up with faculties and they experience suffering because they are associated with consciousness.

original: tasmā te vihiṃsāvitakkassa visayā icchitā sattasaññitā. Ye pana na dukkhaṃ paṭisaṃvedenti
analyzed: tasmā te vihiṃsā vitakkassa visayāḥ icchitā satta saññitāḥ ye pana na dukkham paṭisaṃvedenti
translated: Therefore the beings who are supposed to be made to suffer are the province of the malevolence idea. But those who do not experience suffering

original: vuttalakkhaṇāyogato, te sandhāya “vihiṃsāvitakko saṅkhāresu nuppajjatī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vutta lakkhaṇa ayogataḥ te sandhāya vihiṃsā vitakko saṅkhāresu nuppajjati iti vuttam
translated: because they do not possess the characteristics already stated are the beings referred to in the words “The malevolence idea does not occur in formations.”

original: Anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṃsūti ettha āsavehīti katthuatthe karaṇaniddeso,
analyzed: an upādāya āsavehi cittāni ettha āsavehi iti katthu atthe karaṇa niddesaḥ
translated: “Their cognizances were liberated from the taints by non-clinging”: here the instrumental case in “taints” is a locative-locative;

original: cittānīti paccattabahuvacanaṃ, vimucciṃsūti kammasādhanaṃ, tasmā āsavehi kattubhūtehi
analyzed: cittāni iti paccatta bahuvacanam vimucciṃsū ti kamma sādhanam tasmai āsavehi kattu bhūtehi
translated: the plural in “cognizances” is a distributive plural; and the gerundive “to be liberated” is a gerundive of agency.

original: anupādāya ārammaṇavasena aggahetvā cittāni vimuccitānīti evamettha attho gahetabboti
analyzed: an upādāya ārammaṇa vasena aggahetvā cittāni vimuccitāni iti evam ettha atthaḥ gahetabbaḥ ti
translated: So the meaning can be taken as follows: “Their cognizances were liberated by being made the means of liberation from the taints that were the agents of the liberation, by non-clinging, that is, by non-grasping as an object.”🔽So he said “For their cognizances” and so on.

original: āha “tesañhi cittānī”tiādi. Yehi āsavehīti etthāpi kattuatthe eva karaṇaniddeso.
analyzed: āha tesam hi cittāni itiādi yehi āsavehi iti ettha api kattu atthe eva karaṇa niddeso
translated: And here the instrumental case in “by the taints” is also an ablative case.

original: Vimucciṃsūti kammasādhanaṃ. Na te tāni gahetvā vimucciṃsūti te āsavā tāni cittāni🔽ārammaṇavasena na gahetvā vimucciṃsu vimocesuṃ. Ettha hi cittānīti upayogabahuvacanaṃ,🔽vimucciṃsūti kattusādhanaṃ. Anuppādanirodhena nirujjhamānāti āyatiṃ anuppattisaṅkhātena
analyzed: vimucciṃsu iti kamma sādhanam na te tāni gahetvā vimucciṃsu iti te āsavā tāni cittāni  ārammaṇa vasena na gahetvā ettha hi cittāni iti upayoga bahuvacanam  kattu sādhanam anuppāda nirodhena āyatim anuppatti saṅkhātena
translated: ‘They were freed’: this is the means of accomplishment by action. ‘They were not freed by taking them up’ means that those taints were not freed by those consciousnesses taking them up as objects. For here the plural form ‘those consciousnesses’ is used in the sense of instrumentality.

original: nirodhena nirujjhamānā āsavā. Aggahetvā vimucciṃsūti ārammaṇakaraṇavasena aggahetvā🔽cittāni vimocesuṃ. Vikasitacittā ahesunti sātisayañāṇarasmisamphassena samphullacittā
analyzed: nirodhena nirujjhamānāḥ āsavāḥ aggahetvā ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena aggahetvā  cittāni vimocesum vikasita cittāḥ ahesun ti sa atisaya ñāṇa rasmi samphassena samphulla cittā
translated: ‘They were freed’: this is the means of accomplishment by action. ‘They were ceasing through the cessation that is non-arising’ means that the taints were ceasing through the cessation called ‘non-arising’ in the future. ‘They were freed by not taking them up’ means that the consciousnesses were freed by not taking them up as objects.

original: ahesuṃ. Purimavacanāpekkhanti “aññatarasmiṃ bhiṃsanake vanasaṇḍe”ti vuttavacanāpekkhaṃ.
analyzed: ahesum purima vacana apekkhanti aññatarasmim bhiṃsanake vana saṇḍe iti vutta vacana apekkham
translated: ‘They were consciousnesses that had expanded’ means that they were consciousnesses that had blossomed through the contact of the rays of the special knowledge. ‘Looking for the previous statement’ means looking for the statement ‘in a certain frightening forest grove’.

original: Tenāha “yaṃ vuttaṃ aññatarasmiṃ bhiṃsanake vanasaṇḍeti, tatrā”ti. Katanti bhāvasādhanavāci
analyzed: tena āha yam vuttam aññatarasmim bhiṃsanake vana saṇḍā iti tatra ati bhāva sādhana vāci
translated: Therefore he said: ‘What was said about a certain frightening forest grove, there …’ ‘Katanti’ is a word for the means of accomplishment by state.

original: idaṃ padanti āha “bhiṃsanakatasmiṃ hoti, bhiṃsanakakiriyāyā”ti. Bhiṃsanassa karaṇaṃ
analyzed: idam padanti āha bhiṃsanaka tasmin hoti bhiṃsanaka kiriyāya ati bhiṃsanassa karaṇam
translated: ‘This word’ is ‘bhiṃsanakatasmiṃ hoti, bhiṃsanakakiriyāya’. ‘Bhiṃsanassa karaṇaṃ’ means the doing of the frightening.

original: kiriyā bhiṃsanakataṃ, tasmiṃ bhiṃsanakatasmiṃ.🔽Idāni aññathāpi atthayojanaṃ dassento āha “atha vā”tiādi. Imasmiṃ atthavikappe bhiṃsayatīti🔽bhiṃsano, bhiṃsano eva bhiṃsanako, tassa bhāvo bhiṃsanakattanti vattabbe ta-kārassa🔽lopaṃ katvā “bhiṃsanakata”nti vuttanti dassento āha “bhiṃsanakatasminti bhiṃsanakabhāveti🔽attho”tiādi. Yebhuyyaggahaṇaṃ lomavantavasenapi yojetabbaṃ, na lomavasenevāti āha
analyzed: kiriyā bhiṃsanakatam tasmin bhiṃsanakatasmin  idāni aññathā api attha yojanam dassentaḥ āha atha vā atiādi imasmin attha vikappe bhiṃsayati iti  bhiṃsanaḥ bhiṃsanaḥ eva bhiṃsanako tassa bhāvaḥ vattabbe takārassa  lopam katvā bhiṃsana katanti vuttanti dassentaḥ āha bhiṃsana katasmin ti bhiṃsanaka bhāve iti  attha utiādi yebhuyyak gahaṇam lomavanta vasena api yojetabbam na loma vasena iva ati āha
translated: The state of being fearful is the state of being fearful in that which is fearful.

original: “bahutarānaṃ vā”tiādi.
analyzed: vāti ādi
translated: Now, showing the meaning in another way, he said “Or alternatively” and so on. In this interpretation of the meaning, he frightens, thus he is fearful . He who is fearful is fearful himself, thus he is fearful . The state of that is the state of being fearful . But instead of saying “the state of being fearful,” the word ta- is omitted and “the state of being fearful” is said. Showing this, he said “In the state of being fearful means in the state of being fearful” and so on. The word “mostly” should be construed also by way of the hairy ones, not only by way of the hairy. Thus he said “Or mostly” and so on.

original: Purisayugavasenāti purisakālavasena, purisānaṃ āyuppamāṇavasenāti vuttaṃ hoti. “Sabbapacchimako
analyzed: purisa yuga vasena āti purisa kāla vasena purisānam āyu ppamāṇa vasena ati vuttam hoti sabba pacchimako
translated: By way of a pair of men means by way of a period of men, by way of the measure of the life-span of men. It is said: “The last

original: subhaddasadiso”ti tīsupi gaṇṭhipadesu vuttaṃ. Tasmiṃ kāle vijjamānānaṃ dvinnaṃ purisānaṃ
analyzed: subhadda sadisaḥ ti tīsu pi gaṇṭhi padesu vuttam tasmin kāle vijjamānānam dvinnam purisānam
translated: of all is like Subhaddā.” This is said in the three junctions. At that time, taking the life-span of two men who existed,

original: āyuparicchedaṃ sakalameva gahetvā “satasahassaṃ…pe… aṭṭhāsī”ti vuttaṃ. Dveyeva purisayugānīti
analyzed: āyu paricchedam sakalam eva gahetvā aṭṭhāsi iti vuttam dveyeva purisa yugāni iti
translated: the whole measure is said: “A hundred thousand years, … eighty thousand years.” Two pairs of men only

original: ettha purisānaṃ yugappavattikālo purisayugaṃ. Abhilāpamattameva cetaṃ, atthato pana
analyzed: ettha purisānam yuga ppavatti kālaḥ purisa yugam abhilāpa mattam eva atthataḥ pana
translated: Herein, the time of the appearance of two men is a pair of men. But this is merely a mode of expression. In fact

original: purisova purisayugaṃ. Dharamāne bhagavati ekaṃ purisayugaṃ, parinibbute ekanti katvā
analyzed: purisaḥ uva purisa yugam dharamāne bhagavati ekam purisa yugam parinibbute ekam ti katvā
translated: the pair of men is just one man. When the Blessed One was living it was one pair of men, and when he had attained to Parinibbāna it was another. So it was said:

original: “dveyeva purisayugānī”ti vuttaṃ. Parinibbute pana bhagavati ekameva purisayugaṃ asītiyeva
analyzed: dveyeva purisa yugāni iti vuttam parinibbute pana bhagavati ekam eva purisa yugam asītiyā iva
translated: “There were only two pairs of men.” But when the Blessed One had attained to Parinibbāna, there was only one pair of men. The life of purity lasted for eighty

original: vassasahassāni brahmacariyaṃ aṭṭhāsīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: vassa sahassāni brahmacariyam aṭṭhāsi iti veditabbam
translated: thousand years.

original: 20. Sāvakayugānīti sāvakā eva sāvakayugāni. Asambhuṇantenāti apāpuṇantena. Gabbhaṃ gaṇhāpentassāti sabbaññutaññāṇassa vijāyanatthaṃ ñāṇagabbhaṃ gaṇhāpentassa.
analyzed: sāvaka yugāni iti sāvakāḥ eva sāvaka yugāni a sambhuṇantena ati a pāpuṇantena gabbham gaṇhāpentassa ati sabbaññu taññāṇassa vijāyana attham ñāṇa gabbham gaṇhāpentassa
translated: . Pairs of disciples: pairs of disciples are just disciples. Who would not attain: who would not reach. Who would conceive a conception: who would conceive a conception of the knowledge-embryo for the purpose of giving birth to the knowledge of omniscience.

original: 21. Ko anusandhīti pubbāparakathānaṃ kiṃ anusandhānaṃ, ko sambandhoti attho. Sikkhāpadapaññattiyācanāpekkhanti
analyzed: kaḥ anusandhi iti pubba apara kathānam kim anusandhānam kaḥ sambandhaḥ ti attho sikkhāpada paññatti yācanā apekkhanti
translated: . What is the connection? What is the connection between the earlier and later parts of the sutta? What is the relationship? The request for the announcement of the training precepts

original: yācīyatīti yācanā, sikkhāpadapaññattiyeva yācanā sikkhāpadapaññattiyācanā, taṃ apekkhatīti
analyzed: yācīyati iti yācanā sikkhāpada paññattiyā iva yācanā sikkhāpada paññatti yācanā tam apekkhati iti
translated: is a request for the announcement of the training precepts. The request is the announcement of the training precepts. The Blessed One was looking for that.🔽. The Blessed One was looking for the request for the announcement of the training precepts.

original: sikkhāpadapaññattiyācanāpekkhaṃ bhummavacanaṃ, yāciyamānasikkhāpadapaññattiapekkhaṃ🔽bhummavacananti vuttaṃ hoti. Yācanavisiṭṭhā sikkhāpadapaññattiyeva hi “tatthā”ti
analyzed: sikkhāpada paññatti yācana apekkham bhumma vacanam yāciyamāna sikkhāpada paññatti apekkham  bhumma vacanam ti vuttam hoti yācana visiṭṭhā sikkhāpada paññattiyā iva hi tattha ati
translated: The words “if he should ask” are a statement of fact looking to the request for the announcement of the training rule.🔽The words “if he should ask” are a statement of fact looking to the announcement of the training rule.

original: iminā parāmaṭṭhā, teneva vakkhati “tattha tassā sikkhāpadapaññattiyā”ti. Yaṃ vuttanti
analyzed: iminā tena iva vakkhati tattha tassā sikkhāpada paññattiyā ti yam vuttam ti
translated: The announcement of the training rule is distinguished by the request, and so it is referred to by the words “therein” in the phrase “therein, the announcement of the training rule”.

original: “sikkhāpadaṃ paññapeyyā”ti iminā yaṃ sikkhāpadapaññapanaṃ vuttaṃ, yācitanti attho.
analyzed: sikkhāpadam paññapeyya iti iminā yat sikkhāpada paññapanam vuttam yācitam ti attho
translated: The words “if he should ask” refer to the announcement of the training rule that is stated in the phrase “he should announce the training rule”.

original: Tattha tassā sikkhāpadapaññattiyāti tassaṃ yāciyamānasikkhāpadapaññattiyanti attho.
analyzed: tattha tassā sikkhāpada paññattiyā ti tassam yāciyamāna sikkhāpada paññattiyan ti attho
translated: The words “therein, the announcement of the training rule” refer to the announcement of the training rule that is requested.

original: Akālanti sikkhāpadapaññattiyā akālaṃ.🔽Āsavaṭṭhānīyāti ettha adhikaraṇe anīyasaddoti āha “āsavā tiṭṭhanti etesū”tiādi. Ke
analyzed: akālam ti sikkhāpada paññattiyāḥ akālam  āsava ṭṭhānīyā ti ettha adhikaraṇe anīya saddo ti āha āsavā tiṭṭhanti etesu utiādi ke
translated: The words “it is not the right time” refer to the announcement of the training rule.🔽The words “a basis for taints” are explained as follows. The word “basis” is a word for a legal issue, and so he says, “Taints stand in these,” and so on.

original: pana te āsavā, ke ca dhammā tadadhikaraṇabhūtāti āha “yesu diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikā”tiādi.
analyzed: pana te āsavā ke ca dhammā tad adhikaraṇa bhūtā ti āha yesu diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika atiādi
translated: But what are these taints, and what are the principles that are the legal issues? He says, “Those in regard to which there are taints relating to the present life and the next,” and so on.

original: Diṭṭhadhammikā parūpavādādayo, samparāyikā āpāyikā apāyadukkhavisesā. Te āsavanti
analyzed: diṭṭhadhammikā parūpavāda ādayo samparāyikā āpāyikā apāya dukkha visesā te āsavanti
translated: And the kinds of abuse, etc., in the present life are the kinds of abuse, etc., in the next life, which are the different kinds of suffering in the states of loss. They flow

original: tena tena paccayavasena pavattantīti āsavā. Nesanti parūpavādādiāsavānaṃ. Teti vītikkamadhammā.🔽Asati āsavaṭṭhānīye dhamme sikkhāpadapaññattiyaṃ ko doso, yenevaṃ vuttanti āha “yadi🔽hi paññapeyyā”tiādi, vītikkamadosaṃ adisvā yadi paññapeyyāti adhippāyo. Parammukhā
analyzed: tena tena paccaya vasena pavattanti iti āsavāḥ parūpavāda ādi āsavānam te iti vītikkama dhammā  asati āsava ṭṭhānīye dhamme sikkhāpada paññattiyam kaḥ dosaḥ yena ivam vuttan ti āha yadi  hi paññapeyya atiādi vītikkama dosam a disvā yadi paññapeyya ati adhippāyaḥ parammukhā
translated: out by means of those conditions, thus they are effluents. They are carried away by the effluents of abuse, etc. They are those who transgress.

original: akkosanaṃ parūpavādo, parehi vacanesu dosāropanaṃ parūpārambho, sammukhā garahanaṃ garahadoso.
analyzed: akkosanam parūpa vādaḥ parehi vacanesu dosa āropanam parūpa ārambhaḥ sammukhāḥ garahanam garaha dosaḥ
translated: If there were no states that are grounds for effluents, what would be the harm in announcing a training precept? “If he should announce it” is said. The meaning is: if he should announce it without seeing the harm in transgressing. Abuse of another by speaking with one’s back turned to him is “abuse by speaking with one’s back turned to him.” Assigning faults to others by means of their words is “assigning faults to others.” Reproaching to their face is “reproach.”

original: Kathañhi nāma paliveṭhessatīti sambandho, kathaṃ-saddayoge anāgatappayogo daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: katham hi nāma paliveṭhessati iti sambandhaḥ kathaṃsadda yoge anāgata ppayogaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: How could he turn his back on them? The construction is this. The word “how” should be regarded as having the function of a future negative particle.

original: Anvāyikoti anuvattako. Bhogakkhandhanti bhogarāsiṃ. “Amhākamete”ti ñāyantīti ñātī,
analyzed: anvāyikā iti anuvattakaḥ bhoga kkhandhanti bhoga rāsim amhākam ete iti ñāyanti iti ñātī
translated: A follower is one who follows. A mass of wealth is a “wealth-aggregate.” Relatives are those who are known as “our own people.”

original: pitāmahapituputtādivasena parivaṭṭanaṭṭhena parivaṭṭo, ñātīyeva parivaṭṭo ñātiparivaṭṭo.
analyzed: pitāmaha pitu putta ādi vasena parivaṭṭana ṭṭhena parivaṭṭaḥ ñātīya iva parivaṭṭaḥ ñāti parivaṭṭaḥ
translated: A circle is a succession. A circle of relatives is a circle of relatives.

original: Ghāsacchādanaparamatāya santuṭṭhāti ghāsacchādane paramatāya uttamatāya santuṭṭhā,
analyzed: ghāsa chādana parama tāya santuṭṭhā ati ghāsa chādane parama tāya uttama tāya santuṭṭhā
translated: “They are satisfied with the attainment of mere robes and almsfood”: they are satisfied with the attainment of mere robes and almsfood, with the highest, the supreme robes and almsfood.

original: ghāsacchādanapariyesane sallekhavasena paramatāya ukkaṭṭhabhāve saṇṭhitāti attho.
analyzed: ghāsa chādana pariyesane sallekha vasena parama tāya ukkaṭṭha bhāve saṇṭhitā ati attho
translated: The meaning is: they are content with the highest, the supreme state of renunciation in the search for robes and almsfood.

original: Ghāsacchādanameva vā paramaṃ paramā koṭi etesaṃ na tato paraṃ kiñci asāmisajātaṃ🔽pariyesanti paccāsīsanti cāti ghāsacchādanaparamā, tesaṃ bhāvo ghāsacchādanaparamatā,
analyzed: ghāsa chādanam eva vā paramam paramā na tatas param kiñci  ca ati ghāsa chādana paramā tesam bhāvaḥ ghāsa chādana parama tā
translated: Or else, “mere robes and almsfood” are the highest, the supreme limit for them; they do not search for or desire anything else that is not in conformity with their state.🔽They are satisfied with the attainment of mere robes and almsfood.

original: tassaṃ ghāsacchādanaparamatāya santuṭṭhā. Tesu nāma koti yathāvuttaguṇavisiṭṭhesu
analyzed: ghāsa chādana parama tāya santuṭṭhā tesu nāma yathāvutta guṇa visiṭṭhesu
translated: “Among those who are called ‘monks’”: among those who are called “monks” in the way described above.

original: tesu bhikkhūsu ko nāma. Lokāmisabhūtanti lokapariyāpannaṃ hutvā kilesehi āmasitabbattā
analyzed: tesu bhikkhūsu kaḥ nāma loka āmisa bhūtanti loka pariyāpannam hutvā kilesehi āmasitabba ttā
translated: “They are the world’s refuse”: they have become included in the world; they are to be touched by defilements.🔽“They are the world’s refuse” because they are the refuse of the world.

original: lokāmisabhūtaṃ. Pabbajjāsaṅkhepenevāti “pāṇātipātā veramaṇī”tiādinā pabbajjāmukheneva.
analyzed: loka āmisa bhūtam pabbajjā saṅkhepena iva ati pāṇātipātā veramaṇī iti ādinā pabbajjā mukhena iva
translated: “By the mere going forth”: by the mere going forth, by the mere “I undertake” of the precepts beginning with “abstaining from killing living beings.”

original: Etanti methunādīnaṃ akaraṇaṃ. Thāmanti sikkhāpadānaṃ paññāpanakiriyāya sāmatthiyaṃ.
analyzed: etat ti methuna ādīnam akaraṇam thāmam ti sikkhāpadānam paññāpana kiriyāya sāmatthiyam
translated: “The opportunity”: the opportunity for the performance of the proclamation of the training rules.

original: Balanti yāthāvato sabbadhammānaṃ paṭivedhasamatthaṃ ñāṇabalaṃ. Kuppeyyāti kuppaṃ
analyzed: balanti yāthāvataḥ sabba dhammānam paṭivedha samattham ñāṇa balam kuppeyya ati kuppam
translated: The strength of the knowledge of the penetration of all things as they really are. He would be a failure: he would be a failure

original: bhaveyya. Etassevatthassa pākaṭakaraṇaṃ na yathāṭhāne tiṭṭheyyāti, paññattiṭṭhāne
analyzed: bhaveyya etassa iva atthassa pākaṭa karaṇam na yathā ṭhāne tiṭṭheyya ati paññatti ṭṭhāne
translated: in the treatment. The meaning is, he would not stand in his place, that is,

original: na tiṭṭheyyāti attho. Akusaloti tikicchituṃ yuttakālassa aparijānanato akusalo acheko.
analyzed: na tiṭṭheyya ati atthaḥ akusalo ti tikicchitum yutta kālassa a parijānanataḥ akusalaḥ achekaḥ
translated: he would not stand in the place of a designation. Unskilled: unskilled in knowing the time for treatment.

original: Avuddhi anayo, byasanaṃ dukkhaṃ. Paṭikaccevāti gaṇḍuppādanato paṭhamameva. Sañchaviṃ
analyzed: avuddhi anayaḥ byasanam dukkham gaṇḍu ppādanato paṭhamam eva sañchavim
translated: No increase, no benefit, misfortune, suffering. At the very outset: at the very beginning, because of the production of the boil.

original: katvāti sobhanacchaviṃ katvā. Bālavejjoti apaṇḍitavejjo. Lohitakkhayañca maṃ pāpetīti
analyzed: katvā ati sobhana chavim katvā bāla vejjo iti apaṇḍita vejjo lohita kkhayam ca mama pāpa iti iti
translated: Having made a good skin: having made a good surface. The ignorant doctor: the unskilled doctor. And he would bring on a loss of blood:

original: vibhattivipariṇāmaṃ katvā yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: vibhatti vipariṇāmam katvā yojetabbam
translated: this should be construed with the locative case-ending.

original: Akālaṃ dassetvāti sikkhāpadapaññattiyā akālaṃ dassetvā. Rogaṃ vūpasametvāti phāsuṃ
analyzed: akālam dassetvā ti sikkhāpada paññattiyāḥ akālam dassetvā rogam vūpasametvā ati phāsum
translated: Having shown it at the wrong time: having shown it at a time not suitable for the announcement of a training rule. Having allayed the disease: having made it comfortable.

original: katvā. Sake ācariyaketi ācariyassa bhāvo, kammaṃ vā ācariyakaṃ, tasmiṃ attano ācariyabhāve,
analyzed: katvā sake ācariyaka iti ācariyassa bhāvaḥ kammam vā ācariyakam tasmin attanaḥ ācariya bhāve
translated: In his own teacher’s method: the state of being a teacher is the teacher’s state or action. In that, in his own teacher’s state,

original: ācariyakamme vā. Nimittatthe cetaṃ bhummavacanaṃ. Viditānubhāvoti pākaṭānubhāvo.
analyzed: ācariya kamme vā nimitta atthe ca itam bhumma vacanam vidita anubhāvaḥ ti pākaṭa anubhāvaḥ
translated: or in the duties to a teacher. The locative case here is in the sense of a reason. ‘Whose influence is well known’: whose influence is evident.

original: Vipulabhāvenāti pabbajitānaṃ bahubhāvena. Sāsane ekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā dhammā na uppajjantīti🔽yasmā senāsanāni pahonti, tasmā āvāsamacchariyādihetukā sāsane ekacce āsavaṭṭhānīyā
analyzed: vipula bhāvena ati pabbajitānam bahu bhāvena sāsane ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyāḥ dhammāḥ na uppajjanti iti  senāsanāni pahonti tasmai āvāsa macchariya ādi hetukā sa āsane ekacce āsava ṭṭhānīyā
translated: ‘Because of the abundance’: because of the abundance of those gone forth. Some things that are a basis for taints do not arise in the Dispensation.🔽Because the dwellings are sufficient, some things that are a basis for taints do not arise in the Dispensation

original: dhammā na uppajjanti. Iminā nayenāti etena padasodhammasikkhāpadādīnaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: dhammā na uppajjanti iminā nayena ati etena pada sodhamma sikkhāpada ādīnam saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: because of the absence of the desire for a dwelling place, etc. ‘By this method’: by this method the inclusion of the training precepts, etc., should be seen.

original: Lābhaggamahattanti cīvarādilabhitabbapaccayo lābho, tassa aggaṃ mahattaṃ paṇītatā
analyzed: lābha gga mahattanti cīvara ādi labhitabba paccayaḥ lābho tassa aggam mahattam paṇīta tā
translated: ‘The greatness of gain and honour’: gain is the requisite of robe-material, etc., that is to be obtained; its greatness is its excellence,

original: bahubhāvo vā. Bahussutassa bhāvo bāhusaccaṃ. Ayoniso ummujjamānāti anupāyena abhinivisamānā,
analyzed: bahu bhāvaḥ vā bahu ssutassa bhāvaḥ bāhusaccam ayonisaḥ ummujjamānā ati anupāyena abhinivisamānā
translated: its abundance. ‘Abundance of learning’: the state of being learned. ‘When they are misapprehending’: when they are misinterpreting by an improper method;

original: viparītato jānamānāti attho. Rasena rasaṃ saṃsanditvāti sabhāvena sabhāvaṃ saṃsanditvā,
analyzed: viparītataḥ jānamānā ati atthaḥ rasena rasam saṃsanditvā iti sabhāvena sabhāvam saṃsanditvā
translated: the meaning is, when they are knowing wrongly. ‘By mixing taste with taste’: by mixing the real nature with the real nature;

original: anuññātapaccattharaṇādīsu sukhasamphassasāmaññato upādinnaphassarasepi anavajjasaññitāya
analyzed: anuññāta paccattharaṇa ādīsu sukha samphassa sāmaññataḥ upādinna phassa rase pi anavajja saññitāya
translated: in the case of the allowable spreads, etc., because of the similarity of pleasant contact, the taste of the contact that is clung to is regarded as blameless.

original: anupādinnaphassarasena upādinnaphassarasaṃ saṃsanditvā, samānabhāvaṃ upanetvāti attho.🔽Uddhammaṃ ubbinayaṃ satthusāsanaṃ dīpentīti “tathāhaṃ bhagavatā dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmī”tiādinā
analyzed: an upādinna phassa rasena upādinna phassa rasam saṃsanditvā samāna bhāvam upanetvā iti attho  uddhammam ubbinayam satthu sāsanam dīpenti iti tathā aham bhagavatā dhammam desitam ājānāmi itiādinā
translated: by combining the taste of the contact that is not clung to with the taste of the contact that is clung to, by bringing them to the same level.

original: satthusāsanaṃ uddhammaṃ ubbinayaṃ katvā dīpenti.
analyzed: satthu sāsanam uddhammam ubbinayam katvā dīpenti
translated: They make the Teacher’s Dispensation shine forth by means of the highest and the most excellent: they make the Teacher’s Dispensation shine forth by saying: “I understand the Dhamma taught by the Exalted One in this way” and so on.

original: Imasmiṃ attheti “nirabbudo hi, sāriputta, bhikkhusaṅgho”ti evaṃ vuttabhikkhusaṅghasaññite🔽atthe. Kathaṃ pana dussīlānaṃ corabhāvoti āha “te hi assamaṇāva hutvā”tiādi. Kāḷakadhammayogāti
analyzed: imasmin atthe ti nirabbudaḥ hi sāriputta bhikkhu saṅghaḥ ti evam vutta bhikkhu saṅgha saññite  atthe katham pana dussīlānam cora bhāvaḥ ti āha te hi hutvā atiādi kāḷaka dhamma yogā ti
translated: In this matter: in the matter of the bhikkhu-saṅgha referred to in the words: “The bhikkhu-saṅgha, Sāriputta, is free from barrenness.”

original: dussīlatāsaṅkhātapāpadhammayogato. Pabhassaroti pabhassarasīlo. Sāroti vuccantīti
analyzed: dussīla tā saṅkhāta pāpa dhamma yogato pabhassaro ti pabhassara sīlo sāro ti vuccanti iti
translated: How is it that the unvirtuous are thieves? He says: “For they are not true bhikkhus,” and so on. They are bound to the black qualities: they are bound to the bad qualities called unvirtuousness.

original: sāsanabrahmacariyassa sārabhūtattā sīlādayo guṇā “sāro”ti vuccanti.
analyzed: sāsana brahmacariyassa sāra bhūta ttā sīla ādayaḥ guṇā sāro ti vuccanti
translated: The pure-lived: the one of pure virtue. The essence: the virtues such as virtue, etc., are called “the essence” because they are the essence of the Dispensation and the holy life.

original: Sabbaparittaguṇoti sabbehi nihīnaguṇo, appaguṇo vā. So sotāpannoti ānandattheraṃ
analyzed: sabba paritta guṇoti sabbehi nihīna guṇaḥ appaguṇaḥ vā so sotāpannaḥ ti ānanda theram
translated: The one of least virtue: the one of the least virtue, the one of the lowest virtue. The stream-enterer: the Elder Ānanda.

original: sandhāya vadati. Sotaṃ āpannoti maggasotaṃ āpanno. Paṭipakkhadhammānaṃ anavasesato
analyzed: sandhāya vadati sotam āpannaḥ ti magga sotam āpannaḥ paṭipakkha dhammānam anavasesato
translated: He speaks with reference to the path. He has entered the stream: he has entered the path stream. Because of the complete absence of states opposed to the path,

original: savanato pellanato soto ariyamaggoti āha “sototi ca maggassetaṃ adhivacana”nti. Sotāpannoti
analyzed: savanataḥ pellanataḥ soto ariya maggo ti āha soto ti ca maggassa etam adhivacanan ti sotāpannaḥ ti
translated: because of hearing, and because of entering, the path is called the noble path stream. Thus he said: “And ‘stream’ is a term for the path” . He has entered the stream:

original: tena samannāgatassa puggalassāti iminā maggasamaṅgī sotāpannoti vatvā tamevatthaṃ
analyzed: tena samannāgatassa puggalassa ati iminā magga samaṅgī sotāpannaḥ ti vatvā tam eva attham
translated: he is a person possessing that path. Having said that one who possesses the path is a stream-enterer, he now illustrates that meaning

original: udāharaṇena sādhetvā idāni idhādhippetapuggalaṃ niddhāretvā dassento āha “idha panā”tiādi.
analyzed: udāharaṇena sādhetvā idāni idha adhippeta puggalam niddhāretvā dassentaḥ āha idha pana atiādi
translated: with an example in order to make it clear. Then he points out the person intended here, saying, “But here” , etc.

original: Idha āpannasaddo “phalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno”tiādīsu viya vattamānakālikoti āha
analyzed: idha āpanna saddo phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ ti ādīsu viya vattamāna kālikaḥ ti āha
translated: Here the word “entered” is in the present tense like such usages as “he is practising for the realization of the fruit” . Thus he said,

original: “maggena phalassa nāmaṃ dinna”nti. Maggena hi attanā sadisassa aṭṭhaṅgikassa vā sattaṅgikassa🔽vā phalassa sototi nāmaṃ dinnaṃ, atītakālikatte pana sarasatova nāmalābho siyā. Maggakkhaṇe
analyzed: maggena phalassa nāmam dinnanti maggena hi attanā sadisassa aṭṭhaṅgikassa vā sattaṅgikassa  vā phalassa soto ti nāmam dinnam atīta kālika tte pana sarasataḥ iva nāma lābhaḥ siyā magga kkhaṇe
translated: “The fruit is called by the name of the path” . For the path gives the name “stream” to the fruit, which is similar to itself, whether it be of eight or seven factors.

original: hi maggasotaṃ āpajjati nāma, phalakkhaṇe āpanno.
analyzed: hi magga sotam āpajjati nāma phala khaṇe āpannaḥ
translated: But if the past tense were intended, the name would be obtained only by memory. For at the moment of the path one is said to “enter the stream” , and at the moment of the fruit one is a “stream-enterer.”

original: Virūpaṃ sadukkhaṃ saupāyāsaṃ nipātetīti vinipāto, apāyadukkhe khipanako. Dhammoti🔽sabhāvo. Tenāha “na attānaṃ apāyesu vinipātanasabhāvo”ti. Atha vā dhammoti apāyesu
analyzed: virūpam sa dukkham sa upāyāsam nipāteti iti vinipātaḥ apāya dukkhe khipanakaḥ dhammaḥ ti  sabhāvaḥ tena āha na attānam apāyesu vinipātana sabhāvaḥ ti atha vā dhammo ti apāyesu
translated: “It is a falling, a letting fall, of what is ugly, painful, and harmful” . It is a throwing into states of loss, a throwing into the suffering of the states of loss. “Dhamma” :

original: khipanako sakkāyadiṭṭhiādiko akusaladhammo. Yassa pana so akusaladhammo natthi sabbaso🔽pahīnattā, so yasmā apāyesu attānaṃ vinipātanasabhāvo na hoti, tasmā vuttaṃ “na attānaṃ
analyzed: khipanako sakkāya diṭṭhi ādiko akusala dhammo yassa pana saḥ akusala dhammo natthi sabbaso  pahīna ttā saḥ yasmai apāyesu attānam vinipātana sabhāvaḥ na hoti tasmai vuttam na attānam
translated: its individual essence. Hence he said: “It is not of the nature to throw oneself into states of loss” . Or alternatively, “Dhamma” is the unprofitable dhammas such as the embodiment view, etc., that throw one into states of loss. But he who has completely abandoned that unprofitable dhamma

original: apāyesu vinipātanasabhāvoti vuttaṃ hotī”ti. Kasmāti avinipātanadhammatāya kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: apāyesu vinipātana sabhāvo ti vuttam hoti iti kasmā ati a vinipātana dhamma tāya kāraṇam
translated: is not of the nature to throw oneself into states of loss, because he has abandoned it. Hence it was said: “It is not of the nature to throw oneself into states of loss” . “Why?” : he asks the reason for the non-throwing-into-states-of-loss.

original: pucchati. Apāyaṃ gamentīti apāyagamanīyā. Vinipātanasabhāvoti uppajjanasabhāvo. Sammattaniyāmena🔽maggenāti sammā bhavaniyāmakena paṭiladdhamaggena. Niyatoti vā heṭṭhimantato sattamabhavato
analyzed: pucchati apāyam gamenti iti apāya gamanīyāḥ vinipātana sabhāvaḥ ti uppajjana sabhāvaḥ sammatta niyāmena  maggena ati sammā bhava niyāmakena paṭiladdha maggena niyato ti vā heṭṭhimantataḥ sattama bhavato
translated: “They go to states of loss” : they are liable to go to states of loss. “Of the nature to throw into” : of the nature to arise.🔽“By the path of rightness” : by the path that has been reached by right directing. “Assured” : assured by the non-arising of the seven kinds of becoming beginning with the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: upari anuppajjanadhammatāya niyato. Sambodhīti uparimaggattayasaṅkhātā sambodhi.
analyzed: upari an uppajjana dhamma tāya niyataḥ sambodhi iti upari magga ttaya saṅkhātā sambodhi
translated: “To enlightenment” : to the three higher paths.

original: Sambujjhatīti hi sambodhi, ariyamaggo. So ca idha paṭhamamaggassa adhigatattā avasiṭṭho🔽eva adhigantabbabhāvena icchitabboti. Tenāha “uparimaggattayaṃ avassaṃ sampāpako”ti.🔽Uparimaggattayaṃ avassaṃ sampāpuṇātīti sampāpako, sotāpanno.
analyzed: sambujjhati iti hi sambodhi ariya maggo so ca idha paṭhama maggassa adhigata ttā avasiṭṭho  eva adhigantabba bhāvena icchitabbaḥ iti tena āha upari magga ttayam avassam sampāpakaḥ ti  upari magga ttayam avassam sampāpuṇāti iti sampāpakaḥ sotāpannaḥ
translated: ‘He awakens to it’ means that he awakens to the noble path, which is enlightenment. And since the first path has already been reached, the remaining paths are to be desired as what is to be reached. Hence he said: ‘He will certainly reach the three higher paths.’

original: Vinayapaññattiyācanakathā niṭṭhitā.🔽Buddhāciṇṇakathā🔽22. Anudhammatāti lokuttaradhammānugato dhammo. Anapaloketvāti padassa vivaraṇaṃ🔽“anāpucchitvā”ti. Janapadacārikaṃ pakkamantīti ettha iti-saddo gamyamānatāya na vutto,🔽evaṃ aññatthāpi īdisesu ṭhānesu. Tattha janapadacārikanti janapadesu caraṇaṃ, caraṇaṃ🔽vā cāro, so eva cārikā, janapadesu cārikā janapadacārikā. Taṃ pakkamanti, janapadagamanaṃ
analyzed: vinaya paññatti yācana kathā niṭṭhitā 🔽buddha aciṇṇa kathā 🔽anudhammatā ti lokuttara dhamma anugataḥ dhammaḥ an apaloketvā ti padassa vivaraṇam 🔽an āpucchitvā iti janapada cārikam pakkamanti iti ettha iti saddaḥ gamyamāna tāya na vuttaḥ 🔽evam aññattha api īdisesu ṭhānesu tattha janapada cārikam ti janapadesu caraṇam caraṇam 🔽vā cāraḥ saḥ eva cārikā janapadesu cārikā janapada cārikā tam pakkamanti janapada gamanam
