original: gacchantīti attho. Pakkamantiyevāti avadhāraṇena no na pakkamantīti dasseti. “Janapadacārikaṃ🔽pakkamantī”ti ettha ṭhatvā bhagavato cārikāpakkamanavidhiṃ dassento āha “janapadacārikaṃ
analyzed: gacchanti iti attho pakkamantiyā iva āti avadhāraṇena no na pakkamanti iti dasseti janapada cārikam  pakkamanti iti ettha ṭhatvā bhagavataḥ cārikā pakkamana vidhim dassentaḥ āha janapada cārikam
translated: the meaning is, “they go.” By the particle eva he shows that they do not not go. “They go on a tour of the country” .🔽🔽Having said this, he shows the Blessed One’s method of going on tour, saying “on a tour of the country” .

original: carantā cā”tiādi. Cārikā ca nāmesā duvidhā turitacārikā ceva aturitacārikā ca. Tattha🔽dūrepi bodhaneyyapuggalaṃ disvā tassa bodhanatthāya sahasā gamanaṃ turitacārikā nāma,🔽sā mahākassapattherapaccuggamanādīsu daṭṭhabbā. Bhagavā hi mahākassapattheraṃ paccuggacchanto
analyzed: cārikā ca nāma isā duvidhā turita cārikā ca iva a turita cārikā ca tattha  dūre api bodhaneyya puggalam disvā tassa bodhana tthāya sahasā gamanaṃ turitacārikā nāma  sā mahākassapa thera paccuggamana ādīsu daṭṭhabbā bhagavā hi mahākassapa theram paccuggacchantaḥ
translated: The meaning is: “they went away.” By the particle eva he shows that they did not not go away. In the passage “they went away on a tour of the country” he shows the method of the Blessed One’s going on a tour by saying “they went away on a tour of the country” and so on. A tour is of two kinds: a swift tour and a leisurely tour. Herein, the Blessed One’s going quickly to a place in order to instruct a person who is capable of being instructed even though he lives far away is called a swift tour.🔽This may be seen in the Blessed One’s going to meet the Elder Mahā Kassapa,

original: muhuttena tigāvutamagamāsi, āḷavakassatthāya tiṃsayojanaṃ, tathā aṅgulimālassa, pukkusātissa
analyzed: muhuttena āḷavakassa atthāya tiṃsa yojanam tathā aṅgulimālassa pukkusātissa
translated: for the Blessed One went a distance of three gavutas in a moment to meet the Elder Mahā Kassapa. He went thirty yojanas for the sake of Āḷavaka, thirty for the sake of Aṅgulimāla,

original: pana pañcacattālīsayojanaṃ, mahākappinassa vīsayojanasataṃ, dhaniyassatthāya sattayojanasatāni
analyzed: pana pañcacattālīsa yojanam mahākappinassa vīsa yojana satam dhaniyassa atthāya satta yojana satāni
translated: fifty-four for the sake of Pukkusāti, a hundred and twenty for the sake of Mahā Kappa, and a hundred and seventy for the sake of Dhaniya.

original: agamāsi, dhammasenāpatino saddhivihārikassa vanavāsītissasāmaṇerassa tigāvutādhikaṃ
analyzed: agamāsi dhammasenāpatino saddhivihārikassa vanavāsī tissa sāmaṇerassa
translated: He went to the forest-dwelling novice monk named Tissa, a pupil of the General of the Dhamma, who was staying

original: vīsayojanasataṃ agamāsi, ayaṃ turitacārikā. Yaṃ pana gāmanigamanagarapaṭipāṭiyā devasikaṃ
analyzed: vīsa yojana satam ayam turita cārikā yam pana gāma nigama nagara paṭipāṭiyā devasikam
translated: twenty-five leagues away. This is called “rapid walking.” But when the Blessed One goes from village to town and city,

original: yojanaaḍḍhayojanavasena piṇḍapātacariyādīhi lokaṃ anuggaṇhantassa gamanaṃ, ayaṃ aturitacārikā
analyzed: yojana aḍḍhayojana vasena piṇḍapāta cariyā ādīhi lokam anuggaṇhantassa gamanam ayam aturita cārikā
translated: following the worldly way by going for alms, etc., a league or a league and a half a day, this is called “slow walking.”

original: nāma. Imaṃ pana cārikaṃ caranto bhagavā mahāmaṇḍalaṃ majjhimamaṇḍalaṃ antimamaṇḍalanti
analyzed: nāma imam pana cārikam carantaḥ bhagavā mahā maṇḍalam majjhima maṇḍalam
translated: When he goes on this walk, the Blessed One goes in one of three ways: the great-circle way, the middle-circle way, and the small-circle way.

original: imesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ maṇḍalānaṃ aññatarasmiṃ carati. Tattha “janapadacārika”nti vuttattā
analyzed: imesam tiṇṇam maṇḍalānam aññatarasmim carati tattha janapada cārikam ti vutta ttā
translated: Here, since it is said that he goes on a “walk through the country,”

original: aturitacārikāva idhādhippetā. Tameva vibhajitvā dassento āha “mahāmaṇḍalaṃ majjhimamaṇḍala”ntiādi.
analyzed: aturita cārikā va idha adhippetā tam eva vibhajitvā dassentaḥ āha mahā maṇḍalam majjhima maṇḍala ntiādi
translated: the slow walk is intended. Dividing it up, he says, “The great-circle way, the middle-circle way” and so on.

original: Tattha antimamaṇḍalanti khuddakamaṇḍalaṃ, itaresaṃ vā maṇḍalānaṃ antogadhattā antimamaṇḍalaṃ,
analyzed: tattha antima maṇḍalanti khuddaka maṇḍalam itaresam vā maṇḍalānam antogadhattā antima maṇḍalam
translated: Here, the small-circle way is the small circle, or it is the small circle because it is included in the other two circles.

original: abbhantarimamaṇḍalanti vuttaṃ hoti. Imesaṃ pana maṇḍalānaṃ kiṃ pamāṇanti āha “tattha
analyzed: abbhantarima maṇḍalanti vuttam hoti imesam pana maṇḍalānam kim pamāṇam ti āha tattha
translated: the inner circle is meant. But what is the size of these circles? He says:🔽Herein, the great circle is 900 leagues.

original: mahāmaṇḍalaṃ navayojanasatika”ntiādi. Navayojanasatikampi ṭhānaṃ majjhimadesapariyāpannameva,
analyzed: mahā maṇḍalam nava yojana satikanti ādi nava yojana satikam pi ṭhānam majjhima desa pariyāpannam eva
translated: Even the 900-league place is included in the Middle Country,

original: tato paraṃ nādhippetaṃ turitacārikāvasena agamanato. Yasmā nikkhantakālato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: tato param na adhippetam turita cārikā vasena agamanataḥ yasmā nikkhanta kālataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: but what is beyond that is not intended, because of the impossibility of going there quickly.🔽Because from the time of leaving,

original: gatagataṭṭhānassa catūsu passesu samantato yojanasataṃ ekakolāhalaṃ hoti, purimaṃ
analyzed: gata gata ṭṭhānassa catūsu passesu samantataḥ yojana satam eka kolāhalam hoti purimam
translated: the place that is gone to becomes one uproar in all four directions, a hundred leagues all round. Those who have come

original: purimaṃ āgatā nimantetuṃ labhanti, itaresu dvīsu maṇḍalesu sakkāro mahāmaṇḍalaṃ osarati,
analyzed: purimam āgatāḥ nimantetum labhanti itaresu dvīsu maṇḍalesu sakkāraḥ mahā maṇḍalam osarati
translated: first get the invitation. In the other two circles the honour comes down to the great circle.

original: tattha buddhā bhagavanto tesu tesu gāmanigamesu ekāhaṃ dvīhaṃ vasantā mahājanaṃ āmisapaṭiggahena
analyzed: tattha buddhāḥ bhagavanto tesu tesu gāma nigamesu ekāham dvīham vasantāḥ mahā janam āmisa paṭiggahena
translated: There the Enlightened Ones, the Blessed Ones, living for one day or two days in this or that village or market town, help the great multitude by accepting material things,

original: anuggaṇhanti, dhammadānena ca vivaṭṭūpanissitaṃ kusalaṃ vaḍḍhenti, tasmā vuttaṃ “gāmanigamādīsu
analyzed: anuggaṇhanti dhamma dānena ca vivaṭṭu upanissitam kusalam vaḍḍhenti tasmā vuttam gāma nigama ādīsu
translated: and they increase the profitable that is rooted in deliverance by means of the gift of the True Idea. That is why it is said:

original: mahājanaṃ āmisapaṭiggahena anuggaṇhantā”tiādi. Samathavipassanā taruṇā hontīti ettha🔽taruṇā vipassanāti saṅkhāraparicchedane ñāṇaṃ kaṅkhāvitaraṇe ñāṇaṃ sammasane ñāṇaṃ
analyzed: mahājanam āmisa paṭiggahena anuggaṇhantā atiādi samatha vipassanā taruṇāḥ honti iti ettha  taruṇā vipassanā ati saṅkhāra paricchedane ñāṇam kaṅkhā vitaraṇe ñāṇam sammasane ñāṇam
translated: As to “his serenity and insight are youthful”:🔽“Youthful insight” is a term for the four kinds of knowledge, namely, knowledge of discernment of states, knowledge of the removal of doubt, knowledge of the choice of means, and knowledge of the way and the not-way .

original: maggāmagge ñāṇanti catunnaṃ ñāṇānaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Samathassa taruṇabhāvo pana upacārasamādhivasena
analyzed: magga amagge ñāṇanti catunnam ñāṇānam adhivacanaṃ samathassa taruṇa bhāvaḥ pana upacāra samādhi vasena
translated: And the youthfulness of his serenity should be understood as access concentration.

original: veditabbo. “Sace pana antovasse bhikkhūnaṃ samathavipassanā taruṇā hontī”ti idaṃ
analyzed: veditabbaḥ sace pana antovasse bhikkhūnam samatha vipassanāḥ taruṇāḥ honti iti idam
translated: “But if the bhikkhus’ serenity and insight are youthful” is said by way of illustration.

original: nidassanamattanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Aññenapi majjhimamaṇḍale veneyyānaṃ ñāṇaparipākādikāraṇena
analyzed: nidassanam attanti daṭṭhabbam aññena api majjhima maṇḍale veneyyānam ñāṇa paripāka ādi kāraṇena
translated: For they wish to go wandering in the Middle Country for the purpose of ripening the knowledge of their pupils there.

original: majjhimamaṇḍale cārikaṃ caritukāmā cātumāsaṃ vasitvāva nikkhamanti.
analyzed: majjhima maṇḍale cārikam caritu kāmā cātumāsam vasitvā ava nikkhamanti
translated: And they leave only after they have stayed there for four months.🔽“Having given the Invitation”: having given it by way of the giving of permission.

original: Pavāraṇāsaṅgahaṃ datvāti anumatidānavasena datvā. Māgasirassa paṭhamadivaseti māgasiramāsassa
analyzed: pavāraṇā saṅgaham da tvā ati anumati dāna vasena da tvā māgasirassa paṭhama divasa iti māgasira māsassa
translated: On the first day of the month of Magha: on the first day of the month of Magha called Magha because one is warm in it .

original: paṭhamadivase. Idañcetarahi pavattavohāravasena kattikamāsassa aparapakkhapāṭipadadivasaṃ
analyzed: paṭhama divase idam ca itarahi pavatta vohāra vasena kattika māsassa aparapakkha pāṭipada divasam
translated: This is the day after the full-moon day of the month of Kattika called the day of the “opening of the doors of the city of Brahma” .

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Tesanti tesaṃ buddhānaṃ. Tehi vinetabbattā “tesaṃ vineyyasattā”ti
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam tesanti tesam buddhānam tehi vinetabba ttā tesam vineyya sattā ti
translated: “For them” : for those Buddhas. “Beings to be trained by them” : because they have to be trained by them.

original: vuttaṃ. Vineyyasattāti ca cārikāya vinetabbasattā. Māgasiramāsampi tattheva vasitvā
analyzed: vuttam vineyya sattā ati ca cārikāya vinetabba sattā māgasira māsam pi tattha iva vasitvā
translated: And “beings to be trained” are those to be trained by the performance of a miracle. After staying there for the month of Magha,

original: phussamāsassa paṭhamadivaseti idampi nidassanamattanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Catumāsavutthānampi🔽buddhānaṃ vineyyasattā aparipakkindriyā honti, tesaṃ indriyaparipākaṃ āgamayamānā
analyzed: phussa māsassa paṭhama divase ti idam pi nidassanam attan ti daṭṭhabbam  buddhānam vineyya sattāḥ a paripakka indriyāḥ honti tesam indriya paripākam āgamayamānāḥ
translated: on the first day of the month of Phussa, this too should be regarded as an illustration. For the Buddhas,🔽when the faculties of the beings to be trained are not yet ripe, stay on there for another month, two months, four months,

original: aparampi ekamāsaṃ vā dviticatumāsaṃ vā tatthevavasitvā mahābhikkhusaṅghaparivārā
analyzed: aparam pi eka māsam vā dviti catu māsam vā tattha eva vasitvā mahā bhikkhu saṅgha parivārā
translated: waiting for their faculties to ripen. Then, surrounded by a great community of bhikkhus,

original: nikkhamitvā purimanayeneva lokaṃ anuggaṇhantā sattahi vā chahi vā pañcahi vā catūhi🔽vā māsehi cārikaṃ pariyosāpenti. Veneyyavasenevāti avadhāraṇena na cīvarādihetu carantīti
analyzed: nikkhamitvā purima nayena iva lokam anuggaṇhantā sattahi vā chahi vā pañcahi vā catūhi  vā māsehi cārikam veneyya vasena iva ati avadhāraṇena na cīvara ādi hetu caranti iti
translated: they go forth and, benefiting the world in the way already described, complete their tours in seven, six, five, or four months,🔽respectively. By the specification “according to the disciples” he shows that they do not go on tour for the sake of robes, etc. For,

original: dasseti. Tathā hi imesu tīsu maṇḍalesu yattha katthaci cārikaṃ carantā na cīvarādihetu
analyzed: dasseti tathā hi imesu tīsu maṇḍalesu yattha katthaci cārikam carantā na cīvara ādi hetu
translated: in these three continents, wherever they go on tour, they do not go for the sake of robes, etc.

original: caranti, atha kho ye duggatabālajiṇṇabyādhikā, te “kadā tathāgataṃ āgantvā passissanti,
analyzed: caranti atha kho ye duggata bāla jiṇṇa byādhikā te kadā tathāgatam āgantvā passissanti
translated: If the Buddha were to go on tour, then those who are unfortunate, foolish, old, sick, etc., would not get to see the Tathāgata.

original: mayi pana cārikaṃ carante mahājano tathāgatadassanaṃ labhissati, tattha keci cittāni🔽pasādessanti, keci mālādīhi pūjessanti, keci kaṭacchubhikkhaṃ dassanti, keci micchādassanaṃ
analyzed: mayi pana cārikam carante mahā janaḥ tathāgata dassanam labhissati tattha keci cittāni  pasādessanti keci mālā ādīhi pūjessanti keci kaṭacchu bhikkham dassanti keci micchādassanam
translated: But if I go on tour, then the people will get to see the Tathāgata. Some will develop confidence in the Tathāgata,

original: pahāya sammādiṭṭhikā bhavissanti, taṃ nesaṃ bhavissati dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā”ti
analyzed: pahāya sammādiṭṭhikāḥ bhavissanti tam na esam bhavissati dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: some will worship him with flowers, etc., some will give him alms, some will abandon wrong views and adopt the right views. This will be for their welfare and happiness for a long time.”

original: evaṃ lokānukampāya cārikaṃ caranti.
analyzed: evam loka anukampāya cārikam caranti
translated: Thus, out of compassion for the world, they go on tour.

original: Apica catūhi kāraṇehi buddhā bhagavanto cārikaṃ caranti jaṅghavihāravasena sarīraphāsukatthāya,
analyzed: apica catūhi kāraṇehi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ cārikam caranti jaṅgha vihāra vasena sarīra phāsuka tthāya
translated: Moreover, the Buddhas go on tour for four reasons: for the sake of physical comfort in walking on foot;

original: aṭṭhuppattikālābhikaṅkhanatthāya, bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadapaññāpanatthāya, tattha tattha
analyzed: aṭṭhuppatti kāla abhikaṅkhana atthāya bhikkhūnam sikkhāpada paññāpana tthāya tattha tattha
translated: for the sake of waiting for the right time for the arising of the eight freedoms; for the sake of establishing training rules for the monks; and for the sake of instructing those beings whose faculties are ripe for instruction in this and that place.

original: paripākagatindriye bodhaneyyasatte bodhanatthāyāti. Aparehipi catūhi kāraṇehi buddhā
analyzed: paripāka gati indriye bodhaneyya satte bodhana tthāya ati aparehi pi catūhi kāraṇehi buddhā
translated: For four other reasons, the Buddhas go on tour.

original: bhagavanto cārikaṃ caranti buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchissantīti vā, dhammaṃ, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ
analyzed: bhagavantaḥ cārikam caranti buddham saraṇam gacchissanti iti vā dhammam saṅgham saraṇam
translated: or ‘They will go for refuge to the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Sangha,’

original: gacchissantīti vā, mahatā dhammavassena catasso parisā santappessāmāti vā. Aparehipi
analyzed: gacchissanti iti vā mahatā dhamma vassena catasso parisāḥ santappessāma ati vā aparehi pi
translated: or ‘We will satisfy the four assemblies with a great downpour of the Dhamma.’

original: pañcahi kāraṇehi buddhā bhagavanto cārikaṃ caranti pāṇātipātā viramissantīti vā,
analyzed: pañcahi kāraṇehi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ cārikam caranti pāṇa atipātāḥ viramissanti iti vā
translated: For five other reasons do the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, go on an almsround:

original: adinnādānā, kāmesumicchācārā, musāvādā, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā viramissantīti
analyzed: a dinna ādānā kāmesum icchā ācārā musā vādā surā meraya majja pamāda ṭṭhānā viramissanti iti
translated: ‘They will abstain from killing living beings, from taking what is not given, from sexual misconduct, from false speech, and from wine, liquor, and intoxicants, which are the basis for heedlessness.’

original: vā. Aparehipi aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi buddhā bhagavanto cārikaṃ caranti paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ
analyzed: vā aparehi pi aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ cārikam caranti paṭhamam jhānam
translated: For eight other reasons do the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, go on an almsround: ‘They will attain the first jhāna,

original: paṭilabhissantīti vā, dutiyaṃ…pe… nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiṃ paṭilabhissantīti
analyzed: paṭilabhissanti iti vā dutiyam pe na ivasaññānāsaññāyatana samāpattim paṭilabhissanti iti
translated: the second jhāna, the third jhāna, the fourth jhāna, the base of the infinity of space, the base of the infinity of consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.’

original: vā. Aparehipi aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi buddhā bhagavanto cārikaṃ caranti sotāpattimaggaṃ
analyzed: vā aparehi pi aṭṭhahi kāraṇehi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ cārikam caranti sotāpatti maggam
translated: For eight other reasons do the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, go on an almsround: ‘They will realize the fruit of stream-entry,

original: adhigamissantīti vā, sotāpattiphalaṃ…pe… arahattaphalaṃ sacchikarissantīti vāti.
analyzed: adhigamissanti iti vā sotāpatti phalam pe arahatta phalam sacchikarissanti iti vā ati
translated: the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and the fruit of arahantship.’

original: Pupphāni ocinantā viya carantīti iminā yathā mālākāro bahuṃ pupphagacchaṃ disvā tattha🔽cirampi ṭhatvā pupphāni ocinitvā pupphasuññaṃ gacchaṃ disvā tattha papañcaṃ akatvā🔽taṃ pahāya aññattha gantvā pupphāni ocinanto vicarati, evameva buddhāpi yattha gāmanigamādīsu
analyzed: pupphāni ocinantā viya caranti iti iminā yathā mālākāraḥ bahum puppha gaccham disvā tattha  ciram pi ṭhatvā pupphāni ocinitvā puppha suññam gaccham disvā tattha papañcam a katvā  tam pahāya aññattha gantvā pupphāni ocinantaḥ vicarati evam eva buddhāḥ api gāma nigama ādīsu
translated: “Wandering on, as if plucking flowers” : by this he shows that just as a garland-maker, having seen a tree with many flowers,🔽stays there for a long time, plucks the flowers, and then goes away, leaving the tree flowerless, so too the Buddhas, wherever there are many beings to be trained in villages, towns, etc.,

original: vineyyasattā bahū honti, tattha cirampi vasantā te vinetvā vineyyasuññagāmādīsu papañcaṃ🔽akatvā taṃ pahāya aññattha bahuvineyyakesu gāmādīsu vasantā vicarantīti dasseti.🔽Tatoyeva ca atikhuddakepi antimamaṇḍale upanissayavantānaṃ bahubhāvato tāva bahumpi
analyzed: vineyya sattāḥ bahū honti tattha ciram pi vasantā te vinetvā vineyya suñña gāma ādīsu  a katvā tam pahāya aññattha bahu vineyyakesu gāma ādīsu vasantā vicaranti iti dasseti  ca ati khuddake pi antima maṇḍale upanissayavantānam bahu bhāvato
translated: stay there for a long time, train them, and then, leaving them, go elsewhere to villages, etc., where there are many to be trained.

original: kālaṃ sattamāsapariyantaṃ cārikaṃ caranti.
analyzed: kālam satta māsa pariyantam cārikam caranti
translated: And in this way, even in a very small district, because of the many who have the requisite conditions, they wander on, staying for a long time—up to seven months—on their wandering tours.

original: Santasabhāvattā kilesasamaṇahetutāya vā santaṃ nibbānaṃ, sukhakāraṇatāya ca sukhanti
analyzed: santa sabhāva ttā kilesa samaṇa hetutāya vā santam nibbānam sukha kāraṇatāya ca sukhanti
translated: Nibbana is “peaceful” because of its state of peace and because it is the cause for the stilling of defilements; and it is “bliss” because it is the cause for the bliss of the noble fruitions.

original: āha “santaṃ sukhaṃ nibbānamārammaṇaṃ katvā”ti. Dasasahassacakkavāḷeti jātikkhettabhūtāya
analyzed: āha santam sukham nibbānam ārammaṇam katvā ati dasa sahassa cakkavāḷā iti jāti khetta bhūtāya
translated: He said: “Nibbana, which is pleasant, is the object.”🔽In the ten-thousand world-element: in the ten-thousand world-element which is the field of birth

original: dasasahassilokadhātuyā. Idañca devabrahmānaṃ vasena vuttaṃ, manussā pana imasmiṃyeva🔽cakkavāḷe bodhaneyyā honti. Bodhaneyyasattasamavalokananti paṭhamaṃ mahākaruṇāya
analyzed: dasa sahassi lokadhātuyāḥ idam ca deva brahmānam vasena vuttam manussā pana imasmin yeva  cakkavāḷe bodhaneyyāḥ honti paṭhamam mahā karuṇāya
translated: for the ten-thousand world-element. And this is said with reference to the gods and Brahmas, but human beings🔽are to be developed in this very world-element.🔽Looking down on beings to be developed: first, having spread out the net of his knowledge of omniscience,

original: pharitvā pacchā sabbaññutaññāṇajālaṃ pattharitvā tassa anto paviṭṭhānaṃ bodhaneyyasattānaṃ🔽samolokanaṃ. Buddhā kira mahākaruṇāsamāpattiṃ samāpajjitvā tato vuṭṭhāya “ye sattā
analyzed: pharitvā pacchā sabbaññuta ññāṇa jālam pattharitvā tassa antar paviṭṭhānam bodhaneyya sattānam  samolokanam buddhāḥ kira mahā karuṇā samāpattim samāpajjitvā tatas vuṭṭhāya ye sattāḥ
translated: afterwards he looked down on the beings to be developed who had entered into it.🔽It is said that the Buddhas, after entering upon the attainment of great compassion, emerge from it and then, thinking: “May those beings who are able to be developed by me through the knowledge of maturity come into the range of my knowledge,”

original: bhabbā paripākañāṇā ajjayeva mayā vinetabbā, te mayhaṃ ñāṇassa upaṭṭhahantū”ti cittaṃ
analyzed: bhabbā paripāka ñāṇā ajjayā iva mayā vinetabbā te mayham ñāṇassa upaṭṭhahantu uti cittam
translated: they resolve their minds and direct their attention.

original: adhiṭṭhāya samannāharanti. Tesaṃ saha samannāhārā eko vā dve vā bahū vā tadā vinayūpagā
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāya samannāharanti tesam saha samannāhārāḥ ekaḥ vā dve vā bahū vā tadā vinaya upagā
translated: With their direction of attention, one or two or many of those who are to be developed and who have come to maturity🔽come into the range of the knowledge of omniscience. This is the Buddha’s supernormal power here.

original: veneyyā sabbaññutaññāṇassa āpāthamāgacchanti, ayamettha buddhānubhāvo. Evaṃ āpāthamāgatānaṃ
analyzed: veneyyāḥ sabbaññuta ññāṇassa āpātham āgacchanti ayam ettha buddha anubhāvaḥ evam āpātham āgatānam
translated: To those who have come into the range of his knowledge,

original: pana nesaṃ upanissayaṃ pubbacariyaṃ pubbahetuṃ sampativattamānañca paṭipattiṃ olokenti.
analyzed: pana nesam upanissayam pubba cariyam pubba hetum sampativattamānam ca paṭipattim olokenti
translated: but they look at their root-cause, their previous practice, their previous cause, and their present practice.

original: Veneyyasattapariggaṇhanatthañhi samannāhāre kate paṭhamaṃ nesaṃ veneyyabhāveneva
analyzed: veneyya satta pariggaṇhana attham hi samannāhāre kate paṭhamam veneyya bhāvena iva
translated: For when the invitation ceremony is performed, the first thing that appears is their state of being a disciple.🔽Then, thinking, “What will happen?” they look at their root-cause,

original: upaṭṭhānaṃ hoti. Atha “kiṃ nu kho bhavissatī”ti saraṇagamanādivasena kañci nipphattiṃ🔽vīmaṃsamānā pubbupanissayāni olokenti.
analyzed: upaṭṭhānam hoti atha kim nu kho bhavissati iti saraṇa gamana ādi vasena kañci nipphattim  vīmaṃsamānā pubbupanissayāni olokenti
translated: examining whether they have any attainment such as the refuges, etc.🔽“When he has entered upon it”: when he has announced it or when he has entered upon it in the midst of the gathering.

original: Otiṇṇeti ārocite, parisamajjhaṃ vā otiṇṇe. Dvikkhattunti ekasmiṃ saṃvacchare dvikkhattuṃ.
analyzed: otiṇṇe iti ārocite parisamajjham vā otiṇṇe dvi khattum ti ekasmin saṃvacchare dvi khattum
translated: “Twice a year”: twice in the course of a year.

original: Buddhakāle kira ekekasmiṃ saṃvacchare dve vāre bhikkhū sannipatanti upakaṭṭhavassūpanāyikakāle
analyzed: buddha kāle kira ekekasmin saṃvacchare dve vāre bhikkhū sannipatanti upakaṭṭha vassūpanāyika kāle
translated: It seems that in the Buddha’s time the bhikkhus assembled twice a year, once when the rains were near and the dwellings were to be allocated,

original: ca pavāraṇākāle ca. Upakaṭṭhāya vassūpanāyikāya dasapi vīsampi tiṃsampi cattālīsampi
analyzed: ca pavāraṇā kāle ca upakaṭṭhāya vassūpanāyikāya dasapi vīsampi tiṃsampi cattālīsampi
translated: and once at the Invitation ceremony at the end of the rains. When the rains were near, ten, twenty, thirty, forty,

original: paññāsampi bhikkhū vaggavaggā hutvā kammaṭṭhānatthāya āgacchanti. Bhagavā tehi saddhiṃ
analyzed: paññāsam pi bhikkhū vagga vaggāḥ hutvā kammaṭṭhāna tthāya āgacchanti bhagavā tehi saddhiṃ
translated: or fifty bhikkhus came together in groups to the Blessed One for the purpose of meditation. The Blessed One

original: sammoditvā “kasmā, bhikkhave, upakaṭṭhāya vassūpanāyikāya vicarathā”ti pucchati.
analyzed: sammoditvā kasmā bhikkhave upakaṭṭhāya vassūpanāyikāya vicaratha ati pucchati
translated: and asked them, “Why do you wander about at a time when the Rains are approaching?”

original: Atha te “bhagavā kammaṭṭhānatthaṃ āgatamha, kammaṭṭhānaṃ no dethā”ti yācanti. Satthā
analyzed: atha te bhagavā kammaṭṭhāna attham āgatamha kammaṭṭhānam naḥ detha iti yācanti satthā
translated: They replied, “We have come to ask you for a subject of meditation. Please give us a subject of meditation.”

original: tesaṃ cariyavasena rāgacaritassa asubhakammaṭṭhānaṃ deti, dosacaritassa mettākammaṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: tesam cariya vasena rāga caritassa asubha kammaṭṭhānam deti dosa caritassa mettā kammaṭṭhānam
translated: The Teacher gave to each a subject of meditation in accordance with his character. To one of greedy temperament he gave the subject of meditation called the Unlovely; to one of hating temperament he gave the subject of meditation called Lovingkindness;

original: mohacaritassa “uddeso paripucchā kālena dhammassavanaṃ kālena dhammasākacchā idaṃ
analyzed: moha caritassa uddeso paripucchā kālena dhamma ssavanam kālena dhamma sākacchā idam
translated: to one of deluded temperament he said, “Recite the Scriptures, ask questions, listen to the Law at the proper time, discuss the Law at the proper time. This is the proper course for you.”

original: tuyhaṃ sappāya”nti ācikkhati. Kiñcāpi hi mohacaritassa ānāpānassatikammaṭṭhānaṃ sappāyaṃ,🔽kammaṭṭhānabhāvanāya pana bhājanabhūtaṃ kātuṃ sammohavigamāya paṭhamaṃ uddesaparipucchādhammassavanadhammasākacchāsu
analyzed: tuyham sappāyanti ācikkhati kiñca api hi moha caritassa āna apāna ssati kammaṭṭhānam sappāyam  kammaṭṭhāna bhāvanāya pana bhājana bhūtam kātum sammoha vigamāya paṭhamam uddesa paripucchā dhamma ssavana dhamma sākacchāsu
translated: Now although the subject of meditation called Mindfulness of Breathing is the proper subject for one of deluded temperament,🔽in order to make him a fit vessel for the practice of meditation, the Teacher first instructed him in the recitation of the Scriptures, in the asking of questions, in the listening to the Law at the proper time, and in the discussion of the Law at the proper time,

original: niyojeti. Vitakkacaritassa ānāpānassatikammaṭṭhānaṃ deti. Saddhācaritassa visesato
analyzed: niyojeti vitakka caritassa āna apāna ssati kammaṭṭhānam deti saddhā caritassa visesataḥ
translated: and then instructed him in the subject of meditation called Mindfulness of Breathing. To one of speculative temperament he gave the subject of meditation called Mindfulness of Breathing.

original: purimā cha anussatiyo sappāyā, tāsaṃ pana anuyuñjane ayaṃ pubbabhāgapaṭipattīti dassetuṃ
analyzed: purimāḥ cha anussatiyaḥ sappāyā tāsam pana anuyuñjane ayam pubbabhāga paṭipattī ti dassetuṃ
translated: The first six recollections are helpful. But in order to show that the practice of the preliminary stage is the undertaking of these,

original: pasādanīyasuttantena buddhasubodhitaṃ dhammasudhammataṃ saṅghasuppaṭipattiñca pakāseti.
analyzed: pasādanīya suttantena buddha su bodhitam dhamma su dhamma tam saṅgha su paṭipattim ca pakāseti
translated: he expounds the Pasādanīyasutta, showing the excellence of the Enlightened One, the excellence of the True Idea, and the excellence of the practice of the Community.

original: Ñāṇacaritassa pana maraṇassati upasamānussati catudhātuvavatthānaṃ āhārepaṭikūlasaññā
analyzed: ñāṇa caritassa pana maraṇa sati catu dhātu vavatthānam āhāre paṭikūla saññā
translated: But for one whose temperament is that of understanding, the recollection of death, the recollection of peace, the defining of the four elements, and the perception of the repulsiveness of food

original: visesato sappāyā, tesaṃ upakāradhammadassanatthaṃ aniccatādipaṭisaṃyutte gambhīre
analyzed: visesataḥ sappāyā tesam upakāra dhamma dassana attham anicca tā ādi paṭisaṃyutte gambhīre
translated: are particularly helpful. In order to show the helpfulness of these, he expounds a deep sutta concerned with impermanence, etc.,

original: suttante katheti. Te kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā sace sappāyaṃ hoti, satthu santike eva
analyzed: suttante katheti te kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā sace sappāyam hoti satthu santike eva
translated: and when they have taken up the meditation subject, if it is helpful, they stay on with the Teacher;

original: vasanti. No ce hoti, sappāyaṃ senāsanaṃ pucchantā gacchanti. Tepi tattha vasantā
analyzed: vasanti no ce hoti sappāyam senāsanam pucchantā gacchanti te pi tattha vasantā
translated: but if not, they go away asking about a helpful lodging. They too, while staying there,

original: temāsikaṃ paṭipadaṃ gahetvā ghaṭentā vāyamantā sotāpannāpi honti sakadāgāminopi anāgāminopi
analyzed: temāsikam paṭipadam gahetvā ghaṭentā vā āyamantā sotāpannāḥ api honti sakadāgāminaḥ api anāgāminaḥ api
translated: take up the three-month practice and, striving and persevering, become stream-enterers, once-returners, non-returners, and even arahants.

original: arahantopi. Tato vutthavassā pavāretvā satthu santikaṃ gantvā “bhagavā ahaṃ tumhākaṃ
analyzed: arahantaḥ api tatas vuttha vassā pavāretvā satthu santikam gantvā bhagavā aham tumhākam
translated: Then, after completing the three months and after the Invitation ceremony, they go to the Teacher and say, “Venerable sir, we have completed the three months’ practice.

original: santike kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā sotāpattiphalaṃ patto…pe… ahaṃ aggaphalaṃ arahatta”nti
analyzed: santike kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā sotāpatti phalam pattope aham agga phalam arahattanti
translated: He took up a meditation subject in his presence and attained the fruit of stream-entry … the supreme fruit of arahantship.”

original: paṭiladdhaguṇaṃ ārocenti, upari anadhigatassa adhigamāya kammaṭṭhānañca yācanti.
analyzed: paṭiladdha guṇam ārocenti upari anadhigatassa adhigamāya kammaṭṭhānam ca yācanti
translated: When they have announced the special qualities they have attained, they ask for a meditation subject in order to attain what they have not already attained.

original: Tena vuttaṃ “pure vassūpanāyikāya ca kammaṭṭhānaggahaṇatthaṃ…pe… upari kammaṭṭhānaggahaṇatthañcā”ti.
analyzed: tena vuttam pure vassūpanāyikāya ca kammaṭṭhāna ggahaṇa attham pe upari kammaṭṭhāna ggahaṇa attham ca ati
translated: Hence it was said above “for the purpose of taking up a meditation subject before the Rains and for the purpose of taking up a meditation subject afterwards.”

original: Āyāmāti ettha ā-saddo “āgacchā”ti iminā samānatthoti āha “āyāmāti āgaccha yāmā”ti,
analyzed: āyāma ati ettha āsaddaḥ āgaccha ati iminā samāna atthaḥ ti āha āyāma ati āgaccha yāma ati
translated: Let us go: the prefix ā here has the same meaning as āgacchā in the expression āgacchāma, “let us go.” So the meaning is, “Let us go, Ānanda.”

original: ehi gacchāmāti attho. Ānandāti bhagavā santikāvacarattā theraṃ ālapati, na pana tadā
analyzed: ehi gacchāma ati attho ānanda iti bhagavā theram ālapati na pana tadā
translated: The Blessed One addressed the elder as Ānanda because he was near to him, but not because there were no other bhikkhus in residence at the time.

original: satthu santike vasantānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ abhāvato. Pañcasataparimāṇo hi tadā bhagavato🔽santike bhikkhusaṅgho. Thero pana “gaṇhathāvuso pattacīvarāni, bhagavā asukaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: satthu santike vasantānam bhikkhūnam abhāvataḥ pañca sata parimāṇaḥ hi tadā bhagavataḥ  santike bhikkhu saṅghaḥ thero pana gaṇhatha āvuso patta cīvarāni bhagavā asuka ṭṭhānam
translated: For at that time the community of bhikkhus in the Blessed One’s presence numbered five hundred.🔽But the elder announced to the bhikkhus, “Friends, take your bowls and outer robes. The Blessed One wishes to go to such and such a place.”

original: gantukāmo”ti bhikkhūnaṃ āroceti. “Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesī”ti
analyzed: gantu kāmaḥ iti bhikkhūnam āroceti atha kho bhagavā āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi iti
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda.

original: vuttattā “bhagavato paccassosī”ti idha bhagavatoti sāmivacanaṃ āmantanavacanameva
analyzed: vutta ttā bhagavato paccassosi iti idha bhagavato iti sāmi vacanam āmantana vacanam eva
translated: “He listened to the Blessed One” is said here with the word “Blessed One” in the vocative case,🔽because it is stated in the text. The meaning intended is that the word “Blessed One” is a vocative word, and it requires another word in apposition to it.

original: sambandhīantaraṃ apekkhatīti iminā adhippāyena “bhagavato vacanaṃ paṭiassosī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sambandhī antaram apekkhati iti iminā adhippāyena bhagavataḥ vacanam paṭiassosi iti vuttam
translated: Therefore it is said, “He listened to the Blessed One’s speech.”

original: Bhagavatoti pana idaṃ patissavasambandhena sampadānavacanaṃ yathā “devadattassa paṭissuṇotī”ti.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ iti pana idam patissava sambandhena sampadāna vacanam yathā devadattassa paṭissuṇoti iti
translated: But the word “Blessed One” is a locative word in the sense of a locative of sphere, as in the expression “he listens to Devadatta.”

original: Paccassosīti ettha paṭi-saddo abhimukhavacanoti āha “abhimukho hutvā suṇī”ti. Bhagavato
analyzed: ettha paṭisaddaḥ abhimukha vacanaḥ ti āha abhimukhaḥ hutvā suṇi iti bhagavataḥ
translated: In the expression “he listened to the Blessed One,” the prefix paṭi- has the sense of “in front of,” and therefore the commentary says, “he listened facing the Blessed One.”

original: mukhābhimukho hutvā adhivāsetvā suṇi, na udāsino hutvāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: mukha abhimukhaḥ hutvā adhivāsetvā na udāsinaḥ hutvā ati adhippāyaḥ
translated: The meaning intended is that he listened after accepting the Blessed One’s words, facing him, not with indifference.

original: Tassa pāṭihāriyassa āgantukavasena katattā vuttaṃ “nagaradvārato paṭṭhāyā”ti. Suvaṇṇarasapiñjarāhi🔽rasmīhīti ettha rasa-saddo udakapariyāyo, piñjara-saddo hemavaṇṇapariyāyo, tasmā
analyzed: tassa pāṭihāriyassa āgantuka vasena kata ttā vuttam nagara dvārataḥ paṭṭhāya ati suvaṇṇa rasa piñjarāhi  ettha rasa saddo udaka pariyāyo piñjara saddo hema vaṇṇa pariyāyo tasmā
translated: Since the miracle was performed as a temporary event, the commentary says, “starting from the city gate.”🔽The word rasa in the expression “golden-hued rays” is a synonym for water, and piñjara is a synonym for the color of gold. Therefore

original: suvaṇṇajaladhārā viya suvaṇṇavaṇṇāhi rasmīhīti attho. Samujjotayamānoti obhāsayamāno.
analyzed: suvaṇṇa jala dhārā viya suvaṇṇa vaṇṇāhi rasmīhi iti attho samujjotayamānaḥ ti obhāsayamānaḥ
translated: the meaning is that the rays were like golden streams of water. The word samujjotayamāno means “illuminating.”

original: Assāti verañjassa brāhmaṇassa. Bhagavantaṃ upanisīditukāmoti bhagavantaṃ upagantvā
analyzed: assa ati verañjassa brāhmaṇassa bhagavantam upanisīditu kāmaḥ iti bhagavantam upagantvā
translated: Assa: to Verañjā’s brahmin.

original: nisīditukāmo, bhagavato samīpe nisīditukāmoti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: nisīditu kāmaḥ bhagavataḥ samīpe nisīditu kāmaḥ iti vuttam hoti
translated: Upanisīditukāmo: wishing to sit down near the Blessed One, wishing to sit down after approaching the Blessed One, wishing to sit down in the presence of the Blessed One, is what is meant.

original: Brāhmaṇa tayā nimantitā vassaṃvutthā amhāti pāḷiyaṃ sambandho veditabbo. Dātabbo
analyzed: brāhmaṇa tayā nimantitāḥ vassaṃvutthāḥ amhā iti pāḷiyam sambandhaḥ veditabbaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: Brāhmaṇa tayā nimantitā vassaṃvutthā amhāti: the connection in the text should be understood thus: ‘Brahmin, we who have spent the Rains, invited by you’.

original: assāti dātabbo bhaveyya. No asantoti neva avijjamāno, kintu vijjamānoyevāti dīpeti.
analyzed: assa ati dātabbaḥ bhaveyya no asanto ti na iva a vijjamāno kintu vijjamānaḥ iva iva ati dīpeti
translated: Dātabbo assāti: should be given, would be given. No asanto: not non-existent, but what is shown is that it is existent.

original: Vinā vā liṅgavipallāsenettha attho daṭṭhabboti āha “atha vā”tiādi. Iminā sāmaññavacanato
analyzed: vinā vā liṅga vipallāsena ittha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ iti āha atha vā itiādi iminā sāmañña vacanato
translated: Or else the meaning should be seen here without a change of gender. Therefore he said “Atha vā” , etc. By this he shows that here the indication of the neuter gender is

original: ettha napuṃsakaliṅganiddesoti dasseti. No natthīti no amhākaṃ natthi. Noti vā etassa
analyzed: ettha napuṃsaka liṅga niddeso ti dasseti no natthi iti no amhākam natthi no ti vā etassa
translated: from the common noun. No natthīti: we have not, we do not have. Noti vā etassa vivaraṇaṃ natthīti: or else this is the explanation of no.

original: vivaraṇaṃ natthīti. Kesaṃ adātukāmatā viyāti āha “yathā”tiādi. Pahūtavittūpakaraṇānanti
analyzed: vivaraṇam natthi iti kesam a dātu kāma tā viya iti āha yathā itiādi
translated: Kesaṃ adātukāmatā viyāti: like whose unwillingness to give? Therefore he said “Yathā” , etc. Pahūtavittūpakaraṇānanti:

original: ettha vittīti tuṭṭhi, vittiyā upakaraṇaṃ vittūpakaraṇaṃ, tuṭṭhikāraṇanti attho. Pahūtaṃ
analyzed: ettha vitti iti tuṭṭhi vittiyāḥ upakaraṇam vittu upakaraṇam tuṭṭhi kāraṇam ti attho pahūtam
translated: here vitti is satisfaction, the means of satisfaction is vittupakaraṇaṃ, the reason for satisfaction is the meaning. Pahūtaṃ

original: dhanadhaññajātarūparajatanānāvidhālaṅkārasuvaṇṇabhājanādibhedaṃ vittūpakaraṇametesanti
analyzed: dhana dhañña jātarūpa rajata nānāvidha alaṅkāra suvaṇṇa bhājana ādi bhedam vittu upakaraṇam
translated: They have much wealth and belongings, such as money, grain, gold, silver, various kinds of ornaments, golden vessels, etc.

original: pahūtavittūpakaraṇā, tesaṃ pahūtavittūpakaraṇānaṃ maccharīnaṃ yathā adātukāmatā,
analyzed: pahūta vittu upakaraṇā tesam pahūta vittu upakaraṇānam mad śarīnam yathā a dātu kāma tā
translated: They are miserly, and they do not want to give.🔽We do not want to give in the same way that they do not want to give.

original: evaṃ no adātukāmatāpi natthīti sambandho. Taṃ kutettha labbhāti ettha tanti taṃ kāraṇaṃ,
analyzed: evam no a dātu kāma tā api natthi iti sambandho tam kuta ittha ettha tam kāraṇam
translated: Here, tanti means that, the reason,

original: taṃ kiccaṃ vā. Etthāti gharāvāse. Dutiye pana atthavikappe tanti deyyadhammassa parāmasanaṃ.
analyzed: tam kiccam vā ettha ati ghara āvāse dutiye pana attha vikappe tanti deyya dhammassa parāmasanam
translated: or the action. Ettha means in the household life. But in the second interpretation, tanti means the grasping of the gift.

original: Etthāti imasmiṃ temāsabbhantareti attho. Yanti yena kāraṇena, kiriyāparāmasanaṃ vā.
analyzed: ettha ati imasmin atthaḥ yanti yena kāraṇena kiriyā parāmasanam vā
translated: Ettha means in this three-month period. Yanti means by what reason, or the grasping of the action.

original: Dutiye pana atthavikappe yanti yaṃ deyyadhammanti attho.
analyzed: dutiye pana attha vikappe yanti yam deyya dhamman ti attho
translated: But in the second interpretation, yanti means the gift.

original: Alaṃ gharāvāsapalibodhacintāyāti saññāpetvāti brāhmaṇa netaṃ gharāvāsapalibodhena
analyzed: alam gharā vāsa pali bodha cintāya ati saññāpetvā ati brāhmaṇa na itam gharā vāsa pali bodhena
translated: Alaṃ gharāvāsapalibodhacintāyāti saññāpetvā means: “Brahmin, this was not done by the hindrance of the household life,🔽but rather by the turning of Mara’s wheel.” Having thus convinced the brahmin,

original: kataṃ, atha kho mārāvaṭṭanenāti brāhmaṇaṃ saññāpetvā. Taṅkhaṇānurūpāyāti yādisī tadā
analyzed: katam atha kho mārā vaṭṭanena ati brāhmaṇam saññāpetvā taṅkhaṇa anurūpāya ati yādisī tadā
translated: he said: “Taṅkhaṇānurūpāyāti yādisī tadā

original: tassa ajjhāsayappavatti, tadanurūpāyāti attho. Tassa tadā tādisassa vivaṭṭasannissitassa🔽ñāṇaparipākassa abhāvato kevalaṃ abbhantarasannissito eva attho dassitoti āha “diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaṃ🔽atthaṃ sandassetvā”ti, paccakkhato vibhāvetvāti attho. Kusale dhammeti tebhūmake🔽kusale dhamme. Tatthāti kusaladhamme yathāsamādapite. Nanti brāhmaṇaṃ. Samuttejetvāti🔽sammadeva uparūpari nivesetvā puññakiriyāya tikkhavisadabhāvaṃ āpādetvā. Taṃ pana
analyzed: tassa ajjhāsaya ppavatti tad anurūpāya ati atthaḥ tassa tadā tādisassa vivaṭṭa sannissitassa  ñāṇa paripākassa abhāvataḥ kevalam abbhantara sannissitaḥ eva atthaḥ dassitaḥ ti āha diṭṭhadhammika samparāyikam  attham sandassetvā ti paccakkhatas vibhāvetvā ati attho kusale dhamme iti tebhūmake  kusale dhamme tattha ati kusala dhamme yathā samādapite brāhmaṇam samuttejetvā iti  sammadeva upari upari nivesetvā puñña kiriyāya tikkha visada bhāvam āpādetvā tam pana
translated: The meaning is: the occurrence of his intention in conformity with that.🔽Because at that time he had no knowledge of ripening that was dependent on the turning about of his intention, he showed only the meaning that is dependent on the inside.🔽That is why it is said: “after showing the meaning that is visible here and now and in the life to come” . The meaning is: after making it clear by direct perception.🔽In profitable ideas: in profitable ideas of the three planes.🔽There: in profitable ideas as they are being aroused.🔽You: the brahmin.🔽Stirred up: after arousing them again and again, after making them sharp and keen for the performance of merit.

original: atthato tassa ussāhajananaṃ hotīti āha “saussāhaṃ katvā”ti. Evaṃ puññakiriyāya saussāhato🔽evarūpaguṇasamaṅgitā ca niyamato diṭṭhadhammikādiatthasampādananti evaṃ saussāhatāya
analyzed: atthataḥ tassa ussāha jananam hoti iti āha saussāham katvā ati evam puñña kiriyāya saussāhato 🔽evarūpa guṇa samaṅgi tā ca niyamataḥ diṭṭhadhammika ādi attha sampādanan ti evam saussāhatāya
translated: The meaning is: in accordance with the inclination of the person. At that time, because of the absence of the ripening of the knowledge of one who is dependent on the turning about of the inclination, only the meaning that is dependent on the inside is shown. Therefore it is said: “having shown the meaning that is visible here and now and in the other world.” The meaning is: having made it clear by direct experience. In wholesome states: in wholesome states of the three planes. There: in wholesome states as they are advised. You: O brahmin. Having gladdened: having caused to be established in the highest degree, having brought about the state of being sharp and clear in the performance of merit. But that, in meaning, is the arousing of his enthusiasm. Therefore it is said: “having made him enthusiastic.” Having thus made him enthusiastic about the performance of merit, and having shown him the meaning that is visible here and now and in the other world, he should then advise him in the practice of the virtues of the trainee.

original: aññehi ca tasmiṃ vijjamānaguṇehi sampahaṃsetvā sammadeva haṭṭhatuṭṭhabhāvaṃ āpādetvā.
analyzed: aññehi ca tasmin vijjamāna guṇehi sampahaṃsetvā sammadā eva haṭṭha tuṭṭha bhāvam āpādetvā
translated: and he gladdened him and rejoiced him by extolling other special qualities of his that were already existent.

original: Yadi bhagavā dhammaratanavassaṃ vassi, atha kasmā so visesaṃ nādhigacchi? Upanissayasampattiyā
analyzed: yadi bhagavā dhammaratana vassam vassi atha kasmā so visesam na adhigacchi upanissaya sampattiyā
translated: If the Blessed One rained down the treasure of the Dhamma on him, why did he not reach the distinction?🔽Because he did not possess the requisite conditions.

original: abhāvato. Yadi evaṃ kasmā bhagavā tassa tathā dhammaratanavassaṃ vassīti? Vuccate🔽– yadipi tassa visesādhigamo natthi, āyatiṃ pana nibbānādhigamatthāya vāsanābhāgiyā
analyzed: abhāvataḥ yadi evam kasmai bhagavā tassa tathā dhammaratana vassam vassī iti vuccate  yadi api tassa visesa adhigamaḥ natthi āyatim pana nibbāna adhigama atthāya vāsanā bhāgiyā
translated: If that is so, why did the Blessed One rain down the treasure of the Dhamma on him?🔽It may be replied: although he did not reach distinction, nevertheless all the earlier and later talk on the Dhamma was for the purpose of his future attainment of Nibbāna and for the purpose of the establishment of the tradition of the Dhamma.

original: ca sabbā purimapacchimadhammakathā ahosīti daṭṭhabbā. Na hi bhagavato niratthakā
analyzed: ca sabbā purima pacchima dhammakathā ahosi iti daṭṭhabbā na hi bhagavataḥ niratthakā
translated: For the Blessed One’s teaching of the Dhamma is never fruitless.

original: dhammadesanā atthi. Temāsikopi deyyadhammoti temāsaṃ dātabbopi deyyadhammo. Yaṃ divasanti yasmiṃ divase.🔽23. Buddhapariṇāyakanti buddho pariṇāyako etassāti buddhapariṇāyako, bhikkhusaṅgho.
analyzed: dhamma desanā atthi temāsikaḥ api deyya dhammaḥ ti temāsam dātabbaḥ api deyya dhammaḥ yam divasanti yasmin divase  buddha pariṇāyakanti buddhaḥ pariṇāyakaḥ etassa ati buddha pariṇāyakaḥ bhikkhu saṅghaḥ
translated: “Even for three months” means even for the giving of an offering for three months. “On that day” means on the day .🔽“The Buddha’s guide” : the Buddha is the guide of this one, thus he is “the Buddha’s guide,” that is, the bhikkhu Saṅgha.

original: Taṃ buddhapariṇāyakaṃ, buddhajeṭṭhakanti attho. Yāvadatthaṃ katvāti yāva attho, tāva
analyzed: tam buddha pariṇāyakam buddha jeṭṭhakam ti attho yāvadattham katvā iti tāva
translated: “The Buddha’s chief” : the Buddha is the chief of this one, thus he is “the Buddha’s chief,” that is, the bhikkhu Saṅgha.🔽“Having given as much as he wanted” means having given as much as he wanted.

original: bhojanena tadā katanti adhippāyo. Dātuṃ upanītabhikkhāya paṭikkhepo nāma hatthasaññāya
analyzed: bhojanena tadā katanti adhippāyaḥ dātum upanīta bhikkhāya paṭikkhepaḥ nāma hattha saññāya
translated: The meaning is: he should not do so by means of food. The refusal of the alms food offered is by means of the hand-signal,

original: mukhavikārena vacībhedena vā hotīti āha “hatthasaññāyā”tiādi. Onītapattapāṇinti ettha🔽onīto pattato pāṇi etassāti onītapattapāṇīti bhinnādhikaraṇavisayoyaṃ saddo bāhiratthasamāsoti
analyzed: mukha vikārena vacī bhedena vā hoti iti āha hattha saññāya atiādi onīta patta pāṇin ti ettha  pattataḥ pāṇi etassa ati onīta patta pāṇi iti bhinna adhikaraṇa visayaḥ yam saddo bāhirattha samāsaḥ ti
translated: by facial expression, or by a change in the voice. Therefore it is said: “By means of the hand-signal, etc.” The meaning of onītapattapāṇi is this:🔽the hand is removed from the bowl, thus it is onītapattapāṇi. This is a compound with a different base, namely, a bahubbīhi compound with an external meaning.

original: āha “pattato onītapāṇi”ntiādi. “Onittapattapāṇi”ntipi pāṭho, tassattho onittaṃ nānābhūtaṃ
analyzed: āha pattataḥ onīta pāṇin tiādi pāṭhaḥ tassa atthaḥ onittam nānābhūtam
translated: Therefore it is said: “The hand is removed from the bowl,” etc. The reading onittapattapāṇi is also allowable. Its meaning is this: the bowl is removed, i.e., made different,

original: vinābhūtaṃ āmisāpanayanena vā sucikataṃ pattaṃ pāṇito assāti onittapattapāṇi, taṃ
analyzed: vinābhūtam āmisa apanayanena vā sucikatam pattam pāṇitaḥ assa ati onitta patta pāṇi tam
translated: made separate, by the removal of the food, or it is made clean. The hand is not from the bowl, thus it is onittapattapāṇi.

original: onittapattapāṇiṃ, hatthe ca pattañca dhovitvā ekamante pattaṃ nikkhipitvā nisinnanti
analyzed: onitta patta pāṇim hatthe ca pattam ca dhovitvā eka mante pattam nikkhipitvā nisinnanti
translated: That onittapattapāṇi, having washed the hand and the bowl, having placed the bowl to one side, sits down.

original: attho. Pattuṇṇapaṭṭapaṭe cāti pattuṇṇapaṭe ca paṭṭapaṭe ca. Tattha pattuṇṇapadese
analyzed: pattuṇṇa paṭṭa paṭe ca ati pattuṇṇa paṭe ca paṭṭa paṭe ca tattha pattuṇṇa padese
translated: This is the meaning. Pattuṇṇapaṭṭapaṭe ca means both pattuṇṇapaṭe and paṭṭapaṭe. Therein, those that exist in the pattuṇṇapaṭe🔽are called pattuṇṇā. They are also called a kind of coarse cloth. But the paṭṭapaṭe are Chinese cloth.

original: bhavā pattuṇṇā, kosiyavisesātipi vadanti. Paṭṭāni pana cīnapaṭāni. Āyogādīsu āyogoti
analyzed: bhavā pattuṇṇā kosiyavisesā iti pi vadanti paṭṭāni pana cīnapaṭāni āyoga ādīsu
translated: In āyogo, etc., āyogo means

original: paṭiāyogo, aṃsabaddhakaṃ pattatthavikādīsu. Bhesajjatelānanti bhesajjasampākena sādhitatelānaṃ.
analyzed: paṭi āyogaḥ aṃsa baddhakam patta tthavika ādīsu bhesajja telānam ti bhesajja sampākena sādhita telānam
translated: The second is the shoulder-strap and the bag for the bowl and the other requisites. The third is the oil prepared with medicinal herbs.

original: Tumbānīti cammamayatelabhājanāni. Ekamekassa bhikkhuno sahassagghanakaṃ telamadāsīti sambandho.🔽Mahāyāgaṃ yajitvāti mahādānaṃ datvā. Saputtadāraṃ vanditvā nisinnanti puttadārehi
analyzed: tumbāni iti camma maya tela bhājanāni ekam ekassa bhikkhuno sahassa gghanakam telam adāsi iti sambandhaḥ  mahā yāgam yajitvā ati mahā dānam da tvā sa putta dāram vanditvā nisinnanti putta dārehi
translated: The oil-tubes are the oil-containers made of leather. He gave to each bhikkhu oil worth a thousand .

original: saddhiṃ vanditvā nisinnaṃ. Temāsanti accantasaṃyoge upayogavacanaṃ. “Temāsaṃ sotabbadhammaṃ
analyzed: saddhim vanditvā nisinnam accanta saṃyoge upayoga vacanam temāsam sotabba dhammam
translated: Having made a great sacrifice: having given a great gift. Having paid homage together with his children and wife and sat down: having paid homage together with his children and wife

original: ajjeva suṇissāmī”ti nisinnassa taṃ ajjhāsayaṃ pūretvā desitattā vuttaṃ “paripuṇṇasaṅkappaṃ
analyzed: ajja iva suṇissāmi iti nisinnassa tam ajjhāsayam pūretvā desita ttā vuttam paripuṇṇa saṅkappam
translated: and sat down. For three months: the word “for” is used in the sense of “until.” “I shall listen to the Dhamma that is to be heard for three months🔽right now.” Since the Exalted One taught the Dhamma in order to fulfill his intention, it is said that he “fulfilled his intention.”

original: kurumāno”ti. Anubandhitvāti anugantvā.🔽Buddhānaṃ anabhiratiparitassitā nāma natthīti āha “yathājjhāsayaṃ yathārucitaṃ vāsaṃ
analyzed: anubandhitvā iti anugantvā  buddhānam an abhirati paritassitā nāma natthi iti āha yathājjhāsayam yathārucitam vāsam
translated: Following: going after.

original: vasitvā”ti. Abhirantaṃ abhiratīti hi atthato ekaṃ. Abhirantasaddo cāyaṃ abhirucipariyāyo,
analyzed: vasitvā iti abhirantam abhirati iti hi atthataḥ ekam abhiranta saddaḥ ca ayam abhiruci pariyāyo
translated: The Buddhas have no dissatisfaction or restlessness, thus it is said that he “lived for as long as he liked.” “Delight” is the same in meaning as “satisfaction.” The word “delight” is a synonym for “satisfaction.”

original: na assādapariyāyo. Assādavasena ca katthaci vasantassa assādavatthuvigamanena siyā
analyzed: na assāda pariyāyaḥ assāda vasena ca katthaci vasantassa assāda vatthu vigamanena siyā
translated: not in the way of gratification. And when someone lives somewhere by way of gratification, he may become disaffected with it when the basis for gratification disappears.

original: tassa tattha anabhirati, tayidaṃ khīṇāsavānaṃ natthi, pageva buddhānaṃ, tasmā abhirativasena
analyzed: tassa tattha anabhirati tayidam khīṇāsavānam natthi pageva buddhānam tasmai abhirati vasena
translated: But that does not happen to those whose cankers are destroyed, much less to Buddhas. So it is because of abiding in bliss that

original: katthaci vasitvā tadabhāvato aññattha gamanaṃ nāma buddhānaṃ natthi, vineyyavinayanatthaṃ
analyzed: katthaci vasitvā tad abhāvataḥ aññattha gamanam nāma buddhānam na atthi vineyya vinayana attham
translated: the Buddhas go elsewhere after living somewhere. But the Buddhas have no going elsewhere because of the disappearance of the need for living there.

original: pana katthaci vasitvā tasmiṃ siddhe vineyyavinayatthameva tato aññattha gacchanti,🔽ayamettha yathāruci. Soreyyādīni anupagammāti mahāmaṇḍalacārikāya vīthibhūtāni soreyyanagarādīni
analyzed: pana katthaci vasitvā tasmin siddhe vineyya vinaya attham eva tatas aññattha gacchanti  ayam ettha yathāruci soreyya ādīni mahā maṇḍala cārikāya vīthi bhūtāni soreyya nagara ādīni
translated: However, after living somewhere for the purpose of training those who need training, they go elsewhere for the purpose of training those who need training there.🔽This is the meaning here according to preference. They do not go to Soreyya, etc.,🔽without having gone to Soreyya town, etc., which are like the thoroughfares of the great continent-wide wanderings.

original: anupagantvā. Payāgapatiṭṭhānanti gāmassapi adhivacanaṃ titthassapi. Gaṅgaṃ nadinti🔽gaṅgaṃ nāma nadiṃ. Tadavasarīti ettha tanti karaṇatthe upayogavacananti āha “tena
analyzed: an upagantvā payāga patiṭṭhānam ti gāmassa api adhivacanam titthassa api gaṅgam nadinti  gaṅgam nāma nadim tad avasarī iti ettha tanti karaṇa atthe upayoga vacananti āha tena
translated: Payāgapatiṭṭhāna is a name for a village and also for a ford. The river Ganges:

original: avasari tadavasarī”ti.
analyzed: avasari tad avasari iti
translated: the river called Ganges. They descend to it: here the word “to” has the sense of an instrument. “They descend by means of it” is the meaning.

original: Buddhāciṇṇakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: buddha aciṇṇa kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The story of the Buddha’s practice is finished.

original: Samantapāsādikāyāti samantato sabbaso pasādaṃ janetīti samantapāsādikā, tassā samantapāsādikāya.🔽Tatridaṃ samantapāsādikāya samantapāsādikattasminti ettha tatrāti purimavacanāpekkhaṃ,🔽idanti vakkhamānakāraṇavacanāpekkhaṃ. Tatrāyaṃ yojanā – yaṃ vuttaṃ “samantapāsādikāya
analyzed: samantapāsādikāya ati samantataḥ sabbasas pasādam janeti iti samantapāsādikā tassā samantapāsādikāya  tatra idam samantapāsādikāya ettha tatra ati purima vacana apekkham  idam ti vakkhamāna kāraṇa vacana apekkham tatra ayam yojanā yam vuttam samantapāsādikāya
translated: She is called “pleasing in every way” because she generates confidence in every way, in every respect.🔽Herein, this is the construction: “In the pleasing in every way of the commentary, which is pleasing in every way, in the pleasing in every way, in the state of being pleasing in every way, in the generating of confidence in every way, of the commentary, which is pleasing in every way, this is the reason, namely, the method of exposition by way of the succession of teachers, etc.”

original: vinayasaṃvaṇṇanāyā”ti, tatra yā sā samantapāsādikāti saṃvaṇṇanā vuttā, tassā samantapāsādikāya
analyzed: vinaya saṃvaṇṇanāya iti tatra yā sā samanta pāsādikā ati saṃvaṇṇanā vuttā tassā samanta pāsādikāya
translated: Herein, “in the pleasing in every way of the commentary, which is pleasing in every way” refers to the commentary called “pleasing in every way” mentioned above in the words “in the commentary, which is pleasing in every way, on the Vinaya.”

original: saṃvaṇṇanāya samantapāsādikattasmiṃ samantapāsādikabhāve sabbaso pasādajanakatte
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇanāya samanta pāsādika ttasmin samanta pāsādika bhāve sabbaso pasāda janaka tte
translated: “In the pleasing in every way, in the state of being pleasing in every way, in the generating of confidence in every way” refers to the state of being pleasing in every way, to the state of being pleasing in every way, in the commentary, which is pleasing in every way.

original: idaṃ hoti. Kiṃ hotīti āha “ācariyaparamparato”tiādi.
analyzed: idam hoti kim hoti iti āha ācariya paramparatā utiādi
translated: “This is the reason, namely, the method of exposition by way of the succession of teachers, etc.”

original: Ācariyaparamparatoti “upāli dāsako”tiādinā. Vuttaācariyaparamparato. Nidānavatthuppabhedadīpanatoti
analyzed: ācariya paramparato ti upāli dāsaka uti ādinā vutta ācariya paramparataḥ nidāna vatthu ppabheda dīpanato ti
translated: Herein, “by way of the succession of teachers” means by way of the succession of teachers beginning with Upāli, Dāsaka, etc., as stated above.

original: nidānappabhedadīpanato vatthuppabhedadīpanato ca. Tattha bāhiranidānaabbhantaranidānasikkhāpadanidānadassanavasena
analyzed: nidāna ppabheda dīpanataḥ vatthu ppabheda dīpanataḥ ca tattha bāhira nidāna abbhantara nidāna sikkhāpada nidāna dassana vasena
translated: and by showing the different sources and by showing the different bases. Herein, the showing of the different sources should be understood as the showing of the external source, the internal source, and the source in the training precepts.

original: nidānappabhedadīpanaṃ veditabbaṃ, theravādappakāsanaṃ pana vatthuppabhedadīpanaṃ.
analyzed: nidāna ppabheda dīpanam veditabbam thera vāda pakāsanam pana vatthu ppabheda dīpanam
translated: The showing of the different bases is the showing of the Theravāda.

original: Parasamayavivajjanatoti “sakāya paṭiññāya mettiyaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nāsethā”tiādīsu micchāpaṭipannānaṃ
analyzed: para samaya vivajjanato ti sakāya paṭiññāya mettiyam bhikkhunim na āsetha atiādīsu micchā paṭipannānam
translated: By the elimination of other doctrines: in such passages as “Do not accuse the nun Mettiyā on your own responsibility” (Vin.i,10), the elimination of the gains of others who are practising wrongly,

original: paresaṃ laddhinirākaraṇato, tatoyeva ca attano samayapatiṭṭhāpanena sakasamayavisuddhito.
analyzed: paresam laddhi nirākaraṇato ca attano samaya patiṭṭhāpanena saka samaya visuddhito
translated: and by the purification of one’s own doctrine by means of that same passage.

original: Byañjanaparisodhanatoti pāṭhasodhanena byañjanaparisodhanaṃ veditabbaṃ, saddasatthānusārena
analyzed: byañjana parisodhanato ti pāṭha sodhanena byañjana parisodhanam veditabbam sadda sattha anusārena
translated: By the purification of the phrasing: the purification of the phrasing should be understood as the purification of the text.

original: vā nibbacanaṃ dassetvā padanipphattidassanaṃ byañjanaparisodhanaṃ. Vibhaṅganayabhedadassanatoti
analyzed: vā nibbacanam dassetvā pada nipphatti dassanam byañjana parisodhanam vibhaṅga naya bheda dassana to ti
translated: Or the showing of the derivation of the words by pointing out the derivation of the words by means of the science of grammar🔽is the purification of the phrasing. By the showing of the divisions of the method of analysis:

original: “tisso itthiyo”tiādipadabhājanassa anurūpavasena nayabhedadassanato. Sampassatanti
analyzed: tissaḥ itthiyā iti ādi pada bhājanassa anurūpa vasena naya bheda dassanato sampassatanti
translated: by showing the divisions of the method of analysis according to the words “three kinds of women” and so on. By seeing:

original: ñāṇacakkhunā sammā passantānaṃ, upaparikkhantānanti attho. Apāsādikanti appasādāvahaṃ.
analyzed: ñāṇa cakkhunā sammā passantānam upaparikkhantānam ti attho apāsādikam ti appasāda āvaham
translated: and of those who see correctly with the eye of knowledge, the meaning is that they investigate. Not inspiring confidence: not arousing confidence.

original: Etthāti samantapāsādikāya. Sampassataṃ viññūnanti sambandho. Tasmā ayaṃ saṃvaṇṇanā
analyzed: ettha iti samantapāsādikāya sampassatam viññūnan ti sambandho tasmai ayam saṃvaṇṇanā
translated: Herein: in the Samantapāsādikā. The connexion is: “to the wise who see.” Therefore this commentary

original: samantapāsādikātveva pavattāti yojetabbaṃ. Kassa kena desitassa saṃvaṇṇanāti āha “vinayassā”tiādi.
analyzed: samantapāsādikā tu eva pavattā iti yojetabbam kassa kena desitassa saṃvaṇṇanā ati āha vinayassa atiādi
translated: should be construed as follows: “to the wise who see the Vinaya as inspiring confidence in every way.” Whose is it? Whose commentary is it?

original: Iti samantapāsādikāya vinayaṭṭhakathāya sāratthadīpaniyaṃ
analyzed: iti samantapāsādikāya vinaya ṭṭhakathāya
translated: Thus in the Samantapāsādikā Vinaya commentary

original: Verañjakaṇḍavaṇṇanā samattā.
analyzed: verañja kaṇḍa vaṇṇanā samattā
translated: The description of the Verañjā chapter is finished.

original: Paṭhamo bhāgo niṭṭhito.
analyzed: paṭhamaḥ bhāgaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: The first part is finished.
